comment: Best professor for 111L, and it is not even close. He does not uses quizzes or tests, so the final grade is just an average of your lab reports. He was very helpful and was a good laugh. Definitely take him for lab!
His Chm 111L is great! No midterms or tests just the lab reports. He also explains all the formulas you need before the lab.
would give him a 0 if i could
i would never wish anybody to have him as a teacher
WORST ever. do not take him no matter what
worst professor at wake, would never EVER take him again, terrible teacher, even worse to communicate with outside of class, thinks he is better than everyone
THIS IS FOR 111 LAB. Amazing Lab instructor. Super funny and personable, also explains the lab very well. No midterm-final is also great.
Awful teacher

Class was lecture based which would be fine if it was explained well.  Speaks about Chem topics at a level WAY above everyone's head.  Grading system is weird, all tests and he is a stickler for partial credit.  If you can take anyone else, do so.  I have had such amazing experiences with every other teacher in the Chem department except for him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lab is great! He explains all the formulas beforehand and he gives clear guidelines. We also didn't have a midterm or final lab exam which made it even easier.

Salam is by far one of the WORST professors I've had at Wake. His teaching methods are so confusing and out of order compared to the other chemistry professors. When in a lab, not his though, I'd be so lost because what we were going over was stuff that we had yet to cover in his lecture. Definitely try aiming for another professor! #salamsucks!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Salam clearly knows a lot about chemistry but not a lot about teaching. He explains basic concepts in complicated terms and he seriously makes passing CHM111 practically impossible unless you already have a strong base knowledge in chemistry. Also, if you ask him a question in class, prepare for him to make fun of you.

His lab is great, it's the only lab where your total grade is simply the average of your other labs out of 100. If you disagree with the TA's assessment, you can bring it up with him and he will likely give you points back. That being said, his lecture is difficult to stay awake for. Exams aren't bad but some self teaching is definitely required.

I would stay far away from this class. Only the teacher assistant taught me CHM 111 in one day than Salam could in a month. Get ready to cry and read the textbook this semester if you have to take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I know all these people saying he had him for lab say he was good, but trust me, you should never take this man for lecture. He is genuinely the hardest teacher I have ever had. He tries to make this class a weed out course even though it is literally supposed to be an intro level chem course. I had to fight so hard for my grade in this class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had to teach myself this whole class and would study weeks in advance for hours on end. This man is so arrogant and if you ask a question in class, chances are he will either laugh at you or mock you. Even the other professors in the department do not like him. I learned more from the student instructor than I did the professor.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Whatever you do, DO NOT take Salam for CHM 111. This professor does not teach the same material as the rest of the CHM 111 sections and he goes completely out of order with the chapters. He also does not give the standardized tests that the other sections take, and his tests are extremely difficult. You will have to teach yourself the entire class.
Only take him for Chem 111 Lab. It is the only lab without a final. Do not take him for Chem 111 he teaches a different curriculum then the rest of the Chem 111 sections.

Salam is a good man but a terrible professor. He teaches the course chapters in a questionable manner and also only grades you based off 6 homework assignments and 4 exams (which can be pretty rough). I recommend choosing a different professor for chem 111 but if he's all that's left, be ready for long hours of studying on your own.

He's probably the best you can take for Chemistry 111 Lab. He doesn't give a midterm nor a final, grade is only based on your lab reports which for me was amazing. He literally gives you the formulas for everything all you need to do is plug in your numbers and that's it. Great lab professor!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: just no. he is nice, but he makes it so much harder than it has to be and if u have him for lecture and someone else for lab you will be struggling in your lab as he chooses to do his own syllabus that does not match those of the other teachers, ie. the lab syllabus.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Salam is SO smart, educated and  knowledgeable on what he teaches. I took lab and lecture with him. Lab I 100% recommend as he always taught sample problems and we had no midterm/final. Lecture is hard to understand, but the grade is tests which are not that hard if you prepare from the book. Overall think he is so kind and wants people to learn!

Very passionate about chemistry. No idea why he is teaching 111 as he goes WAY to in depth on topics to the point where what should be simple concepts are complex, confusing, and irrelevant to the course. Seems like he is trying to confuse as many people as possible.
Manages to explain even the simplest concept in a way that makes it extremely confusing. Recommend learning and taking notes from the textbook not from his lectures.

Dr. Salam was great for lab, every other section had a midterm and a final, and ours did not. Highly recommend him if needed for a lab. His pre-lab lectures were short and simple and was always out of lab in under an hour and a half.
Easiest class I've ever taken, and the easiest lab out of my friend group. Highly recommend taking his lab.

I could definitely see him having a hard lecture class but his lab went by pretty smoothly. He seemed pretty approachable for help and his PowerPoints before the lab helped explain the concepts behind the lab very well. I think I learned more in his lab class than I did in my actual lecture class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I would 100% recommend Prof Akbar for CHM 111L. His TAs are great (and do all of the grading), but he also does a good job of explaining the lab concepts and helping out when necessary. I can definitely see how he might be a hard professor to have for a lecture class, but he is probably one of the best lab instructors.

While I do believe what people said about him being not so great teaching lecture. I think his lab is great. It is only graded by the lab reports, there's no pre lab quizzes, midterm or final. So I would definitely take him for LAB.

Here is the thing about Salam Akbar, his CHM 111 class is only a good idea if you have experience in general chemistry beforehand. If you don't, then his class is an absolute nightmare. He explains even the most basic concepts in the most complex ways. If you have knowledge about general chemistry, then his class should be fine.

Dr. Salam is an extremely difficult professor. His lectures are hard to understand because of how complex they are. Even simple concepts are hard to grasp because of his complicated word choice. Every class I would take pages of notes but not understand a single thing I wrote down. Do not take this class without prior advanced chemistry knowledge.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr Salam is very smart but he cannot teach It is by far the worst class I have ever taken It is absolutely horrible if you are not already amazing at chem
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He is very nice and cares about his students just very very boring and grades pretty hard.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: His class was terrible; you could tell he worked to make it a "weeding course." Even tutors in the chem center, who are chem majors, do not understand topics the way he explains/teaches them. He's extremely knowledgeable in chemistry, but he has no business teaching 111.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Salam is an incredible professor. I do not understand why there are so many bad reviews of him on here. It's probably some students who were too incompetent to put in the effort to learn the material. Dr. Salam is highly accommodating, understanding, and extremely knowledgeable.

He is a very smart man who knows his stuff, but he teaches kind of boring and doesn't really assign homework. You are responsible for learning the material, and you don't have to go to class. He genuinely cares, but you have to care too. Not the best teacher if you're not great at chem already but he will work. He grades fair and to the point.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Akbar is very smart, to the point where it is very difficult to understand his lectures. Problem is, classes are basically lectures only with only some time for questions if they are asked. If you can not understand the lectures, be ready to read the textbook as much as possible. Either that or you will need to do the practice questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take him if you want to continue in chemistry. The only reason one should take him is if you have a really good understanding of chemistry. His lectures are very intense and heavy. You can get a good grade on tests if you really pay attention his lectures. He also complicates very basic topics. He should be your last resort as a professor.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. I HAVE NO IDEA WHY THIS MAN IS ALLOWED TO TEACH GEN CHEM. The order in which he teaches the material does not coincide with any of the other chem professors and he is not engaging at all. Only gives about four tests and the final is 50% of your grade. If you're signed up for his class, get out of there.

TERRIBLE PROF. DO NOT TAKE. Got stuck with him. As others have said, very arrogant and not helpful. Doesn't know how to convey info well to students. Not encouraging at all. Worst prof at WFU hands down. Beware.
I can't understand anything. I'm not even learning chemistry in his class, and I am having a harder time in my lab because of it.
Grades by only 4-5 tests. Does not give extra credit. Lectures aren't interactive.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Too smart to interact with the public. Doesn't know how to convey what he is trying to teach.
He can't interact with student  the only prof in our department that no research group. he is so rude
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: really arrogant he can't teach you any thing so rude and makes you feel stupid
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Don't waste time with him.
Hard grader with very difficult tests

Professor Salam is very fast when giving his lectures, and although he is brilliant, his objective comes off as unclear to his students.  He doesn't use curves when grading his tests, and expects the average of the test to be around a 75.  If you have him, teach yourself the material through the book rather than relying on him to clarify.

Professor Salami teaches primary from power point slides with very little textbook usage. Outside class work is mainly optional, with only 5 homework assignments per year. However, tests are ridiculous. Often, he makes concepts more difficult to understand than they actually are. If stuck with Salam, learn from the book, it is clearer than he is

I'm not saying she's perfect but I got along with her. She expects a lot from you – Orgo II is a hard class – but she's up front about what she expects. If you listen to her and do what she says, you will get a good grade in the class. Orgo II takes practice but it's not impossible even though it might feel like it

I love her!! She is so kind and the best lecturer I've ever had. Yes, her class is difficult (every Orgo class is difficult...) but she gives so much extra credit and puts a lot of buffer grades in the system.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Lowkey one of my favorite professors. She expects a lot from you and will not baby you. She offers a lot of extra points for bad test grades that boost our grades up. She gives lots of review material and I advise to actual read the textbook, it helps so much for before and after lecture. After the first exam much nicer and approachable too.

Despite the rumors, I LOVED Dr. King. She pushes you extremely hard, which makes you a better student. Yes this class is a brain twister sometimes but she is great at lecturing and clearly explains topics. At first she can be very intimidating but she is so nice once you get to know her. She'll also crack jokes and tell you about her farm animals

I thought professors were supposed to be a support system until I met Dr. King. Everyone in the class was clearly trying so hard but she doesn't acknowledge the effort that was put in if your grade doesn't reach a certain level. I've never studied for a class harder in my life and it simply wasn't worth the time and money spent.

She provides a lot of resources and well organized (although not the best at writing informative headings for said resources). If you are able to follow along and not get behind on work, you will learn a lot. Unfortunately, she is not very understanding and can come across as rude at times. She will expect more from you than any other teacher.

She taught my MWF class too fast. Covers the board while she writes notes & erases it quickly. When she does write it's equations only, not explanations or definitions. Grades tough, especially w/ mechanisms. Expects you to give 1 hr EACH day to her class & assigns pre class hw, pre class videos, hw to do after class, TB problems, & has pop quizzes

Orgo 1 lab was not hard all semester until the final. She seems like a nice person and if you prep for lab (its a lot of work) you'll be fine, but the final was a different story. It was ridiculously hard compared to the rest of the class, and there were questions that we had never seen before. Absolutely nothing like the study guide.

Dr. King is amazing, but not easy. She expects a lot from her students and will not baby you. She is passionate about chemistry and it gets tough but if you stick with her, you will become a stronger, more resilient student.

It's true what they say...this class is hard! But equally, it has been the greatest source of academic growth imaginable for me. Exams will push you to your limits, you may leave a few classes near tears at the material to be memorized. Yet, you'll walk away with a deep sense of pride for what you accomplished and will have learned how to learn!

Dr. King is an amazing professor, despite the rumors. She is brilliant, organized, genuinely kind, and talented at teaching the material. Unfortunately, this course is naturally difficult and simply not meant to be an easy A. Dr. King's exams are semi-impossible, but I learned more from her than I think I would have from any other professor.
She does not care about the wellbeing of her students. She is highly unprofessional and gives unfair or clear expectations of her students. She also looks like Ursula

Angela King does not care about about the wellbeing of her students. She has blatantly yelled and cursed out our TAs in front of us in lab, and yells at students until they have cried for making a mistake on her unclear and poorly written instructions. She thrives off of students failing and struggling and refuses to help them.
She should be fired. Immediately.

Do not take this professor. I repeat DONT take this professor. Her lectures are not bad but her quizzes are hard and her exams are absolutely ridiculous. If you ever want to make it medical school, do not take this professor. Not only is she a difficult professor but she is also very rude and unprofessional. Pick another professor or dont take chm

Avoid at all costs. Labs are already difficult and time consuming but managed to do decently on them. The final was impossible. I memorized the entire study guide and got a 40%. Class average was an F including curve. bumped my grade from A to C. If u take this class just accept the fact the you are gonna do poorly. Just be happy you passed.
get ready to learn guys!

A lot of people say she is a bad professor. It's not the Dr. King isn't bad, Orgo 2 is. Dr. King does everything she can to help us succeed in a very difficult class. As long as you do the practice problems and get the abundant outside help that is offered, the class should be easier.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Don't know why so many students are giving bad rating about Dr King. If you fail on the exam, it is either you are not doing what you are supposed to do, or you are genuinely dumb.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I'm not sure why there are students saying Professor King is incredible; she's far from it. The worst professor at Wake Forest. Do not take her or she'll make your life terrible.

Dr. King really cares about her students and organic chemistry. She gets a bad rap for being one of the hardest organic chemistry professors, but if you do all of the suggested problems and put in the work, you will be completely fine. She gives lots of extra credit, and her lectures are incredibly clear and organized. Overall, fantastic professor.

Dr. King's class is not as bad as her other reviews imply. She gives lots of extra credit towards the end of the semester and curves tests too. Her tests are pretty hard (but not unfair) & she genuinely wants you to do well. She has lots of office hours and wants to help you learn the material. Do her suggested practice problems and you'll do fine
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: As a lab professor, she didn't have much control over curriculum or grading. But, she explained everything well and was accessible outside of class to discuss any assignments.
Very experienced
Read and do pratice. Tests are doable. She's great and we had a great semester
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the best professor that i had. She encourage students to form good learning habits. Though the exams are hard, she will give curve a lot. Do what you suppose and ought to do and you will get a score that you want. Please don't give bad rating just because you get undesired score. Orgo is meant to be hard, and Dr. King is one of the best.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. King is tough and can be abrasive but there's no pretense with her and she can be funny at times. The class was what med school probably feels like. She knows her Chem so if you pay attention and keep up with all the work, you'll learn a ton. If you want handholding though, definitely stay clear of Dr. King as that is definitely not her style.

Dr. King thrives off of failing students. She yells at students during lab and forces us to put 3-4 hours into lab reports weekly. I had an A until the lab final, which was impossible to study for. The average was an F, including the curve, and my grade went from an A to a C. She blamed the class's collective failure on us in an aggressive email.

Angela King is the most incompetent professor I've ever had. I had an A for lab until the final exam scores came in and ended up with a C. Never take her or you'll be miserable for the entire semester.

Dr. King is unkind and not approachable. On multiple occasions she publicly humilated students who made honest mistakes. She conducts her labs to be incredibly stressful. I had severe health issues with excused absences and she was not accommodating or sincere to my needs. Avoid her at all costs.

I took Dr. King for lab and the class was bearable and I got through it. The one thing I struggled with was her unclear grading criteria and vague directions on the lab instructions. If you pay attention in lab, do not make mistakes, and follow the pre-lab you will be fine. She is not very approachable but is willing to help you if need be.

I had Dr. King for orgo II lab. She was extremely unkind and not understanding. I had some serious health issues and she hassled me about having at least 2 doctors notes to prove that I really needed to miss class. She is an extremely hard grader and does not give partial credit. She does not grade timely either.

She was an instructor for my CHM 122 lab and although the class was online, she has gotta be the most unorganized professor that I've had in college. She would randomly move the due dates of assignments up to like the next day when they were originally due a week later. I had a bad experience with her and would definitely not recommend her.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. While tests are standardized amongst the Organic Chemistry II professors, 1/3 of your grade will be determined by her quizzes and final supplement. Gives pop quizzes and normal quizzes almost every other class and they are incredibly difficult and not curved. If she is the only option do not take it that semester.

Good lectures. Unfortunately unless you live, breathe, and bleed organic chemistry, these will do you no good. The exams are next to impossible and quite unreasonable for the amount of time allotted. On top of that, she usually coordinates lab, and it is a disaster. Just ask the poor TAs that have to work for her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: GRADE DEFATION. She takes joy in making test too long and difficult.
Wonderful teacher, puts a lot of effort and excitement into her teaching.

She does not keep up class discussion. She grades you ridiculously hard on research papers by grading you down and not having an explanation why. She devises a points system out of no where to justify giving you the grade you receive.
Dr. King really sparked my interest in Chemistry.  Her tests were hard, but fair.  You really have to learn the material to do well, but she is very understanding and helpful if you ask.
No Comments
Very clear, very helpful, expects alot of students, but not unreasonable. Study and and do well on the homeworks and you'll soar.

His lectures are so entertaining - was genuinely looking forward to every class. Take him if you are an econ major. He is so passionate about what he teaches and it makes the experience great. You need to go to every class and there are quizzes on each day's reading that are easy. If you put in some work and have a legit interest, you'll get an A
Simply the GOAT. His class requires some work but it's worth it. Extremely nice guy - I'll take every class he offers during my time at Wake.

Dr. Whaples is the best economics professor at Wake and it isn't close. Lots of reading but you leave each week of class feeling like you got you money's worth and actually learned. Daily quizzes but they're free if you do the reading. The most genuine guy I've ever met and everyone respects him - every econ major should take a class w Whaples.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: If you want to pursue Econ, take him. If not, you might want to consider someone else. He's taught this class for a long time and is great at what he does. He prays for students at the beginning of the semester and before exams. However, there are (relatively easy) quizzes before every class and he's, from what I've gathered, the hardest 150 Prof.

His class is great if you are an Econ major because it moves at a very fast pace and you learn a lot. However, don't take this class if you are just using it as a prereq for the B school. Quizzes every day and very hard exams. He is nice, and a great teacher though. Just a lot of work.

Whaples is a good lecturer and you will learn more in this ECN class than any other. However, you will have to do a lot of homework and there are quizzes in nearly every class. The exams are also much more difficult than other professors.

He is nice but it is a very difficult class. He wants you to read 20-30 pages a night and remember specific quotes for quizzes EVERY CLASS. There are way easier classes that you can take. Just avoid all together!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment:
He is a good and friendly professor and is probably the highest quality econ professor at Wake if you can endure the insane difficulty of his class.
He loves to rush and be ahead of other econ classes, be ready to make up to 100-150 pages worth of Word notes during the course learn 40 pages worth of difficult and new content before each class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Whaples is BRILLIANT! Take any course of his if you have the chance. While you will be put to work, it is worth it. You will leave class every day inspired and more knowledgeable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: While his class is fairly difficult, you will certainly learn a lot. He's a great lecturer, but be sure to take notes on the assigned readings; there are quizzes nearly every class. The textbook is a must and attendance is definitely important for keeping up with the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Literally such a high quality professor. He genuinely cares a lot about what he is talking about which makes the class interesting and enjoyable. I originally just took Econ to fulfill a requirement and I now want to major in it. Definitely a hard class but your grade will reflect only the work you put in.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Whaples is a fantastic professor. If you think there's a chance you'll take econ beyond intro level, this is your guy since you will really know what you're doing after you take his class. There r easier profs but if you care about the material there is no better choice than Whaples. Great dude, looking forward to taking another class with him.

Professor Whaples is great. He is extremely knowledgable and well published in the world of Economics and he probably knows more than any other Econ professor at Wake. You'll have MWF quizzes based on assigned readings. All tests are curved. Pay attention, read the chapters, study, and talk to him after class/ in office hours, and you will be fine.

Dr. Whaples is a funny and enthusiastic teacher who will teach you a lot. However, he is difficult and you will likely have to study roughly an entire chapter for each class quiz and study frequently for challenging tests. He is not an easy teacher, and I took economics in high school. This class was significantly more challenging than I thought.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Very hard FYS class - 32 quizzes, 7 dense books to read plus other reading, 6 short essays and a 5000 word essay with an oral presentation and an unscheduled final exam based on the presentation of your peers.The syllabus does not lay this out. Be prepared to memorize random facts & insane reading. Your grade will not reflect your work. Avoid!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: His lectures are comprehensive; sometimes he includes news and extracurricular materials such as Nobel Prizes, federal fund rates, etc. Definitely A challenging course as we have quizzes and 12+ pages of readings every week. Not for everyone, but if you are interested in Econ and applying for B school, I highly recommend his class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Knowledgeable but test-heavy. Readings are usually over 18 pages long and you are supposed to memorize over 50 different statistics on them for daily MWF quizzes.
Class is very difficult for a 150 course, and the tests are completely ridiculous.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Whaples is a nice guy but the tests are near impossible. It is completely on you to learn most of the material and prepare and reading the textbook and listening in class is not enough to do well. You need to work very hard to get a good grade. The only nice part is his curves, which do help since the tests are so hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: A super nice guy and cares a lot about his students and subject but super hard tests. If you want to be really challenged take him but even doing all the work and readings will not fully prepare you for tests. He does curve the tests a lot (usually our average was in the 70s) which was really nice
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Whaples is an amazing teacher, and your grade in the course will mirror the effort and work you put into this course. Daily quizzes that are a good chunk of your grade keep you engaged in the material, which makes the tests not as bad. Make sure to take notes and talk to him outside of class
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Whaples is an extremely passionate professor. He is constantly discussing his own experiences, the current status of the economy, as well as writing his own detailed essays. He is definitely a difficult teacher with extensive reading, quizzes, and exams, but he does want to help his students and is readily available to help.

Best professor I have ever had at Wake. I enjoyed every class of him. If he would teach intermediate Economics, I would probably major in Economics. Very organized and well prepared. Handouts are very helpful.

Beside the fact that there are daily quizes and lots of homework Prof. Whaples is amazing he is passionate about teaching and loves Wake. He talks about his family a lot and shares fun antidotes to easy the stress of tests and quizes. There might be a lot of work but you will enjoy this class.

Whaples is a solid professor. Your grade is made up of daily quizzes, 2 midterms, and final exam. I am a horrible test taker, so my grade did not reflect the amount I actually learned in his class (despite there being curves on each test). That being said, he is very respected and truly cares about his students.

Although I found Dr. Whaples' class to be very challenging, I believe he is one of the most honest, kind, and pleasantly idiosyncratic people I have ever met. He is openly and unashamedly Christian, yet always presents material in an unbiased and logical way. I respect him immensely as a person and professor. He makes Econ fascinating and relevant.

Best professor I've had at Wake hands down. He definitely makes you work for your grade though. You have quizzes at the beginning of almost every class, but it forces you to understand all of the material. He also curves each test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I loved Professor Whaples. If you really put the work in for this class, you should have no problem getting an A, but that means that you have to read the textbook and go over your notes. The quiz system he has in place forces students to retain the information he is teaching, and it really works. This class was amazing.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Hardest class I took this semester, it was my only non-A. Super interesting content and Whaples is a great professor. Reading the textbook is mandatory to succeed.

Professor Whaples is a legend in the school.  From his daily quizzes to challenging test- he will make you work for your grade.  That being said, he curves his test grades and many people received good grades.  You will exit the class feeling as if you have a firm grasp of economics and will be ready for an Econ major or for the Business school.
Excellent professor! Makes economics relateable and incredibly interesting with humor and incredible teaching ability.  Oh, he's hot!
TAKE WHAPLES!!! He is a fantastic teacher with a goofy sense of humor. You will learn the material and his lectures are clear, interesting and fly by. Easily one of my favorite professors at wake.

I took Whaples' Current Economic Issues class, which was great! The class was interesting, and much more reading-writing based than the traditional Econ class, meaning much less graph drawing and math to do (a big plus for me). There was a fair amount of homework, but if you actually do (most of) the reading, getting a good grade was not hard.
Very enthusiastic with an entertaining sense of humor..gives semi-daily quizzes and occasional readings but overall the class isn't too difficult. would definitely recommend

AWESOME teacher, good guy.  He actually wants people to get good grades and that's what I like about him.  I took the entrepreneur FYS class, be prepared to do A LOT of reading but if you are remotely interested, most of it isn't bad.  I typed 4-5 short papers total.

Extraordinarily good teacher. Explains things with a lot of very good examples, and will be incredibly helpful out of class. Wish he gave a little more time between homework assignments and their due dates, though.

Great class, very intersting, well structured, brief intro to micro econ and then mostly discussions.  Read 3 or 4 books and wrote papers, one long final paper and some group work but nothing that felt extreme.  Was supposed to read the NYtimes every day...never did, overall really enjoyed the class
Excellent. One of the top 3 I had at Wake Forest.
No Comments

A solid professor. Lectures are a little scattered, grading is largely subjective, and getting an A requires real drive (a B+ is easy and A- super doable). I learned so much. You can just take note in class and study outside - no "work" other than that. I wouldn't have any reservations about taking a class of his again.

Dr. Tague was good and knew what he was talking about. You'll learn a lot in lectures as long as you pay attention. Hate the grading system but most of bio department uses it so it's not just him. Drops lowest test score.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor really loves what he teaches and he created the course in general. Very helpful in office hours and the study questions he gives are the general concepts of the tests

He's funny and clearly cares about his students. He's available outside of his class a lot. Near test days, he offers more hours. His slides aren't very organized, and can definitely be hard to comprehend outside of class, so try not to miss a lecture. He records audios of lectures too. The textbook reading and quizzes are busy work in my opinion.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Tague is definitely a tough professor if you do not use the resources he provides for the class. I really do think this class is what you make of it. If you put in the time and effort, you will see that benefit play out in your test grades. Also go to his office hours! I went into every test knowing what to expect after office hours.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I am obsessed with biology, and I love learning it. But, I do not think the presentations and lectures were useful for this course. I had the hardest time taking notes because the slides were not organized whatsoever. It was always said, that "I will come back to it" and never went back. Since the course is exam-heavy, it is hard to get an A.

I used to love biology and now I don't. He made the content more confusing and his slideshows are impossible to understand (a mess). He is a kind man but not very lenient and emphasizes the "weed-out" nature of the class. If you are pre-medicine and you want to like biology, take another professor.

Class is graded really odd with 5-1 scale that corresponds to a letter grade at the end of the semester. Easy pre-class quizzes before most classes but the tests can be niche and difficult if you only take notes and passively listen to his lectures. Definitely not an easy A

Bio 150 is a tough course in general so I think a lot of the tough rep Tague gets is from that. He is really great at breaking down concepts for you 1:1 so GO TO OFFICE HOURS IF YOU ARE CONFUSED (something I took for granted). His tests are tough but very reasonable if you pay attention to class and prep accordingly for the exams.

Dr. Tague is an inspiration to all up and coming biology and science majors at Wake Forest University. He singlehandedly made me choose to switch my major to biology after the inspiring efforts he put in. I didn't do amazing on the first test, but after meeting with him consistently I scored near perfect on all the rest.

Dr. Tague is very accessible outside of classroom and enthusiastic about bio. However, I spent tons of time (much more than other wake courses) but still got lower grade. Grading system is unclear, harsh, and discouraging (most students will get less than 3/5 in tests). Too many things covered in a single lecture, no homework but high workload.
I think that if you want to do well in Dr. Tague's class you will have to read from the textbook. He is a really nice professor and really cares about biology

Professor Tague's class was one of the hardest classes I took, but boy did I learn how to problem solve. This is not your typical cellular bio class. Memorizing means nothing in his class. Get ready for Tague to rewire your brain.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You must pay a lot of attention to the lecture!!! He goes over huge amount of information in his lecture so you must give 100% attention. The grading policy was pretty horrible but if you are good at bio you should be fine. He is a very very nice guy.

Honestly don't know why this guy doesn't get the credit he deserves. Fun lectures and explained things well, entertaining guy, wears Hawaiian shirts to class every day. Regular textbook assignments and his expectations are clear and reasonable. Grading scale is awful, but that's up to the bio department and the same for all BIO 150 courses.

I would not be deterred by the other ratings of this professor. I don't think Tague is the problem, its Wakes Bio departments grading system. You have four tests, with the lowest one being dropped that determines your entire grade. Apparently, Tague grades harsher than others, but there's no way to tell since every professor is so subjective.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: While Dr. Tague is very nice and passionate about Biology, the grading system in the bio department at Wake is very confusing and unfair. There are no objective "right" answers as a grade of an A is determined by the top students' test answers. There is so much info, and be prepared to work a lot outside of class to understand the material
His class is very lecture heavy and has a very unclear grading system, as he even directly said he grades subjectively. Have to take a lot of time outside the class to review.

Don't let the other ratings deter you from this professor. Although it is a bit of a learning curve to get used to his style of lectures, he is engaging and super helpful in office hours. From what I've heard the whole bio department at Wake is wack which can reflect poorly on the professors.

For the love of god do not take this class. I was interested in bio, but he has completely destroyed any interest. I have nothing against him personally, but his teaching style is horrendous. He breezes through huge topics without slowing down or explaining it thoroughly, and asking him a question just makes things more confusing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Avoid biology if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Worst teacher Ive ever had.

Dr. Tague is a great person, but I don't like of teaching style. Lectures were very long with tons of new information every day. I hadn't taken bio since freshman year in hs and ended up doing fine, but I had to work for it. He is definitely accessible outside of class, but sometimes he doesn't clarify well. Tests are hard, but doable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: 1. Lectures: A mishmash of information overload, irrelevant anecdotes, and preposterous metaphors. Miss a class due to sickness or quarantine for covid? HA, best of luck to you. 2. Tests: Our little scientist here has let "holistic grading" get to his head. Your only hope is that he "feels" that your answers are sufficient (hint: they're not). ��

Dr. Tague requires textbook readings and quizzes before every class that are important for your participation grade. I thought they were helpful to see the information before the lecture. He has slides for every class and posts them on Canvas which are perfect to study off of because he will take material right off of them for the tests.

Dr. Tague's lectures are very interesting, but his grades tend to appear out of thin air based on his "flavor of the day". His grades are pretty nonsensical (i.e. not percentage based and just based on whatever he thinks is good for the work) which is frustrating for students and does not provide a clear framework for expectations.

Good lecturer but HORRIBLE person. A very unfair grader, cares more about himself halt than helping students. Does not allow students to join on zoom if sick (COVID) and online resources from class (powerpoints) are horribly unclear if do not attend class. He decides what grade you deserve in the class early on and does not change. Horrible.

Dr. Tague has a heavy workload for his class. He is also a very hard grader and the grading criteria is unclear. It feels like he pulls grades out of the air and you cannot figure out how to improve. I got the same grade on every test. However, he is lively and caring. Be ready to study, even if you are like me and have a strong bio background.
Don't choose him. He's one of the worst teachers I've ever had in my life.

The tests are very weird, and I didn't feel super prepared for them, even though i did the reading outside of class, and took notes on/listened to the lecture. It is heavy with the application of lecture topics. He is a very interesting teacher though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: The worst professor i've ever have. His class is so unorganized that if you don't have bio background, you won't be able to understand any of it. There are 5 total tests in the semester and two of them are at the end. You also need to do quizzes on what you are learning the next day before class. Take his class if you are a masochist.

Very excited about biology and can tell he loves his job. He makes lectures exciting but sometimes talks way too fast. Need to be a fast notetaker for his class. Tests are very difficult and heavy workload outside of class. He offers a lot of help and is very flexible to meet with you

Dr. Tague's class has a heavy workload, but it is reasonable considering how much information the course covers. It's fast-paced and you have to work hard to earn a good grade, but if you come to him with questions and show you're putting in an effort, he will definitely reward you. Overall, the class is difficult but he makes it better.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Tague is one of the most hilarious and sweet professors I have ever met. He always cracks jokes in class and pre-recorded lectures which keeps things interesting. However, academic-wise, I would not recommend him. He gets off-topic very easily and gives ten minute answers in class to simple yes or no questions. Grading is also very unclear.

If you have never taken a flipped class before, please do yourself a favor and DO NOT start with this one. Dr. Tague only teaches material via a downloadable 1-hour powerpoint, but attendance to each "revision period" is still mandatory. He never offers relevant textbook chapters to read and is incredibly inflexible regarding students' schedules.

This class assigns a heavy workload and requires a lot of information absorption. Its not an impossible class but its a difficult one. However, Dr. Tague is a very fair grader and wants to see that his students understand the curriculum. The only reason I would not take again is because of the workload.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Make sure to complete the quizzes on time, and study plenty for the tests! Otherwise, there are not many other grades.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Ramachandran is a hard grader on the first paper and then basically does not read the other papers. She has favorites and calls people out for not reading. Participation is a huge thing to her so definitely ask questions and make comments during  lecture.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class as an upperclassman who has never gotten beneath an A- in college. I put more work into INTRODUCTION TO RELGION, than accounting, and still did worse somehow. The classes are all extremely boring and no matter how much work I put in, there was no chance for me to do well because of grading biases. Do not take.

Super unclear grading criteria. The last 3 weeks we had 3 papers in a row. She lectured our class for 1hr for how all 75 of her students misunderstood the 3 pages of instructions for a 3 pg essay. Promised to give us extra credit if we rewrote parts and then never did. The tests are open note and essay As, but papers will drag your grade down.

Do NOT take this class. The absolute worst professor I have taken my entire academic career. Completely unprofessional, incredibly rude, and critical. Confusing assignments that have nothing to do with the readings. Also VERY political.

Do not take this class. Insane amount of reading, which have nothing to do with the discussions in class. Instructions say one thing but she will change them three times and means something completely different. Awfully boring plus she promised extra points which she never ended up giving plus and we got lectured for an hour how we made her "mad",
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Nice professor, quirky humor, but DEEPLY imprecise and convoluted communicator. Her lectures literally make no sense. Tons of errors in her assignment instructions, which she edits until the due date. No matter how hard you work, improvement is impossible because she cannot get her point across. This class is not difficult for the right reasons.
This teacher is very difficult for ALL students and we all suffered
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is not friendly and made me regret doing a class in the divinity school I would not recommend taking her if you value your sanity
Good luck if you take her. You'll need it
Legitimately the most biased educator I have thus experienced. Asked who we voted for in the election and made it super weird.
The readings are buns
This is NOT the teacher you want for a divisional like this. Too much work and tough grader for what should be an easy divisional.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Sometimes cannot formulate grammatically correct sentences. Makes me wonder how she got hired
If you think taking an easy Religion course for a divisional, DON'T TAKE IT WITH HER. Avoid at all costs for your own good. Makes the class way too hard
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Terrible. that's about it
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She gives the least clear directions that I have ever heard. The whole basis of the class is talking about useless topics aimed at blaming dominant social groups(white, christian) and attributing all hardships experienced by minorities to differences in race and religion. She basically wants to stick you with a very biased perspective. Hard fade
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Legitimately the worst teacher I have ever had. Extremely vague and unclear with instructions while also requiring students to engage way too deeply with content for a class called RELIGION 101!! She asks way too much for a simple divisional requirement class and is not good at communicating the material to students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This is the worst professor I've ever had. The way her class goes changes every day. She expects class discussions but doesn't guide you with real questions. She has favorites and if you're not one of them, you're screwed. I took this class thinking it would be an easy divisional, I was wrong, it was way too much for not that big of a class. Avoid.

Basically a political religion class where it's lengthy readings and questions attached everynight. Discussion style but can be interesting/boring although tests are open note which make it easy. Def not the easiest divisional bc essays are graded harshly but if u wanna learn about the context of religion in society its an option
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Do not take her for a divisional. Her instructions are very unclear and she is a harsh grader. She does not clearly assign / explain homework but then gets annoyed when no one does it right.

I took this class as a divisional with little knowledge on worldly religions. However it turned out be an American Politics class in association with religion. It's definitely interesting and some of the papers / projects are cool topics. Need to do the readings and notes guides for easy points / hw is everynight. Grade = papers  + participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I absolutely love Dr. Ramachandran! Her sense of humor will have you cackling! We only done five-six assignments. Most were collages with a paper to accompany it. Fair grader and available to meet if you have questions. This is one of the only professors office hours I went to weekly. Take her if you want to be thought provoked!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: She hasn't updated her research in the last 10 years and clearly only cares about her 200/300 level courses. Listens but doesn't actually listen. She cut off a group presentation mid-presentation because she didn't understand them. The finished and were actually on track to be right.
She's funny!

Her feminism FYS class is not too bad. The readings were intelligent and thought-provoking, and she is a nice teacher that tries to make her students have fun. Some of the papers' rubrics were confusing and strange, and sometimes she says things that don't make much sense.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I recommend her Feminist FYS! You will learn a lot and have in-depth discussions about your own experience which I enjoyed. The papers are fairly easy, however, most assignments are pretty vague when it comes to the rubric. She is very good at answering most questions and is very understanding if you are having trouble with something!

Oh my God do not take her FYS Feminism class. It's discussion based, which really means that you sit there and listen to her talk in circles about nothing interesting. Not many assignments and they're SO vague. She picks on the only boys in the class, it's so uncomfortable to watch. As a former feminist, I actually think I hate being a woman now.

The class was very unstructured and her questions were often very lengthy and hard to follow. She also made a few problematic comments that made many people uncomfortable in class. If you can, I might would find someone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Though I agree that sometimes assignments tend to be vague, she is a lovely professor who tries to connect to her class. She was extremely flexible and accommodating when you communicate with her. Overall, she is a lovely professor and would love to take a class with her again.

Gives few/confusing instructions for assignments and grades them very harshly. Wants questions to be asked during class but again is confusing and will refuse to respond to emails. Unprofessional in class. All of this makes for an extremely frustrating class experience. Not worth taking her for the divisional.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Should not be teaching a 100-level divisional. Comes off as very friendly and sarcastic until you see your grades. You won't fail, but if you're taking this as a divisional, look for other professors.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Assignments are not always explained clearly and are usually very conceptual/confusing. She gives opportunities to ask questions in class, but if she doesn't answer them clearly and you're still stuck, she doesn't want emails later on which makes it very difficult to get your questions answered. Unprofessional and expects a lot for little teaching.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: The class is alright and not hard but just dont get on her bad side. Very unprofessional
Her classes are pretty interesting. She is helpful if you have questions. Her tests are pretty straight forward and she's a fair grader.
Easy 10/10 HES100, would recommend.

Dr. Wrights' course is the first health class I have ever taken that genuinely feels interesting and relevant. She is so cheerful and enthusiastic about her subject. You do need to get a 100% to get an A but she makes this so, so easy - extremely light workload, open note everything, very clear criteria, multiple opportunities to redo assignments.
Absolutely amazing professor. Really cares about her students and their success, even gives extra attempts on her comprehension checks. Would 100% take again.
The best HES professor. Take her class.
The nicest professor ever. Is so willing to work with you and gives you class time to complete work yet you still learn alot. Absoluetly try for this.
Best HES 100 professor at Wake

Dr. Wrights is the sweetest lady I've ever met and a fabulous professor. She truly cares about all of her students and is passionate about what she teaches. Even though it was only half a semester and a required course, I really enjoyed her class. The quizzes are easy and the class activities are fun.

Best Prof at Wake! Super friendly and welcoming to freshman! Met some of my best friends in this class. She loves when students speak up as we grade our own participation. If do well on quizzes and hw it's an easy A. Super accommodating with busy schedules and gets to know you as a person, not just a student. Also take her FYS best class!!

She is amazing. This class was really easy, just do the assignments and you'll be fine. The assignments and mini online quizzes are really easy, and she makes class fun. I would highly recommend taking her for HES 100.
she makes HES 100 exciting and she's super understanding and caring!

it is hard to make HES interesting, so knowing that she is really doing all she can. easy grader and I love how she is straight forward on the scale. Not many assignments and you usually just do them in class. I'd recommend.

Professor Wrights is a great choice for the HES divisional. There's homework every class, but it's super quick and she uses projects for grades instead of tests. She's super kind and understanding and getting a good grade in her class is fairly easy.

Super amazing professor. Her class has good energy and she seems caring. Assignments are not tough and the grading system is extremely beneficial for students. It is based on how much effort you put in to the course rather than how well you do on quizzes.
One of the best professors at Wake!

Dr. Wright is amazing! She teaches with a reverse classroom, so expect a decent amount of reading for a 1 credit course, but the work is easy and she makes an effort to make a required class fun and interesting.
Super great teacher! She's super sweet and very understanding, she will definitely be there for you for whatever you need.
She's a sweetie :)

Dr. Wrights was super nice and really easy. Compared to other HES teachers, I think she was definitely the easiest and most inspirational. The stuff we learned in class was also very helpful, especially if you get to take it in your first semester. She shows you exactly who to contact and where to find people at Wake.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Wrights is AMAZING and I could not recommend someone more for the required HES class. You need to go to class and will often be asked to be technology free, but she is incredibly flexible and kind.

Dr. Wrights is extremely nice and really cares about her students. Her class is extremely easy and the homework is very easy and is more like busy work. If you finish your work early she allows you to leave. Overall, she's super easy and nice and I definitely recommend her.
Super Easy if you do the work! Go to class cause gives you time to finish the assignments & takes attendance.  Modules are due at the beginning of each class but not hard.
Pretty easy class, the homework is very manageable but you do have to show up for class because she counts attendance. She is a very cheerful personality and it is an easy A.

I took HES100 with Dr. Wrights online over the summer. She had recorded lectures and provided an abundance of materials. The content for the class is pretty much the same regardless of your professor, but I think Dr. Wrights went out of her way to be available and ensure our success... Just make sure you do your work on time.
Dr. Wrights is so sweet and really cares about her students. HES 100 is pretty easy but don't get behind and COME TO CLASS and you will get a good grade.
AMAZING... if u try you will do well

I had her for my first semester of freshman year and I LOVE her. She is amazing, engaging, and knowledgeable about the topics. Most if not all the work she gave you time to work on in class, and everything is super manageable! Just remember to participate in class and you'll get so much out of this course.
Dr. Wrights is awesome. Just do the homework, turn in the in-class work, and you'll be fine.
Take for HES - attendance is mandatory and will be forced to close laptop during class but easy A
Very nice professor, truly cares about students

Professor Wrights was a great teacher who is extremely educated on topics discussed in class. She is passionate and caring and very mom-like in her demeanor. There is a lot of work outside of class, but most is fairly easy and quick.

Attendance really matters for this class it's a huge part of your grade. There's sort of a lot of homework but none of it is hard. She is extremely passionate about the topics she teaches which makes it interesting to sit through. I would recommend it if you don't mind doing some busy work because it's not a hard course to get an A in.
Professor Wrights was always in an uplifting mood. She made class material fun and easy to understand. Overall she is amazing and the work in class is really easy.

There is a pretty standard curriculum for the HES 100 classes, so the homework and quizzes are the same with any instructor. But, Professor Wrights was very passionate about many different health-related topics, which made the sometimes boring material more interesting.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: She is very nice and enthusiastic. However, you can't miss more than 3 classes. Do not take her health class if you hate homework. You have a quiz with every homework and you can't make them up if you miss them. lot's of reading homework and she gives partial credit for missing work. Her lectures were tedious though.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Wrights truly cares about her students and is clearly passionate about the topics she teaches. She is mindful of her students' workload and is conscious not to add to it. The homework due before class is always a 5-10 question quiz based on short readings. Her rubrics are always clear for the in-class projects and she grades very fairly.
Goat if his section has a seat you better take it

TAKE DR. WREN! He is super funny, understanding, and explains things in a very concise way. Warning you will do a ton of ALEKS, but it genuinely helps. His grading distribution is completely works to your advantage compared to other professors who teach the same class. He cares about his students and wants to see you succeed.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: After taking AP Chem and almost failing, I was scared for this class. However, Dr. Wren made material easy to understand. Grades are heavily padded by ALEKS and he gives many resources to ensure success. He is caring, funny, and understanding aside from being an amazing professor, which makes  class enjoyable. Do anything you can to take him!!!

Amazing Professor. Very funny and cares a lot about his students. He explains the topic in a way that is easy to understand. Not too much homework and you can drop your lowest quiz grade. Very accessible and hosts reviews before each test.
Professor Wren is awesome! Great lectures and provides all resources for you to be successful.

There is a reason Wren is the dept. head. This class preps you so well for the exams that you barely need to study. Wren knows exactly how and when to introduce each topic, and will have sympathy on the class. Only drawback of the course was the timing of the exams (not his fault, they had to plan them before they knew when breaks were)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Wren is fantastic. He clearly puts effort into knowing how to teach effectively and it makes a big difference. Things to know: notes aren't posted it's all whiteboard. Grades are padded with ALEKS so just do it and you'll be fine. Super nice and funny guy, go to office hours. He genuinely cares about his students and if we do well.

By far one of the best professors on campus. Dr. Wren does research on how to best teach students, and it shows. He is always accessible and cares about each student's success. He will always take the time to talk through concepts and make sure you understand the material. His lectures are also incredibly well organized and easy to follow
Take him for Chem 111

Dr. Wren is such an amazing teacher. He makes boring lectures into entertaining ones and is super dedicated to his work which is abundantly obvious in his class. While the class is hard - it is a chemistry class after all - I would definitely recommend him as a teacher I would happily take again.

Dr. Wren was a great guy. If you pay attention in class, actually do ALEKS, and do the practice tests, you will be fine. He's also super nice in office hours and I found it easy to just show up and talk to him about stuff. He's very dedicated to student learning and appeals to all learning types to make his class easier. Would definitely take again

He is such an amazing and caring professor. I have never had a professor who is more approachable and kind in my entire time at Wake. He really knows his stuff and is super fun to talk to during office hours

Dr. Wren is a great professor. His lectures are super clear and he is really good at explaining confusing concepts. He truly cares about all his students and always wants to help. I would definitely recommend taking Dr. Wren for chem 111.

Dr. Wren is an awesome professor! I had him for lecture and lab, and if you get the chance you should to! He is the only professor I know that is actually there for EVERY lab, and he is SO helpful! Yes I am getting a B in chem, but it certainly has nothing to do with him. The exams are hard, but that is because it is chemistry.

Dr. Wren was one of the best professors I have ever had. His lectures are simple and straightforward, and he is an amazing teacher. His tests were graded very fairly, and there were never any surprises on them.

TAKE WREN FOR CHEM! chemistry is hard, not going to lie. but it's chemistry. there are many topics to learn, but he does a great job at making sure every student is on board. no powerpoints, no bs. and take many notes in class, as exams are based off lectures. but he cracks the best jokes and learns basically everyones name. extremely caring
He is always helpful outside the class! His test is hard but doable.

Professor Wren was fantastic for Chem 111. Lectures are easy to understand. He genuinely cares about his students. You need to work hard and do all of the ALEKS, but if you can do that you will be alright. There are so many resources like his review sessions, the SI sessions, and the chem center. You can get a good grade if you put in the work.

I absolutely loved Dr. Wren. Genuinely one of the best professors and actually made me love chem. He posts his lectures online before the in person lecture, so you have the ability to watch and take notes beforehand. Not much homework, tests are decent, and he's always available for office hours. Take Dr. Wren if you can!!

Professor Wren was a very caring professor that ensured all students were clear on test material, homework, and any other assignments. There is lots of homework but as long as you put the work in and go to office hours an A is very attainable.

Dr. Wren is a very nice Man and wants his students to succeed. However, the material learned in class is not the material on tests. Even if you study all the material he tells you you need to study, there will still be questions on tests that are completely foreign.

Great teacher. Adjusts class to make sure everyone understands what he's teaching and always encourages questions. Lectures are very concept based and math problems are taught outside class on your own via ALEKS. Tests can be difficult but he's easy to talk to and wants to see you succeed.
The test are very hard

Amazing man, but his style of teaching is not for everyone. He does not teach much in class and expects you to learn it off ALEXS or on your own. Exam 2 is super hard and was not fair. He is very nice and understanding, but overall I would say nice man not great teacher.

Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. Just make sure you get your ALEKS turned in on time, and I'd recommend pre-watching lectures before class so you're not going in blind and you can focus on listening instead of taking notes. Knows his stuff, super funny professor.

Very supportive and approachable. Gave really good lectures online and supplemented well in class. Reasonable amount of homework on ALEKS, but he gives extensions when needed. Grading is very straightforward and fair.

He is one of the best professors I have had. He makes boring stuff interesting and make you engaged. Not an easy A, but if you do exactly what you are told you will be fine grade wise. He is truly awesome!

Dr. Wren is an amazing professor. As other people already said, he cares about all of his students and treats everyone with respect. His class is anything but easy, and he will definitely make you put in a lot of effort that will eventually pay off. You can tell he wants all of his students to do well. Would take his class again in a heartbeat.

He's the best, pick him. He understands the situation we are in and was very lenient. Gave us deadline extensions and days off. The fina grade is mostly based on weekly quizzes which count for 50 percent and hw. The final is only worth 10 percent and he even adds 9 points to original score. He's so nice and wholesome. You won't regret choosing him!

Dr. Wren genuinely wants to see his students succeed and he provides as many resources as possible so that you can be successful. It is a difficult class content-wise, but Dr. Wren will acknowledge how hard you work. He is a very fair grader and is understanding about his students' mental health and wellbeing.

He is the friendliest, most helpful, and most genuine professor I've ever had at Wake Forest University. Very understanding and helpful as I believe he only teaches freshmen. Love the dad jokes, too. This class had quite a bit of work, but it's chemistry; that's normal. Every incoming freshman should try to get Dr. Wren.

Lectures are not very comprehensive, so I had to do a lot of prep and studying on my own time to understand what was said in the lecture. So much ALEKS it's crazy, so do it early so you have enough time to study for exams. His lectures were sometimes confusing, so be prepared to use outside resources to study. Very nice though, and always accessibl
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: He is really invested in students and having his students actually understand the material. If you do the work and finish ALEKS you will do great in his class.

Dr. Wren is an amazing and funny guy. He cares about his students and their success in general chemistry I and beyond. With that being said, his class is somewhat difficult because of the exams (5 exams that are 70% of your final grade). His lectures are beneficial, but there was some uncertainty and ambiguity in the gap between lectures and exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: I really loved Dr. Wren. His gen chem class was pretty hard in terms of the exams but he really did a great job of preparing me for chem II. Also he has such dad humor and i love it.

I think Dr. Greene is a great professor. He is funny and relatable and you can clearly tell he loves teaching. PSY 245 was composed of 4 exams, 3 reflection papers (no more than a page), one bonus reflection paper for extra credit, and a final paper. Tests are application-based so make sure your studying reflects that!

I loved Dr Greene's class. His lectures are so engaging; he really makes every topic interesting by showing examples of the material. He's also very funny, and he really cares about what he's doing. He goes above and beyond to make connections with the class (it's the little things that matter, like, how he plays music before each class) Fantastic!

Professor Greene is a funny, quirky guy, a little weird. Accessible outside of class and his tests are pretty representative of the content. Sometimes has some stuff straight from the textbook so just beware of that. No quizzes and the reflections are super easy. Overall workload isn't crazy and the content is super interesting.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Really enjoyed this summer class, and Heath was super funny. The tests were hard, but if you took notes and payed attention you should be fine.

Dr. Greene's class is very lecture heavy. He has a good sense of humor but sometimes made very inappropriate jokes. Only take him if you are a good test-taker as his tests are very difficult. The averages were in the 70s and 80s for every test and there was no curve. He would also include material from the textbook that we never discussed in class
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Heath Greene is a good and fun professor but the good traits end about there. Class is all about reading directly from slideshows and there is approximately zero assistance given in test preparation. Tests make up almost 80% of the class and are incredibly difficult.

Great lecturer, but the test are pretty difficult. If you read the textbook and take notes you'll be fine. I also highly recommend making flashcards for all of the terms and definitions bolded in the textbook. It's an enjoyable class though, despite the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Greene is a really engaging and fun teacher during lectures, and he is friendly during class and in front of people but he is sometimes rude during office hours. He almost seems annoyed and angry to see you there. Maybe he was having a bad day or something, but he just seems friendly around people and annoyed when no one else is around.
Great teacher but test are hard.
Amazing professor but the tests are really hard

Dr. Greene is a great professor who is passionate about the subject. His passion really translates during lectures, and I find class to be stimulating and helpful. I agree with other raters in that you do need to thoroughly study because the tests are difficult and solely contribute to your grade. Dr. Greene does provide resources for success.

Dr. Greene is very nice and is very fun in class. He makes the classes interesting and I enjoyed taking the course. In order to do well, however, you must do a lot of studying and a lot of reading in the textbook. Your grade is based solely on tests. I would take him again thought because overall he is a good professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Heath Greene's class was lowk kinda hard. He just lectures the entire time which for me can make me a little sleepy and I lose focus. In order to succeed you def have to take notes BEFORE you go to the lectures but idk if that would really help that much anyway.There are 5 exams- & those are your only grade.they are application based & pretty rough

No homework is given, strictly test based and is hard to recover from a bad grade. Five tests in total and cover a huge assortment of materials. Lecture every class, but he is funny and he cares about students growth on a personal level.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Funny, engaging professor. Tests include some material not taught in class--but if you understand the basic psychology concepts you'll definitely pass the class. Definitely worth taking

Amazing prof! Hilarious in lectures and not afraid to go on tangents. Often interacts with students but won't call on you if you don't raise your hand. Super enjoyable course and easy to pass if you study for tests.

I'm taking Dr. Greene's class now, and it's phenomenal! He is my favorite professor, and his lectures are so entertaining and definitely help prepare for the tests. The tests are totally manageable if you are engaged in the content beforehand and if you study - he's also great at giving lots of information about tests! Also, he has awesome fits.

I really loved prof Greene's lectures and his charismatic energy which made this divisional more enjoyable. I will give some advice that the test questions are pulled from the textbook not his lectures, so make sure to read it! 95% of your grade is made up of 5 tests which are all pretty manageable multiple-choice tests
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Greene is awesome. Definitely read the textbook though because there can be test questions that weren't covered in lecture, just the textbook. You can tell how enthusiastic he is about the material and he makes it fun to learn. Make sure to do the extra credit on the research requirement! Would totally take again.

Greene is a funny guy who has interesting lectures. He only gives online multiple-choice tests that he finds online and sometimes does not cover things we talked about in class. The tests are very specific and they are one of the only things that go into your final grade. He doesn't respond to emails and can be rude. Pick a different professor.

Professor Greene is great. He generally follows his slideshows for teaching, but doesn't lecture with a monotonous tone. He really seems to care about the subject and his students. It isn't required, but I recommend reading the textbook and taking notes. His tests are pretty hard, but there aren't any quizzes and hardly any homework.

Dr. Greene is a super cool and charismatic guy, and his lectures are great and easy to follow. However, his tests are surprisingly difficult. I think a lot of people underestimate the importance of reading the textbook.

I love Dr. Greene. He is an extremely nice, caring guy that wants the best for his students. His lectures are funny and entertaining. I had him for both intro psych and abnormal, and both classes are entirely based on tests (plus one paper for abnormal). Make sure to read the textbook for both courses, as he pulls a lot from them for tests.

Greene is overrated. Tests don't represent class and take a lot of studying. Lectures will not prepare you effectively and he is not helpful. Doesn't provide any additional materials and test questions can feel random. Know that you will need to read, take notes, and study hard. I learned a lot, but not from him, largely all from my own studying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: From reading all the reviews on here I think Greene is a bit overrated. I'm not a psych major though and so I could just be being cynical. His tests do not really follow his lectures at all, which are very broad and open ended discussions. They are all multiple choice but are really difficult. Study the textbook closely to do well in the class.
Take Greene. absolutely. cannot go wrong. great professor, actually cares about teaching and students. one of the best professors at wake forest no question about it.
The class requires good note taking and I would recommend reading the textbook. He's an amazing person that cares a lot about his students and his classes are very enjoyable.
He is the nicest guy on the planet. Greene is hilarious, helpful, and clearly really knowledgeable about his subject. I hated his tests, but I loved his class.
No Comments

The grading is tough, however you get used to it after the first exam. Plus she drops the lowest exam for a make final which only includes previous test question. This class is truly a breeze with many days where she cancels class. She is truly hilarious and the course is very interesting. GREAT FOR A DIVISIONAL
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Her lectures are interesting and the class is pretty stress free since there are no true tests or homework. HOWEVER, there are four/five written take home exams and they may seem easy, but she is an EXTREMELY tough grader. I would not take this class as a divisional, I made that mistake. However, I did learn a lot and the professor is really funny.
