This professor truly made me believe she wanted us to fail. Ellen fails to care for her students and their well-being and treats her students mercilessly. It is a shame she is allowed to influence young students.
Awful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took her biological anthropology class and her lecturing was very dry but she did seem passionate. While the material was straightforward (or so I thought), her grading is not. She didn't explain what she wanted and simultaneously deducted points for over-explaining things. Do not take unless necessary, definitely not for a divisional.

Content wise, the class was really interesting and I learned a lot. Dr. Miller is a cool person and really passionate about what's she teaching, so the lectures are interesting and easy to follow. She is knitpicky grader though. She wants it exactly her way and will take points off for the dumbest stuff and class averages were always really low.

Do not take as a divisional. She is an extremely unrealistic and harsh grader. I've never had a prof take points off an exam for including "extra details" that she views as "unnecessary," even if you answer her question correctly. And she doesn't just take off 1 point for that, you'll receive 0 points on that entire question.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Miller is friendly and keeps class entertaining, however your entire grade is based on four required exams and one optional fifth exam. Dr. Miller is an extremely picky grader and often takes off a ton of points for small things like adding "too much detail" to your answer. The average on the fifth exam was a 55% and she does not curve.
A very picky and subjective grader! Her exams are the only things really counting for a grade, so they're weighted very heavily.

Horrible professor with pretty boring lectures. Starts off thinking itll be a good class with the take home tests but she is a ridiculously hard and unrealistic grader. Also extremely difficult to reach out and get help as the only way to contact her is her cell phone, no email at all.

Dr. Miller is super nice and has super clear lectures. Her tests ask questions that are basically answered word for word in the lectures so if you attend class and take notes, the tests are not bad. Youre given a week for the tests and theyre open note, so shes specific in grading, but as long as you take careful notes, youll be fine
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: DONT TAKE AS DIVISIONAL. Professor Miller is super passionate about bio anthro and the class interesting but only take it if you're passionate as well. Your whole grade is based on 4 test (with one optional make-up that can drop your lowest grade) but she is a VERY picky grader. Many people regretted taking this as a divisional.

If you are taking this for a divisional simply do NOT! She is weirdly picky about test answers and you have to work way too hard to do fine. A majority of my class felt the same way and we all regret taking her class. Take a different divisional or if you are passionate about Biological Anthropology then a different professor at least.

Although she's passionate about ANT 113, this was the worst decision of my academic career. She offers only a one-hour office hour time once a week, does not use email (you must call), and 4 exams determine your entire grade. Literally the worst class. Do not take it as a divisional or buy a box of tissues because you WILL be crying a lot.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Honestly, this class was really hard but I think that has to do with it being online. She was very invested in her students and available outside of class. I wouldn't recommend taking this class if you are just trying to get a divisional, but if you are pre-med it might be an interesting divisional for you, and could be helpful. 10/10
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: She tries to be relatable and make lectures interesting but she just regurgitates the power points which get posted online anyways. She is an extremely strict grader. Which is necessary for only being graded on take home assignments but I would work with other students on tests and still my grade would suffer. Don't take if it is for a divisional.

Dr. Miller is a very interesting professor who has very thought-provoking material and lectures. I learned a lot in this class but wish I did better. It is hard to reach out and get help because she only has her personal phone number to get in contact with. She's very harsh and strict on deadlines and attendance. Only 4 grades for the class total.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She gives you guidelines, but they are not simple to follow because she is VERY particular when it comes to grading. Most times the correct answer isn't good enough. Unless anthro runs in ur blood, be prepared to do worse than you like. Other than that amazing woman who's passion shows through in her lectures. DONT TAKE AS DIV. Only 4 grades go in
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I love Dr. Miller! She clearly loves her job and is very passionate about anthropology. Your grade is based off of 4 exams and you can replace your worst grade with an optional 5th exam. Her lectures are interesting and fun and as long as you pay attention to the slideshows during class, you will do fine in the class. I highly recommend Dr. Miller!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Miller was a really great professor! She is a really tough grader so expect to prepare really well for exams, and do NOT be late to her class. She views it as very disrespectful. She is intimidating but she has an engaging sense of humor and is very enthusiastic about anthropology!

Do not take Prof. Miller is you want to pass. She is an EXTREMELY harsh graders. You'd be lucky to score above a 70. Her exams are all short answer questions. Do not take the class if you're taking ANT as a divisional. She did well with online classes. She really cares about her class. But she does not make this an easy A class.

Miller is an amazing professor as long as you are respectful and actually do the work as a student should. The book is not necessary for this class really except one or two times so if you know someone taking this class maybe split the price between a few people because it isn't needed except for one exam I think. Pay attention during lecture!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Literally if you just follow her instructions at the beginning of the class and actually come to class and pay attention it's impossible to fail. She gives the test to us a week in advance to ensure that you have the time to get the best grade possible. Yes, she's a tough grader and is pick but following the instructions that she gives out is key.

the professor obviously wrote that last comment herself. 'Cranky' is an understatement, and a word no one under 30 uses. She is arrogant and entitled, and comes off as "blatantly rude", not "cranky". I did well in the class, but could have done without the professor.

Grade is 4 tests which are 5 essay questions of a study guide of 10 questions you get a week a head of time (there is the option of taking a 5th test and dropping the lowest score). Interesting subject, Miller can come off as cranky but is happy to help if you reach out to her.I would reccomend this class/ professor.
Memorization, pickiest grader, no email, it was just awful
horrible
great teacer. lecture style class

Not a good teacher. He makes the material very confusing and teaches very different materials than the other teachers. Grades are based on how much he likes you and the tests have random things that we never learned on them. Would really recommend doing anything you can to not take him.

2 exams, 2 excel projects, and participation worth 20% of grade which entirely depends on how much he likes you and how close you sit to him. Never seen a prof try to fail his students like this dude. Exams are impossible but don't worry cuz he'll just make up your grade in his head. He actually said "I will give you the grade I think you deserve."

Dr. Pinder creates a competitive class environment by having randomized participation, very polarizing guy. 
Exams are almost impossible but final grades are curved. 
Learned a lot in his course and would take this prof again.

Dr. Pinder, while he seems like a nice guy out side of class, is truly a terrible professor. 20% of your grade is participation, but yet he limits participation to a randomly generated name caller. The average on the exams are terribly low, not because the students to do not study or try, but because the tests are impossibly hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Your grade really depends on how much he likes you. Kind of an odd guy, but something about him makes you feel bad for the guy. Tests are extremely hard, but he does curve if he likes you enough. Don't think the course is too hard to get a B in, but an A is nearly impossible.

In each class, you will spend a large amount of time reviewing two problems that could have been solved using excel or simpler algebra and logic. A large portion of your grade will depend on how early you show up to class and entertain him. He is very dismissive towards students' questions and can often come off as rude when answering them.

I had him at the Charlotte campus PMBA program. He resented being there and took it out on the class. He is petty and childish. We did not have the advantage of being in Winston-Salem to stroke his ego by activities such as listening to him play guitar and acting amazed. His teaching was intentionally terrible and his character is worse.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Excel could have solved every problem, yet he enjoys paper & pencil. Tests are designed to melt your brain when you're 10 mins in. Tip for scoring A: Superpower
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: belittles you in office hours and makes you feel dumb
Jon is great. Polarizing, but great. He prepped me great for my summer internship and is a really great human.
He literally tanked my class, and was reprimanded by the university for it.  If he doesn't believe in what you're doing, he'll protest with indifference toward you and your grades.

Dr. Pinder is an awesome professor who is always smiling and really wants his students to succeed. The first half of the course is much easier than the second half so don't get too comfortable, but Dr. Pinder will help you with anything you need - just ask. I would definitely recommend taking his class. Also is excel skills are unmatchable.
Jon is one of the best teachers Wake has to offer. He can take a class of MBAs and make them experts in excel and stats. If you show interest in the class he will go to great lengths to help you out.

Easily one of the best professors I've ever had (no, didn't go to some small no-name; had undergrad at a large public T15).  I've had classes with both Quant professors, and you just can't go wrong with Jon.  He genuinely cares about the students in his own goofy way and does his best to make sure that every student learns something useful.

What I learned and applied is simply outstanding!! Jon is polarizing for many love/hate. At 5+ years removed, I still use these skills in healthcare and foreign assistance work. Most of all, use these skills for yourself!! Get ready for serious work, though. Life is more than living by numbers, and he tries to teach that too.

I graduated in 05; I can safely say Pinder teaches nothing you will use in the real world. He makes quant unnecessarily hard, sets you up to fail, then offers a helping hand (which was never very helpful). If you play his game, you'll do fine, but don't believe the 'pinder show' hype.  Boone is better...he teaches you what you really need.

Jon is a very tough professor and will not hesitate to call students out in class. His grading is strict but is rigiruous (he will re-read your papers 2 to 3 times). He is very helpful if you come to him with the "What did I do wrong?" attitude and a little defensive if you approach with the "My answer is really right!" method.

Very interesting personality - I can see how some students like him very much some not at all. He is very smart and knowledgeable and goes the extra mile for you if you show interest and commitment. What he teaches is hard stuff and you can't skip-read, you must work hard. I wish I could attend the class again.
fantastic

Jon's Quant Methods course is one of the few courses I remember enjoying in the FT MBA program.  It was hard, but the lessons have been extremely useful since I took it in 2001.  I would love to take it again as a refresher!

Whoever is disparaging this guy on here needs to get a clue.  I've been out of his class 5 years now and I use what he taught me every day.  People with Quant abilities get paid a helluvalot more than those who don't, so I'd say I owe him about $50K in thanks.  If you connect with him, you're set.  A great guy.

Jon is hard, class material is hard, but it is worth it.  This class will certainly help me earn addition 50K-100K.  I wish the pace was slower, but it is ok. The best thing about him - he loves what he teaches and definetely carries you to the world of quant methods with enthusiasm.
Very challenging, but you walk away with tools to succeed.  Material cannot be learned in one sitting, so prepare to struggle daily.  Difficult grader at times.

This guy is super smart but a total ****. In the end I got a lot out of his class but I'm not sure it was worth the daily beratings. When I heard this guy got Teacher of the Year I thought that they must have run out of professors to give it to. Arrogant and whiney. Spiteful at times and loves to make you look stupid. And is good at it.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Definitely caring definitely accessible during office hours. The course lost a lot of structure when he taught it my semester. As in, the students were choosing what was on the final and he covered topics with broad strokes in one lecture, leaving out a lot of detail. Kind of made a mess around the final but its okay. He is a really nice guy
Jed has definitely been the highlight of my first semester, I always looked forward to my FYS class. Great man

FYS with Macosko might be the highlight of my week. The discussions are often very interesting and you will definitely learn something. The 2 essays and presentations are graded very easy as well as HW. I will miss this FYS class in fact Jed may be my best friend.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This was a fun class! It was pretty easy and Dr. Macosko always kept class fun and entertaining. I would definitely recommend this class to incoming freshmen. However he can be kind of emotional and the class was very disorganized

FYS with Dr. Macosko is a roller coaster every day but he really cares about his students and his class is actually fun. The workload isn't that bad, there are 2 papers and 2 presentations all graded off of how interesting they are, but he wants his students to succeed and my favorite part of my day was this FYS

DO NOT TAKE HIS PHY113!!! His teaching style is beyond slammed: he explains the basic concepts of acceleration due to gravity, velocity, and distance in a horribly confusing way. Every topic after is jumbled with 2 or 3 others. He always goes off on irrelevant tangents. He gives no equations. The homework is unrelated to class. Can't write anymore

Prof Macosko graded papers arbitrarily based on enjoyment, which was very annoying, but he was still a good professor who cared about us and wanted us to learn. He's a physics professor, so he doesn't have much of a clue about fintech, and he gave us quizzes on stuff that he didn't even know. The class isn't too much work, but the grading is weird.

Wayyyyyy too difficult for an FYS. He grades based on rankings of whose paper is most interesting to read (no real criteria). He will make you rewrite an assignment by hand if AI detected, which has false positives all the time. So much writing for homework and papers (way more than other FYSs). Macosko also knows NOTHING about fintech.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Guy is so unorganized his class is a mess. His grading criteria is unknown and it feels like it is completely random at times. Only take if it is your last option fys

Dr. Macosko is the type of professor where it is evident that he cares about his job and his students. The class is over big data and influential people, and all of the presentations were over influential people of our choice. Overall, the class was interesting, and I always looked forward to it.

Dr. Macosko is an incredibly kind and passionate professor. It is apparent from the first day of class how much he cares both about the subject matter and wanting his students to succeed. I took his first year seminar on big data and influence and learned a ton. There were four, five-page papers, which seemed reasonable for the class.

Dr. Macosko is incredibly funny. The class itself is relatively easy to get an A in in my experience. You are graded on 4 5-page essays and corresponding 15 minute presentations. It's a very chill class and Dr. Macosko clearly cares greatly about his students. The grading criteria can be a bit unclear but if you follow directions you will do well.

This professor gave very easy quizzes. It was mainly graded on your performance on papers. It seemed like most classes were very flexible and unorganized. He used some odd grading and rating systems. He sometimes can criticize students in his class publicly, but it builds tough skin. He is really entertaining, and I really enjoyed taking his class.

Professor Macosko is the guy you want. FYS class consists of 4 essays and presentations, which mostly make up your grade, and he is a fair grader, and overall class is not very hard. Dr. Macosko is a great person, cares about his students, is very flexible, and I genuinely enjoy coming to class because it's very laid back.

Dr. Macosko is hands down the best professor I have had. He cares deeply about his students and the class is engaging and enjoyable. I learned how to become a better writer and give meaningful presentations all while learning more about about big data. I would highly recommend Dr. Macosko for FYS 100!

Jed Macosko is a great professor and I throughly enjoyed his class. He was always making it interesting and fun, connecting what we were learning to our own lives. He is passionate about the topic our FYS was on and brought people in to talk about it which was super interesting. The only difficult thing is the 5-page papers (4 of them).

Professor Macosko is a great professor. At times he can be a little too blunt or transparent, but he always has your best interests in mind. This class is a lot of work for an FYS class but is manageable. Do not expect to learn a lot about big data, as this is primarily a writing class. Overall, Jed is a very enthusiastic and fun teacher.

I took Dr. Macosko's FYS class, and he's the best. He truly cares about his students and makes sure class is fun, collaborative, and interactive. The class presentations about influential people were fun, and as long as you show up to class and put some effort in, you should do well. I highly recommend taking his class!
Jed is the best. Our class was a great time. We did a lot of papers, presentations and quizzes but grading was not hard. If you do your work you will be fine.

Jed Macosko was pretty soldi for FYS. graded based on rankings of the class which I did not agree with but even if you were near the bottom of the rankings you still got like an 87. easy grader easy course load.

He is a great guy. Really cares about his students. I can't speak for physics, but in FYS he always came to class with jokes. Very family oriented. Learned a lot about his family and he took us all out to eat with his family at the crepe place down the road.
Dr. Macosko was a great fys teacher. He made the class engaging and fun. He never assigned too much work and was understanding if you needed an extension.
The grading was a bit weird, but the classes were great.

(pt. 3) Class would be interrupted frequently by the sound of his incoming text messages and he would not proceed with class until he responded to the message. Several classes were taught when he was in a car on the highway. I got an A in this course however I did not learn anything and I truly would advise taking anyone else over Macosko.

(pt.2) The professor would frequently leave his office hours less than thirty minutes in and tell the students to "help each other" because he had another commitment. When a student asked for help on a difficult, in-depth problem, his response was "if you try really really hard and still don't get it I will just give you the answer tomorrow".

(pt. 1) Dr Macosko is the worst prof I've had at Wake. I took this course over the summer and he did not lecture on ANY content whatsoever, made half of the homework for the entire summer due BEFORE the FIRST day of class (???), and decided to hold class an additional half hour longer than the listed WIN course time. No feedback was given on tests.
I loved this class and professor. He put me in a great mood everyday and was an easy grader for the most part. I would recommend to anyone who needs an fys requirement.

Mr. Macosko is a great professor. His FYS class was very interesting and I learned many things I hadn't before. The class focuses on influencers and big data. Grade mostly consists of 4 essays and 3 presentations. He does grade rank the essays though. Participation matters to him so make sure to attend class. He's very nice and understanding!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Chukwu is one of the nicest teachers I have had throughout my college career. He is extremely caring and wants the whole class to succeed. He is also very accessible outside of class, which I suggest people take advantage of. I could not have asked for a better MTH 111 teacher.

He's super nice and patient, and will take the time to go over anything again that you don't understand. Very accommodating, and genuinely wants you to grasp the material. He often pauses during class to check for questions, and when there are, he's great at breaking things down to make them easier to understand. Highly recommend him as a professor

He is extremely accommodating and makes sure you understand the material. One thing I appreciated was that he always gave time for questions and encouraged students to ask them. I personally became behind in the course due to surgery, but he made sure I understood everything and had enough time to catch up. Great professor!
Super chill and easy to reach for questions! 100% recommend!

I really liked Professor Chukwu! He always made the class engaging and made sure to ask people if they had questions. His grading distribution was very good and his grading was not super harsh. I would definitely take his class again!

I've taken Professor Chukwu's course twice now and he remains one of my favorites. His deep understanding of the subject matter is evident in every lecture, and he has a remarkable ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and engaging manner. I recommend taking his class to all my friends.

Professor Chukwu is one of my favorite professors in the mathematics department. His deep understanding of the subject matter is evident in every lecture, and he has a remarkable ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and engaging manner. I recommend taking his class to all my friends.

Professor Chukwu made calculus understandable for me (didn't take in high school). Office hours were a LIFESAVER. Lectures and handouts were comprehensive, and grading/scheduling was well-organized. Class materials posted online, lots of practice problems. Professor Chukwu works with you to really teach the concept, and he is really funny too!

Professor Chukwu respects every students and is very accessible outside of the classroom. Lessons are easy to follow along, there is a presentation (available on canvas) and a handout going with the material. He walks through examples, showing steps/answer Exams are doable, questions frequently come from past class/homeworks.

Professor Chukwu respects every students and is very accessible outside of the classroom.

Lessons are easy to follow along, there is a presentation (available on canvas) and a handout going with the material. He walks through examples, showing steps/answer 

Exams are doable, questions frequently come from past class/homeworks.
Dr. Chukwu is a phenomenal professor with a clear passion for the subject. He also has a wonderful sense of humor! Would recommend!

Regarded as the hardest of all the Wake calc 1 professors. Hard exams and quizzes. Gives back weird feedback. But will say overall he is a nice guy definitely just takes some going to office hours for him to start to like you.

Hard to understand and a very awkward speaker. Lectures were not helpful and students who asked questions were completely lost with the answers he provided. Only way to get through the class is self teaching via youtube and such, but the benefit is that the content is easy. Grading is weirdly particular sometimes. Don't take him unless you have to.

So I do not recommend taking Professor Chukwu unless you took Calculus in high school. That being said, he was a great teacher that went into extreme detail on how to solve problems. His tests were the hardest of all the Calc l teachers however, that is on purpose. By making his exams so difficult I was able to do extremely well on the final.

He is a nice man but is way too hard of a grader and his exams are just insane. He told classes and me several times he would curve our final grades and he did not. The other math 111 teachers allow retakes and dropping of an exam, Chukwu does not. I genuinely like him as a person he just caused so much unnecessary stress!

Overall a good teacher but just an extremely hard tester and harsh grader overall. Accessible outside of class but sometimes he doesn't answer the students' questions well (most of the times lead to confusion from both parties).

The toughest of all MTH111 professors. He does this on purpose, one of the only professors who does not allow test corrections. Not an awful guy if he likes your class, but his tests were EXTREMELY long and difficult- kind of ridiculously so.

This was my favorite class of the semester.His teaching style was simple yet incredibly effective, and he really just cared about us succeeding and doing ok. Every member of our class was special, and we all became very close both in and outside of the classroom.

He is horrible at explaining, and the only math 111 teacher who doesn't allow retakes or extra credit. His questions are ridiculously harder than the homework. he doesnt bother learning names, would mark me absent even if i was there, and didnt let me make up a test after i had a life threatening accident that put me out for a week.
How is he a professor? He makes mathematical mistakes in every lecture. No wonder Wake Forest's rank dropped so much.
Took calc in high school and still could not understand the way he taught MTH111.
Lots of telling not a lot of showing. Nice enough guy but hard to understand and often cold towards students. Overall hard class in general but its no easier w Prof. Chukwu
He just gives loads of homework and doesnt teach that well.

Dr. C is kind of hard to understand sometimes, but he is a nice and caring professor. Test questions come from the WS and class problems, so if you pay attention and do your homework you'll be fine. He explains things in different ways and offers plenty of extra helps and time for questions.

Her lectures move very fast and can be confusing. The tests are difficult but she drops an exam and some quizzes and also gives a good amount of extra credit. She's also very available outside of class.

She was super generous when dropping grades (took top 10 quizzes & dropped a test) and cared about her students doing well. She is also accessible outside of class and wants her students to do well. There was a lot of outside work compared to other ECN 150 classes, but lots of drops!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
Her quizzes would not make sense to you at all...very unclear instructions and also timed
Tests are the same

She is enthusiastic which makes the class have more energy, but she is confusing and the tests are really hard. 20 point tests, if you miss a single question your'e toast. She gives practice tests but no answer key so the only way to know if you did anything correct is her office hours. I wouldnt rec but shes not awful

I took Regan for my FYS credit. She was very knowledgable, expects a lot from her students. However, very lenient and makes class interesting relating concepts to the real world. I recommend, while she can be a hard grader she is understanding and accessible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is a nice person by all means. However, all instructions, including those from hws, tests, and quizzes could be extremely hard to understand. She also has her own way of grading which requires students to show all the steps (in the way she requires) to receive credit. For any step that you did not do as she likes it, no credit received.

The class is very lecture heavy and she can move pretty quick but explains concepts using a lot of examples which is very helpful. You can do well on all the exams if you utilize the resources she provides, the most helpful being the old exams she publishes on canvas. If you practice those you will be very prepared for the questions on exams.

Awful class. You can't see your grade on Canvas, all tests are graded out of 20 points so if you miss one full question you're pretty much out of luck. Willing to help but explanations are never very helpful. Class is fast and confusing. Doesn't post answer keys to practice tests so you don't know if you're doing it right. So frustrating and awful.

(I took intro) Lovely person outside of class, but frustrating class situation. Textbook mandatory for homework, but not really helpful for exams. Offers lots of help if you ask for it (and super encouraging), but you need to actually put in time/effort into her class to pass it. I didn't, so I got a bad grade. You need to go to her class daily.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: The worst teacher I have ever taken. No further explanation needed but simply do not take take my word.

She goes over everything extremely fast as if someone was rushing her. She also does not explain the material well and expects students to be on her level of expertise. Personality wise, she's funny and bright. Nonetheless, if you want to receive the best education about Econs, enroll in someone else's class.

I took her online during the summer. Was super available and willing to help when we needed her. The summer class was test heavy, but each exam was only worth 20 points. Our class average was pretty low per test because even a few points off was a big grade drop. Overall, just do a bunch of her practice tests and make sure you can answer those well

She's like a solid teacher and her lectures are fine. But she's a tough grader and her class averages are B-. Also she messed up my final grade. There are other teachers where u can be just as good and get a better grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: She rushes, explains unclearly, and erases the board too quickly. Her lectures don't cover all the material on the test, and she often gets things wrong on quizzes. Must go to office hours and do all practice tests to do well. I am pre-med and took this class because I was interested in econ, major regrets.
a

This review is not for her Econ 150 course but for her Global studies FYS course. You have daily 50 page readings for homework with quizzes. Plus either a paper or in class debate worth 10% of your grade basically every other week. She is also a hard grader on the essays. In other FYS classes you either meditate or watch movies and pick your grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I liked Professor Regan. She was clear, the class was structured, and once you understood how the class worked if you put in the work you did well. That said, she can be difficult to approach, intimidating, and at times a bit snarky. She gives you a lot of points through homework to make up for test grades and a fair amount of unchecked readings.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Very nice lady and accessible outside of class. Tests really follow the study guides and she offers a ton of review sessions. A challenging course overall but defiantly manageable.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Does not follow well with the textbook. Make sure to double check answers graded incorrectly on exams because she'll grade some incorrectly sometimes.
10/10 for Econ 150. I took it online but still superrrr easy
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Regan is one of the hardest professors I have ever had, but I have learned so much from her. The work load is heavy, but all of the work she gives helps students understand material better which makes exams much more doable. If you complete the work, attend office hours, and attend class you can definitely be successful.

Professor Regan definitely is a frustrating professor at times. When I would go to office hours, she had difficultly understanding the basic questions I was asking and I often didn't get an answer at all. She also takes points off of exams without explaining why, and if asked, does not really give a clear reason.

Worst class I have ever taken. Hundreds of pages of reading every night, lectures that are borderline incoherent, and no structure to the class whatsoever. Far and away the worst class I have taken in my academic career. Taking this class was the worst mistake I have ever made, and her class has solely made me question the standards at Wake Forest

Dr. Oke is a nice guy and his lectures were fine. There were quizzes every Friday but he drops the lowest 2 and they are always on problems that are exactly like what we covered throughout the week. If you haven't taken calc this class will be hard. He moves quickly and occasionally explains things in a confusing way. Overall he's fine and funny.
Wouldn't show up for office hours, lectures hard to follow. Don't take him.

He works out problems in class then posts the notes on Canvas, which is super helpful. He doesn't take attendance. Quizzes every Friday and he drops the lowest 2. Tests aren't awful, but be familiar with every type of problem covered. 

He explains things/answers questions pretty clearly. He's very nice and jokes around sometimes with students.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had. Doesn't care about students and doesn't respond to emails. Be prepared to teach yourself the material as it makes concepts more confusing. Overall very difficult to understand so never take his class.
He is very kind and cares a lot about his students. If you didn't take calculus before, you will struggle.
Absolutely brutal teacher. Doesn't answer emails, frankly does not care about students learning, doesn't know how to teach. Stay far away

Professor Oke was great. Super nice guy and always keeps the class entertained. All the hw was online and each assignment takes max 30 minutes. With the exception of 1 exam, his exams were very straight forward and just like problems done in class. If you took calc in hs you should be completely fine but make sure to pay attention during class time

He unteaches the material. If you were good at calc in hs you won't be in his class. Worst professor ever, you won't learn anything. He does not explain anything properly, not even sure he knows how to do the problems he's trying to teach.

BEWARE!! You will learn nothing during his lectures and must teach the material to yourself. Whenever he gets to a problem he can't he tells you to do it on your own and moves on. He is organized with homework schedules but only assigns online work.
Worst math class I've ever taken tests do not resemble study guides or homework and grading is extremely inconsistent.

Let me begin, He is an Incredibly genuine and nice guy and means completely well. He is a god awful teacher. He takes the word teach out of teacher. He simply recites, failing to every elaborate on difficult subjects. He expects us to know it as soon as it comes out of his mouth.
Professor O is such a caring teacher

Nice guy, one of the worst professors Ive ever had. Lectures are over complicated that cover concepts that make no sense when there are much easier ways to solve problems but does not accept these forms. Difficult to understand and assigns homework due on Friday and Saturday nights. stay away if you can. Tests are also very difficult

Professor Oke cares that the students understand the material being lectured on. He maximizes class time with lectures and notes. Be prepared to pay attention in class and take notes to aid learning. His accent does not interfere with learning and he keeps the class entertaining with comments and jokes.
Very detailed man, absolutely love the guy. You will actually have fun with math. I'm a Stats major so I needed this class as a requirement. Great teacher, Great man.
Such a mid teacher. Not too bad. Would be acceptable to take again but it just requires more work
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If you want an easy A, you're not going to get it with him. You will actually learn the material though. His lectures are typically very dense, so take notes, and don't miss class. He's also got quizzes every week, but those aren't so bad. Also, he tries to make discrete math fun, and cracks a few jokes.

Worst teacher at Wake hands down. If u are reading this thinking "oh he cant be that bad, the kid writing this probs j sucks a math" you are exactly the kid that is gonna fail it. Literally, take ANYONE else for this course. He gives MC tests and then halfway through announces the correct answer isn't listed.

A hard class in general. He gives many opportunities to do well. He let us redo tests and quizzes as take homes. He goes very fast in class so prior knowledge of calc helps. Doesn't give a lot of homework and listens to feedback from students. He's a sweet man who wants his students to succeed, but he's definitely not for everyone.

Professor Oke is the worst math professor Ive ever had; he should not work with students. He refuses to help you and when you say youre confused and says no youre not. I got an A in calc in high school, yet cannot understand a single thing in this class. PLEASE stray away from him, you will be miserable if you dont. He doesnt teach he recites

comment: Please try and shy away from Professor Oke. His lectures make no sense and even if you've taken Calculus in high school before, you will still be extremely confused by his lack of explanations. Seems annoyed when you ask questions and you'll have to seek outside help in order to do well. Definitely do not recommend this course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: If you have any other options please PLEASE take a different professor. You will be teaching yourself most of the material on your own. In class, students ask for further explanations and we are left even more confused. In comparison to calc from high school, his methods are overly complicated and more difficult than necessary.

She is super super nice! She is a little stingy about specifics when it comes to grading. However, if you just go see her and talk, she explains everything and makes it super clear what she is looking for.
She's my favorite person I recommend her to everyone. Although I only had her for lab I still rave about her. TAKE ALLISON RICE
Dr. Rice is the best of the best, hands down. She made every concept seem easy, and the class was a breeze. Cannot recommend her enough.

DR. RICE IS THE BEST. EVER. Dr. Rice truly cares about your success and makes herself so available to answer questions and help with any concepts. Her tests are straightforward, and she is by far the best lecturer I have ever had. She explains organic chem so well and makes it very understandable. She is an angel!!!!!!!!

Dr. Rice is hands down one of the best professors! Her lectures are straightforward and the class is very organized. The work outside of class is never busy work and you will know what is expected of you for the exams. She cares a lot for her students and is always accessible. She makes a challenging class very manageable. Take her class!

Anyone who is giving Dr. Rice less than a 5 is just bitter. Dr Rice is hands down the professor I would choose for any difficult class. She explains things clearly, gives very fair feedback and grades, and provides plenty of opportunities to get your grade up. If you are doing poorly in Dr. Rice's class, it is 100% on you

Dr. Rice is a queen! Orgo is really hard and she knows it so she gives you lots of extra credit opportunities and practice problems. Her lectures are kind of fast-paced but she explains concepts very clearly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Rice is the most caring professor I have ever had. She explains difficult concepts so clearly and is extremely understanding of her student's individual needs. She is so helpful outside of class and exam material is reflective of what is learned in class. I never would have thought ochem would be my favorite class but it is because of her.
Mrs. Rice wasn't even my teacher. She was my tutor at GTCC. She's the only reason I got an A in CHM151. She's very caring. Highly recommend!!!

Dr. Rice was an amazing chem professor. She gave many opportunities to raise our grades and really cared about our success. She was also very good at explaining difficult concepts and graded everything very fast.

For labs with Dr. Rice, she really did a good job of explaining to students how to get an A in the course and provided many opportunities for extra credit. If you go to her office hours and ask her to review your work, she will either approve your work or push you in the right direction to get full credit for your work.

She is a great prof! She wants you to succeed by giving extra credit, reviews before exams, and offering office hours where she is there to always help. She grades super quick and lets you know what your grade is. She always takes your lowest exam grade and averages it with your highest which helped me a lot.

Dr. Rice is the best! She is super sweet and caring. She really wants you to succeed and is more than willing to work with you to be successful in her class. She also is really respectful of students time and does not require useless, busy work that you would find in other classes. TAKE THIS ANGEL'S CLASS!

Dr. Rice is one of my favorite professors at Wake. I began the class with very little chemistry experience or appreciation, but she quickly made me fall in love with it. Classes were engaging and genuinely interesting, and she always held review sessions before tests. There are lots of opportunities for extra credit. Would absolutely recommend!!

Dr. Rice was my favorite professor by far. I struggled with chem in hs and was terrified for gen chem, but Dr. Rice's teaching was phenomenal and allowed me to love chem. She gives extra credit, and her teaching is very clear and helpful. She gives practice exams and review sessions to make sure we understand test material. Take her if you can!!

Dr. Rice was by far the best professor I had this semester and it wasn't even close. I had her for both lecture and lab. She was always available to help and prepared us extremely well for each test by providing a ton of review work. She also grades extremely fast which was super nice. All-around great woman and would totally take another class.

Dr. Rice is the best teacher! Shes so caring and wants you to succeed. She gives a lot of review material and resources to help you succeed. Her tests align really well with the homework and practice problems she gives.

I absolutely love Dr. Rice. I was not afraid to ask any questions, and she explained everything amazingly. If I was nervous about a test she would reassure me that I would do fine. Just do all the practice problems she gives you and you will do amazing! If you have the opportunity, take her!

Dr. Rice is awesome! She really cares about all the students in the class and wants to make sure that everyone is understanding all material. In the lab class I took, many of the experiments did not work out exactly right for students, and Dr. Rice was more than understanding and made sure the grading rubrics accommodated common errors.

I love Dr. Rice! she is super clear and truly wants her students to succeed in chemistry. Her hw assignments are well spaced and the tests are fair based on the material covered. I would definitely recommend her for lecture and lab.

Lectures are kind of long and boring but are straight from the textbook. She only gives 2 homework assignments per chapter, but there are a lot of opportunities to figure out what's going on. She hosts very helpful review sessions before tests.

I LOVED professor Woolfolk. He is so nice and you can tell he loves what he does. He gives out full study guides for each of his tests that look EXACTLY like what is on the test but with different questions. It makes studying so much easier. He is very clear about what he wants and if you follow those guidelines you'll do well. Would take again!

I actually had him for 113 but it wasn't an option. Prof. Woolfolk is my fav professor this semester! He makes his students feel smart, always encouraging and motivating. I was terrified for a class taught in Spanish, but he teaches so well and is so patient. Hoping to take a course of his again in the future!!! Me gusta la clase de Espanol mucho!
Professor Woolfolk is great and he makes a class like Spanish 212 manageable. He is very lenient on grading and is overall a great teacher and awesome person.

Professor Woolfolk is amazing and I would recommend taking his class 100x! He was accessible outside of class and very helpful during the entire semester. He made sure to try and keep the class as engaging as possible and was very encouraging to help people uncomfortable speaking in front of the class feel comfortable enough to do so.

Dr. Woolfolk is definitely caring and humorous. Overall very nice but his lectures aren't super helpful or clear. He does make time to meet outside of class and office hours. Oddly strict about going to the bathroom during class. No technology in class even for notes. He is a tough grader. Class is boring and notices if you don't pay attention.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Excellent professor! The content of the class can be difficult, and boring, at times, but Profe Woolfolk is so caring, very engaging, and enthusiastic, that it makes the class very enjoyable. I hope Profe Woolfolk gets to teach more upper level Spanish classes, because I would love to take another with him.

Professor Woofolk cares about his students and is a really kind and understanding professor. Class can be a bit boring sometimes but it is usually engaging and he is so nice and makes me excited to go to Spanish. Definitely recommend taking him and would take him again!

Dr. Woolfolk is the nicest professor ever. His class is challenging, and participation matters. The online homework is not too hard and is good practice. The course is very grammar heavy which is hard no matter who is teaching.

Took this class pass/fail like many other students in the class. Woolfolk is overall a great guy and an even better prof. Class is, without fail challenging, but he does a great job of helping when he can! I would recommend especially because much of the wake Spanish department sucks.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Don't think professor Woolfolk is easy. You need a good grasp of the language to do well in this class. With that being said, he deeply cares about his students and his passion for teaching is contagious. He makes learning Spanish fun and is a very accessible professor. Would recommend!

Profe Woolfolk is seriously the best Spanish professor at Wake. He is such a lenient grader and he wants his student's to succeed. He is very approachable and always answers questions. The workload is manageable but you will need to teach yourself some of the grammar before class.
Dr. Woolfolk is the best Spanish teacher he is so nice and understanding and literally wants to see everyone do well. He is such a nice grader and really teaches the material in a good way.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Woofolk is amazing. The work is tough, but he gives so many resources to prepare you and set you up for success. Could not recommend him more.

Prof Woolfolk is so nice and always willing to meet with students. I am in his class right now and I love it. I have an A and because of him I'm considering doing a Spanish minor. He is a lenient grader and gives points back where he can.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I absolutely adore him he is such a genuine, caring guy who makes all of his students feel welcome & has a chill environment. I had him for 153 too & he made a subject I didn't like as a hispanic into something I looked forward to everyday. I considered getting a Spanish minor because of him, coming from someone who was dreading the required class.

Professor Woolfolk is literally the best. I loved his class so much. Even if you don't like Spanish, he will make it more enjoyable and you can easily manage the class. He does give homework every class, but it's always reasonable and as long as you do it, you'll be fine. He cares so much and wants his students to succeed. Take Woolfolk if you can!

woolfolk is the SWEETEST professor. he cares about his students greatly and he makes class interesting. he is very fair with tests and easy in grading. you have hw every night, but it is very manageable. you have written compositions x2, regular exams x3, interviews x2, and a presentation. participation and attendance matter. i loved this class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Such an angel. Not a huge fan of Spanish but he was actually a great teacher and cares about his students. Pretty easy Spanish class definitely recommend! His tests are very straightforward.

I am personally not a fan of language and I was dreading taking SPA 212. With that being said, Dr. Woolfolk is a legendary teacher who cares about his students, is not an unreasonably difficult grader, and, admittedly, his class made me think about continuing Spanish because I actually felt myself grow as a speaker. If her is available, take him!
Prof. Woolfolk cares about his students and reallywants them to succeed. Not too much work as well. Would recommend
Not too hard grader, really wants to teach spanish and will help you as much as you need
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I know this sounds biased, but I am convinced Gorsuch graded subjectively. I talked to many people in my class who said they received high marks and lots of extra credit on homework, but despite getting my homeworks checked by multiple tutors in the CLASS office, consistently did poorly. You will never receive feedback on your work in this course.

Avoid this class. If you have no idea about economics, then do not take this class as it is very difficult. He is so boring and his classwork is not even taught in class. Tests are hard and unrealistic within a short time frame. He doesn't teach that much in the class but his slides then show hundreds of slides of information.

He is nice, but not the best lecturer. The questions on the exam are worded weirdly, and some of the questions weren't really covered in class. Even though I had taken Econ before, he made the concepts seem harder than they really were. His class will be difficult if you don't make friends/study buddies.

Gorsuch doesn't understand how to most effectively teach ECN150. No feedback is given. Questions on exams and homework are vague, and it is not always clear what answer he is looking for. I have seen three tutors through CLASS for this course and they all have been surprised at the difficulty and not been able to answer some of my questions.

Professor Gorsuch is a very nice guy but he is by far the worst teacher/professor I have ever had my entire life. His lectures do not teach anything and there is minimal resources outside of class to help. His test are manageable but I would recommend not taking Econ 150 if he is your only option.

Dr. Gorsuch provides students with a heavily structure introductory economics course. Each class consists of a lecture, with an occasional worksheet that you will work on with a group. There is one graded homework assignment and one test for each unit which will constitute the entirety of your grade.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Always gives lectures that you can very easily get lost in. The grade is basically 4 homeworks and 4 tests. He is not the best explaining things so prepare to learn outside of class. Only upside is his tests are easy and are just like the review sheet he gives.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. I do NOT recommend his class at all. He is a very nice guy, but his class is lecture-heavy... however, you will barely learn anything from them. You need to study the textbook and topics from online sources to do good. He is an easy grader and there are few assignments, however you still will not understand.
The class isn't very hard but he is really boring and doesn't explain things very well. I formed a study group which helped.

Class is basically self-taught. His lectures are unhelpful when completing homework and tests. But, he is a relatively easy grader and gives a lot of partial credit. Tests are a mirror of review questions. You will do well if you make an effort on homework, study hard for exams, and ask him for help in office hours, class, or via email.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: horrible teacher actually hate him BUT even with someone who has learned basically nothing and has done pretty horribly on his tests, I still have a B and he is not a very difficult teacher
Nice guy and let’s you do whatever you want in class, but the guy can’t teach to save his life.
Super nice professor, sometimes doesn't explain things well but wants kids to get good grades and makes the class manageable. Easy grader and always available to help for office hr. and over email.

easy enough class, 3 tests and final plus 4 homework that make up majority of your grade. tests can be stressful and a little difficult but nothing too bad. super sweet guy and wants to give kids good grades so he grades nice & v helpful in office hours!! love him!!
Gorsuch is a lecture-heavy teacher but an easy grader and if you pay attention in class you will succeed. He really helps you out during office hours and always answers your questions.

Professor Gorsuch is a nice person, but lacks in some areas of teaching. He is very knowledgeable of economics, which makes it hard for students to understand at times because he doesn't talk down to our understanding of the subject. Tests are mirrors of the review guides, there is 1 homework assignment per unit. Overall not a terrible class.
Josh is a really nice guy, and very willing to help you outside of class. His lectures are a bit difficult to follow, and content can be difficult at times. However, tests are relatively easy.
Joshua is a nice guy and an easy grader but he is boring and bad at explaining things. If you take his class you have to teach yourself basically.
Very monotone and isn't the best at responding to questions.
Hate that guy

Probably the worst professor you could ever get. He enjoys giving more homework than other 3 classes combine and award everyone's hard work with low grades. He has a grading rubric, but he doesn't want to share it to students. He always assigns pointless homework and wastes everyone's time. He won't grade your assignment until semester ends.

Professor McKeen is 0% Amazing. He makes sure students' participation by taking attendance at every class. He gives quizzes on irrelevant topics and rewards students efforts with Bs and Cs. He will fail by his standard

comment: His lessons are numerous and useless. He had students read materials out of class and then gave quizzes in class. Lots of pointless group discussions, and very unclear rubrics.
Disgusting

Brags about his glory days at Dartmouth.

Doesn't give A's

I can't believe I have to pay for another semester to put up with this man

comment: Totally waste of time. Most horrible teacher and class I have ever had!!! How could he still be a teacher!!

Thank you so much Professor McKeen for successfully lobbying beloved associate dean Dr. Shafer to pressure friendly Dr. Martin giving students unforgettably high pressure midterm exam before fall break and right after your overly time consuming yet meaningless strategy simulation. comment: Professor McKeen's lectures are tedious but his homework and quizzes are manageable. For those struggling, I'd advise spending more time on course material and less on social media such as GroupMe. Keep grinding

Professor McKeen assigns countless busy work assignments seemingly designed to waste student's time. He is in love with AI and thinks it is necessary to use it for the most basic tasks. We are required to input long prompts for assignments to tell us things that we could think up in 5 seconds using our brains.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is not awesome. Professor McKeen single-handedly made WFU drop from rank 29 to rank 47. If I gotta do one more useless assignment for this class imma fly to Antarctica and punch a penguin. Professor McKeen, if you are reading this I think you're a great person but you are out of touch with your students. Shoutout to Yiheng the goat.

No activity could unite the whole program but the resentment to McKeen made it. A 1.5-credit course even has much more homework, readings and quizzes than the other four 3-credit courses. His assignments are genuinely USELESS and waste everyone's time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is very disorganized, issuing the required reading only the day before the test, and hardly reminding you that there was a test coming up next class that required reading. A lot of pointless team work. It is foolish to have a conversation two months after the start of the school year to familiarize the group members with each other.

He insinuated that students were cheating when they performed well on quizzes but claimed he wasn't explicitly accusing anyone of cheating. He frequently sprung surprise quizzes often with extensive reading assigned just the night before. He assigned an excessive amount of both group and individual assignments, many of which seemed meaningless.
Don't take these reviews with a grain of salt. Would give a zero if I could. Dude needs to go.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Accuses students of cheating when they score a 100 or do well on a quiz. Wants students to do poorly and heard everyone gets a B if you put forward effort or not. No benefit in putting effort towards this class.  Assignments consist of busy work that takes away from other technical and challenging classes. Practicum is well done, this class is not.

His class is completely useless and has nothing to do with the MSBA program. He gives out way too many assignments, quizzes that pertain to nothing, and actual class is a waste of time. He will make useless exercises to do in class and then he will be on his phone while we are discussing. 350 characters is not enough to express my thoughts.

This class was an utter waste of time and should not be included in the MSBA program. McKeen gives you no time to work on your practicum projects and assigns tons of useless assignments that are unnecessary. He is not understanding at all of other students' commitments and takes pride in just giving students a B+ just for fun.

The material he teaches is not helpful at all, I am wasting so much time in class. All his assignments are just bust work which is the last thing I want when I am trying to get a job. He doesn't cover the real business we need to have for the practicum like understanding finances. He has no regard for anyone's time and is't open to feedback.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This man teaches a business analytics course and does not know a lick of business analytics. I have not learned a drop of business analytics in this class.

Professor McKeen assigns way too many useless assignments that take up way too much time and they are frustrating to do especially during the middle of a job search. He does not care about students' other commitments and cold calls in class all the time. His grading criteria is strange and it is very, very hard to make an A in his class.

He has roll calls in every class without considering many students still in the job market. He doesn't allow students to open laptops during class. Also, he assigned a lot of useless assignments. His grading criteria are VERY untransparent. Typically students will get a B+ in this course. It is very, very hard to get an A.

I came into this class with a strong Calculus background and I'm fully convinced thats the only reason I did so well. Mishra is very nice but not a good teacher. He will frequently overcomplicate simple topics or gloss over complicated ones. I found we did more specific examples then learning generally how to approach different problems.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Lectures aren't the most engaging, but the exams really aren't difficult, and there are so many resources to help you prepare for them. There are group problem sets and daily worksheets that boost your grade. Also he is very willing to give extensions on assignments.

Professor Mishra is a really nice guy but his class is hard. You will definitely need to utilize the math and stats center tutoring department. He does prepare you well for the final though, it was very similar to previous tests.

Super nice guy and means well, but not the best at conveying information. Not very difficult to do well in his class if you stay current use other resources for help, but he definitely made things more challenging than they needed to be at times. As a person, great guy. As a professor, not the best.

I would definitely not recommend taking a class with Pratyush Mishra. I took his MTH 111 class and, while I did well grade-wise, I found it did not live up to true Wake Forest University standards. If you truly would like to learn Calculus or have not taken a Calculus course before, I recommend finding another professor.

Pratyush cares and is funny. Calculus is a hard class, and his course actually prepares you well for future courses. His unit tests are hard, but since the final is standardized over all sections, if you do even mediocre on his tests you'll do well on the final. Actually study and you'll be fine. Ask for help, go to the Math & stats center.

Great man, TERRIBLE PROFESSOR! Super unorganized and his office hours were no help at all! He chooses to make things much more difficult than other professors and assigns lots of work! His exams were also super hard and confusing and nothing of what was taught in the lecture ended up on his exam! #STAYAWAYFROMPRATYUSHMISHRA!

Had to take this as a prerequisite, and I wish I had taken it with anyone else. He argues with his students, and we often found ourselves having to correct his simple math mistakes. He would stare at his own problems and look even more confused than we were. Not good at explaining his work or doing it in the first place. VERY challenging

Smart but disorganized and simply unhelpful as a teacher. Was incredibly difficult to follow even with a background in calc. Doesn't prepare the class for his tests at all. Wouldn't recommend taking his class if you want to have a life. Definitely the worst professor I've had at Wake.

Hard to follow in class, lectures were scattered, and office hours weren't helpful. Nice guy, but really tough material and a lot of material. Tests were super hard, I felt extremely unprepared. I had a background in calc, and still struggled a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
He is an extremely nice guy, but: 
a. his tests are comparatively a lot harder than other profs and you will have less opportunities for retakes/curves. 
b. he does not tell you what is on the tests, practice exams are not reflective of tests, and answer keys almost always have mistakes.
He is smart, but not the best professor.

He is obviously very intelligent but it can be a little much in his lectures. I would recommend a basic understanding of calculus to take this class. However, his material really preps you for the final exam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: would be much better suited for research, not suited for lower level math courses. scatterbrained but also really smart overall, but not suited for teaching
pratushy my a$$

I wasn't going to rate Mishra bc I thought I would be restating what everyone else said. However, he's been pissing me off. I'll start off saying that he's not a mean guy. But, expect no sympathy if you're new to calc. He won't tell you the topics on tests, explain his work, or keep track of your work - say by to your 100. I hope you have telepathy
He is not a good teacher, if you are able to find another professor I highly recommend doing so.

Professor Mishra is a nice guy, however, unless you have a really good background in Calculus you should not take his course. The lectures are hard to understand and he expects you to learn it yourself if you don't get it. There is a lot of homework, most of which isn't applicable to exams and quizzes. I would avoid this class as best as possible.

Mishra is a great man but as far as teaching goes, the WORST. If you take him, make sure you have a strong calculus background (or honestly it doesn't matter because even those who did were also struggling). Get ready for weekly maths and stats center visits and for a load of worksheets and Webassign's to complete.

Honestly great guy, terrible teacher. Get ready to stay up late and teach yourself everything. A is very much possible and not crazy to get, but be prepared to sacrifice your social life. He doesn't grade his tests, his TA does, and man does he take off points for nothing. Good luck and say good bye to any weekend plans.

Very homework-heavy. Be prepared to spend lots of time on the homework. He uses class time to go over practice problems, so you will mostly teach yourself the physics using the textbook. Not the best teacher at times, but is very accessible through email.
Great professor; uses active learning and works through examples in class. A fair amount of work but high grades on the tests and in the class overall
Avoid. Terrible teacher. Doesn't actually teach and overly hard

Decent professor, if you can get past his off putting and at certain points flat out rude personality. Should not be teaching undergrads imo. Just put a lot of time into the homework and youll survive. Instructions are pretty clear on how to study for tests, so follow them and youll do fine.
Good professor. Enjoyed the class.

I took his 113 class during the zoom era, so it may be different, but he's overall a solid choice for intro physics. He is very math-heavy though so I recommend a very strong foundation in calc 1 (you will be deriving equations). An A in the class was an 87, but his tests were very hard. I think the class average is an A-. He does flpd classes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: It may be just that I took this class mostly online, but he did not seem to do much actual teaching. He would have us do example problems during class and then rely on breakout rooms to have us figure things out. Though you could tell he was very intelligent he was a little dull and unengaging, and office hours were extremely awkward.

Extremely intelligent person, however, for all of his knowledge, he's completely incapable of relaying information in a way that anyone with less than a PhD can understand. Those who pass his class come out having learned nothing, and in a given year, about a third of the students who take him end up failing.
Lot's of work, but clear lectures and very helpful outside of class.

Highly mathematical teaching style - good if you love math and learning through logical relationships, tough if you learn by other means. Limited office hours and minimally helpful during them, tons of homework and way too much weight on the final in my opinion. It's nice that he teaches straight from the book though so you can follow along.
A continual stream of work, but it helps you keep up.
long homework assignments, but very helpful in office hours. Learn an amazing amount. Lectures fairly mathematical but usually good.
Challenging class, but I have never learned so much in my life! Except to spend ~8hrs a week, mostly on HW.
Demanding, but  helpful and organized. I've learned more from this class than from any other at Wake.
lots of work, but good prof!
clear organized
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

HES 100 was really easy with Woodard. The class definitely has a lot of busy work considering it is only worth 1 credit hour, but it is not a challenge whatsoever. Honestly, if you just show up to almost every class and act like you are paying attention you will be fine. For HES 100, she is good and she is clearly a nice lady!

She is so sweet and cares about her students. She really knows what she is talking about and just wants her students to understand how to live a healthy lifestyle. There's a bit of work but as long as you stay on top of it it's really very easy. Getting an A just takes doing the bare minimum of doing the quizzes and assignments on time.

She is a smart and kind professor that cares about her students. Despite this, she gives way too much work for a one credit class. We get reading and quizzes online to complete before every single class and she is not very lenient with late work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Very straightforward class. Her workload is more than the other professors from what I've seen but still completely manageable. I sat in class while she spoke and did the assignments, very very minimal homework if you approach it this way. The content was more interesting than I initially thought and you will learn something. I recommend!

You can definitely tell that Professor Woodard cares about her course content and views it as important info to help people manage their health while in college. She assigns a lot of work for HES which is really unnecessary, but it's not like it's that hard, it's just tedious beyond measure. You'll be fine, but maybe find another teacher

She's a very nice lady, and I can tell she's passionate about what she teaches, but perhaps she doesn't realize that we don't share the same zeal for HES 100 as we are just trying to fulfill the requirement. The work took way too long for a 1 credit hour class; however, it's busy work and pretty easy. Just make sure you show up to class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Woodard is very knowledgeable and does a good job teaching health. She cares about and understands the students. The expectations for the course are clear!

Way too much homework for a 1 credit hour class, on the first day she even told us that we were meant to spend 4-6 hours on her class a week! Overall easy assignments but it felt like busy work we could be doing for another class.

Dr. Woodard was very kind and understanding. HES 100 is not a fun class, I knew almost all of the information taught in this class prior to taking it. Dr. Woodard assigned a lot of busy work but the class is pretty much an easy A.

Woodard clearly cares about her classes, but doesn't understand that her course is only one credit hour. I have done more work for this class and spent more time outside of class on HES100 than I have on all but one of my classes this semester. It is manageable, but very frustrating. She is a sweet woman, though.

There is so much busywork, daily quizzes, and assignments that take as much time as a 3-4 credit course. She basically makes a 1 credit course the same workload as some 3 credit courses, which is insane. So unless you have an easy schedule do not elect to take this section of HES 100. It was so much harder than a basic 1 credit course has to be.

She gives so much busywork. When comparing her assignments to the other HES teachers she gives much longer assignments with more questions, while doing the exact same content. I get that the nature of a mandatory HES course will be this type of work but take another teacher to make it less dreadful. Try to take first half of semester.

A lot of busywork but that's just the nature of a lot of HES classes. Wonderful person but can be a bit nitpicky with grades at time. If you're a freshman, TAKE THIS AT THE START OF THE SEMESTER! You'll thank yourself for doing so during the second half.

DO NOT TAKE FOR HES. She is a nice lady, but gives way too much work for a 1 credit required health class. She took of 0.15 points for a grade on my discussion post. Annoying grader, too much work, and takes her job too seriously as a health prof.

She is by far the best HES 100 teacher. A lot of busy work but if you are willing to just do the work you will get an A no doubt. Attendance matters into your final grade but participation doesn't so just show up. She is a really nice and caring professor who genuinely cares about what she teaches.

Sharon Woodard was a kind teacher. She is clearly passionate about health and teaching. Her class is boring, but so are all mandatory health courses. She assigns a lot of homework (all busy work). The homework is extremely easy but does take time. It is easy to do well as long as you do the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: This lady is the worst. She's nice in person but I don't think she ever ended a class on time, always going over the 50 minutes that the class is supposed to be. She assigns an insane amount of work, to the point where it's almost inevitable you're gonna miss an assignment because she's just always assigning stuff. All dumb busy work

I did like having Sharon Woodard for HES 100. Despite assigning quite a bit of work, she seemed very energetic about the class in general. Attendance is mandatory but she is extremely understanding if you need to miss for sickness or other health reasons. Pay attention to her rubrics because she outlines everything she wants from you in them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Out of all the teachers for HES100, probably the one that gives the most work. Would avoid taking if there are other options but not the end of the world if you have her. Just lots of unnecessary busy work.
Be care taking this class and avoid it entirely if you can. Rupp does not give out As. Also a very rude and negative person overall.

NEVER and I mean NEVER take this class. You go through a book in about a week then write 3-4 page paper. That paper is impossible to get above a B+. I think she gave only 3 people an A- all year. She is really mean and if you don't read you better pray someone in your class did cause she will take it out on grading class papers if you didn't read.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Gives an INSANE amount of reading (2 nights to read north of 100 pages). Very fast turnaround to write papers (sometimes we would only have 2 days to write papers). Extremely harsh grader. Also not a nice person, very rude and judgemental.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Worst FYS to take. An insane amount of reading for FYS. She is very by the book: harsh grading, strict on participation and absences. Take any other FYS. This class made my freshmen year schedule 100x harder than my friends.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Rupp is actually personable if you get to know her, and work hard in her class. Not a class for people who skip, don't like reading, etc, as she takes participation really seriously. People are right, she's a really tough grader, and she assigns a decent chunk of work. However, if you apply yourself, she's really helpful.

Decent professor all in all. Took her for HST 173, and at times she could be a nitpicky grader but as long as you apply yourself in class and do the work you'll get off with at least a B. From what I've seen its insanely hard to get an A, but the class isn't outright impossible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Rupp often sued passive aggressive remarks when she was unsatisfied with our work. She is a very difficult grader who shapes her questions in a way that is difficult to comprehend. If she doesn't like a specific thing you say, she will dock your grade and let you know how she felt:/. The most difficult and unpleasant class I have had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She grades so harsh because you have to write what she wants to hear, not the facts. She is without a doubt the hardest grader I've ever experienced and when we had to lead individual seminars, she gave everyone Bs which is stupid because we had to lead a class for an hour, yet she doesn't think it was good enough for her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader
