comment: Rupp is one of those teachers that just wants everyone to care about history as much as she does. Her class has a lot of reading and writing but I think that just prepares you well for other classes. Tends to get annoyed/sad when no one participates in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Essays are impossible today core higher than an 80 because if you use a word she doesnt like she takes off points like wtf how do I know what words you do and dont like. Participation also matters a lot and there are non stop readings
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Rupp grades harder than any other prof I have seen on campus. dont expect to pass or get a good grade just bc it's an FYS course. Hardest FYS course to take at WFU so i recommend you take literally any other course. She is a kind lady but if you dont share her opinions it is obvious you arent the favorite.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Susan Rupp is an excellent professor, a true shining star in a sea of mediocrity. She is one of the only professors who I can say genuinely cares about each and every one of her students. Other than that one weird Tuesday morning class where she laid out an impassioned argument against the validity of the Holocaust, I have no complaints whatsoever.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Rupp is a history buff teaching an FYS course. She definitely inserts her own beliefs (religion and social issues) when not necessarily warranted, so be prepared. She did not do much along the lines of teaching, as the students led every class in discussions. Often, if you get a low(er) grade there is no feedback or comments as to why.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Rupp is a great teacher. The course is a lot of work because you get to learn a lot. Note that the negative reviews seem to all be from people who didn't expect to have to go to class in college, lol.

I think only one kid in our class got as on a regular basis. She almost never gives them out . She also her grades participation very hard ... just going to class everyday gets you a C. You better not skip. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: this is the hardest history class u could take at wake. she gives such an unreasonable amount of reading for each class and there are so many papers u have to write. her grading is so picky and u will almost certainly never get an A. her lectures are virtually impossible to follow in class and she gets sidetracked always. DONT TAKE
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: The course load is way more than necessary. The nightly readings are strenuous and dry, which make it hard to digest and interact with in class. Lots of essays. Extremely tough grader. The content is interesting and she really knows her information, the teaching is just dry and makes going to (mandatory) class even worse. Sometimes petty.
class attendance is integral to doing well in her class

Pretty interesting course. I took Europe in the Modern Era (History 102). The work load is pretty heavy from what I remember but if you studied and participated in class now and then you will do fine. She is a very nice lady and easy to talk to. She wants you to do well.
No Comments

Dr Tomlinson made me actually enjoy orgo. He is caring, organized most of the time, and really encourages people coming to office hours. If you miss a lecture, you're going to be behind (but it's orgo, so thats obvious). The content is hard, but he wants you to do well. Also he curves tests :)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Tomlinson is awesome and funny. I really appreciated how he always gave us pep talks and reminded us that our test scores aren't the end of the world. He tends to go pretty fast and you have to do outside reading. If you have him for orgo, how you do is based on you, not his teaching. He also gives a lot of partial credit and practice exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Tomlinson motivates his students to do well. However, his lectures are very unorganized, making it hard to pay attention and understand what is happening during class. The test averages were never good, and your entire grade depends on how you do on those three very hard tests and the final.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor. Best Orgo Professor at Wake. He makes the lectures fun and interesting in a course that can be extremely challenging. He always motivated students and does his best to help you out with your grade. Gives partial credit and curves exams if the average is less than a 75. With Orgo, the average almost always was.

I love Tomlinson! Orgo is hard, but he cares about students and wants them to learn the material. Office hours are great, and he really tries to work with you not against you. Lecture heavy, and tests are hard, but he is a great teacher and explains things multiple ways. Definitely take Tomlinson for orgo!
Orgo I is a hard class with any professor, but Dr. Tomlinson makes it a lot easier. His lectures teach you a lot and he is very accessible outside of class. Definitely would recommend.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Tomlinson is the ideal Chem Lab professor. He's one of the heads of the school's Chem department, and he's the head of the overall pre-med department. Therefore, he knows what skills you will need for further down the road. Outside of lab, he's pretty chill and likes to get to know the students. I would definitely take him for lab if you can.

Tomlinson is a great lab professor. He tangents a lot but most of it is generally helpful. He gives very clear criteria for lab notebooks and makes it pretty easy on you. I strongly recommend Tomlinson for Chem 111L if you can get it.

Best Orgo professor at Wake hands down. The class is hard because the material is hard, but he does everything he can to help you succeed. His tests are definitely difficult, but he prepares you well. I recommend reading the textbook, doing the practice problems, and then going to office hours with questions.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I cannot recommend Dr. Tomlinson enough. I learned more than organic chemistry in his class that I can carry with me in the future. He is a genuinely caring instructor and if you need help, he will give it. If he sees you are struggling, he will work with you. Organic chem is hard, but he made it doable. TAKE DR. TOMLINSON IF YOU CAN!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Dr. Tomlinson was a gift. The two semesters I had with him (Organic Chemistry: CHM 122 and 223) were precious. He really cares about his students. His approach to teaching is interesting; it is You and Him vs the Material  not You vs Him. In other words, he's on your side the entire way and wants you to reach your potential and succeed.

Dr. Tomlinson is the best professor in the chemistry department. He really know how to engage with the class. He teaches well online. You will do well in his class if you ASK questions. Do not be afraid to talk to him. He made organic chemistry very enjoyable. Highly recommend to take organic chemistry with him. He will prepare you well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really wants you to succeed, so if you put in effort and actually try you will be fine. Always make sure to reach out if you are struggling, he is always accessible. He is really fun to talk to and always willing to help. Assessments are kinda difficult, but if you pay attention you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the best professors I've had. Took him for Orgo 2. Not only did he make sure we knew the content, he made sure we understood WHY things worked how they did so, come test day, we knew exactly what to do, even for molecules we'd never seen before. So caring and genuinely wants to help you learn. Moves fast with notes so make sure to keep up.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Tomlinson moves quickly, but is a great professor and wants his students to succeed. He loves chemistry, it is easy to tell
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Tomlinson is a great professor. He tried to be as thorough as possible during Orgo 2 and posted notes online for review. I mean this sincerely-it was the hardest class I have ever taken-I'm not exaggerating. Office hours help, Tomlinson has a talent of seeing where you are studying wrong and helping you fix that issue. I wish I'd gone to him sooner
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Tomlinson is one of the most amazing professors I have ever had. If you have the chance to take a class with him DO IT! His lectures are fast but if you read the textbook ahead of class you should be fine. If you are confused about anything afterwards make sure to go to his office hours because he will answers all questions happily.

Tomlinson was fantastic. I had to take gen chem for my pre-med major and I ended up with him accidently but it was great. He's very clear about what he teaches, wants you to succeed, and he teaches you what you need to know and avoids what you don't. He moves pretty quickly but if you review the chapter before class you should be fine.
The best HES100 professor. No midterm, no final, minimal homework. Absolutely lovely

She knows almost everyone is taking this class because they have to and really accommodates this. No final, no exams, minimal homework. People would be blatantly doing other work in the class and she wouldn't care as long as you did the short homework assignments on time.

Dr.Romeo is a great HES100 professor, she was very passionate and truly cares about the students. She gave the appropriate amount of work for a 1 credit class and often allows you to start homework assignments at the end of class.
Super easy HES 100 class and she is very nice.
Amazing professor, easy A and grade is based on completion, and gives you a few absences to use. The course is extremely easy and she is very kind and respectful.
So so so easy, no tests, easy canvas homework, cannot reccomend enough for HES100

I had HES as an 8am but she honestly made it so doable. Class is usually let out 15 mins early so I had time to get work done for her class or even go get breakfast. Lecture heavy class but the assignments were very easy. Attendance counts for a good amount of points so make sure you actually show up. Definitely take her!!
THE BEST! So sweet, lets you out early when she finishes the lecture or you can stay to do the hw in the remaining class time.

Great professor and easy class. Barely any work, and class is dismissed 15 to 20 minutes early. But I think attendance was a major part of the grade. All assignments are simple and designed to be done in class itself. Take her if you can!

Professor is one of the nicest people I've had on campus so far, annoying that health is mandatory but I guess it makes enough sense, didn't give any busy work everything was short, simple, and sweet. Classes usually got out early and professor is genuinely a really nice and knowledgeable person. 100% recommend trying to get her for health.

I loved Prof. Romeo, she was awesome. I got so lucky to be in her class, as I know some of the other health teachers aren't as lenient and kind as her. She has very clear grading criteria, and leaves you with time in class to complete assignments/homework. I have nothing but great things to say about her, highly recommend her HES 100 class.
Super nice, if you go to class you will get an A. 100% recommend for HES100.
so nice and so easy
The only reason I did not get an A+ in this class is because it was at 8 am and I missed like half of them. She is really sweet and would make a great aunt.

If you have her early in the day, she is really kind and strives to make the class bearable. I 100% would take her again. Even if the assignments are lengthy, she generally gives them A grades. It is virtually impossible to flunk her class; all you need to do is show up and do your work.
Super nice and understanding - understands that class is not top priority

Prof. Romeo is the nicest teacher I've had this semester. She genuinely cares about her students and does not try to stress you out. It was an easy course but only if u submit the reflections on time but she gives you a week and class time to do it and they are short. I highly recommend for HES
If you show up and do any work (it is graded for completion) you will get an A
lots of busy work, i didn't show up to class often and she didn't care, but so easy.
Way better that the other HES professors, and she always let's you out early.

Professor Boone is not the worse Quant teacher you can get but BY far not the best. He is knowledgable, gives limited homework, and teaches a lecture style class. That said your grade is unfortunately entirely based off of difficult exams. He was both stubborn and dismissive to students seeking help, and I found his attitude unprofessional.

Dr. Boone is friendly and knowledgeable. The tests entirely comprise one's grades, which can be challenging. Compared to other Quant 1 professors, I'd say Dr. Boone is solid because you do learn good skills and he won't tank your GPA.
Great guy. everyone whos hating is probably just slow. teaches well. connects with students and really cares
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He gives NO feedback and is very stubborn. You will get a good understanding of Quant 1 but the tests are annoyingly detailed and no partial or extra credit is given and cannot be earned.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Boone is such a knowledgeable person. He certainly will be one of my favorite profs at Wake regardless of my grade. His Socratic style lecture is great.

Throughout this semester I tried so hard to enjoy this professor and he made this class a nightmare. He is passive-aggressive very difficult to reach. He does not treat you well unless you perform well on his exams. I met with him to see how I can do better on his exams, and he told me that my score was fine because it was the class average.

Didn't teach us all semester then proceed's to put ambiguous questions on exams making it impossible to succeed. On top of that, if you did poorly on an exam and wanted help you would have to create a document anywhere from 3-5 pages in order for him to just schedule a meeting with you. Belittled students for not knowing answers to questions.

I learned more in professor Boone's class than in any other. Class is structured to ensure real learning is taking place. Professor Boone delivers thought provoking lectures with exceptional real world context and practical application. This is the most challenge class I've ever taken, and the most rewarding. Get ready to get learn something.

Better suited fr undergrad teaching. For a Masters course dealing with experienced professionals he came across as arrogant. He loves to explain the Algebra and Calculus. Not really required for an MBA -- a better use of time is this is how you use it in excel and this is how your interpret the data. I got more in study sessions with a tutor.

Can take very long time explaining a concept, preferred if he would let student get entire question out, before starting to respond.  otherwise seems genuinely interested in students success.  Just try to be a specific as possible in your questions, because if you don't know, "H' he will want to start all the way at "A' before moving forward.

Not sure a prior negative critique from another reviewer was deleted.  Explanations were lacking and confusing.  His examples were okay, but class discussions would have been better if he was more open-minded and listened to what students were saying/confused about.
stubborn. always took way to long to explain questions to class.

He is very good at giving you examples and projects that help you see the concepts at work in the real world. I found the Marketing Research class that I took with him to be extremelly relevant to the career for which I was preparing. Teacher is very nice and with good humour at times - it's a pleasure to attend his classes.
Good professor, a little arrogant, but made material easy to understand to someone without a math background
Very good teacher.  He explains the meaning of Quant and places emphasis on understanding methodology versus memorizing formulas.
No Comments
Made quant really easy for me to understand.
If all professors were as helpful, clear, smart, and nice as Derrick, the world would be a better place.  Top 5 instructors of all time.  He actually makes math interesting and fun.
very rude! do not say your opinion if it is the opposite of him. he is anti-semitic towards Jewish students who do not agree with his views about palestine.

Condescending, snarky, and egotistical. He plays hard favorites, so if you aren't on his good side he will lower your grades. Has no regard for students or their circumstances and will punish you for not having physical book copies, using electronic devices, or not agreeing with him. Treats students like toddlers. Plus be rdy ro read absurd amounts
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Trachtenberg is rude and sassy, unless you play teacher's pet be ready to tolerate his attitude. You should also be ready to read hundreds of pages for every class as well as write cited, multi-sourced, complex 1-2k word essays, in 7 days or less. No electronics, strict on phones and attendance. Do not take this class unless necessary
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is anti-Semitic. He is very condescending and rude. He does not care about students unless they agree with all of his false teachings. He spreads misinformation. Beware. If you are a Jewish student, avoid him at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I loved his class. He is one of the most knowledgeable and caring professors I've come across at Wake. He also isn't actually rude like some of the ratings say. He's just a sassy man but it's not meant to be rude.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Dr. Trachtenburg is a difficult professor. Every review about him being a hardass is true. He can be condescending and rude, but if you're willing to be a teacher's pet you'll be fine because he plays favorites. Just agree with what he says and don't stand out. He doesn't allow electronics. Only take him if you have to. Spare yourself if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Very knowledgeable and passionate professor. Assigns a lot of reading and expects you to come to class prepared. He gives regular quizzes that are very easy, even if you just skimmed the reading. He is a very understanding and kind professor who truly cares about his students. One of my favorite professors here at wake.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Did not enjoy this class. Tried to engage with teacher and was met with a condescending attitude. Avoid if you can.
His class wasn't too difficult and pretty interesting. None of the tasks were daunting and I had a good time learning with him. Would take again

He is one of the worst professors I have had at Wake. He would promise to do a lot of things that he will not end up doing. Also you need to be obedient with him, because if you are not, he will start to not like you the way high school girls do, and take random points off of your grade. I would not take him if you don't have to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: This professor is a gift. He doesn't make it easy but it's always worth it. After his class, I'm a better student. You get what you put in so hard work and growth are rewarded.
Lots of in-class discussion, encourages participation and debate, very experienced in the field and passionate about what he does, grades only on essays and participation
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: 10/10 great person & prof, interesting lectures, laidback classes but will still learn something

I really enjoyed this class, but it was a lot of reading and writing. The topic is incredibly interesting, and he is very good at being sensitive to the fact that the Holocaust and the reading materials for it can be incredibly difficult to read. I will say, that he does definitely have his favorites, but as long as you do the readings you'll be ok
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: You will be reading a lot for his class, even if its an intro class for graduation requirement. He doesnt like it when people disagree with him, so students need to watch out for that. You also need to make sure to follow all his rules in class, otherwise he will take points off of participation.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The worst professor/ teacher I have ever had in my life. He doesn't realize he is in the 21st century and forbids using laptops and ebooks. Not only would he call you out in front of the class like you are a 7 yo, your grade will suffer significantly because of it. He plays favorites to an extreme, and if you disagree at all, u screwed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: The class was pretty easy if you do the large amount of reading and participate. He is the type of Prof that will never admit he is wrong and will make his opinion known which got annoying pretty fast. Everyone could tell who is favorite students were in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This class requires a lot of reading and participation. Dr. Trachtenberg is easily accessible outside of class and he is willing to work with you so that you understand the class content because it can be difficult sometimes. He is a very fair grader, but he expects you to do the work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Miller is the best! There is daily homework and bigger assignments about every other week, but not too hard at all. She is super accommodating and not too hard of a grader, as long as you put in the work her tests are very doable. A very kind woman and tries to make the class fun. Would highly recommend to help complete the language requirement!

Profesora Miller is the best. Her teaching style allows you to understand the material and continually practice to understand it. Daily mini quizzes are not difficult if you do the lessons due before class. I strongly recommend her.
Super kind and cares about her students. Class isn't super challenging but make sure to participate.

Lauren is the best. Very clear what is asked of you and reasonable expectations for people learning Spanish. If you know any Spanish whatsoever, you'll be chilling. Not much work outside of class it was super free - shoutout Lauren.
Best teacher in the Spanish department at Wake. There are no better options because Lauren is the best option
I never knew what she wanted or how she graded. The class is too easy and before the tests, she pretty much tells you what they are about. She is a nice lady but a poor teacher.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: She's so sweet and helpful! She really tries to make sure that every student understands her lectures. She is a fair grader. She does assign A LOT of homework but so does every language course at Wake Forest. If you have to take a spanish class, please take her!

I had Profesora Miller for 113 and 212 and I am not good at spanish and she made it possible to get an A- in both classes. I really liked her because she is so helpful in office hours and gives study guides that tell you whats on the tests and you can boost your grade with homework. Considering taking another class just because I like her teaching
I took her FYS 100 class and she was great and very helpful! I recommend her class!

She is a very nice person and is pretty understanding in most areas. she does take off a ton of points from your final grade for not being early to class every day so be aware of that. she also will for sure tell you if your work is bad, even if you think its great. overall tons of work and papers and you cant guess what your grade will be
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: One of the best teachers I have had at Wake. Definitely take her class -- I had a 10AM and did not miss one class because I actually enjoyed going to class. Wish there were more teachers like her at Wake.

Mrs. Miller was an amazing professor. From the first day, she was very helpful and effective with teaching. She speaks in Spanish the whole time but she demonstrates with her body and hands what she is talking about so even if we don't understand what she is saying, we understand what is going on.

Professor Miller was the best professor I had this semester. She is very kind and willing to work with you for a variety of different reasons. Overall, I loved being in her class and would recommend her to anyone taking spanish.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Miller is extremely supportive and fosters a fun classroom environment. Her class this semester has by far been my favorite, and she does a great job at explaining the material and helping students feel like they're capable. As long as you do the homework, study, and participate in class, it's an easy A.

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor. As long as you participate in class and do the assignments, you will pass her class. Dr. Miller really cares about her students and she makes sure that everyone understands what she's covering before moving along. Also, she gives a study guide before each test which is really helpful so you know how to prepare.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Miller understands how hard it can be to learn a second language and makes herself easily accessible outside of class. She is a very fair and fast grader. She almost always had our grades in the day after an assignment. She is very organized and values participation (it's part of our grade). I would definitely take her class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Miller is one of the most kindhearted professors I've ever had. I wish she taught more upper level classes so I could take her again. She cares about each student and makes her classes entertaining.
Lauren Miller is a fantastic Spanish professor! I had her for both SPA 113 and SPA 153. She makes it easy to get a good grade in her class as long as you put in the work. Take her classes!

At first, you'll freak out and think she gives insane amounts of homework, but then you realize you don't really have to do it, or at least you don't have to get anything correct on it. She gives you better grades than you probably deserve, and also, you'll grow to love her. Most of class is going over homework and reading your poems out loud

Loved Profe. Howe. She cuts a lot of slack when grading, and really just wants you to do well and learn in her class. She was understanding and hilarious, lots of homework but nothing too crazy. Opportunities to increase your grade, overall I would recommend.

She seems mean at first but she's just sarcastic and actually hilarious. Like she'll make jokes with you but there is a lot of busy work (though you don't really need to do any of it and she won't notice if you skip a few questions on the hw). She clearly cares about her students, is pretty lenient, and we also did tango so it kinda worth it.

You're not allowed to leave class for the bathroom and she gives a lot of homework, but she's a very easy and fair grader. She wants you to do well in her class. She always goes over the homework and it's all relevant to the tests. She's also lowkey hilarious and you will bond with your class.

Although there definitely was a LOT of homework for this class, participation matters much more and she often won't check if you have completed the homework. I improved in my Spanish so much. She was super intimidating at first but everyone in my class had a great bond with her by the end of the semester. Super funny lady.

There is definitely a LOT of homework in this class that's basically just busy work, but none of it is that hard. She is a pretty easy grader, and if you're naturally pretty decent at Spanish you'll be fine. She's very funny, and if you work hard and participate a lot you won't have any problems. Class is just going over homework and flashcards.

Lowkey not a nice person. She gives a lot of homework, but class itself is easy because we just go over the homework. She makes a lot of out of pocket comments which are funny until they're about you. She's a easy grader, I usually think she gives me a better grade than i deserve.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: she is really funny, hard at first but the homework is only for completion and it gets much easier
she's funny. we did tango. so yay. other than her overload of hw life was great
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: You cannot leave to use the bathroom or get water once class starts. Homework assignments are a lot of effort and pretty much busy work. While she kept class entertaining, the whole time you basically go over the homework in pairs and then go over it as a class.

Howe can be funny but she won't let you leave the class once class starts (including to go to bathroom or get water). There is A LOT of homework, all busy work, and she doesn't actually teach anything. The entire class you just work in pairs and exchange your HW answers. Wouldn't recommend overall, there are a lot of easier spanish teachers.

Terrible professor. Homework assignments are so much work for no reason, she literally does not prepare you for tests whatsoever, and the overall learning environment is extremely stressful as she loves to cold call people. She also clearly does not care about students learning at all. Avoid at all costs.

Prof Howe is 100% the worst teacher to take if you are just trying to fulfill the 200-level requirement. She's an unrealistic grader given that she and does not prepare you for assessments. All the time in class is spent going over the homework in groups, so you don't even leave the period knowing if you did the work right or not.

She is a terrible teacher for a 200 level course. She has not taught me anything. All she does in class is go over the homework and I rarely have to come up with my own sentences I just read what I translated for homework the night before. She expects us to know grammar without teaching it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Gives an insane amount of homework.

Professor Howe was the worst professor I have ever had at Wake. Always sassy and rude, and at times gives off the impression that she hates college kids. The worst part of her class is the absurd amount of pointless homework assignments that take hours to complete. Everything in this class is busywork. Avoid this professor at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Prof Howe is a nice, comical person, but she is not a great teacher. She assigns a LOT of busy work outside of class and then spends the entire class period going over the answers. We rarely had any actual lectures or went over course material other than homework. She is a tough grader so do not expect an easy A from her class.

She is an awful human being and a horrible professor. She will ridicule students in class and provides no rhyme or reason to her grading methods. I am of Spanish descent and found the coursework to be busy work in addition to ridiculously hard grading.

Incredibly knowledgeable, but extreme social limitations and a draconian style (no time for in-class questions or clarifying a point confusing the class) splits students and their interest in her material somewhat. She's condescending and austere to them too, but I think she cares and she can't often communicate that well. Much better one-on-one.
Nope

Insane requirements.Her grading is about you following her obsessive pages of rules than learning the material. You can have the right answer but she will mark it wrong if you didn't abbreviate a particular word or if you did abbreviate it and she didn't want you to. She does not care if you know the material only how you say what you said. AVOID

Somewhat rude, was barely accessible. Highly pressured calls if you were on call, made students feel bad for getting answers wrong. Very particular grading expectations. Failure to realize that not all students learn or process information the same way. No TA. Will give very low grades to students.

I had Grebeldinger for Civ Pro 1 and 2. She is a tough grader and sets high expectations, but she is very clear about what she wants. If you take notes, listen to the lectures, read, and apply feedback then you should have no issues in her class. Tip: She doesn't like stupid questions. Only ask a question if it is relevant. Best 1L professor.
Lets just say that when a professor sends out a 12 page email regarding her pet peeves, beware her grading.
If you follow her very specific instructions and pay attention, you can't go wrong.
Most straight forward professor ever.  Make sure you state things her way or else she'll take off points even though it was the right answer.  Anti social and a little crazy.
One of the best professors at Wake!
People skills are lacking. Not helpful.  The class is somewhat straight forward though.
A little odd, however she tells you exactly what she wants and does not hide the ball; refreshing in a law school prof.
If you don't understand what she is teaching you, you are the problem.

Very bad professor.  Very.  Throws information at you and you can't ask questions because it takes her out of her precious schedule.  Wake should save money by just taping her class and playing it back to students.

The class was not interesting, but Grebeldinger teaches in a very clear manner.  I also appreciated her system where only a portion of the class is on call each day, taking some of the stress out of the 1L experience.
No Comments
This is her gig, and she shines.  Much better than Civ Pro.
She is anal-retentive and vague and just overall rude to everyone.  She expects certain things on exams but won't explain what she wants.

Professor Arnett was great.  Very fun and goofy in class keeps spirits high.  She explains everything very well in class too.  370 is a flipped classroom so you learn at home and apply in class which I enjoyed.  Obviously the material is tough but I always found the in class activities to be very useful in expanding knowledge I learned preclass

Arnett is known to be the HARDEST grader in all of Bio150. But, out of her and farbach, she is the better explainer. The entire BIO150 layout and curriculum is so bad but if you want to the professor who expains better and gives you more study resources, take her but prepare to work harder to do better on the exams than your friends in farbach.

Dr. Arnett is not clear with her grading! The whole semester I honestly did not understand my grades, or why I would get certain grades...seems like its almost impossible to get an A. She is a little intimidating during class, however, she is accessible out of class and is way less intimidating there. She's also likes to talk about her cats lol.
Extremely unclear criteria for grading
She makes her tests pretty much impossible to get 5's (A) on. Not a fan. But she is funny

The class is okay but don't expect to get above A-. It's not her as a teacher, because she's actually really good, it's the bio grading system for 150/160. Her lectures are really fast paced and material dense, but if you go to her office hours she is super helpful and goes a lot slower. Her personality is much less intimidating in office hours.

Very condescending to students, is snappy and sarcastic in lectures which not everyone can pick up on. Tests are extremely hard to prepare for, and the notes from class do not help yet she makes attendance mandatory. Can't use computers, never responds to emails. I learned so much good content from this class, but getting an A is almost impossible

Understanding BIO150 is a learning curve! Dr. Arnett is definitely a hard grader but she wants you to succeed and genuinely understand the big picture and the material. Take good notes during class and make sure to understand how to answer the study questions and you should do fine.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You can tell Dr. Arnett really wants you to succeed in the class! The course is hard, but that's mostly because of the material. Don't wait until the last minute to study, and go to office hours as often as you can!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Very lecture-heavy, you can't use any electronics for notes, she goes by very quickly in class, and she can be very snappy. You need tons of studying to prepare for the tests and your grade is based solely on the tests. Her slideshows are also very unhelpful if your notes aren't very good from class.

As much as I dislike Wake's bio department, Dr. Arnett made my experience nice. The grading is weird, yes. But she is a good lecturer. She uses a lot of dry humor and sarcasm, so she might sound a bit cold because of that, but she's actually nice. Very knowledgable and will make you think beyond what's just taught. I enjoyed her lectures.
extremely condescending towards students. Not approachable and has unreasonable expectations

While the class is hard and grading is too, she puts a lot of effort into teaching course material in a way that really makes you learn it. To do well in the course, you must prioritize studying. She provides great study resources on canvas page after each lecture and is very organized. Do her study questions to prep for test; you can make an A.

Bio 150 was very difficult. The only thing in the grade book is tests which makes it hard. The class moves very quickly, however Dr. Arnett is an amazing lecturer. Dr. Arnett gives you all the resources you need to succeed from day one and is frequently available for office hours. As long as you pace out your studying you will be fine!

She is not an understanding person at all which makes working in her labs harder. Just make sure not to miss any labs because she wont excuse you for any reason and will deduct your overall grade by a whole letter grade. Maybe she is better with lecture but I am truly disappointed by her lab course.

The class itself just sucks she goes very fast and you are not allowed to use any electronics in the class (computer/iPad) so you have to go back through all of the slides after class because she doesn't want you to be able to copy all of them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I loved taking Dr. Arnett's class! I had her for biochemistry, and while it is definitely not an easy class, it was always interesting. The workload outside of class is heavy and participation is important. But the course is weighted so that you can fail the first test and still pass. She is also a generous grader and gives partial credit!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Whitehead is amazing and teaches us ways to a healthy lifestyle. This class had 3 major essays, but they were each spaced out and she cancels class for an entire week each essay for workshopping. Expect readings due each class, but all were super interesting and not too long. There are occasional pop quizzes, but she almost always hinted.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Whitehead is great, she is extremely understanding. There is a lot of reading, but it is manageable. There are pop quizzes, but she usually hints at them when they're coming. Her writing workshops are great, and we get actual feedback from students and her. It is more of a discussion based class so the readings do matter.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is a very kind and understanding person. She is super sweet and calming; however, she is a harsher grader then I expected, but for a WRI 111 I thought she was great!
Lots of busy work in this class and pop quizzes on readings. Takes a long time to grade papers. But overall she is very kind and always available for extra help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Do the reading and you'll be fine. Take her feedback from peer review sessions and your grade will be good. The one day you don't do the reading, there will be a pop quiz. She's also super sweet and teaches because she cares and wants to be there.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Whitehead is nice and caring as long as you are also nice to her and show effort in the class, including office hours.  There's a lot of reading and pop quizzes which are graded harshly. There's also 3 essays that have a lot of different assignments and workshops that can be difficult to follow. Overall good teacher but tough.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Whiteheads has been one of my favorite teachers this year. She does assign a lot of homework, but it is usually a free 100 if you do it. She is a somewhat tough grader for pop quizzes and papers, but if you go to office hours and workshops for papers, you'll do well. She is one of the nicest professors here, and there's no final as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Lots of homework and pop quizzes for readings. She grades tough on the essays and quizzes. The class environment is very fun and calming though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She is really nice but never gave me substantial feedback on my essays, in fact she locks the grades so you cant see how you are doing in the class. The quizzes unbearably hard even though I always did the readings. She gave most of the class a 40% because she didn't like how we answered the questions. This class singlehandedly ruined my semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Elisabeth is a true GEM. She is probably one of the most kindhearted people I have met. She genuinely cares about you and wants you to succeed. I will say her class was a lot of work, there were lots of readings, reflections, and obv essays, but most of it is actually pretty interesting. And she is very understanding if you email her or need help.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I would highly recommend taking Elisabeth's class for WRI 111. She is a truly genuine, caring professor and will recognize you as a person. Her readings are very insightful and interesting, which are needed for daily discussions. The workload for the class was manageable but be prepared for quite a bit of work. However, the class is worth it!

Elisabeth is a very nice woman but she assigns so much unnecessary work for no reason. The classes are boring and attendance is mandatory. Overall, she is a very nice person but I would not take a class with her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: I love Elisabeth. I had her for WRI111 and all of her readings and activities were centered around mindfulness. I used to despise writing, but she kept the class so interesting and really worked with me to grow as a writer. Definitely a lot of work outside class, but worth it! It also helps that she is like the sweetest human ever.

Lots of interesting readings. Some easy quizzes. Intensive class; by intensive I am referring to both reading and writing. But any reasonable/hardworking person WOULD NOT regret taking her class. Extremely supportive.

She is really a great professor. I had her for WRI 111, and I thoroughly enjoyed her class. There is a lot of reading and she will assign 2+ hours of homework in between classes, but if you are able to keep up, you'll love it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Such an angel! I love Elisabeth so much (yes she lets you call her by her first name!) She does give you reading and essays but her content and the way she teaches is really engaging and interesting. It's not an easy A but she teaches some great classes and is so nice. 100% would take again!
She is so kind and supportive! I am so glad I had her as a professor. She goes by her first name with her students and is very relaxed. Take her you wont regret it!!
Johnson was really nice & definitely cares about the students but it's a big class. He's great overall but a hard class

I would go out of my way to take Dr. Johnson for 150. His lectures are engaging and easy to follow. He clearly wants his students to succeed. You get access to many resources. With that being said, you have to put the work in. He can be picky in the way you word things on tests because he wants to know about the "why" and not just the "what."
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Johnson is an amazing professor and has lectures that are actually interesting. He puts a lot of effort into his slides and demonstrates good engagement with his class. He is a super funny and kind person and grades fairly. The bio bin grading scale is awful, but I enjoyed attending his class. Definitely first choice 150 professor.

A lot of the issues people have are with the bio bin grading system, but Dr. Johnson is a fantastic professor! He's very funny and clear about what you need to know, and he's very accessible and great with feedback!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Overcomplicates most things. Overcomplicates canvas, grading. Knowledgable professor though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: As long as you make an effort you can pass. He likes when you take the time to go to him for questions. He is very knowledgable and makes class interesting. Get ready to laugh and learn a lot. Love this teacher.

As long as you read from the slides and test yourself starting a week from the exams, you'll get an A. Grading is done on a bin-basis, and the margins are tight to get an A, but it's doable. He explains things well, and his lectures are recorded on canvas, along with study problems and handouts.

Great professor. Really lively lectures that keep you well engaged with informative slides. Tests are fairly doable if you study. Provides great study guides that take you through entire unit and helps you to not only answer the question given but apply that knowledge in others areas which is a very useful skill on the tests

I love Dr. Johnson. He has been my favorite professor at Wake. His tests are quite difficult, but I tutored with him personally in his office hours rather than doing peer tutoring. He is a great lecturer and genuinely cares about his students and teaching unlike other professors. P.S. He is forced to make his exams like that.

Dr. Johnson is very sweet. He seems to care about his students and it's clear that he is passionate about the material and wants to engage everyone. The Bio department sucks in general but that is out of his control and he does his best to make the class fun.

I had him for bio150 He cares lot about his students and tried to make the lecture engaging and though he did not always succeed it made the class more personable. He gives moderate amount of 1 (a 2 min question about last class, and a pre-class multiple choice assignment) the reading= not necessary but helpful. He gives lots and lots of resources.

I adore Dr. Johnson. He's incredibly energetic, and you can tell he's passionate about student learning and engagement (it's literally his research). When he lectures, you can't help but feel excited as well from how excited he is to teach the material. The class tho is hard. so many readings, it's impossible. the tests are hard. you HAVE to read.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Assigns 40 pages of reading and like an hour worth of videos every week. If you dont do those you dont learn because he lectures only once a week. Flipped classroom is so dumb and he should not be employing that with a stem class. Im literally going to get an A so Im only bitter cause he acts like this is the only class you have.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Bio 114 was really difficult because it was a lot of information in a short period of time, however, Dr. Johnson was fantastic. He genuinely cares about students understanding the material and was helpful with questions after class. His tests were hard, but not impossible-mostly multiple choice. I still see him all the time and say hi!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: He is very difficult. I thought that I would take his class and be challenged, but when I met with him for extra help he was very unhelpful. I am all for being challenged, but if I am being  challenged I need the teacher to be able to help me.
He's really cool

His 112 class is difficult but I learn so much. I still vividly remember what he taught. His teaching style is clear and his lectures are always funny! He puts his lecture slides and recordings online.
hardest teacher ever

I mean you will learn Spanish because she teaches the course well and knows the language. But she's mean and cold calls on everyone in the class so if you aren't ready to constantly participate, stay away. Daily quizzes also.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If you want to truly learn Spanish, take Professor Morris. She is an incredibly tough grader but will truly help you learn a new language. She is kind and caring and will push you to do better than just "ok." Be ready to work your butt off, but be rewarded with real Spanish knowledge.

Oh lord. While her lessons are good, every little thing is so specific it comes back to get you. SO much work and honestly harsh grading where points are taken off for everything even going to the bathroom. Sweet person in theory but this is a class youre counting down till it finishes.

Prof Morris is nice but is not the best teacher, while she has super high expectations for her students and is a harsh grader. Despite the flipped classroom concept, most teachers review grammar and content in class but the way she does it is not easy to understand. She doesn't post her slides and dislikes when people use computers in class.

she cold calls which is awful but she is very sweet outside of class. she gives a lot of homework and is a very harsh grader on the homework and PEs so make sure to try on all of them from the beginning. Class is a lot of participation but the tests are super easy!

Three weeks and I am ready to slit my writs. Worst professor I ever had. She is so boring; repeats the info in the textbook. Why do we have a teacher when we can read the textbook at home? I asked a question about a Latin American artist; she had no idea. Her grammar explanations are unclear. I feel I am back in middle school. DON'T TAKE HER

She taught pretty well and is engaging. Lots of participation/cold calling. Lots of VHL and other assignments outside of class. Everything taught in class will be on tests, including all movies and structures. She is NOT okay with being on phones or distractions on computers. Lectures are good and helpful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Language courses are always gonna be hard but she saw Elementary Spanish and ran with it. I do no prefer the simple teaching style she had. I literally felt like I was back in middle school. But if you prefer a much simpler and video heavy teaching style then she might be best for you.

Professor Morris is a great teacher! She always has videos that she personally makes for her students. However, she is an extremely tough grader on the tests. Most people in the class got Cs on their tests and they were weighted heavily. I think that this might be a common theme for Spanish classes at Wake though.
She teaches well and the class is straight forward, but she's rude and is not lenient at all. I think she's a solid teacher, but she annoys me everyday.

she was very nice and understanding! granted, i had her online for all of last year both semesters and she REALLY encourages participation. it was kind of annoying being on a screen 8AM being forced to speak a different language. however, she was accessible and had office hours for those who needed it. if you can, take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Very nice woman and gives great feedback. She is always there for help when needed and has accessible office hours and responds to emails fast. The class moves very fast and becomes hard quickly, but the test expectations are set very clearly and she gives AMAZING study guides. I would totally recommend her and her class. Not an easy A though.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I absolutely love her class. She sets very clear expectations on what we need to do, and if you follow those you will succeed with flying colors. She gives you a study guide with the format of the test, and tells you exactly what she is looking for. Her lectures help everything make sense, and answers every questions amazingly. I highly recommend!
She explains things to beginners in a way that makes sense. Really supportive and available outside of class. Would recommend her if you have the choice
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: She's a great teacher, but 153 is a hard class-very grammar-focused with lots of homework. Morris does her best to explain in class and strongly encourages participation from EVERYONE. There are daily quizzes, but that is a required part of every 153 and 212 Spanish class as far as I know. Overall a really good option for 153.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was  a really great teacher. It was a lot to learn, but she definitely made it possible for all of her students to do well in the class. She is big on participation and if you ever go to her with any questions she is more than willing to help!

I have her for SPA 113 and she is really helpful. If you ask questions and semi pay attention, you will do well. I recommend her b/c she makes learning(as dorky as it sounds) fun. Definately take her class if you have a choice.
Dr. Fahrbach cares about her students and is very helpful outside of classroom.

She is very sweet and caring, but her lectures are hard to understand, so be ready to teach yourself the content. Her office hours are very helpful, and she provides many resources on Canvas for studying, but the content often doesn't match the exams. Exams are graded like AP tests; if you fail the final, you fail the course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This is probably one of the worst professors I have ever had. Her lectures make no sense and she does not provide any materials to help outside of her lecture slideshows. You teach yourself all of the coursework. Take Arnett if that is an option instead.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. F is clearly very smart and nice but she cannot teach at all. Her lectures are extremely confusing and very fast-paced to the point that this feels like a 300 course and does not provide much help outside of class. If you want to do well in the class be prepared to teach it yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr Farbach is nice, but this class was awful. The biology department grading is a Joke. I was at nearly every class, completed every assignment, and passed the exams. I however failed the final exam, which according to the grading chart, automatically failed me for the course. The lectures were confusing at times and the exams had random material.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I really liked Professor Fahrbach. If you follow the reading questions and suggested study questions, you'll know everything you need for the exams. Though the bins grading system is kind of odd, if you do the Learning Curves and understand the module questions, you'll do fine. Definitely go to office hours to review your tests.

Dr. Fahrbach is a very smart individual, but is unable to demonstrate any topics to her students. She has repeatedly humiliated students and made them feel inadequate for the class, despite their effort to do well. She does not acknowledge the effort made by students and makes them feel like they are unworthy of being in her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Fahrbach is smart and brillant as she demonstrates in lecture. Yet, the grading system she has for the course is poor as your grade depends on 6 items. For me, the subjective grading the department had overshadowed how much hard work I put into the class. Beware that BIO 150 is a weed out course at Wake and it shows in the grading system.

She's Dept. Chair but ironically, grading is unscientific as can be. Lab was frustrating too. Bio150 is a mystery-ride leaving you frustrated and wanting to stay clear of the Winston bldg for good. I feel for people who have to take Bio160 and regret taking this for a divisional. Silver lining = one subj. eliminated as a potential degree to pursue.

Dr. Farbach makes it almost impossible to do well on her tests by providing virtually no guidance on what to even study. What she lectures on in class barely covers what she expects you to know for the tests. When trying to study for her tests I come across MULTIPLE things that she had literally never mentioned in class. Avoid her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She does not care about her students - at all. She embarrasses them publicly and cares more about making sure they know just how wrong they are instead of explaining to them why something may in incorrect. She does not seem to be this way by first appearance, but in private, she is terrible.

D.r Fahrbach is an awesome professor who really cares about her students and LOVES biology. Her love for biology shows through her teaching. She is SUPER helpful when you need help outside of class. As long as you put in effort, you will do well.

Fahrbach lectures the entire class and rarely asks for participation. She gives out 4 tests and a final. Homework is always to read a chapter of the textbook and spend 20 minutes answer questions about the reading. These assignments are given every 1-2 classes. Tests are 3 pages and she grades fairly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a nice person, but she is super soft spoken so staying awake is hard. However, her test will eat you alive, just follow the study guide. Even then, she has some difficult questions that she presume as difficult so she will make a multiple choice question 10 point.

She's an amazing professor and really cares for the well-being of her students; if you go to her for help she'll make sure you leave with complete clarity of the material.  She's a little soft-spoken during her lectures, so if you want to stay awake, I would suggest sitting toward the front of the class (and even then I drifted off sometimes).

Extremely passionate about the subject matter. Her tests are extremely detail oriented with a combination of short-response, charts, and tricky multiple choice. Attendance to class and reading the textbook is necessary. Weekly quizzes.
Great class. Dr. Fahrbach is extremely helpful and nice. She is a great teacher and is really excited about the material. If you are willing to put in the work, you should be able to ace this class.

Whitaker is a great professor and I would recommend for everyone to take him, he truly cares for his students. 2 papers which he grades easy and 2 tests that are a little hard but if you study you are fine. He assigns readings, but if you listen in lecture I realized they aren't really necessary. Overall, great divisional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Whitaker is a very fascinating professor. He is so passionate and deeply knowledgable about "Hinduism" and makes lectures really fun to listen to. Class is super easy as long as you actually try a little, as there are only 2 tests and 2 short essays they're very straightforward. Overall really fun!
Super interesting - lots of lectures but classes help shape mindset and widen perspective
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: (Took this class online this summer) He was accessible and had a clear syllabus outlining the course. The recorded lectures can get boring but were informative. (The provided textbooks covered the same info, though.) There were a few exams and essays that weren't difficult if you study a little. No other homework. I would take his class again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He can be interesting and has somewhat engaging lectures, but he is extremely strict about attendance and you cannot miss a single class. He also has a super strict grading scale and even a 95 is considered an A-. He grades the tests pretty harshly and there are a lot of very dense, boring readings. There are way better religion divisionals.
Professor Whitaker is inspiring and interesting. I always look forward to going to class. You will leave this class mind blown and you should not leave Wake Forest without taking him.

This class was so enjoyable. I can't recommend enough. You don't have to read if you pay attention in class. The only homework is 2 650-word essays and studying for the exams. The only hard part is that you have to memorize some Sanskrit. But as long as you do that, you will get an A. He told us once he doesn't believe in giving less than A's.

Definitely a very enjoyable class. You basically have the option of paying attention in lectures or doing the reading. Very manageable class and Whitaker makes it very interesting and engaging. Great class for getting a divisional out of the way.
good prof
awesome teacher. intro to hindu traditions was very interesting but not too much work. would definitely recommend taking a class with dr. whitaker, even if you're not interested in studying religion
He's a really cool guy, but be warned- his classes are RIGOROUS. A ton of dense reading. He rarely ever gives A's. He really likes to challenge his students, so if you're up for it, take Whitaker.

Absolutely amazing professor, his classes are hard to get into but if you've taken a class with him before or go to his office hours he gives it pois. Everyone should try out his classes, they supply good information but most importantly they make you think. Great professor.
good discussions, lets the students give input.
No one should graduate without taking this professor at least once.
Great prof. Interesting class discussions.
No Comments

I'm literally obsessed with Randi. She is absolutely hilarious, so caring, and just so into the content she's teaching. I loved all the books we read, and looked forward to coming to class every time. HIGHLY Rec.
I really loved her- she makes me want to major/minor in English

Really genuine and cares about her students and her subject. I didn't know anything about this topic before the course, but she was obviously so pasionate about it that I became invested by the end. I felt like she wasn't just there to expound upon her own views or to tell us what hte "right " readings were, but  truly wanted to hear our ideas too.

More than half of our class is taking Prof. Saloman again after taking her class last semester. She really cares about us and about the books and our experience of reading them. And also just about our college experience and our intellectual development and thinking more generally. These have been the best classes I have taken at Wake.

I love Prof Saloman! She's my favorite professor at Wake so far. It says something that we're all taking her class again who weren't seniors. She really cares and you can tell she loves what she does and wants you to also.
SO brilliant and really cares about her students and what they think and what they want to take away from the books and the course.
She's amazing. I just love her!

I just love Professor Saloman. She really takes time for her students, and she cares about books and about what we think of the things we read and just in general. She made me want to be and English major and not just minor.

Such a great prof and a great class. Ignore the negatvie rating. I'm 99% sure it was this guy in our class who came less than half the time, then monopolized class when he did, even though he obv. didn't read the books. What she said about mental health was about what A CHARACTER in Mrs Dalloway thought, not what she thought.
SO amazing...I love Prof. Saloman. She advised my thesis on a topic I developed in this class, and it was the best experience of my academic career.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Love her. Made me want to be an English major though I was unsure going in if I would just minor or not. Spent lots of time with me on my assignments.

Only online class where I felt like I actually learned like in a regular class. Really good professor and really nice person. She held office hours on Zoom everyday after class and made appointments if you wanted too. I'm not an English person, but I actualy liked this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Love Prof. Saloman. She's one of my favorite English professors. This class was interesting, and I learned a lot. It's a lot of work, but if you put in the effort you can definitely get a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: She was away for a little while, and I was worried she might not be at Wake anymore, but she's back now. Definitely the most engaged and caring prof. I've worked with. She really cares about youir ideas and gets excited about helping you to develop your papers and projects. Which makes you excited too, which is kind of cool.

I have NO idea where the other two ratings are coming from. She actually SAID not to come to class if you were sick and t o Zoom with her instead. And I told her I was struggling with depression and she checked up on me 3x and said she'd step in and speak with my academic advisor for me if I wanted. THe books were awesome and so was she-best prof
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Just all over the place. On the first day of class, she pulled up 4 syllabi from previous years and none of them were for this year. During lectures, she rarely talked about the book. She would go on tangents about the most random things like super glue. She also lacked understanding of the concept mental health. I walked so you can run!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: He was the worst professor at Wake Forest Law.  I think he got off on making students feel nauseated and incompetent.  [Tips: Outline dump on the exam and ignore him when he says to use the terms "reference above" for questions on the exams you have partially already answered in a previous question...you are better off retyping answer for each ques
Incomprehensible, but a nice guy.  Teach yourself the course, as he never talks about the crux of anything.  He's always on the margins, and NEVER addressing any meaningful concepts.

You have to teach the class to yourself because most of what he focuses on in lectures is not relevant to the subject matter.  Use supplements and OUTLINE DUMP on the exam.  Regardless of what the questions are, put everything you know about Civ Pro in the answers.  I cannot stress enough that you put everything you know about Civ Pro on the exam.
Love the person; Can't stand the professor.  Better off learning from a supplement.  Go to class to see where he is at, but don't use anything he says.
i couldn't imagine a worse teacher.  avoid like the plague.

Mad Dog can be hard to understand, here are some tips to survive:  if there is a paper option, take it!!! Then you won't have to figure out what it actual material and what is vintage Mad Dog conversation.  Don't let him scare you!! He expects a lot but as long as you're prepared for class and make a reasonable effort you'll be fine.

You guys are wimps.  This man is a  genius.  If you let him...he will teach you how to be great lawyers.  If you expect that practicing law will be easier...then you are mistaken.  I wish there were more like him.

Worst professor I had in all of law school.  He might as well have been speaking Greek in class, as nothing made any sense all semester.  I highly recommend anyone taking Civ Pro I from Walker to completely ignore class notes and purchase the Arthur Miller Sum & Subtance CD's, which are the only reason I got an A in the class.

George K. Walker is the bane of my existence.  Tips to survive: At the beginning of the semester, get the Arthur Miller CDs (listen to them now! don't wait till Exams).  Get the High Court Case Summaries.  75% of what he says in class is useless; reading the cases also won't help unless you already have a fundamental understanding of the sub. G/L
Nice guy out of class, but for a subject as basic as Civil Procedure, I really think a professor who can give new students a good base in the subject would be a more effective use of my money.
He teaches a lot of material for his own benefit. The reality is the subject matter is difficult enough and he makes the obscure more obscure.
Very helpful. He really teaches you to think on your feet.
Very old professor who is very hard to understand in class.
Prof Walker is very hard to understand.  He does not speak clearly and uses the same outline from 20 years ago
No Comments

Dr. Pace is a good professor and her class is fairly easy. Class attendance is not a part of your grade, but there are in-class "exit tickets" that will contribute to your grade. Dr. Pace is kind and clearly interested in the material, although she makes her personal opinions and political views apparent and sometimes includes that in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Pace is such an amazing person and professor. Work is super easy and there are no tests or quizzes. Extremely lenient with late assignments. As long as you do your work you will get an A
Free. So free.

Dr. Pace was the best! She truly cares about her students and wants us to do well in the class. Workload is not hard, you just have to read 1-2 articles per week as homework to write about and discuss during class. She's not harsh with submission either, if you submit it a few days later she'll still grade it! I honestly really loved her class.

Pace is the GOAT. I have taken her for two classes now, and she always makes an interesting class. REL 101 was incredibly light in terms of workload, and she covered parts of religious studies that are relevant today to help keep the class engaged. She is beyond nice and couldn't be anymore helpful. 10/10 would take again
Dr. Pace is a great professor. She wants her students to learn the material and grades very leniently. Her class was interesting and engaging. I would highly recommend taking her class.
Pretty easy divisional with a really lovely prof, a 95 is the cutoff for an A though so make sure you stay on top of assignments
so chill and so easy

Pace is great. She's a super understanding professor and she makes REL 101 interesting. I skipped class 3 times and she was chill about every time. She kindly cancelled class about 4 times this semester and always let us out 20-45 min early. No quizzes, no tests, only discussion board posts which are about 200 words. 100000% take.
She is the nicest prof I've ever met at Wake. Great feedback, happy class meeting and I learned a lot!
Dr. Pace is the kindest professor ever! She assigns most of her graded work for homework but everyone gets an A if you put in the effort. No tests or exam. Love this class.

I can't say how much I love taking her class. Dr. Pace is so knowledgeable, and at the same time cares about her students' wellbeing. Her class is easy but she still offers you great readings and lectures that make you reflect on your own religious journey. Feedbacks were also helpful.
Love this woman. Great teacher. Cares about the class. Just an overall legend.

Literally one of my favorite human beings. She is so caring and thoughtful and really cares about all of her students. This class was very interesting and thought-provoking. The workload was light and projects were fun. Don't skip out on doing the work and participating in discussions because that's how you learn the material. Definitely take Pace
Great teacher, very interesting and easy. No reason not to take this class for the religion divisional.

I had Dr. Pace for my FYS and adored her. She is super happy, friendly, and passionate it's exciting. I only took this class because it was the only one available, but I love it. I would suggest taking any class with her

Adrian Bardon is a decent teacher with easy tests if you attend lectures and do the readings. However, he heavily injects political bias into his teaching. After Trump's election, he compared deportation policies to the Holocaust, criticized Israel as "not really a democracy," and framed Locke's property theory as colonialist justification.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dont take him. The reviews say he won't tank your GPA but he tanked mine. The reviews are also most definitely written by him. Everyone got Fs on the midterm despite the class being "self graded." He caused everyone unnecessary stress for what should have been an easy A divisional (divisional classes are supposed to be easier) Got a C... run.

I've never met anyone with a more grandiose sense of self. His tangents are disrespectful and inappropriate, an overall bad professor. The fact he made up those fake reviews tells you all there is to know about the type of person he is. Maybe instead of faking reviews, he should focus on becoming a better educator.

Probably one of the worst and most misleading professors I have ever had. Not only lied about the terms of our self-grading but also assigns reading that are very complicated and then selects peculiar points/ideas from them for tests (that are supposed to be ungraded but were not). Arrogant and rude professor who will make you not enjoy the subject

Said the class would be self graded and this was a bold faced lie. Said the midterm was nothing to stress about, then gave everyone Fs and insulted our intelligence over email. Cold personality and spends the whole class grilling students on politics. He also doesn't teach and only briefly mentions important page #s from hard-to-understand reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: HORRIBLE PROFESSOR! Look at all of the five star ratings- all of them are made on the same day. Earlier in class he was talking about how he couldn't believe his rate my professor was so low, now he magically has five star ratings. Suspect he put fake reviews so people would actually take his course. Average on the midterm was an F! DON'T TAKE HIM!
Not too much work, content is intersting, grades are not important to him so he wont fail you if you try, all around nice guy. Funny too
Funny guy. Questions the grading system so if you put in effort you will get an A. Smart too.
great teacher, won't take your GPA, cares deeply about topic. Would recc for sure

Cares a lot about the subject. Easy grade but still enouraged to put in the work as the discussions are great. Woudl take again 100% *does have opinions, but will never make you feel bad if you disagree
Great professor, genuine and good guy. would take again. doesn't belive in grades so class wont tank your gpa but also important to do the work.

Great professor. Genuinely cares a lot about the topics he teaches, so understandably he has an opinion, and while he sometimes makes it clear how he feels he is very thoughtful and thinks deeply. He also thinks critically about all opinions, even ones on "his side". Has his own quirks and character, but that is part of what makes him great.

Literally the worst. Talked about himself all the time. Said he didn't understand why people were crying at the wailing wall when he was doing research there. Not an empathetic bone in his body. Taught his own book and was offended when people asked questions about it. Tests were extremely easy and there was only one paper.

Imagine reading a Huffington Post article out loud about why toothpaste is racist in a really smug tone.
That's basically this whole class.
But it is self-graded, so if you take it you'll sacrifice your brain cells for your GPA.

Imagine watching the most boring segment on CNN for an hour a day, 3 days a week. Imagine the political takes from the average Twitter user, and turn them into a class.
Upside: Self-graded. Was the only reason I stayed.
Great prof. Really funny, nice, and understanding. Gave a lot of good material and led good discussions.

There is a 5 question quiz each morning based on the daily prep from the textbook SO DO IT. Prof Atkins is a clear expert but beware that she teaches mostly in Spanish. Participation is beyond expected or she will call on you. Class is more of practicing what you teach yourself from the textbook than actual learning. Exams are more than manageable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Super easy, very kind professor. Extremely easy grader too
