Professor Atkins is great! She speaks in simple Spanish half of the time which I feel has really helped me learn. There are 5 question check ins before every class but getting a perfect score on them is easy if you read the textbook. Tests are medium difficulty but she gives a study guide and plenty of resources.

Although 153 is difficult, Profe. Atkins was a great teacher and clearly explained everything in class and was available outside of class if you needed to work with her. There is a lot of work and you need to work hard, but she wants you to succeed and is not the harshest grader.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed Professor Atkins for 153. 153 is challenging no matter what but I thought Atkins made it not too bad. There are a lot of assignments but that's not unique to her. Overall Atkins is a good choice for 153 because she speaks English and can clarify anything confusing.

Spanish 153 is sneakily one of the hardest underclassmen classes no matter the professor, but Atkins is amazing. She makes sure to do everything to help you succeed and has a fun personality as well. You just need to be prepared to do a lot of work and keep up with the quick pace.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is a great teacher and an overall great person. My only complaint about this class is that there is so much homework that by Thanksgiving you hope to never see or hear Spanish again. There is so much tedious hw with lots of tests and compositions mixed in. I don't think I've had a break from work in this class since we started.

I loved Prof. Atkins! The class itself (SPA 153) was very heavy on the homework but none of it was too difficult, just a bit time consuming; however, Prof. Atkins gives great feedback on compositions and is very clear about what you need to study to succeed in her class.

This is the first class I have had to really study for ever; it was hard for me. That being said, I have never been that great at Spanish, and the workload was a little daunting. I would have to disagree with some of the reviews saying you can easily get an A, because I genuinely thought I was dying at times lol. Dr. Atkins is very sweet, though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: A great teacher and definitely took the time to help her students both in and out of class. There's a homework assignment for each class but it's graded for completion- not too bad. She gives a lot of work so be prepared for a lot of assignments, but overall it's possible to get an A as long as the work is put in. I liked her a lot. Would recommend

Professor Atkins is super sweet and very organized. Your schedule for the whole semester will be posted on the first day, and her expectations are clear. However, there's lots of new material and it moves at a pretty fast pace, but that's kind of just the nature of 153. That being said, you can definitely get an A if you put in the work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I would highly recommend taking her, as she is one of the best Spanish professors that I've had. She is always willing to work with students on their assignments and is fair with her grading style. You can make an A as long as you put in the effort. However, the class enforces learning by massive amounts of homework, so be ready to work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Atkins is wonderful! She is very understanding and breaks concepts down very well. She is also very patient. I would totally take her class again. I had her for Spanish 153.

I've chosen her as a Spanish professor three times because she's that great. Very patient with those who aren't particularly confident in their Spanish and always shows you ways you can improve and become a better speaker. Do the homework, prepare for the tests, put your best effort forward, and you will get an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Her class is very easy however the material is extremely dry. Fairly painful to sit through, but Atkins is very nice and understanding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Atkins is an amazing spanish professor. Take this class show up do your homework and you will get an A

Dr. Bettencourt was an amazing psych teacher. She reminded me of my AP psych teacher that I loved. If you go to class, pay attention, take notes you should be fine. she posts all the slide shows which are so helpful. She is so caring and her attitude is so bright, the vibes in the classroom are just overall so positive and enriching shes so awesome

She is extremely sweet and she cares a lot about her students and her lectures are very interesting. Her exams are extremely difficult and you need to study a lot for them. She does drop the lowest test and homework grade tho.

Dr. Bettencourt is an amazing professor! I'd never taken a psychology course before, but the way she explains and teaches the subject is really clear, and she has tips to help you remember the material. There isn't much homework, but you still are prepared to take the tests. She's also very flexible with deadlines. Also a pretty easy class

Dr. Bettencourt is the best! She truly cares about her students and wants them to do well, she drops assignment grades as well as lowest test grades. The class is really lecture heavy but she makes it interesting. Her tests honestly aren't hard, they just go over a lot of content. She's actually the sweetest and I'd def recommend her for 151!

I took prof. Bettencourt for psych 151 and her class is super interesting and she is super understanding, but her tests are really difficult, even if you study a lot. Your grade is mostly based on tests, but she drops the lowest test grade.
Loved Professor B, she's great at simple explanations and makes lectures engaging which was nice. Also loves sports so she's very understanding and quadrative if you're a student-athlete!

Very kind teacher who has great lectures. She is easily accessible outside of class and super helpful with anything you need related to the course. Minimal homework, but the exams are very difficult. Lots of studying necessary outside of class.

I took Dr. Bettencourt for psych 151 and she was the best professor! I always found lectures to be really interesting but the class is very lecture-heavy, unless we were reviewing for tests. The tests weren't too bad, as long as you put in the work to try to understand the topics (which weren't conceptually difficult). she also drops lowest test

She is very nice, but her exams are beyond difficult. Her lectures are easy to follow and she wants you to learn psychology for what it is. Her office hours are pretty helpful; you can drop the lowest exam grade and some homework. It is not impossible to get an A and there was no final, which is nice but still hard to get an A.

I love Dr. Bettencourt! Biopsych was my 2nd class with her and while there is SO MUCH CONTENT you get the test questions beforehand :) Other assignments include pre-class quizzes, reflect and connect assignments, and article comments - all super easy. I recommend this class for anyone wanting to go into healthcare as it's super interesting.

She is very sweet and genuinely wants her students to do well. Likes to bring in relevant examples, which is helpful, but she usually just reads off the slides like other people have said. I got Bs on all of her tests, but other parts of the grading system helped a lot. Extra credit by doing research studies, but this is in all PSY151 courses.

Dr. Bettencourt is the most caring professor I've had at Wake so far. She genuinely wants you to do well and is always accessible outside of class to help you in any way she can. Her tests are definitely difficult but if you study hard you will do fine. Extra credit is also very easy to acquire as long as you keep up with it over the semester.

Dr. Bettencourt is really nice and her class wasn't too bad. All you have to do for the class is take 4 exams (no final during finals week). The exams are 40 multiple choice questions in 50 min. They can be a little difficult, but not horrible. If you go to class and pay attention, you should get at least a B. She sometimes does a slight curve.
Very interesting Psych class and very easy! Attendance is not mandatory or even taken by the teacher. The tests are all online and all multiple choice questions.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She was a caring, fun professor. She mainly read from the slides but included added information which was beneficial for the exams. The assignments for the class included a weekly reflection (incomplete/complete), quizzes, and 4 exams. A week before the exam, we got 8 possible exam questions, of which 4 were selected on exam day. Loved this class.

Dr. Bettencourt was a good professor, however she kind of just read what was already on the slides. She had trouble answering a lot of students questions. This class was pretty easy as long as you memorized what was on the slides. The tests were predictable and all multiple choice.

Dr. Bettencourt is a very nice person. But, her tests are extremely difficult, online, and all multiple choice. Each test has an insane amount of information on it, and they are rarely curved. The class is extremely fast-paced, and it does not help that she speaks extremely fast. It definitely takes a learning curve to understand her tests.

Exams were all online and multiple choice. The questions were not clear at all and had multiple possible answers. The quizzes were open note and still very difficult. In general all the answers for everything were very difficult to distinguish between. Nice person, easy to meet with.

Dr. Jones is a kind professor who truly cares about her students learning. She emphasizes having an overall understanding of concepts and gives opportunities to earn points back after exams, like through test corrections or a curve. She provides many practice problems and often leaves time during class to do the problems and ask questions.

Amanda Jones is such a sweet professor and she really wants everybody to succeed in class. She understands organic chemistry is a hard subject and gives you chances to make up work (in different ways) when exams are given. She goes through class notes thoroughly and gives lots of work but be sure to use other resources to supplement for exams.

Organic chem is going to be a difficult class no matter what, but Dr. Jones is super caring and understanding, and she really wants you to succeed. If you go to her office hours and ask questions, she is very helpful!

Dr Jones lectures most of the class. The lectures are extremely hard to follow and really can only be slightly understood if the entire textbook chapters have been read before class.

Tests are extremely short and cover less than half the materials covered.

Test questions are ambiguous and grading is unclear and inconsistent

Yeah orgo sucks no matter who you take, but her lectures were pretty disorganized and made the class a bit more difficult. However, she was incredibly caring and would do everything she could to help. Her classes normally involve 40 minutes of lecture and 10 of individual work where you can ask questions. Would recommend for lab if anything,
Dr. Jones's lectures are very disorganized and it can be hard to follow what she is saying at times. She is a really nice person, but taking Orgo with her makes it more difficult than it needs to be.

Pretty good prof, orgo 2 is hard but she really wants you to understand the material. we had lots of take home tests and open note exams plus a lot of homework. WileyPlus will kill your grade if you're not careful.

Dr. Jones is a good professor you just need to understand the way she teaches. Lectures are confusing a lot of the time because she is kind of unorganized with what she is explaining. The canvas materials are very helpful though. She is also pretty helpful to meet with outside of class - awkward but very sweet.

Dr. Jones is a solid chem professor, although she is challenging. But orgo 2 is going to be tough no matter who you take it with. She goes pretty fast in lectures and her exams are crazy tough, but if you have good study habits you should be fine. Her in-class practice problems are helpful though.

Dr. Jones is incredible. She's clear, attentive, and has a great personality. The class structure though? Ridiculously difficult. The "quizzes" are nearly impossible. People literally gave up their soul for this class. You have to do a lot of outside work. Feels like a full-time job. Estimate 15+ hours every week studying.

I took Dr. Jones orgo II class and it was wonderful. The class and topic was extremely challenging, but she is super kind and helpful. As long as you put in the work and ask for help when you are stuck, you will for sure succeed.

She needs to improve the pace of her lectures. She goes too fast and doesn't explain the concepts well. It is easier to learn from the textbook than from her lectures. She expects you to also read the textbook and watch extra videos outside of class. She also gave two in-person quizzes that were limited note and made it unnecessarily hard.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Highly recommend taking Jones for CHM 223! She's very fair and genuinely wants her students to succeed. However, be aware that the class is still a ton of work. If you don't stay on top of it and fall behind, there's only so much she can do to help you so keep up with your work!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She tries, but is clearly inexperienced. Exams are inconsistent. Can't decide what she wants. I feel like I'll be unprepared for future courses and the MCAT. I'll have to do lots of catching up on my own time. I wish I had taken Dr. King's course instead. I heard she is really tough, but that all her students do well on standardized exams/MCAT

She means well, but she's just not a good lecturer. I passed her first exam easily, but I'm not sure I'm really learning anything. She is so nervous during lectures that it detracts from the learning experience. I think she is actually smart and I think she knows what she is doing, but she doesn't seem sure that she knows what she is doing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Colyer is one of my favorite faculty in the chem department. She is super nice, caring, and wants to help you. Although I did find the class to be a little boring and uninteresting, it wasn't hard and there weren't many assignments. However, there is a lot of discussion and participation. Overall great professor and would take again.

280 lab can suck, but Dr. Colyer is the sweetest most caring chem prof I've had. You will stay in lab the entire 4 hours so be warned, but nothing is all that hard if you pay attention in the prelab lecture. TAs grade, but there is a token system to get extra credit which doesn't require much extra work. I would recommend her for 280L.

She made me love Chemistry, and her lectures are great. She wants you to do well and always brings lively energy to her class. She is very accessible outside of class and offers tons of review sessions. 111 can be difficult, but she made it very enjoyable and reminded us that our grades aren't everything. 10/10. I would highly recommend!

I took CHM 334L with Christa. Anal chem lived up to the name... Several students wound up dropping the course before the first course meeting... I ended up with an A in the course. Dr. Colyer was my favorite professor! Incredibly kind and knowledgeabel. If you can, do not take the lecture with the lab. Poster symposium was the highlight of my year!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took Dr. Colyer for Chem 111 and she was AMAZING. She was the sweetest and kindest professor I've had at Wake and she truly wants you to do well. She's very accessible outside of class and her SI sessions are the best. She gives extra credit at the end if you do a few things throughout the semester so be sure to do them!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This is for her lecture class. She is probably the most kind and caring teacher I have ever had, all she wants is to see her students succeed. The tests are pretty easy if you study. There is weekly homework online which isn't too long and some reading every week which isn't too bad. From what I have heard, she seems like the best chem 1 professor.

Dr. Colyer is an amazing professor. If you pay attention to her lectures and do the assignments, this should be an easy class for you. Would highly recommend her again for anyone who's going into chemistry.
Gave tests that were very fair and plenty of resources to prepare for. Homework quantity is negligible. Professor Colyer is the goat.

Dr. Colyer is the best. I had her at 8 a.m., so I dreaded the class, but her energy and enthusiasm about wanting everybody to understand the topic definitely made up for it. CHM 111 can be tricky at times, but she is very accessible outside of class, gives tons of review options, and will use great examples to understand a topic. Highly recommend!!

Dr Colyer was one of the most caring and helpful professors I've ever had. She was super accessible outside of class and explained things so well. Dr Colyer was super happy and upbeat, which gave the class a super good environment. I would take her class again in a heartbeat.

Dr colyer is a sweet woman who really cares about your understanding of the material, your health, and just you. SHe is very reasonable and makes sure everyone understands the labs before proceeding. The TAs provide lots of good feedback on the lab notebooks. Overall you should definitely take her lab and have a conversation with her once in a whil

I took Dr. Colyer for lab, and she was amazing! She made sure we understood the lab materials, and she was always helpful in answering questions. She responded quickly to emails, and she was very caring and kind. She gives many token opportunities, and she helped me learn so much about the lab! We often were able to leave the lab early.
With the labs, it's a pass or fail and she gives opportunities where you can earn tokens in the end that you can trade in to improve your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Colyer is amazing for lab. She learns everyone's name quick. She is always smiling and happy to be in lab.
Best lab ever. Iconic. Take Dr. Colyer

SPA 153 was no joke. You must prepare far in advance for the exams and final. Even with days of studying, I had a C average on these exams. Grading rubrics for other assignments seemed out of her control and were decided by the Spanish department instead.

Dra. Valdez follows the rubrics fairly, but your preparation/participation is what matters.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Valdez is an overall nice person, but she is a super tough grader and rarely gives partial credit on tests. You're entire grade is based on the tests and compositions so study hard for those or they will tank your grade. She also expects students to know more than they do.

A good choice for SPA 153. Material is clearly mapped out for the entire semester. Need to do readings to do well on daily quizzes but it's not an overwhelming amount of work. Tests are difficult but not impossible if you study. I think her class is fair. From what I can tell her tests are not more difficult than any other SPA153 professors.
She is a very sweet professor who cares about her students. The semester is mapped out very well and the expectations for the course are clear!

She is nice but very difficult. It's like she assumes I know more than I do. I had never taken Spanish before this, and it was very fast-paced. Rarely gives partial credit, and the daily quizzes will plummet your grade if you don't do well on all of them. Lectures are very important, don't miss class, she doesn't post the slides.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a nice person but gives very difficult tests and homework to beginner students learning Spanish. She teaches assuming that everyone knows way more than they do. Very fast paced and difficult to do well. Also tough grader.

Dr. Valdez truly cares about her student's well-being and brings treats to class. The tests are pretty difficult but that isn't really in her control. Be prepared for daily quizzes and no curves on the exams. My only problem with her is that she is passive-aggressive sometimes and didn't round my C+ to a B- even though I was a decimal away.

Dr. Valdez was awesome! Any complaints I have about the course are departmental and not decided by her. She is a really caring person and tries to make sure all of her students succeed :). Definitely take her for 153 if you can!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dra. Valdez is engaging and organized. Her classes aren't spectacular but she provides the resources for you to know what is required of you, so your success is based on your efforts. She is sweet and friendly, but also professional. Overall, she is a great professor and this class isn't too taxing.

Professora Valdez is one of the sweetest humans I know. She genuinely cares about us students and helps us succeed. She is a very fair teacher and if you follow the instructions, you'll get a good grade. She's honestly a bit generous with grading. She has come to my performances outside of class to support me.  She is so tender and kind.

Dr. Valdez is a good professor for 112. The only thing I didn't like about her is that she is kind of rude and not too accessible for office hours. Otherwise, she has good lectures and is mostly understanding.
She was ok. The class's pace is reasonable, but the tests are hard. Definitely not a bad option for those who aren't very good at Spanish.

Dr. Valdez is passionate about teaching, which comes through in class. But, some aspects of the class feel slightly like high school. She gives daily quizzes and weekly participation grades, which means that you have to be in class every day on time and study the material ahead of time to do well in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Shes not bad. You do have to do the homework though and show up to class. She explains things in a simple manner and makes it easy to understand.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Valdez gives a lot of homework, BUT I think it's manageable. She's a great person/super sweet but I think is sort of lost. We have homework on days we don't have class but it's really easy (just busywork). It's almost impossible to get above a 90 on a test (average65) but all of the other hw will help you a little. Idk if I would take again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: grades harsh, test averages are like 65-75 but she refuses to curve them, quiz every morning on the material for that day so you have to study in the morning but test grades are buffered by other stuff. hw 3 nights a week on average plus presentations and projects.
I would stay away and just take a different professor
Her tests make no sense and she doesnt give us study guides
Shes nice in class but not very accessible after, just do the reading quizzes and you should be fine
Doesnt respond to emails
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She asks really specific questions on the test and unless you have a good memory you wont get them
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She just has a really confusing way of creating tests that isnt related to the material learned. Forget about her responding to your emails. Every time I would send her an email I made sure to forward it every hour after until she responded, if she even did.
Will not respond to emails. Extremely unclear grading criteria, especially regarding class participation. Expect a B for participation even if you speak 2 times a class.
Her class is unreasonably difficult with minimal guidelines.

The Professor sets unclear expectations, and her grading seems incoherent. You will need to read and teach yourself course concepts, as lectures are not effective in emphasizing main points. Studying for the exams is a free for all with little guidance.

She is fun to talk with, but she single handedly made me reconsider my major. Her class stressed me out to the max because it's so difficult to do well even if you tried your hardest. Grading and expectations were unclear and it was difficult to even know what to study for.

Professor Lisher is kind. She is a good person and is nice, however, her course is unreasonably difficult. The readings are long, and the tests are all long answers with very little guidance on what to study. She looks for specific answers and is quick to take off points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I would not recommend her whatsoever. Zero guidelines for major assignments and not responsive to emails either. Tests are vague questions that she'll take points off for simply not writing what she "expected". All the grading is done is one big swoop at the end of the semester that there is zero chance for the student to learn from mistakes.
Her POL 116 class is pretty easy in my opinion but sometimes she did have unclear expectations for assignments and tests. I would recommend her, however.

I liked Dr. Lischer. She kept her class simple and the exams were easy. However, her grading criteria for some assignments is kinda unclear, and whenever I asked for clarification she didn't email back.

If you have concerns for your overall wellbeing, keep swiping on WIN if you see this professor. Her class is unnecessarily difficult, as it is characterized by mandatory attendance, poor studying guidelines, and the general inaccessibility of the professor. At the end of the semester, expect a 20-page paper & a final exam; the icing on the cake.

Knowledgeable sure, but not effective at teaching. Also he is incredibly judgemental and disrespectful if you fail to understand something. Lots of other great MTH-112 profs at Wake that you should choose
Took for Calc 2- Definitely a good teacher and very available outside of class to help. VERY generous retake policy can be bad for students who are motivated by grades.

If you took Calculus BC in high school, this class will be easy but don't worry if you haven't taken it. Dr.Tan explains everything very well in calc 2 and is accessible outside the class. He changed course criteria after his first year, so it is easy to get good grades if you participate in the class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment:
(MTH112)
Pros: Very accessible outside of class, patient explaining things, gives good feedback, clearly outlined notes, revision & retests.
Cons: Weekly homework takes more than 2 hours and is graded on accuracy.
Conclusion: Put in time & effort, you will learn a lot.

Chee Han explains things very well during class. There was a lot of homework but an amount I expected from a calc 2 course. The weekly packets are partially graded on accuracy which is really the only annoying thing about this course. Tests were difficult but, he had retests and revisions and so I think everybody had at least a 90 on every test.
Insanely difficult and time consuming weekly homework assignments graded for accuracy (on top of daily homework that's actually relevant to the exams), incredibly frustrating

He's a nice professor who explains concepts clearly with examples and is very accessible outside of classes. But it is also true that he gave a lot of homework (5-7Qs + WebAssign) and tests are generally harder than other sessions (confirmed with my friend from another session). You will gain a lot from his class at the cost of time and effort.

He gives homework every week that will take a minimum of 5 hours. Brought it to a tutor once and even she couldn't solve it... that's absurd. With the other assignments, get ready to spend 7-8 hours on homework each week. His tests have questions that are usually way harder than anything you learn in class. Not worth it. You won't get an A.

Dr. Tan seemed to try and make everything difficult until the very end. It almost felt like he would rather fail me than let me withdraw from his class. I hope he can adjust the way he approaches the classroom in the future because he really does seem to somewhat care about his students and what he is teaching them.

Look, Dr. Tan is a nice guy and I really think he cares about what he teaches, however, unless you are ready to move at his pace and really apply all your energy into his class I strongly advise against taking his class. I ended up withdrawing from his class along with around a third of the other students who took him.

Chee Han gets a bad rap, but he's a great guy. He's funny and cares about his students. Having said that, I would not take this if you did not take Calc in high school. However, if you are smart and did take Calc before, you will be so fine. I put in no effort, and this class really wasn't bad. In the nicest way possible, don't take if you're dumb.

Chee Han is very nice and wants his students to succeed, however his lectures are confusing and the homework he assigns is more difficult than anything learned in class. I would not take Chee Han if you do not have a strong Calc foundation.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Tan means well (I think) but he is very sarcastic. He tries to make himself seem like a nice guy, but he's simply too logical to understand the emotions of his students. There is definitely is a language barrier and it's hard to connect with him. His weekly homework is far more difficult than the daily online homework, which he grades harshly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: He means well but is extremely difficult; he assigns homework after every class online and then written homework once a week which is impossible, has nothing to do with what he teaches, and he grades written homework very hard. His office hours are always so crowded because the homework is so confusing that it is pointless to go to office hours

Take Dr. Tan if you love calc and want to be challenged. If not, take someone else. His homeworks are impossible to do without going to office hours (which are always full of other confused students). He goes way too fast in class, but he makes himself very available outside class. Also, he sends a million canvas announcements each day.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a nice guy. He is accessible outside of class and all that stuff. His explanations are very bad, sets up written homework that can't be more difficult, which doesn't apply to what you will see in the test. If in class you learn and practice something, what you see in the exam is that one problem that can't be harder (saw once in class).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She made this course easier to grasp than 111. The first part of 112 was 111 review, so you are able to ease into the new material. Projects were big and HW's and tests were important. If you can keep up with material and learn from the coursework, it should be smooth for anyone who has already taken 111.

Kuykendall is a nice lady who cares for her students & has a passion for Computer Science. She can be unorganized and hard to reach at times, but if you are able to get some one on one time with her, she is great and can help. It's important to stay on top with her assignments and be prepared to do work outside of class to understand the material.

I liked her. She made this class pretty easy, and the tests and quizzes were easy up until the final (it wasn't cumulative though). She gives A LOT of partial credit. Make sure to be in class though, lectures are important and they help you know what will be on the tests. Overall a good class.

Super friendly teacher, she likes to talk but she likes to joke around too. The class is extremely easy and she isn't a hard grader whatsoever. Quizzes and tests are directly related to the problems she goes over in class, and the homework/projects can be done relatively quickly.

She is an easy grader, but that is pretty much the only good thing about her. She often does not know the materials or the answer to students' questions. She is also very impatient. No office hour, so be ready to learn everything on your own.

She's a very nice person but not the best professor. I would recommend her CSC111 but not any courses more in-depth than that. Grading wasn't harsh, but get ready to self-study a lot because sometimes her students or ChatGPT give better explanations.

Her instructions on assignments and exams are ridden with errors and confusing sentences making not understanding the question the main source of point loss which is rough considering she is unable to answer questions in person or over email outside of class.

She is an easy grader usually but let me tell you, you will not get much out of her course. She often teaches material incorrectly and is often corrected by students. She does not know the answer to most questions and never seems quite confident on the material.

She is a nice and caring professor. However, she just talk about definitions in class, instead of difficult points. She has no office hour, which means you have to figure out difficult points yourself. Quizzes and Tests are easy but labs are difficult(or time consuming). You can take her class if you are a good self learner
she is nice and assessments are pretty straightforward, but just be ready to teach yourself most of the material and struggle to read her notes
Professor Kuykendall made class interesting and she is very flexible about assignment due dates.

Nice and caring teacher who loves talking about her dog. Work load can be heavy at first but she will slow down the pace as materials get harder. She won't talk much about the materials in lectures but will answer all your questions.
I enjoyed taking her class. The way she taught us made concepts much easier to understand and the grading policy is very nice.
She honestly is the best CS teacher. The only negative things I'd leave on this is that she doesn't really have office hours due to the fact that she is an adjunct lecturer.
No-brainer to take her. Just a great class; you learn all you'd want to with no stress at all. You don't need to know anything more - absolutely take her if it makes sense.

HES100 is an easy class, so don't worry! Professor Dixon is funny and transparent about the expectations for the class. She did cancel a couple of classes, which was great; sometimes, we would have work posted on Canvas to count as attendance for that day. Overall, the class was light, and getting ahead of the work was easy if needed.

HES 100 is going to be pretty easy no matter what. However, Professor Dixon is so nice. You have two quizzes and two projects that are extremely easy, and occasional HW assignments that take 15 minutes max. As long as you show up to class, you have to purposely try to not get an A.

Professor Dixon is extremely personable and tells you exactly what you need to do in order to get a good grade in the class. Write 4-5 sentences to respond to questions and you will do fine. I recommend Dixon for HES.
Super easy and nice! She will randomly call on you sometimes though. I only had one or two things to do each week, which she often gave us time to do in class. Take her!

Dr. Dixon will attempt to remember everyone's names, but if you don't participate, she probably won't. She cares about students' learning and makes this 1-term course easy. There's some reading and writing, but very little compared to any other class at Wake. Just try at least a bit and you'll get through with an A. Raise your hand a bit.
Professor Dixon understands that her class is required, so it was not difficult if you do the assignments. She is very passionate about health and her lectures were interesting.

Prof Dixon taught a one credit class like a one credit class. It wasn't too hard, and there wasn't a ton of homework; if you put a little effort in and show up to class, it is an easy A. She allows regrades of assignments you didn't get full points on. Overall, if you need to take HES, take it with Professor Dixon.
So great!
Assigned the appropriate amount of work for a 1 credit required course and and reasonable expectations. Attend class + pay attention=A
Understands that students are forced to take HES 100, but still makes it an enjoyable experience. Attend class and complete the few assignments, and you'll get an A.
Easy A for HES 100 as long as you show up and do the assigned work
Professor Dixon is a great professor. There are no quizzes or tests but there are 2 main projects that you have to do. If you do all of the assignments, you should end the class with an A.
No tests, midterm, or final. She had COVID for a few weeks so she cancelled class. Super nice. Very easy class. You just have to show up and do the projects and you should get an A.
Great professor for HES 100; very clear on what is due when and quizzes are open notes.

Professor Dixon is one of the most inadequate professors I have taken at Wake Forest University. Though the material is as easy as possible, Professor Dixon is an extreme grader, especially for a one-credit course. Accumulating only three absences results in a letter grade drop and is not understanding of special circumstances.
An Amazing teacher, class is extremely easy and informational!
I took him for lab, he gave a good lecture at the beginning of each lab and was pretty lenient on grading.

PBJ was honestly a great professor, however he may be a little messy at times during lecture, specifically if you're in his 8am. Don't worry though because he explains way better during office hours. He is also very clear on how he grades. The class as a whole is hard no matter who you have, but PBJ made it a little better!

PBJ made Orgo understandable, although his lectures were sometimes messy and hard to follow. You will be fine if you go to office hours and do the recommended homework. Beware of exams, as he is a pretty tough grader. Also, don't be surprised if your first exam is an A or B, then your second is a C or D. You'll do fine in the course.

Dr. Jones is sweet and very amusing. His lectures, however, are very disorganized and often look like a jumbled mess on a white board. He wont write anything down except for visual diagrams so if you struggle with that, good luck. If you go to office hours and study consistently you should end with a decent grade. His grading is also pretty harsh.

THE MAN! Orgo is hard no matter who you take, but he made it very enjoyable. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you will be very behind if you don't go. His review sessions are always helpful, too. He has a good sense of humor and understands that almost everybody who takes this course is for the pre-med req.

He is a great person and very funny, just very disorganized. Took off a crazy amount of points for the smallest things. He does review sessions which can be helpful. Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you miss even one lecture, you will be extremely behind.

Paul Jones is THE MAN.  Knows how to mix a light hearted atmosphere with a difficult course and workload while still being knowledgable and helpful.  Would highly recommend taking him whether you're an amazing chem student or a below average one.  He will help you learn the material while making the class laugh a couple times.

He is a good professor and makes sure that you understand the topic by making himself available after class. The problem was with his grading. He graded a bit harshly and would take off more points than other professors for the same question. He also doesn't give any curve although every other class received one making it a bit unfair to us.

I had Dr. Jones for Organic Chemistry 2, CHM 223, and the lab section. This is a very challenging class that requires a lot of time outside of the classroom. However, Dr. Jones was always excited to come teach. He was very engaged with the students and held office hours multiple days each week. He graded tests fairly. I really loved his class.

Dr. Jones really cares about his students and holds many office hour opportunities for students throughout the week. Organic is difficult in general, so it is lecture-heavy. There are quite a bit of quizzes and only a few tests. They are difficult, but not impossible. He knows that organic isn't easy and no one gets it on the first try.

If PBJ is an option to take CHM 122, TAKE HIM! He is an incredibly smart, caring, and funny guy who will always go the extra mile and always make himself available to his students. While the material is by no means easy, if you do what he tells you to do (i.e., Wiley+) and you attend his office hours, you will not regret taking this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Great educator. A little disorganized at times, but knows how to challenge students on their individual level. Genuinely nice person, too. Rare combination. Most are either smart but unrelatable or nice but clueless. Not this guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I took P.B.J (Paul Jones) for History of Chemistry, a new upper level chemistry elective. 10/10 would do again! The lectures were funny and upbeat. We learned cool, interesting things and facts that our other chemistry classes left out. Tests were manageable, hw helped me learn, and he was so helpful when I didn't understand a topic.

Class is not easy but he does teach organic chemistry so no matter who is teaching it, it is going to be an extremely difficult course. That being said Dr.Jones is the professor that you want for this class. He is fun, and tries his best to convey this difficult material. He truly wants all of his students to succeed and enjoy the subject.
He is a very smart guy, but has some difficulty conveying topics w/o going over your head. Tests and exams are extremely difficult.

He explains pretty well what is expected of you. Not the best professor but he could be worse. There are 5 exams one being a cumulative final. He creates many extra credit opportunities and drops your lowest quiz and homework scores. Exams are worth most of your grade and are hard. If you apply yourself you should have no problems with this class.
I failed but it was my fault
Didn't really teach well, strange guy overall. Weird classroom dynamic, would not take again. Did not like math after this class.

You have 3 tests in this class which are easy 12% of your grade. There also are weekly quizzes and you do not get to use a calculator in this class. If you are not a good test taker do not take this class. The class is very quiz and test-heavy.

Professor Baker-Jarvis was the best math teacher I have had in a long time! He explains topics really well and holds many office hours throughout the week, he will work with you till you completely understand the subject. He also gives chances for extra credit after an exam. I made at least an 80 on each exam with not too much studying.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Solid professor. Was really helpful in office hours and I actually was enjoying some of the work! The expectations are pretty clear, but he makes you write out all your steps.
This class is full of examples of how problems are done and not much time is given to flesh topics out. The Quizzes and Practice Question given will have problem that are also in the Exam.

I took advanced calc in highschool, but the way he talks makes everything more confusing than it should be. he goes on tangents, and teaches math theory instead of what the equations actually do. he's unclear and cant teach, rarely gives useful info, uses obscure steps, and doesn't explain things in a practical way when asked about them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Quirky guy and very concept based. Sometimes lectures can be boring but he's very easy to talk to and always accessible to help understand the material. If you've taken calculus before it'll be an easy A.

He seems a little boring and awkward at first, but he's actually a pretty likable guy. It's kind of a lecture style class, but he's awesome at simplifying what he teaches. Keeping your grade up takes some work, especially if you haven't taking calc before. Definitely a solid pick though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: The class consists of watching many 10 to 15 minute long videos before coming to zoom class which was optional. Videos had mini quizzes which were easy. Pretty good teacher although class was boring. Grade is based on quizzes, hw, and four exams. He drops your lowest exam grade which helps a lot. Overall, a nice and understanding teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you have taken calc in highschool this class is pretty easy. Averages for tests are 75. He usually curves one of the tests to an 85. He allows you to drop your lowest test score and replace it with your final grade. He can be boring, but attendance isn't mandatory and if you have a friend in the class it's much more doable.

I had studied the material in high school and was comfortable with it but when I listened to his lectures he somehow made the topics more confusing and convoluted. Only take if you have to and have taken calc before. Absolutely the most boring class I have ever taken with the least useful use of class time. You'd see more eyes open in the morgue.

If youve taken calc before, this class isnt too difficult. Weekly quizzes, but I only studied for them at most 10 minutes if at all. Got mostly 10/10s. Online homework due twice a week, but its easy to get 100. Averages for tests are 75, but some do well. Those who havent taken calc before struggle. Generally not a very fun class, but its doable.

Thacker is great. Really passionate and a pretty interesting class after the first couple weeks. He pretty much tells you everything you need to know for the test. Reading can be a bit boring but I've really enjoyed the class.

Lots of former students told me that Culture and Nature was the best and most eye-opening course offered in the environmental program. The class fills fast because of its reputation among the hard-susties so I had to wait until junior year to take it. More work than I expected but it delivered.

After 3 semesters at Wake, Archaeology is my favorite class so far even though not the easiest. Thacker is super enthusiastic and cares, but he doesn't let you get away with not putting in the work. Class lectures are understandable and clear but he drops a few bombs that show he's really smart. Great class if you are into archaeology or history.
Awesome professor!! Definitely recommend if interested in anthropology (archaeology in particular). Won't recommend taking his class if you are not interested AND only for divisional though.
Not very accommodating to those who need more time to process things. Do not take if you need a divisional.

Archaeology with Thacker was not the easiest divisional but it was a great class where I really did learn to think differently. You have to actually read the books and show up to class but the course is phenomenal if you are interested in the subject. Dr. Thacker cares and he is an icon at Wake.

Do not take this class if you need a divisional. He is a nice guy, but this is such a hard class with so much reading. There is way too much reading and this class will take over your whole life. Only take this class if you are majoring in archaeology.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Thacker is a straightforward professor, you won't go into an exam feeling unprepared if you've done your readings and listened in class. He wants you to succeed and is incredibly approachable during office hours. ANT 339 is my favorite class I've taken at WFU!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: This professor is amazing. He works with students and really does his best to ensure that you do well. He is also just a kind man, and if you are interested in anthropology he will encourage you through the class and always be open for questions. Absolutely one of my favorite professors this semester.

Prof. Thacker is such a wonderful person. I loved talking to him and hearing how enthusiastic he is about archaeology. His class is always interesting even though it is lecture-heavy. As long as you attend class and do the essential work, you will get an A. Also, you might go through a phase of wanting to be an archaeologist.
Great professor! I cant wait to take another class with him. He makes you work but it is so worth it. I took anthro 112 with him and you should too!

Thacker is a great professor but he is hard to describe. Class is not easy but he makes it interesting and requires you to think. You don't realize it at first but you learn about more than archaeology. I still use his explanation of science in other classes. He is exactly the kind of deep professor I imagined taking at a good university.

Frequently goes over class time. Don't take his class back-to-back with another class. However, very invested in his students. Requires significant levels of reading, however all are pedagogically necessary.

Dr. Howards is a great guy, and will sometimes pause class to tell a funny story. Class can be slow at times and I feel like he's too smart to be teaching the class. He gets very theoretical and I think the material could be taught in a shorter amount of time and with less technical stuff. Grade really just depends on your math strength.
He's amazing. There's a lot of hw but hes a great guy and makes this class easier! I def reccomend!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Big H is the best. Super nice guy. 112 was not crazy hard, and he uploads all the class notes that he takes. Class is definitely long, and can get a bit boring, but he keeps us pretty engaged. The tests are always fair. All the homework is on a regular weekly schedule, so making a routine is easy, and he uses canvas well.
I love this professor. He is a gracious grader and really cares about the students and their learning. Make sure you study the homework problems before the tests.

He is amazing!!! Linear algebra is not easy but his lectures are straighforward and his tests are fair. There are two tests and weekly homeworks, attandence is mandatory but he will post all the notes. I'd love to take his class again.
He is so nice and really cares about what he is teaching

One of best professors at wake. He is very accessible outside of class. Very patient, nice and clear at teaching. Strongly recommended. The test is fairly easy and he would give partial credit. Definitely wanna take his class again.

I had him in the fall of 2020 and he was an awesome Professor. He cared about whether his students actually understood the material. Very fair tests that were easy if you study the material he tells you to look over. All around great Professor and you should definitely try to take his classes

I took 111 online in Fall 20. He was very organized with his videos and there are weekly tests instead of cumulative, something he didn't do before and he thought it would be better with COVID and he was right. He tells you EXACTLY what sections will be on the test but can throw older material in too. Great teacher, take him if you can, great guy
Dr. Howards is a nice guy who really cares about his students. He grades fairly, always is happy to answer questions, and breaks up lectures with jokes and storries. Definitely take him!

I took explorations in math with this guy, thinking it wouldn't be too hard.  I was wrong.  He gave me the lowest grade I've received in college.  He gave the midterm after the drop date, and didn't allow corrections or anything of the sort.  He's nice and very smart, but the last person you want to take if you're not into math.
No Comments
In Combinatorial Analysis, Dr. Howard was organized, he explained clearly, and he answered appropriate questions.

Dr. Coates is an absolutely excellent professor. I probably wouldn't recommend taking his divisional unless you like history, because there is quite a bit of reading each night, and frequent essays. If you DO like history, do absolutely everything you can to get into his class. He really knows his stuff, and his lectures are engaging and fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Coates was a phenomenal professor. It was a tough class but altogether very intellectually stimulating. Take advantage of his office hours! Such a down to earth guy.

Professor Coates is extremely caring and an amazing professor. With that being said, the class heavily relied on daily readings. You have a few papers, that are fun to write, but it is nearly impossible to get high marks on everything. You have to work very hard to get an A, however, Professor Coates is incredible.

Dr. Coates has both high expectations and flexibility. Reading schedule is heavy but his guiding questions are helpful. Lectures tend to be dull, but he occasionally surprises with humor. He is very responsive to email and gracious with deadlines. He grades fairly. Go to office hours for feedback on assignments before you submit them!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Coates has been a great introduction to the history department at Wake. He is incredibly knowledgeable and is passionate about what he teaches. He is down-to-earth, take advantage of his office hours because he is happy to break down work/content. You will read many many sources and the workload is very writing based.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall, I enjoyed taking Professor Coates's class, but would not take again. He is a nice professor and gives extensions when you need it. This class is not an easy A. Readings take more than 2-3 hours a night, and class is fast paced, lecture-heavy, and paper-heavy. Participation is also very important. Expect this class to take up a lot of time.
Professor Coates is the man. He is a genuine good guy who loves history, and if you participate class is very enjoyable.
Very paper-based class. Nice guy, and the class is interesting. I would definitely recommend it for a history divisional.

Coates was great! I love history, especially the area that his class covered so i'm sure that helped but he is really good. Get your work done, and if you have to miss a class or turn in an assignment late for any reason just talk to him and 9/10 times he'll be completely understanding and accommodating. Thanks for a great semester Prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: This guy is awesome. It's an easy A if you do the work and his lectures are great. This is a must take for a divisional

Prof Coates was a great divisional class, I enjoyed my time in HST 108 and did not experience too heavy of a workload. The midterm and final are both timed essays on your computer which were not too bad. Attendance is a good chunk of your grade so make sure to come to class

Lots of interesting readings and engaging lectures/discussions that clearly show how passionate he is! Grades kinda harshly (not too bad). If you enjoy history and want to be slightly challenged, take this! He pushes you to develop great writing and analytical skills. May not be the best for someone just trying to get through a divisional
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: So. Much. Reading. And lots of (seemingly random) assignments. But, he ends up grading pretty easily, and I got a grade I was satisfied with overall.

Professor Coates is a great professor and I have thoroughly enjoyed his class. He is very helpful and his lectures and discussions really helped me understand the readings and topics better. However, it is very lecture and reading-heavy, and participation is very important to the grade. There are also quite a few essays, but they are fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Awesome professor! His lectures were super helpful. The midterm and final were not too bad. The final paper is divided into multiple steps so it's not stressful. Gives amazing feedback, go to office hours for the final paper. Highly recommend for divisionals!

Dr. Coates is my favorite professor this year. He gives fantastic lectures and a ton of papers. Don't worry because the papers are so easy due to the lectures. He is always available after class and during office hours. Take him you will not regret it. A great way to get your History Divisional done!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. tommy was awesome. It's obvious that he cares about students and making sure everyone understands. He is super helpful during office hours and I highly recommend going especially before the midterms bc going over things in a smaller setting is so helpful. He is super approachable and he posts all his slides and optional hw that is all helpful

Prof Leung is so funny and his lectures are super engaging with many examples and he thoroughly explains topics. Most times the practice questions he gives are very similar to the ones on the quizzes and tests. Not a lot of work at except for weekly quizzes which are helpful in reviewing information before the midterms.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Tommy's great. Just pay attention in class and you'll be fine on the quizzes. I didn't even open my textbook. He tries to explain everything, and when people got questions wrong on Tophat he always asked if anybody needed it explained, orf if they knew what was wrong based on the correct answers.

Tommy Leung was a great professor who explained things in a way first time Econ students would understand. The concepts at hand could be confusing at times, but he provided ample support and extra credit opportunities. The group project helped to boost my grade, as well as the exam prep questions. Tommy Leung was great highly recommend.

Dr. Leung is a very sweet and understanding professor. His lectures, however, are very hard to understand and the slides are extremely wordy. His quizzes are fairly easy and your lowest two grades get dropped. Homework isn't mandatory but is recommended if you hope to do well in the class. Be prepared to teach yourself or get notes from a friend.

Such a sweet guy, but only easy if you pick concepts up easy. He gives *optional* homework, quizzes are fine if you look over the homework and notes (multiple choice), and there's 3 midterms instead of a final. BUT he explains concepts terribly, didn't give clear grading criteria on the one group project we had, and his lectures are pretty boring.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Had him for Econ 150. People say he's terrible but I thought he was an awesome teacher and super nice. Never took Econ before and found everything relatively easy to understand. Also does not give out any homework.

He is a super nice guy and you must pay a lot of attention in class to get good grades. You will have weekly quizzes which are not easy, but only contributes a small weight to you overall grade. The important tests are pretty easy.

I would 100% suggest to not take this class. Dr. Leung could care less about you as a student. If you are struggling and ask for help he appears annoyed and does not want to help you. He is completely unresponsive and his lectures are disorganized. He presents slides with no extra notes. Everything is completely based on prior knowledge in econ.

Professor Leung is one of the hardest professors. He is unclear in lectures and just reads off his powerpoint. He phrases questions unclearly and sometimes the students have to fight for their answer to be counted. There are weekly quizzes (PREPARE), random graded questions during class so pay attention, and he does not offer help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Professor Leung is a great guy and his class is not very difficult at all. There are weekly quizzes, but as long as you pay attention in class, they are easy. The exams are also not bad. He can, however, take a long time to explain things, which can get a bit dull, but he explains things pretty well.

I took this class for a divisional requirement and can not recommend it. He assigned videos once a week that were confusing and hard to follow. In class he assigned questions on TopHat and usually only 30% to 40% would get right. He did not explain the answers very well especially when everyone got a different answer. Take a different teacher.
Tommy is a funny guy and a good teacher at the same time. Very well respected by his students and definitely the best teacher to take for intro to Econ at WFU

His lectures are very straight forward but can be a bit dull sometimes. The textbook isn't mandatory but it helps to clarify any missing spots. The weekly quizzes are straightforward, as well as the test. The homework is optional but will help tremendously for the exams. Show up to class and get the participation credit, study, and you'll be good.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Andrews is incredible nice. The whole class is centered around your daybook and E-portfolio that you work on throughout the whole semester. You have a few papers and one creative project that is so fun to complete. If you work ahead and participate in the fun conversations in class, WRI111 will be really enjoyable.

I loved Dr. Andrews! Such a caring professor who seems like she truly cares about her students. This writing class does include a lot of digital work so if you're not into that then don't take it, however I didn't know anything about digital work and still really enjoyed it. She's very nice with grading, just follow her criteria!

I enjoyed having Dr. Andrews as a professor! She is one of the more fun, caring professors I've had at Wake. A majority of the assignments were us working on our portfolios which were due at the end of the semester. As long as you put in effort and turn things in on time, you'll do great! The only thing is that she grades slowly so be warned.
I took WRI 211 with her. Super cool and engaging professor and not too much homework

Had Dr. Andrews for Writing 210. Super easy but interesting material. She grades a journal with class notes periodically. There were assigned light readings but it does not really matter if you don't read it because she goes over it in class lecture and group discussion.
Great professor that cares about her students and grades pretty easily as long as you do the work.

Highly, highly, highly recommend Dr. Andrews for WRI 111. She is one of the sweetest professors I've had and genuinely cares about how all her students are doing. Although she grades really slowly, she's an easy grader and this class is an easy A if you put in a decent amount of effort.

I love Dr. Andrews! She's a fantastic professor and is incredibly understanding. She makes lectures fun with her quirky personality and jokes. I always enjoyed coming to her class. The only problem is though, she's a incredibly slow grader. I didn't get one our major project grades until the end of the semester.

Dr. Andrews is one of the best profs I've had at Wake so far. There is a fair amount of writing, but it's actually enjoyable. You write about relevant pop culture topics and things you're interested in. Throughout the semester you make your own website. She cares a lot about your mental health. Take this class for a non-stressful Wri 111.

I love Dr. Andrews. She is obviously passionate about what she teaches and about connecting with her students: she ornaments all her slides with gifs and videos pertaining to the topic. We watch SNL clips to help us understand different forms of rhetorical devices / satire. Final project is really fun. Not a hard class.

I don't love writing, but Professor Andrews' wri 111 class was actually pretty fun and laid back. If you just put in a little effort and get assignments done on time, you should be able to get a good grade. Material consists of a few projects, and participation is encouraged.
This class was really fun and laid back. There was a decent amount of homework every week but you're not likely to spend more than 3 hours a week on work.

Dr. Andrews class was fun to attend and I always had a great time completing the assignments. She does take a while to get things back and was even late submitting final grades. But, she is not a harsh grader at all so there was not much to worry about in terms of her grading at the last minute.

Prof. Andrews is an absolute angel. This was her first semester teaching at Wake and I highly highly recommend her for WRI111. The course load is very manageable, you write about what you're actually interested in, and she's a VERY lenient grader. Super sweet and cares about her students. Actually not much writing in total!

The Professor has a lot of experience in the area. It made me want to major in Anthropology. She is hilarious and have a lot of good anecdotes to tell in the class without getting away from the topic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Friederic was truly a great professor. Her lectures were fun and engaging, and she centered class around discussions and student opinions. Her fieldwork in Ecuador is inspirational and fascinating, which she uses to apply concepts in this course. There are two mandatory papers, a midterm, and final which are very reasonable. I highly recommend!
Loved her! She's super down to earth, funny, and knows a lot about what she's talking about. If you're looking to take an anthro course, definitely take her!

I did not enjoy Professor Friederic's class. The class is VERY reading heavy and your grade is made up of only the midterm and the final exam. LOTS of homework and very labor intensive for a divisional requirement.  I would not recommend this class to a friend, however some topics covered were interesting.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: I loved this professor and the class overall! Dr. Friederic is super funny and has an overall compelling personality. She made me want to attend class despite the long walk to Piccolo LOL.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: One of my favorite professors! She's kind and down to earth, and knows what she's talking about. Try to do the article readings because not all the specifics are brought up in class discussions. Most of the information from the textbook will be covered during lectures so don't stress about that. There are not a ton of graded assignments or exams.

Make sure you come to class because exams are based on that. Also, make sure to do the readings and be engaging and thoughtful with your participation. She is not a harsh grader at all; be sure to participate! It will make the class more enjoyable that way, but overall, a great class and a great professor!
Dr. Friederic is very knowledgeable and cares for her students, but her exams can be a bit challenging,

Dr. Friederic is very passionate about what she teaches and engages the whole class when discussing topics. There is A LOT of reading and you need to stay on top of it to be prepared for discussions, essays, and pop quizzes. Her midterm was challenging, but everything on it was covered in class even though some were slightly obscure references.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Friederic was a great professor to have for Cultural Anthropology. She is very passionate about the subject matter which translates to the classroom. Her field work was very interesting to learn about and I loved her class. She is a fair grader but doesn't make it impossible to succeed.
Opened my eyes to anthropology and inequality in the world. She cares about her students and was clear and helpful when we went online. You have to show up and do the reading, but it's a great class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The material is super interesting and easy to understand. I would recommend al though attendance is mandatory and if you skip its harder to know the material on the test without studying. Take this class it was really good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Much more interesting than expected. Not an easy class but definitely worth it. Shes laid back and funny and wants you to do well but you have to show up and do the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: pls for the love of god do not take this class you will go insane trying to follow assignment instructions that are borderline psychosis inducing.

If you write your papers so that they align with her beliefs (even if you don't agree with them), then you're on your way to an A. Get ready to try understanding the readings, only to give up 2 weeks in. There's also lots of group work and in-class discussions that include you and your classmates looking confused followed by awkward silence.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Lal is very close-minded in her feminist views. You are taught as if this is feminism in the nineties and she rarely includes other cultures and binaries other than black/white. There is also an extreme amount of reading and movies outside of class that are time-consuming and force you to do assignments with the views of these resources.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't take Lal if you actually want to learn about WGS! If you're a POC, queer, or any minority, she will attempt to make you a spokesperson. Refuses to accept any feedback on her teaching style even when she asks for it. She is a borderline TERF and will use offensive language like "Blacks" and consistently misgenders people "on accident"
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Most of the class is pretty lecture heavy, with assigned readings that are incredibly long and sometime hard to understand because it's academic journals meant for individuals with prior knowledge. While this course is difficult, I do feel I've learned so much from an individual that is extremely qualified and knowledgable in her discipline.

Professor Lal is hands-down one of the best professors I have ever had. Sitting in her lectures felt like a privilege. She is engaging and passionate about what she teaches. Many students complain about her being tough, but if you do the readings and follow her rubrics, it is not hard to succeed in the class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: This class was extremely reading and lecture heavy. She makes all students participate and her lectures tend to be long and boring. The readings are confusing. The projects and essays are not at all clear about what she is looking for.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is full of lectures and long complicated readings. Essay prompts are rigid and force you into one perspective practically summarizing the theory readings the class is based on. The class is an easy A but your grade is not based on how you apply or understand the topics rather on regurgitating what you read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class so you don't have to. About 20% of what she says is based in fact, and she responds to questions with incoherent rambling. You have to spout her ideology for a good grade, and she's generally rude and extremely pedantic. Even if you wanna take this useless form of sociology, please find another professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Lal is very passionate about what she teaches, making class more engaging. However, she does tend to go off on tangents and can be confusing at times but is always ready to clear things up if it gets too confusing. This class is extremely reading-heavy with multiple readings due each class for discussion. Highly recommend this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: The material was interesting, but the teacher made it more confusing than it needed to be, and it seemed that no matter what anyone said in class, it was wrong. She came in with an attitude and made it difficult to enjoy the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: As an international freshman, it was the hardest class I had ever taken. It's a lot of difficult reading, about 90 pages a week. She limits office hours to 10 minutes/ person/week. We don't have peer tutors for this course as well. Please don't take her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Personally, I loved having Dr. Lal as a professor. Although the classes are very participation and reading heavy, she makes the content extremely interesting. There is reading homework for every class and there are around 5 papers throughout the semester all of which are very manageable. All in all, I really would recommend her as a professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: This class was challenging but in a good way. There was a lot of homework and the projects were time-consuming but clear. If you put the work in, you'll do fine. The materials were super interesting and our discussions really engaging. She clearly cares about her topic. She's willing to mentor also.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Respected

comment: Took Dr. Makarion for WRI-109. Everything was process-based completion grades except for one essay and a final project. Lots of readings for homework but overall class was so easy. She cares about students and provides detailed feedback on assignments. Would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Literally the best. We had some readings each week and only one essay and simple final project. She's a nice grader and is super understanding. Super interesting readings. Definitely my best professor of the semester.
Loved the class. A little bit of homework but were interesting readings and prepared for class discussion well. Very willing to help!

Class content is super interesting and you can tell she enjoys her area of study. Half of your grade is based on participation (Cornell notes for HW and keeping a notebook) and attendance. The midterm and final aren't difficult if you don't procrastinate. She's also very willing to help when you reach out. Definitely take Prof Makarion's WRI-111!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Super kind and understanding! Attendance is mandatory but if you communicate with her in advance there will be no problems. We did one essay and one project. Our homework was mostly Cornell notes surrounding the readings and they were graded on completion and less on accuracy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: By far my favorite professor ever. She is absolutely amazing and SO caring. I learned so much in this class and at times it felt like I had a lot of work, but it was work I was motivated to complete because it was so genuinely interesting. I would 1000% recommend this class and professor to anyone and everyone. I think she is also a great mentor.

She's super great. We had a paper and a project, both were long but super manageable if you budgeted your time correctly. She's super passionate about the subject (not in an annoying way), and is really engaged in class discussions. There's a bit of reading, but it's never that much and is actually pretty interesting.

Professor Makarion is truly the best! The kindest person ever and assigns an appropriate amount of work. Super engaging during class conversation. She wants all of her students to succeed and is a great support system if you need it. I would take her class again in a heartbeat.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Makarion is truly the best professor I have encountered. She is very passionate about what she teaches and cares about every single one of her students. Her outfits always slay and she has the best energy!! A bunch of reading and Cornell notes are required, but mostly everything is based on completion rather than accuracy.

I really enjoyed this class. We were exposed to a lot of different types of writing that we had to analyze and reflect on. She is a great professor who is there to help you. I would definitely take another one of her classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I would highly recommend her writing class! She is kind, super helpful, and makes her class very interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: She is a great professor and very supportive. Interesting content and a stress free class. Will definitely try to take another class with her.
She is an angel on earth, and I absolutely adored this class. Learned so much and had the best time!
Pretty easy for first BEM Class open notes, computer, and everything for tests. Do the problems with him in class and u will get an A

Humorous and amusing in class. Very difficult to work with outside of the classroom and does not offer additional support or assistance.  Grading appears subjective as there is no rubric, and little constructive feedback on assignments.

Pat is one of the most amazing and approachable professors @ WFU; he genuinely cares about student learning (not grades) and inspires students to take learnings beyond the classroom. He's a real asset to the facility of the University; I would definitely take him again if possible.
Nice guy.  Made class interesting.  Pay attention to the small tidbits & asides as he finds a way to include them on the exams.
Good professor.  Went a little fast at times which was hard for us non=computer people but all in all a good class. WAY better than Quant 1!!!
Great teacher. Great class. Great tools.
