I've heard this guy sucks via email but since I never tried I can't comment on that.  He told us he was brief, though-almost as to forewarn us.  I though he went out of his way to help us understand this stuff actually.  We had extra tutorial sessions that he absolutely didn't have to do--but did.  The final was tough but 4 the semester he was fine
Turned what could have been a great course into a trainwreck. Two-Faced, refused to answer students questions in class! At $300 a student hour he should be ashamed!
CB demos were very helpful.  His lectures were a little dry.  His grading was way too tough for a 1.5 credit graduate class.  He treated us like high school students.

Nice guy, but class amounts to nothing more than long drawn-out Crystal Ball demo's. He messes with the lighting in class constantly during these. Also he has different expectations for "performance levels" between his quizzes and tests - a tidbit he will not mention to you until after the fact.
Two personalities, a friendly face in class and nasty and mean comments through e-mail.
No Comments
I just wish we would stop talking about Rennie Stennet.  Otherwise, he's OK and he smells good too.

Absolute riot and a pretty good prof too, although he's not for everyone, particularly as there are paths of far less resistance to the credits his classes confer. Classes are unsystematic but there's something for everyone every time. Expects you to do more than rule-parrot, but loves his diagrams and analogies. Very engaging and open-minded.
He harps all semester that his expectations are as clear as day, and that lectures and reviews are like batting practice for the final...until the final is heavily focused on things he glossed over.
Is this class easy? No. But Professor Parker is a great Con. Law professor. Students aren't spoon fed information but the takeaways are readily available to those who put in the effort.
Needlessly complicates the subject with historical angles better suited for some sort of elective about 20th century judicial history. Tests on bespoke diagrams and nuanced interpretations of cases.

A horrid teacher who relies too heavily on antiquated and (often) incorrect metaphors. He attempts to contextualize cases within their historical framework yet seemingly has not bothered to learn history from any other perspective beyond what he was taught in school in the 1960s and 1970s.

Favorite professor at wake! really entertaining and engaging classes. make sure to pay attention to all his analogies (and use them on exams/paper), even if they don't make sense the first time around. once you learn the material, it all clicks into place.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: my favorite professor.
This guy has to be one of my favorite teachers at Wake. He's hilarious and smart at the same time. It was refreshing to not have a professor who takes everything so seriously all the time.
The most entertaining lecturer at Wake- Loved Con with him and found him extremely helpful outside of class-
Great professor...I really enjoyed his classes...though several people didn't like him....guess it depends on your personality
Entertaining, although I have no idea what I actually learned.

Had him for Con Law I and II, thought he was confusing and probably insane.  Took him for Comparative Con Law and Jurisprudence because the classes sounded good and found out that Parker's a lot of fun in smaller classes. Don't let Con Law scare you away!!  These classes were two of the best I took in law school.
Smart guy. Bad teacher.
He's a very good professor but he gives a lot of work. The tests are also quite harsh.
Always mad for no reason, and gets upset when you dont understand his poor explanations. There are a lot of great 111 profs at Wake, take someone else.

The bad reviews for this prof are likely people who took this class as a div. -- dont do that. If you want to learn, take vanbastalaer. He is passionate, and he seems tough on the outside but is so caring and wants his students to learn. Show up to class, put in the work, you will be fine. This class is the reason I am a cs major. He rocks 1000/10

\RED FLAG NO NO NO 

If you are a computer science major/minor, cs interests you, you are ready to work your butt off, and you don't want to have a social life, then take this class. If one of these does not apply to you, then TAKE A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: super hard class, the other class had way less work and a much kinder teacher, way too much content covered way too quickly

Not enough amazing things to say. He is tough, gives a lots of work, but I have never met someone more passionate about their students. You can tell he really cares whether you understand the content, and goes as far out of his way to make sure of it as possible. Hard tests but big curves, lots of extra credit, but put in the work and ur good
hasn't learned how to teach yet

TAKE HIS CLASS!!! He is a tough grader, but I learned SO much, and while he does give a ton of work, if you put in time you will be rewarded. He curves like no other and takes student feedback incredibly seriously. Dropped everyone's lowest midterm (there were two) and quiz grades. I cannot stress enough how much I loved this class.

His class is tough so I wouldn't take if not interested in computer science, but if you are, his class will be very helpful and prepare you well. He is so nice and has a NICE curve. so even though he's a tough grader, the curve is the best I have seen in all my classes. You get out what you put in and I'm so so happy I chose to take his class.

He is definitely on the harder side for those who don't want to major in comp sci, but if you do, he is a great teacher. He cares about his students and will support you in any way he can. He pushes his students, but if you like computer science, it is rewarding. I feel very prepared coming out of his class and I am happy I chose to take him.

I found him to be a really hard teacher but he does really care about his students. I think that if you take his class, you have to be willing to put in a lot of work. He will prep you pretty well for future comp sci classes but he teaches and grades to harshly for an intro class

He is not the best at teaching the intro level course. He is really smart and can answer doubts but is not very friendly in class. He gets frustrated if a student doesn't understand a concept, and doesn't know how to explain properly. He forgets that everyone is not as smart as him and that it is difficult for a beginner.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: If this is your first time coding, do NOT take this class. Dr.Vanbastelaer is really intelligent, however, it is hard to understand his lectures, as he doesn't know how to explain things in a simpler way. On top of that, he never codes in class, making it much more difficult to understand whatever he is trying to explain.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: I came WR111 with a strong background in writing and didn't find it hard. The readings where quite difficult especially towards the beginning of the semester., then rely on a few of those readings for the semester. You will frequently come into class with an assignment and then have to add to it (reflection or additional writing) during that class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Just dont take wri 111 with him. Hard to get a good grade, class is insanely boring, and the essay prompts are extremely confusing. There's reading before every class and 15 minutes of writing on the reading every class. After that the class is just insanely boring. There are writing classes that are way easier than this one so just stay away.

The class itself was fairly interesting but some of the readings made no sense and therefore caused many of the essays to be difficult. In addition to that, some of the prompts are very unclear in what they are asking you to write and grades vary greatly. you also need a 95 to get an A in the course which seems very unfair to me.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr. Smith is generally nice and considerate. But the class is an absolute bore. Average reading was about 70 pages before class. All you do in class is sit and discuss the readings, and the hour and 15 minutes can feel like an eternity. Simple assignments though and they're graded fairly easily.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Smith's WRI 111 was a great course to expand on my writing skills and knowledge. Dr. Smith is very insightful and accessible. There was a solid amount of reading material, but as long as you come to class having read it you will be set. My writing improved greatly from the beginning of the semester, as Dr. Smith is clear about expectations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He's really nice and genuinely cares about students. One of the best professors I've had here. He helped me rediscover my love for writing and I found his demeanor unsettling yet... calming? Definitely take his class, be prepared to read and participate but you won't regret it.

The class itself is pretty interesting but the teacher can be little strange sometimes. He is quiet, judgmental at times, and a bit pretentious. I enjoyed the readings but the class setup was a boring because it was heavily lectured based and oftentimes, he didn't create an environment where people felt free to talk. Pop quizzes every day.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very boring, a lot of homework, a chance for a pop quiz every class, don't take this class

Incredible professor. Went into the class looking to skate through a divisional and left with a different perspective on writing. The class is not a layup, but if you stay on top of workload an A is very achievable. Readings can be tedious but are mostly interesting, and he helps you apply the readings to your own work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: I am not a humanities person whatsoever so I was super nervous coming into a writing class, but honestly Dr. Smith made me a better, more comfortable writer. As some who deals with a lot of writing anxiety, I definitely felt seen. That being said, this class isn't just an easy A - if you stay consistent, then you will be fine and feel very rewarded
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: There is the chance for a quiz every class, and plenty of reading to keep you busy. If you are a writer and enjoy writing, then you will like this class a lot. If you are not a big fan of the humanities, it may be difficult to get a good grade and complete all the work.

Great professor, feedback made me a much better writer. Overall definitely a chill guy. He does give a decently significant amount of homework and there are a bunch of pop quizzes but it's all manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He was an outstanding professor and I significantly improved my writing through his support. Come prepared with hw notes to class because every day there is a possibility of an open note pop quiz.
He is amazing I love this man

had him online last year. chill professor. the writing assignments did feel like busy work at times. he would post a prompt on friday and expect us to have it due monday. and to do the homework, you had to do the reading. but even the reading was a lot. at least he gave good feedback when you needed it and class was once a week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: This class was so much fun to take and one of the most easiest by far! Professor Yuan is by far amazing and down to earth. The class is very interesting and are mainly lectures. Only 2 tests that are take home and one group presentation. I would definitely recommend.

love, love, LOVE Dr. Yuan! had her last year for an online class. She's the reason why I love sociology and why i'm considering minoring in it. she keeps the lectures interesting and engaging. she's also really fun and chill. any student would be lucky to have her as their teacher.

Prof. Yuan was so amazing!! Her lectures were always engaging and enjoyable, and she is impossible to dislike. As long as you participate and take decent notes you shouldn't have a problem in this class.

Dr. Yuan is absolutely amazing! By far one of the best professors at Wake Forest, she is always open for office hours, amazing lectures, very funny, and makes sociology interesting! I l always look forward to going to her class and she is very fair in her grading. As long as you pay attention in class and review before exams, you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: She was a very good professor. Sociology was already interesting, but she made it more interesting. I learned a lot. Participation is important though so you will have to speak up and answer questions/give your opinions.
Overall an amazing professorthere is so much to earn and take away from her class.

Dr. Yuan is a really genuine and caring professor that really engages students with the material. The class is very rewarding and interesting as long as you put in the work, if you don't you're kinda screwed. I would highly recommend Dr. Yuan, she is a gem. I might minor is sociology because of her class.

Dr. Yuan does a good job of being engaging in class and fair to her students. She is funny and makes you think. I enjoyed her as my prof but definitely do the assigned reading if you plan to talk in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Yuan is such a caring professor! She really can tell when her students aren't paying attention and will dismiss class early sometimes I feel bad. The material is interesting and easy to follow and she makes it clear how you're going to be graded. The exams are open note, and it's more difficult to get a grade below an A than it is to get one.

Dr. Yuan's class is so engaging, she is the cutest person ever and clearly cares about the well-being of her students and gives very little work. Grading is based on two exams (which are open note), and engagement posts about what you enjoyed learning each week. I would highly recommend her class if you need an easy divisional.
Such a good and easy class! Take her if you are taking Soc 151. She's crazy, loves cats, and is always eager to help. Work load is very light and class itself is easy.

If you're taking SOC151, take Prof. Yuan's class. She's fabulous, funny, and quirky. I look forward to her class every week. It's not difficult and honestly gets you engaged and interested in sociology. There are weekly discussion boards (100 words), 1 15min group presentation, and 2 exams that are open note and take home. Would take again!

She got her degree a long time ago and it's incredibly clear. She is easy at times because she has no idea what she's talking about. When going over an exam she is talking about one of the problems and says "Well I don't know why this works but I plugged it into my computer and it did." Wish I had taken someone else.
Do not take her class! She has no idea how to clarify anything. Students with prior experience with computer science are most likely to do well.

I don't think I've ever had a more dysfunctional or opaque teacher in my life. She doesn't have any clue how to communicate any information. I would give a 0 for clarity. Her labs are insufferably unclear as to what she wants you to do. She's still explaining in class what she actually wants THE DAY IT'S DUE. If possible, avoid her like the plague.

Unfortunately not the best professor. I had her for my FYS and she was basically incompetent. She's REALLY sweet, nice, and cares deeply about her students. She tries to explain fairly irrelevant things often, but at least she's nice.

Lots and LOTS of enthusiasm - perhaps too much - and a trivial class. Seems to have the most interest in bringing concepts to the classroom with cutesy little animations and getting students Excited and such. Lectures are information-sparse, quite a lot of trivial demonstration of mathematical operations (filter masks and such). We get the idea already!
agree with the last rating
Avoid. She really has a PhD in CSC?

Terrible teacher!  Avoid at all costs.  She's easy only because she's stupid-- the course has NO structure which makes it very difficult to learn from.  I can't believe we pay people like this to waste our time!!
She's a very nice person, but the course was way too easy.  Not her fault though.  She is very fair however, when you bring things to her attention.
Prof. Burg is very cool.  She will take the time to help anyone who is trying, and she explains the material well.
No Comments
Pleasant, giving instructor.  Takes the time to ensure you learn the material.

He is a nice and funny guy, but his class is difficult. He rushes through class a lot and goes through dumb tangents about his life and kids. This causes him to lose a lot of time and rush. He then puts things on the test (only four tests which are your only four grades) that he never discussed in class.

If you want an accessible prof, do not take this class. He also only ever listened to male students or the girl students he liked. He complained about his 5 kids endlessly and the tests were incredibly hard. I tried to meet with him 5 times (he would say yes over email) and he showed up once.

2 things. If you're good at econ and can pay attention, take his class by all means. If neither are true, look for an easier prof. MacDonald is one of the funniest teachers I have had and his class is really enjoyable, but I have a hard time focusing in class, and he doesn't put the notes online. There isn't much outside the tests for grade.

He is energetic and funny. His texts are mostly multiple-choice and fairly easy. As long as you come to class and take good notes, you will pass. The things on the test are the exact same as in class.
I just love this professor! He is the best professor I have ever seen. I really enjoyed his class and I would definitely take him again next year for higher level class.
Perfect professor for me. I love how he delivers info in class with his own humor.
Very lecture based professor, but each one manages to be engaging. The only 4 grades in this class are your 4 midterm exams, so attending each lecture is necessary to do well.

Professor MacDonald made getting up for an 8am class easy. His lectures were easy and even fun to listen to. Everything learned in class is applied to real life situations. The tests strictly cover what was discussed in lectures so as long as you pay attention in class you'll do decently. Would definitely take his class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: macdonald is hilarious. he made this subject very interesting and I looked forward to class. he has sm dad jokes and is passionate abt econ. he never assigns homework, but has homework / prac test that is optional. he is available to meet with you outside of class if you email him. tests are all multiple choice. never any textbook reading
Really funny and makes clear connections. Make sure you do the online homework because he is likely to use those exact questions on tests
The class was hard and his tests were even harder.
No Comments
great professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I can't overestimate how unpleasant this class was, despite biology being a favorite subject. The way she grades is very subjective and runs counter to scientific principles. By her own account she grades "holistically" and goes with the overall "vibe". Even if you give the exact same answer as the answer key, you may still get a 2 or 3 out of 5.

She is probably not very experienced in teaching yet. But her lectures felt more like reading from slides. When she was asked challenging questions by students, she would miss the point of answering them or answering a completely different question. It's like she has a script she has to follow and will not go off it. Did not enjoy her class
Worst Professor I have ever had. She was the lab instructor, very limited contact, yet she managed to make a lasting negative impact. Would strongly not recommend. Like really not

Lectures go pretty fast, for whatever reason it was just impossible to improve much on tests regardless of how you studied. It was hard to find anyone who did well in her class bc of the grading. We were all pretty frustrated by the end.
Class is not that tough if you put in consistent work. Dr. Vega helped me a lot in offic hours.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Vega frustrated me with the way she went about her students’ success in her class. The Biology department’s holistic grading is terrible, but she’s also a tough grader for no good reason. This class drained me, and she refused to acknowledge that a classroom setting involves meeting in the middle from both the students and the professors.
Vega does not work with her students and does not teach material well.

She sucks. Don't take her if you can avoid it. In general, the biology department sucks. Nonbinary grading sucks. Having an A in one page and a C/D on another sucks. Not getting your exam back without going to office hours sucks. Having 5 exams sucks. Having an exam 3-6 days before final exam sucks. Biology sucks. Goodluck, you need it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I think people were overtly complaining considering the fact that the class median was a B+. However, my gripes were that the rubric was unclear and being a few words could throw you from A to B+ or to B-. The grading mechanism is quirky and not in the good way, basically to get an A you have to get an A approx 5/6 of the test equiv assignments.

She tends to read everything that is on the slide which doesn't help to learn from a different perspective. For tests, she wants you to know very specific details and words and if you don't write specific words down, you don't get that question right, even if everything you write is correct. Not good at being open to other perspectives
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Just dont take her. I dont care if it screws up your schedule. If you want to work harder than ever before and get a bad grade for no reason, this class is for you. The class is graded only by tests, but she looks for key words in a bunch of short answer responses. Miss one key word but fully understand everything? Bam. B-. Why? She cant say
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Such a caring professor! Genuinely cares about her students and checks in regularly. Lots of textbook readings, then quizzes on the readings, and big group project at the end of the semester but not too stressful. Cheat sheet allowed on midterm and final. Take Dr. Allman if you can!!

Very reading heavy, but quizzes are open note & you get a cheat sheet for the midterm/final. If you take good notes on the reading you will do well. Dr. Allman is very caring and wants students to succeed. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Attendance/participation is mandatory, but class content is just going over the reading -- no new material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Kate Allman is super nice and I really like her. There are quizzes every week but they are open-note. There are opportunities for extra credit. The midterm was also open note. There is a lot of reading but it is totally doable.

Dr. Allman was my favorite professor this semester. She cares deeply about her students and is always available to give god feedback or just to talk. She assigns a lot of reading but I thought the reading was really interesting most of the time, and so long as you actually do the reading the class will be a breeze. Absolutely love her! Highly rec!
PSY 151 was a great class! Topics were I interesting. Dr. Allman is also really nice and cares a lot about her students.

I loved Dr. Allmans class! Theres a lot of reading in all of the Intro Psych classes, but Dr. Allman did a good job of giving questions to focus readings and quizzes were open-note. Classes were always engaging and we had a lot of opportunities to share our ideas with the whole class. Final group research project was interesting and manageable.

Dr. Allmans PSY 151 class was one of the best classes that Ive had at Wake Forest. Shes extremely kind and brilliantand she always makes time for her students. She lets her students make walking office hour reservations, even outside of her regular office hours. There is a lot of reading, but she makes class really engaging! Highly recommend!
Professor Allman is caring but only to certain students. My emails to her were left unanswered for weeks. Open note quizzes were helpful in this class, but her grading is unclear at times.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: You can tell she really cares about students. Always tries to make class more engaging and fun-often through group work. Reading can be heavy at times, but manageable. If you are willing to put more than just the bare minimum in this class, you will get an A.

Very nice and genuinely cares about each student. Loves class engagement and group activities. Class consists of a lot of reading outside of class and quizzes are all open note. As long as you participate and pay attention it should be an easy semester grade.

Dr. Allman is really knowledgable and genuinely cares about her students. Definitely a lot of reading, but most of it is intuitive and the quizzes are open-note. If you put in the work it is very rewarding.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Allman is very nice and it is clear that she cares about her students. She assigns 4-5 hours of reading/notes per night though and you get tested on it every week. I would not recommend this class to anyone who isnt willing to dedicate their life to this class because the workload is ridiculous and difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I recommend taking his class for an easy divisional. There are 2 tests (1 in-person & 1 online) and those are pretty easy. There is a final paper that takes up a good amount of work but isn't bad. There are weekly quizzes based on the reading that is done at home. He is very funny and makes sure is everyone engaged in the class. 100% recommend.
The best professor I have had yet, truly cares about his students. He grades incredibly easy. 2 tests which are easy, a paper where mean was a 95, and 50% of the grade is take home quizzes

(PHI220) His lectures are amazing, with examples of key concepts, interactions with students, etc. He is a very caring professor and is very willing to help his students out with questions about lectures/papers. I enjoyed this course a lot even as a non-philosophy major.
Very smart guy, knows what he's talking about and makes it very interesting. Highly recommend for philosophy divisional.

(Environmental Ethics) Professor Hortal gives great lectures, interacts, and walks around the whole room. 1 homework quiz every week is based on readings, and usually due before the next week (takes an hour max). The in-class quiz was also easy and based on information he emphasizes in class. You will get an A if you pay attention.
Interesting and engaging in lectures. Very passionate. One open notes exam, one not open book

His class is easy and engaging and he's very accessible outside of the classroom, he wants to help you do well. All around good professor! His quizzes have multiple attempts and his exams are not difficult if you study beforehand.

PHI 220* Hortal is a fantastic professor. Weakly open note quizzes based on readings, midterm, final, and paper make up your grade. Not a harsh grader at all, and helps prepare you for exams by offering a study guide. I really learned a lot in this class, which was nice as he did so in a funny way. I debated dropping initially, but def worth it!
Great professor who will work with you on your grades and likes to see people get A's
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr.Hortal truly cares about his students and wants to see them succeed.  There isn't much discussion in class, but he will call on people randomly which motivates you to be engaged.  There is only a midterm and a final exam and a couple quizzes each week on readings.  I know he'll always be down to have a conversation even after ending his class.

Class was all lecture, difficult to take notes on. Mid-term required studying, but not too hard of a test. Final exam was open note. Final essay is relatively easy. Not a hard grader, want his students to do well and learn. Other grades come from weekly quizzes and in-class participation quizzes.
homework quizzes and a lot of reading but super easy, midterm was absolute cake, and he's genuinely so funny and such a sweet guy!

I really liked Professor Wise but she focussed way to much on CRT instead of actual Politics. You pretty much have to connect racism to everything in America even if there isn't any. Easy class to get an A-/B+ but you have to pretend to believe our entire country is inherently racist. At least she's transparent about her own political views.

The course was a COMPLETE waste of my time and money, taught nothing about American Government&Politics but only about critical race. Class is an easy A-, but you have no choice but to pretend that you are liberal in order to get an A. Around 3-4 hours of work every week. She's easy and kind, but besides the easy grade, this class was a disgrace.
Just a little ridiculous when it comes to grading. super ambiguous

Easily one of my favorite professors I've taken. The topics covered in class are super interesting, and it was a very engaging course. You definitely have to put in effort consistently throughout the semester, but they make it easy to do so. Would reccommend.

One of the nicest people and most interesting professors I've ever taken. You have to do two small 3ish page writing assignments and about 50 pages worth of reading per week so it takes me about 2-3 hours. Only issue is she is basically a socialist and the class is like 50% critical race theory, but its a college professor so what do you expect
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Online Savvy

comment: Super sweet! Really cares about her students! Take home midterm and final! She gives a lot of reading! Is understanding. Very engaging, is passionate
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about politics and policy! Kind, caring, and understanding. If you participate in class and do the homework, an A is attainable!

Would not take this class as a divisional. There are about 20-30 pages of reading before every class, including a discussion post due on the reading (very time-consuming). Participation is absurd. I was dropped from an A to a B+ at the end of the semester for it. If you don't share her extremely liberal views, participating is very hard. DON'T TAKE
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Prof Wise was great! There are a ton of readings that you have to respond to before every single class, but you can kind of get away with skimming them. Participation is a big aspect of your grade, make sure to say something every single class even if it's just a single comment. She was extremely kind are caring, she really cares about her students
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Class was easy and engaging. It is evident she has very liberal views and will give reading material that reflects those views, but regardless of your views she is respectful and tends to let everyone express themselves. Extra credit through self-care journals. Not tough grader, but you need to put in the work since the exams are everything

Great professor, accessible, caring, clear with grading criteria. I took POL 113 and it was easy. We did have a Canvas post due before every class, but you can do them w/o having to do the reading-I usually took 15-20min to do each one. I am taking her again this sem and it's also not hard (no canvas posts), and engaging. Highly recommend

Professor Wise was one of the best teachers. She always made class engaging; it was important that everyone participated in speaking/discussions, especially with peers. There are discussion board posts in every class based on readings... that midterm and final make up your grade. Lastly, allows for extra credit through self-care journals!

Professor Wise is a great politics professor. She is a lenient grader and there aren't any tests/quizzes which is very helpful. The homework isn't too much and participation is important during class time. She's very caring and won't judge you for any of your opinions. Great class; fully recommend it to anyone!

Really nice lady who is super positive and supportive when students give answers. She's definitely a heavy liberal which makes a lot of students scared to participate and share opinions. The readings can be pretty long, but she always reviews the material in class the next day. This was my first time taking a politics class and I really enjoyed it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She's super nice and easy to talk to, so go to her office hours! Her lectures are sometimes hard to follow, but the assignments usually clear that up-- overall she was great at teaching the concepts!

Ghadiri is a nice person but a terrible lecturer. She did offer help and ways to earn extra points if you weren't happy with your grade, however, I had to self-teach myself the ENTIRE course. She also refuses to put grades in so I still don't know what I have in the class and have no idea what I need on the final, total lack of information.

She seems like a smart woman but she is not good at teaching. Her lectures are boring, skip important info, and are very very difficult to understand. If chem is still fresh in your mind, you may be able to keep up. If not, prepare to do a lot of self-teaching. The assignments are easy but she does not prepare you well for tests (the main grades).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Kind teacher, but very difficult to learn from. Overall, if you can learn well on your own, this is the teacher to take. She doesn't give much homework and isn't a harsh grader, but she is impossible to understand. Her lectures are just reading off of the slides, and she does not answer questions clearly. She also tales a long time to grade tests.

This is not the professor you want to have for your first college-level chem experience. She cares a lot about her students but she paces her lectures poorly and the content is often difficult to understand. I would only recommend taking gen chem with her if you have a strong chemistry background. If you've got a solid grip of chem it's not bad.

Very smart and nice professor who cares about her students. She is determined to make you get a good grade and offers extra credit opportunities. The tests are relatively easy and she gives review sessions before the tests. There is minimal homework, but you should participate in class. Overall amazing professor and definitely would take again.
She was always accessible after class and truly a delight to talk to. While her class pacing is not the best, she makes sure you're ready for the exams and always does a review class before exams.

Dr. Ghadiri's class was not paced correctly, class goes by quickly and we often ran out of time, on the last day of class we were still cramming stuff for the final. She offers extra credit and will replace your lowest test grade with the average of the other 2. She also weights all the tests lower than 20% so they aren't super high stakes.
Although she is extremely intelligent, she is not so great at conveying this information. She also doesn't space the units out and would usually end up cramming the day before all of our tests.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Decent, but wouldn't be first choice. Lectures go by quickly and are hard to understand. Definitely need to read textbook prior to lectures and have it supplement the lecture. Pretty generous grader at the end of things, all in all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a nice professor but her lectures are hard to follow and they go by very quickly. All tests are online. Tests are tough at times since we don't do as much practice in class.
She is really nice, but doesn't follow structure of other CHM111 classes making it difficult to get outside help & lectures aren't always explained thoroughly.

Professor Ghadiri's chem class was very easy. All tests were online and some were even take home. Lectures can sometimes be difficult to understand and she is a little quiet but overall very nice and an easy A for chem 1.

I love Prof Tiboni-Craft but I did find her class quite hard. I took Italian 111 with her and she is a great teacher but there was ALOT of studying required. She heavily appreciates if you show you are prepared and putting in effort so keep that in mind. Even if you aren't the best at her class, just participate and it will be okay. Study hard!!

ITA 112: Prof. Tiboni-Craft is so kind, funny, and caring. She comes to class with incredible energy and truly cares about her students' wellbeing. She's very traditional, requiring students to sit up straight, respond enthusiastically, and participate FREQUENTLY. Exams are easy, and so much extra credit. I can't recommend this professor enough.

I took Professor Craft for italian 111, and she is very passionate about italian. She is very lively, but BE READY TO PARTICIPATE. she is the type of teacher to keep track of people who participate and you have to stay on top of your homework (even if it just says to review). Her tests aren't too bad, and all vocab quizzes are announced.

Prof. Tiboni-Craft is the nicest professor ever! She cares so much about her students and wants everyone to succeed. She provides many extra credit opportunities. Study guides for each test are so helpful. Vocab quizzes are frequent but always announced. If you pay attention and put effort into this class you will do well.

This FYS was a great introduction to college coursework. There's a lot of reading, especially at the start, but Dr. Tiboni-Craft facilitates such interesting conversations that it is definitely worth it. She fosters such a kind and caring class environment, if you are interested in womens' studies and psychology to any extent I highly reccomend.

Professoressa Tiboni-Craft is an amazing professor and truly cares about her students improving their skills. She makes learning Italian fun and is not a tough grader at all. Her tests are super easy if you follow the study guide and there are some fun projects like podcasts and talking to native speakers. Would 100% recommend taking her!
One of the most understanding and caring professors I have ever met. The class is on the easier side, which creates a comfortable environment for students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Tiboni was always excited to be in class and make a connection with students. She genuinely cares about what you think and encourages meaningful class discussion. For FYS100, be prepared for a weekly  discussion post that she does seriously grade, but if you put in effort you will do well. Make sure to participate and analyze the texts given.

Dr. Tiboni-Craft is a wonderful professor who cares so much about her students. I had her for FYS, and the topic was wonderful! It is lots of reading, but the second half of the semester is almost entirely movies, so it balances out! Her grading was always very fair in my opinion, and if you try your best you'll get a good grade :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She loves participation!! She is such a caring teacher who just wants her students to learn. Homework is manageable and tests are the same as the study guide. Highly recommend.

Take her for Italian! Her class is very easy, yet you learn a lot. She is super caring, understanding, and even funny. There is homework every night but it's easy and only takes like 10 minutes. I highly recommend.
Very understanding, compassionate, caring, good conversations, kind. You'll read and watch a good deal of films but the amount was very manageable. I would definitely take again!

Professoressa makes learning Italian so much easier. She is enthusiastic, funny, and wonderful. She cares about "producing the language," so there is no slacking in class. She is aware of the language barrier and works hard to help students understand all we can. She is the fairest grader I know and provides extra credit opportunities. I love her!
Dr. Franco helped me fall further in love with my English major. Incredible proff
He honestly is my favorite professor. He genuinely cared about the success of each student. I'm so glad I had him my first semester here at Wake.

Prof. Franco is awesome. I went in to his office hours before every paper and he was super helpful. I am an science-y person, but I kept up with the readings and participated in class which really helped.

LOTS of reading. Not many grades besides the large papers, but he's extremely helpful and encourages students to see him before they turn it it. It's all discussion so be prepared to talk about the texts or it'll be awkward

One of the best professors I've ever had! He runs the class as a discussion/ seminar, which really forces everyone to read and prepare for class beforehand. He is an extremely tough grader of essays, but I improved my writing abilities 10-fold after taking Dr. Franco's class. He really got excited about the literature, which is also a strength!
He's a good teacher with good ideas. The class is very interesting and the texts are wonderful. Take it!
Excellent, I'm definitely not an "english person", but with a decent amount of time and interest, I learned a lot and truly enjoyed the class.
Great teacher
awesome teacher and a great guy who will do anything to see you succeed.  really inspired me to want to be an English major.
By far one of the best professors you're going to get here, he will literally jump through hoops to help his students.  A must take.
Hidden gem of Wake Forest faculty. Incredibly intelligent, very helpful, entertaining. I wish all professors at Wake were this inspiring.
Super sexy

You have to do most of the work before you come to class. You're expected to take all the notes yourself and then class is review. A lot of Quizlet, Kahoot, and group discussion. You are forced to participate, but she condescends if you get it wrong. Nobody knew what she was saying or wanted to speak. Just be prepared to learn everything yourself.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Morgan is hard if you don't take it seriously. There's a lot of homework and daily 5-question quizzes (necessary to learn a language), but it's not too hard if you do the work. She's not amazing at teaching material in class, so there's a lot of teaching yourself outside of class. Would recommend if you're willing to put in the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: would not take her again. teaches like a high school teacher. lots of outside assignments and daily quizzes.

I like Dr. Morgan, she wasn't my favorite teacher but definitely not the worst. Participation really matters and her tests are pretty challenging. You will have a lot of homework but it's not particularly hard. The class was relatively entertaining and she is a very nice person. I recommend her

Dra. Morgan was very caring and seemed like she really wanted her students to succeed. Class was fun and we played Kahoot/Quizet Live everyday. She gave out helpful study guides and grammar notes before each exam and makes vocab quizlets for her students to use. She was a little bit of a tough grader at first but got easier as the semester went on.
Spare yourself. She is super nice and a good person but her class is really hard and her exams are impossible.

Dr. Morgan has not been my favorite professor, but she also has not been the worst. I always felt like I was being judged by her both inside and outside of the classroom. She has a lot of online homework several times a week and her exams are tough. She is also kind of condescending. She is not mean, just not what I look for.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Morgan is a lovely, smiley lady. Teaches from slideshow, but we play lots of games in her class to learn and have a lot of time to speak in Spanish with partners to practice. There is typically a lot of homework, and class seems to move too fast, but there's a lot to get through, so I get it. Also, her exam study guides are very helpful.
Awesome professor. Will push you but if you work hard you will be successful.
Dra. Morgan is a great professor. I took her for SPA113 and enjoyed the class. The class isn't the easiest, but no spanish classes are.

She does an excellent job teaching, and the material she prepares in her slideshows helps so much. She has a lot to teach in a short period of time so I understand why it is fast, but she expects a lot from her students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Morgan was an incredible professor who genuinely cared about all of her students. She made each class fun with Kahoots and Quizlet Lives of the prior homework. She holds very high standards for her students and gives a lot of work. She was always happy to help students do the best they could. Classes were organized and fun.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: A very nice woman. Graded participation was very difficult. Everything was to a very high standard and as a required divisional class, that was not ideal. I am just happy to be done with Spanish. Realistically there are much easier teachers than her for SPA 212

Take this class for an easy divisional. Lectures were extremely boring and attendance was mandatory but you can just do hw for other classes. This class has a lot of group work but the assignments are super easy, and there are no tests or quizzes. She assigns reading outside of class that is a decent amount of work. Overall easy A and nice person.

She is very nice and it is an easy A is you pay attention to directions. Although it is the most boring class I have ever taken and every class is only lectures. Also the assignments make no sense and the directions could not be more confusing.

If you are a libtard and u are ready for the most boring lectures, or u are a soc major who obviously doesn't care ab ur life anyway, go ahead and get this pretty easy A. I'd rather watch paint dry than go to her classes. 99% of the material is just giving things that are common sense labels and names. All she cares about is racism and genders. L
Holy bot. The most boring class I've ever taken. I just did other hw the whole time.

Do not take this professor. Although she means good, she is one of the most disengaging, tasteless, and boring professors I have ever had. If you want an easy divisional this is it, but you will fall asleep in class and hate her lack of proactiveness of updating grades. Better options if I were to do this again.

I liked professor Babon a lot. Although she does not make assignments very clear at times, she is very accessible to talk to after class. She is an easy grader, but you have to do the work. I actually learned so much from her class, but in a stress free way.

Babon is a great person to take for a divisional! The work is engaging but however her lectures are quite boring. Babon also isn't very tech savvy so canvas page is hard to navigate to see what assignments are due. She can be quite confusing also with assignments but never penalizes if you communicate issues of understanding.

This class was super easy. I would totally recommend taking SOC 151 if you need it for a divisional. That being said, the class was quite boring. Dr. Babon's lectures were not very engaging and most students did not care about the class. The outside readings were actually very interesting, but there were probably 3-4 readings each night.

Dr. Babon's class was fairly easy but the lectures were pretty boring. However, the readings we had to read online for the class were pretty interesting. She doesn't take attendance unless it's a day when we are having a class discussion.

Dr. Babon is sweet but the classes are not engaging. The online reading materials are most interesting, but very frequent and tedious. The lack of energy of the students in class does contribute to the lackluster lectures, in fairness. However, there are probably better sociology classes, or even electives to select from.
Very sweet, super awkward. Lectures were pretty boring but easy A
Very easy and fun class with lots of lectures. Loved the group projects because they were not challenging at all. Attendance does not matter unless there is a class discussion that day.

It's an easy A as long as you put in the effort and participate. Classes are super chill and usually consist of a group discussion, and she always lets you out early. She cares much more about the process and wants you to experiment with your writing. Very open to creativity which I appreciate. I would definitely recommend for WRI 111.

She is super nice and understanding. There are a lot of essays, but she is really nice grading them and focuses more on the process of writing rather than how the essay sounds. It takes some work, but I would recommend.

Professor Koupf is the best! The classes mainly go through slide shows and we do a daily writer's notebook. We usually get time in class to work on our essays. Sometimes, there are readings and short paragraphs to write before class, but it is very easy. Definitely would take this class again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: 3 essays and a final project consist of around 40-45% of the grade, while the other 55-60% is completion and participation. She is very helpful and an engaging professor. Definitely worth taking her for Writing 111.

The workload is pretty light. You have short readings that you discuss in class or write short response about. You have four essays total, but they are fairly straightforward. She is a very easy grader. As long as you talk maybe once a class, you'll be good for the participation grade. Dr. Koupf is super nice and helpful. Very chill overall.

Dr. Koupf is a fabulous professor! She is very kind and personable and willing to meet outside of class. Her WRI 111 class was very well-structured. It requires light reading, 10 journal entries, and 4 essays. As long as you do the work and participate, you will be fine. Try to take her for WRI 111, I promise you won't regret it!

I think she was a decent professor. There were lots of reading but you did not have to do them- just skim when you get to class- as there are no quizzes. The essays you write are interesting and easily graded. She lets you experiment on your writing, a unique, but amazing part of the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Great teacher! Her class was chill and I still ended up learning a lot about invention in writing. I think it might be one of the best writing 111 classes!

Great professor, very kind. The assignments were easy and the readings could be skimmed. No pop quizzes on the readings. She also had a grace period for all assignments that could be used no questions asked. Participate once per class period and you're on her good side, since class participation is always low for WRI111.
An understanding professor who is willing to meet with you outside of class to improve your writing.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Koupf is an excellent professor who is interested in the well-being and success of her students. Grading is not crazy at all, and managing her assignments was not a challenge for me. Class is typically discussion-based, and any readings are moderate and relevant to the course. She provides great feedback and makes writing interesting!

Professor Koupf is amazing. I took her WRI 111 class about advice and it was so fun. I learned a lot but in a fun enough way to keep me engaged. Sometimes I forgot it was supposed to be a serious class because of how discussion based and casual it was.

Not a good class at all. Took her for rewriting in 2019 Spring. Very boring, everything felt like busywork. Lost 1/3 a letter grade because I missed one too many classes (get 3 absences for the semester). Would recommend avoiding her at all costs. Only positive I can give is that she seemed like a nice enough person, but the class was dreadful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Dr. Geyer is a good professor chem 111, he makes the subject easier to understand and clearly wants everyone to succeed. His sections did the best on the common exams, and I would highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Very kind and very helpful, wanted every student to succeed. Chemistry is obviously difficult but Dr. Geyer made it as simple and easy as possible. His classes always had the highest test average on common exams.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had him for lecture and lab, he is amazing for lab and he is okay for lecture. The lectures sometimes dragged and he put focus on some things for too long/short. However, he gives you so many study resources and additional office hours that you can definitely succeed. I would recommend for both.

Dr. Geyer is a fine professor. If you took AP chem in high school you will be fine but if not you will have to do a good amount of learning outside of class. He is always available during office hours and is helpful then his lectures can just be a little confusing.

His lectures are long but they are interesting, he is good at explaining things and he wants his students to do well. He writes the chem test so he gives out a lot of review materials and teaches you exactly what is on the test. Post multiple study guides, quizzes, and practice questions (more than other chem teachers).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He cares deeply about the class, but he lectures for the majority of the class. He moves really fast, so make sure you're ready to teach yourself most of the content outside of class. He is very helpful during his office hours, but this class would definitely be impossible without outside resources.
Good teacher. Really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Always makes himself available before tests.

Lectures are often confusing as he tends to fly through powerpoints without actually explaining concepts. Be prepared to teach yourself much of the content and often be behind compared to other classes. However he has a very generous grading policy, posts many helpful study resources, and is easily asscesible and helpful during office hours
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He cares about all students, easily accessible for feedback. Both his lab and lecture are great. Tests on easier side (common exams). I didn't pay attention in lecture but studied and got an A. Go to SI sessions weekly they are very helpful. If you put in the effort you will get an A. Lowers weight of worst test. Text for aleks code only, take him!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This is for his lab section. Professor Geyer is a great professor with great energy in lab. He gave background knowledge before lab started to make sure we knew what we were doing. Grading was clearly laid out and labs reports had templates
Very knowledgeable professor who does his best to teach his students.

His lectures are extremely confusing and he is very poor at explaining difficult concepts, so most of the understanding will have to be done on your own time. His tests are kinda on the hard side but aren't to bad. I would definitely recommend someone else for chemistry but if you need to take him you should be fine.

Dr. Gyer only lectured in class and expected students to have background knowledge of Chem even when this is supposed to be an introductory class. 4 Tests and a final. Online homework which doesn't correlate to the test and lectures are very long and boring and often don't help for homework questions.

Dr. Geyer is super chill and his lectures are clear. Grade though is 90% exams (ACS is 30%) and homework (Aleks) is 10%. He provides a lot of study materials before tests (Practice exams and study questions) and tells you exactly how to do well which is nice. Tests are still really hard though and you have to study a ton.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Definitely had better lectures than most of the professors I've had. Makes sure you know what you need to know. His tests also aren't very hard and he always curves his test grades. Not even a lot of homework but still made it easy to learn the content.

Take Dr. McPeters for WRI 111!! She is hilarious and so caring and made class a lot of fun. 55% of your grade is completion and she has clear rubrics so you know what she is looking for in your papers. She also lets you revise one paper at the end of the semester. She was very helpful during office hours and canceled class often for conferences.

Not sure how bad of a writer I was not to get an A. McPeters means well, but her grading is way too harsh for a freshman class. If you want to do less work and actually guarantee you get an A, take another professor.

Cindy is by far one of the best professors I've ever had. There was not a single day when I didn't look forward to coming to class. Her energy is immaculate, and she always pushes her students to do their very best. She believed in every student, and while the course can be difficult at times, she teaches you how to persevere and be a better writer

Amazing. She cares for everybody and wants you to do well. She does grade harshly, but it's to your own benefit, and my writing has improved significantly b/c of it. Her papers were fun to write, and she is very accessible outside of class if you need help. She's also very funny and will tend to tell you a lot about her life outside of class. 10/10

Had a great time with Dr. McPeters! Our assignments were very creative and thought-provoking. Each one was fun, and while she does grade tough, your writing will significantly improve. There is reading, but if you manage it well it should be easy to keep up with. If you want to have fun and become a better writer, take this class!

Nicest person you will ever meet. Just 4 essays all semester that she will grade pretty harshly but 50% of your grade is basically completion so its not hard to get an A. She also let people redo one of their essays for better grades. Highly recommend.

She is very nice but is a incredibly harsh grader. She does allow a revision at end of semester but there was one paper where several kids got Cs or worse. Lots of reading as well. Class is easy though because she makes it engaging. If you are prepared to not do well on all the papers and have to meet with her you are fine
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She cares that her students understand the writing process and learn, rather than just achieve a good grade. Assigned readings for class are manageable, but be prepared to comment on them during class. Papers are graded relatively harshly, so be proactive and meet with her before submitting. One paper revision is allowed at the end of the semester.
Dr. McPeters is an amazing professor and I love her class. She gives good feedback and wants you to succeed. Take her for WRI111

Professor McPeters was a great professor. Class was very easy-going and she wasn't afraid to connect with us and tell us jokes or things that were happening in her life. The workload wasn't bad, and although she is a bit of a harsh grader, she allows you to revise your lowest paper at the end of the semester.

She is a very nice professor and is very funny as well. She really connects with her students and is very chill. There were 4 essays throughout the semester and she grades them pretty easily. At the end of the semester, she also allowed students to revise their lowest paper grade to get some more points. There isn't too much homework too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Gangel has been an amazing professor this semester. She is fair in her grading and always willing to help with any questions about grades. Additionally, she is lenient if you need an extension on an assignment for any reason. Although the subject contains math she makes it very easy to understand. I am taking her again next semester. PSY 271*

I enjoyed Professor Gangel, but I could see how some may not. The tests are online/at home but much of the information you have to know she never gets to in class. If you have strong opinions about any politics or any controversial topics I don't recommend this class to you. 5 written assignments are graded that vary in toughness.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gangel gives amazing lectures that are funny and gives good examples of topics. Her class has been enjoyable and she explains psychology clearly and in fun ways. Quizzes are not the easiest but if you prepare for them you will get an A. The assignment is graded a little harder so just make sure you follow the rubric.
Great prof and is very clear about how we are graded. Not too many assignments, and they aren't too bad when we do have them. Recommend her for a good divisional.

chill professor. tests were ridiculously hard. a lot of note taking and reading, but I guess that's how psychology is. i don't recommend take this as a divisional, especially if you've never studied psych in high school.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Gangel is probably the best teacher I've had at Wake. She makes her lectures fun and explains everything very well so you really understand what she's talking about. There isn't a ton of homework and all quizzes are take home and open note. I would definitely recommend taking this class with Gangel!!
Not a lot of work assigned. Had an open note take home quiz every two weeks, and 2 assignments due every 2 weeks. Isnt very hard to get a minimum of a B

She was funny but also came across as rude and belittling at times. Very test heavy. Also was annoying how she took points off for very minor grammar mistakes when it was a psych divisional class and writing shouldn't matter as much. I would get the homework questions correct, but have points taken off because I didn't put a comma in the right spot

Professor Gangel is funny and a good teacher but her tests are SO HARD! There are only 5 and a few assignments so you have to do well on the tests. Not an easy divisional. I'm a psych major and got a B if that says anything.

For an 8 am lecture only class, she made it enjoyable and I learned a lot. Tests do make up your entire grade though, minus 10% for weekly activities that are easy. Tests are multiple-choice and short answer, and there are 5.

I loved having Dr. Gangel as my professor. A lot of the work in the intro to psychology class can be very dry, however, she presented the content in a funny and interesting way. I know many people that got good grades in her class but you will still need to work for it as your final grade is only based on exams.

LOVE dr. Cameron, he's such a sweet professor and really cares about his students. The workload is relatively minimal, he didn't give a final(3 midterms) and made the class as engaging as possible. def recommend.

Lectures just reading directly off the slides in dark room and occas. throwing out a comment/opinion that may be insensitive in setting of Abnormal Psych. Paper rubric confusing, tests dense and MC only. Seems like he tries, but doesn't connect with students. Lack of extra information beyond lecture slides kept many from even showing up to class.
Such a sweet man. His class is entirely lectures, so can get boring. But genuinely the sweetest man, and if you study for the tests, you do fine. Love him.

Lectures are very boring, but there are clear expectations for what will be on the multiple choice & T/F tests. Participation contributes to grade, and there is out of class research requirement (for all PSY 151).

Dr. Cameron is a sweetheart. He is a kind, caring, and understanding teacher. His class is an easy A and very fair. All classes are lectures that can be long and very boring, but if you study the material on the PowerPoint you will do well in the class. He does not cold call or assign homework (except for a few online quizzes).
Dr. Cameron is nice, and the material itself is pretty interesting. Lectures are heavy with info and boring, but the class is an easy A!

Dr. Alan is such a great professor. The class is lecture heavy but it never bothered me. His class is the reason I am minoring in psych. You never have work outside of studying for exams, although his exams are on a lot of material. Loved this class! You can tell he really cares about the stuff he is teaching.
Amazing Professor. Makes me want to minor in psych. Lectures can be a little boring and long but he is such a great guy. Tests are very fair if you study a lot you will get an A

Prof. Cameron is a great man who is clearly in love with his department. While attendance does not matter one of the few things he grades on is class participation so ask questions when you do go. The only things you get graded on are weekly online quizzes, 3 exams and class participation. NO FINAL in this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is a great teacher and you can tell he is really passionate about psychology.

Dr. Cameron is a very traditional professor. He covers all the material you will need to know for quizzes/exams in lecture, and theres no homework. It is very clear what you need to know and he doesnt give random useless assignments. He also presents material very clearly. I would definitely recommend this class.

Professor Celano's class has been one of the most tormenting experiences of my life. He himself is a very nice man, but he has no sense or care for discrete math. Almost all of his classes are just him scribbling and making mistakes on the board. The only good thing is that he grades easy on tests, but avoid this class if you can.

This class is hard on its own but having a professor who is completely monotone during useless lectures doesn't help. This class is entirely self-taught and the homework takes hours. The tests aren't crazy difficult so if you can learn the content on your own you will do fine. I absolutely hated going to this class because it was so boring and hard
Grades the homework kind of harshly but makes up for it with easy exams.
He can't teach and his voice is very monotone. People said he was easy but he isn't. You'll have to figure out everything on your own.

I have major issues with him. He is boring, doesn't know how to teach, and everything I have learned is through the grad school tutors. He is condescending when you ask for help. On top of that, I had a family emergency and asked for an extension and he was rude about it and didn't give it to me. Do NOT take his class
Doesn't know how to teach, lectures are hard to understand and makes many mistakes.

Very helpful, wants you to succeed. Emphasizes in class practice and group work, but if you buy into his class structure and ask him questions during class time, he is great at explaining the concepts. Homeworks are time consuming and graded hard, but doing them makes the exams significantly easier. Overall great professor.

Dr Celano is one of the greatest professors i've had in the Math department he made such a challenging course bearable! His lectures are very clear and easy to understand, and on top of that he keeps students engaged with material during lecture with tons of practice so that you're well prepared for homework's and tests!

Dr. Celano has been my favorite professor at Wake. His expectations are clear, and his tests are extremely straightforward. What you see in class and on homework will be what you should expect on the tests. Just do all homework/practice problems, and you will do very well on this tests. Also always willing to help with problems.

Dr. Celano was my MTH112 professor during his first year here. He's a great teacher and very direct with what he expects out of his students. His office hours are accessible, and he will accommodate for you if needed. He's a super sweet guy and loves to get to know his students and wants you to know him. I highly recommend him for this class.

Kyle is actually my favorite professor in the world. I had him during his first semester at Wake after leaving umiami and he is the best. He is funny, kind, and overall a great person. The tests so far have been light and he seems to be the best MTH 112 professor at Wake.

The grading criteria for the assignments is very subjective and unclear. If you want to do well you are going to have to study and use the tests to build a foundation for your grade. There is a lot of reading, and then relearning in class. In class discussions are great with the lecture, he was not my favorite, but the class is still worth while.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Easily my favorite class I have ever taken at Wake Forest! Dr. Batten brings in interesting case studies and experiences from his professional life.  He is engaging and knowledgable and has actual clinical experience in the field! This class taught me information relevant for my actual life and I recommend it to everybody.

Very...interesting class, to say the least. He's pretty old school and doesn't let you have any devices out during class, but that keeps everyone engaged in the discussions. It requires a solid amount of time to do well, but he makes it clear what he's looking for and makes it easy to succeed.

Dr. Batten is knowledgeable and has clearly taught this class a few times. However, most of our quizzes and tests just had us regurgitating details, usually about specific case studies, from the assigned documentaries and readings. Sounds easy, but he is picky about getting the details exactly right. I don't feel like I learned much in this course.
This professor is amazing the lectures are so interesting and I am never bored in class. Although he is a stuff grader you will probably get an 80-95 on all graded assignments and tests.

I really liked this class! You do have to do a good amount of reading and he's particular with grading, but as long as you are clear and concise with your writing you'll be fine. I like the class discussions and how casual the discussions are. I would definitely take this again!
Overall, interesting class, but very lecture heavy. Professor Batten is very knowledgeable, but is a bit of a tough grader.

I had Dr. Batten for Human Sexuality in Fall 2020. Every week was the exact same, with a discussion post and one-page write up due every week. We only had two other assignments. Not hard, but the posts and write-ups seemed to be graded randomly. Everyone I knew in the course got anywhere from a B- to A- at total random for these assignments.

It is not hard to get an A in the class. I took him for intro psych, he had good insight from his work. He had a new textbook this year that was online, it was a lot of work but an easy A that boosted my grade. He grades the essays kind of harshly on tests. The tests are easy if you study.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: His textbooks and assigned readings are outdated. It is easy to get a good grade in his class but I don't feel like I learned a lot. Asks for extremely personal assignments
Love this professor. Take him if you can. Both intro and human sexuality were great classes. He is a big part of why I became a psych major.
Very interesting class with a funny professor. Not very hard, an easy A.
Her lectures can be boring sometimes, but the class is easy and legitimately enjoyable. The grade is heavily weighted on the midterm and final.

Dr. Zhang is one of my favorite professors at Wake! She is adorable and very accessible outside of class. Sometimes before class, we would all sit and stretch and breathe together. The reading is manageable and helps outline the lectures which she sometimes goes on tangents. The multimedia group project may seem overwhelming, but it's so easy.

I love Dr. Zhang. Her classes are reading-heavy but she doesn't do pop quizzes so if you don't have time you don't have to read. She gets sidetracked during her lectures, so doing the readings will help you keep up with her when she goes off onto a different topic and then picks back up where you left off. She is my favorite professor at Wake.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Her grading system is very different from what it says on Canvas. The entire time I thought I was doing well and had an A, but out of nowhere I got a B+ at the end. Overall, I would save your stress until she changes her grading system so student can know their actual progress. Quizzes do not weigh to anythings, its heavy on the miterm and final

The class was easy. You have two papers and then a final project, plus midterm and final close book exams. The class is pretty much no work until you get to the final and midterm. If you actually keep up with the insane amount of reading then you probably don't have to cram. You can get away with doing absolutely no readings.
She's a very nice person who wants her students to do well. Easy grader and the class has a bit of reading but nothing absurd.

She is a very nice woman she just assigns a lot of work. I took the FYS "The coming of age in the people's republic of China" and the class was extremely boring and a lot of work for an FYS. It is an easy A in the way where if you complete your work you will get an A the homework and class is just such a drag. There is tons of reading too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Class is okay and teacher is okay but I found myself bored a lot of times. That being said it's not that bad of a class. She is a nice profesor who will help you.

Prof Zhang is very nice and caring. She assigns a lot of readings for homework but I don't think most of the class does them, yet we still have a good idea of what is going on. Know your stuff and study and its not too hard to do well on assessments

I loved Professor Zhang. There is a lot of reading for each class but you don't actually have to do them. She is really caring and will give you great feedback on essays/projects if you ask for it. As long as you put in some effort, this is a pretty easy class and she's an easy grader.
Great professor. Very patient and always trys to help.

If you don't know the basics of calc coming in you will struggle. The retakes definitely help. Just be prepared cause you will be screwed on the final if you just follow the material she teaches you. Not a ton of homework but be prepared to get screwed over by her TA when grading written homeworks. They are super specific about how they want it.

1000% take this class for an A in calc. She gives retakes on questions you get wrong on her exams; 75% points back on the first try, 50% on the second. Not the best at explaining concepts but still so worth it. Has frequent office hours. Homeworks are all online, occasionally asked to submit written work from online assignments.

Professor B is great! Sometimes, she may skip steps, which can be hard to follow, so ask questions. She is available for office hours and is willing to meet with you outside of those hours if you reach out. You can retake each test twice for every test you take, one for 75% back and another for 50%. Take advantage of both retakes if you can.
Dr. B is the best professor. The homework assignments are pretty much free 100s if you do them on time and she allows redos on the tests. She is so caring and a great teacher in my opinion.

Professor Betancourt is the GOAT. I took Calc in HS, but she still was such a caring and amazing professor. You can re-take each test up to two times, making your test grade extremely high. The HWs are also free 100% if you do them on time. The final was exactly like the practice tests she showed us. If you need to take MTH 111, take it with her.

Dr. Betancourt is one of the sweetest professors on campus.  She wants you to learn the material, so she does not make things unnecessarily difficult.  Calc will never be easy if you haven't taken it before.  But, if you pay attention in class and struggle through the homework, tests are easy-manageable and an A is 100% attainable.
good teacher

Best math teacher ever! For someone who didn't take calc in highschool, she really taught us well. Allowing for repetition in class and on quizzes helped everyone understand the material better. She was kind and very accessible too!!
She is so sweet! She lets you re-do exam questions twice to get full credit back and she offers really helpful office hours

Betancourt was a good professor. Her lectures can be very dry sometimes, but if you have a background in calc you should be fine. She has a dry humor/shy personality, but if you get to know her and go to her office hours, she's great. Her test retakes were awesome and one of the reasons I did well in her class. She really cares about your grade.

Dr. B's class was very light. Her lectures can be very dry at times, but if you have any sort of calc background, this class should be a breeze. Her exams are very straightforward and q's are taken from the homework. She also allows for 2 makeup days to re-do any missed questions from tests for full credit. She's very nice and highly recommend her!

MTH111 with Dr. Betancourt is so good. I'm not good at math... I have a 98. Why? Test. Retakes.
