Exams are so straight forward, but you can still retake all the questions you got wrong on a test 2 times. Out of the entire math department, Dr. B's class is the easiest A you will get. Homework is online and manageable. She's not high energy, but nice.
decent teacher. hw is 20% and quizzes are 30% so it takes some weight off tests. Tests and quizzes aren't very hard. (math112)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I'm taking Dr. B's MTH112. She is nice and responds to our needs quickly. But just don't know what she's talking about at all. Be prepared to learn everything on Youtube.

Dr. Betancourt is an excellent math professor. She really cares about her students and is very knowledgeable on the topics. Very clear and concise lectures. Would definitely take again. Make sure to also go to her office hours. Quizzes every week.

Professor Betancourt did a good job at teaching her class on her terms, however she failed to prepare her students for the MST 111 exam that was for all students taking this class regardless of professor. My class had an average of 58 on the final exam and no curve was given. She did not prepare us for it at all
Very nice, will have to put a lot of effort though, relies on you to review a lot outside of class. Good at explaining, but goes very fast at times

She is sweet, but grades harshly, the class is hard. Daily online hw that counts for nothing. Cold calls everyone many times per class and only 3 tests in the course that count massively. Study for tests 1-2 weeks prior. You have to memorize 300 vocab words+grammar rules per test. Hardest class in my sem1 freshman yr, test coincide w chm111 tests.
Pretty typical spanish 153 professor. Super nice. Tests were hard and a few compositions. If you do the work you should be fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Overall, I really like Professor Mendoza she is super sweet. Admittedly, the class isn't the easiest, but no 153 class at Wake is. All the 153 classes have the same assignments so shes no different than any other professor. Just because of the nature of the class (only 2 tests and a final), you do have to put in effort to get an A.

Overall average professor. VHL takes more time than you think, and there are assignments almost every day. She's a fair grader but there aren't many exams, and only a few compositions. Participation in class is key, especially if you want to do well on oral exams. There are probably better teachers for Spanish 153 but she is relatively okay.
She is incredibly kind and cares about her student's success, and is very accessible outside the classroom. She's a tough grader though and attendance is a huge deal. Overall she's a solid professor

Professor Mendoza-Batista is a really nice lady, but not a good professor. Lectures just used materials straight from the (expensive) textbook, and she often could not provide much help when students asked questions. She is an extremely tough and picky grader, especially for lower level Spanish courses. Would honestly stay away if possible.

Love this women. Dont understand why everyone hates her. If you minimally understand the Spanish language, you will do well in this class. Ive learned more from this woman in one semester than all four years of high school. Tell her you love Brad Pitt and you will pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: terrible teacher and harsh grader
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Challenging class with lectures that spend no time helping you learn anything. Sweet lady but tough grader.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is a very hard teacher. The slides said what the textbook did verbatim. You couldn't take pictures of the slides and she refused to post them on sakai. I personally wouldn't recommend but you do you. Cares about Brad Pitt a lot and talks about him once a lecture
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Be ready to have absolutely no idea what your grade is if you take this class. There are pop quizzes almost every week on the readings, and the questions ask extreme specifics from the readings. Participation is mandatory to get a good grade, and since there are so few opportunities to get grades, you need to do well on everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: So much reading that leads to very awkward discussions in class where she looks for specific answers. The quizzes are not easy and the Final exam is terrible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is a nice person. but this class is mostly discussion-based. It is also a ton of readings that take hours outside of class. She has 5-8 pop quizzes with tough questions. Participation matters, if you are a more introverted person she expects emails to her after/before class with your thoughts and opinions on the readings,
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Don't take this class. She assigns too many readings that either don't make sense or are useless. She gives tough pop quizzes every other week and most of he readings we do for the class don't get discussed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Appeltova was a really nice and knowledgeable professor. Class discussions had been fun and you should be all good as long as you did all the readings before class, which was not too much. She knows a lot about her field of study and can always give you advice on how to perform better. Really enjoyed being in her class.
She was new when I took her class, but she clearly cares deeply about her students. I learned a great deal and loved the balance of lectures and discussions.

literally so confusing, she gives no grades on canvas so you have no idea what your grade is in the class all semester, super unclear with expectations and assigns a ton of reading but does not specify how the readings relate to the class
overall, just really all over the place and unorganized class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Super confusing prof. Overall not that difficult class (although she gives like no grades back and idk what I have in this course), it's tons of readings and 7 primary source analysis along with one presentation. She's super nice, just explains things so poorly. Class discussion are always awk because she expects certain answers to questions.

The main problem with this course is the amount of required outside reading/ watching documentaries. The papers weren't awful, but the quizzes were pretty tough. There are a lot easier ways to fill this divisional requirement. She is a great person, just so much reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take this class. There are much easier ways to fulfill this divisional requirement. You will be overwhelmed with readings. Classes consist of only lectures with very few small group discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class itself is not that difficult to get a good grade. But the homework is a TON of reading and can be upwards of 50-60 pages a night. The class is just her constantly lecturing which is very boring and she asks questions along with the lecture. Few grades so participation counts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: So much assigned reading that nobody does it, so you barely learn anything. In class, it is entirely lecture/discussion based and there were only 2 quizzes all semester. Two papers over the semester, but also 7 500-word analyses that take a while. Easy to get good grade if you try on these. You can miss 2-3 classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This was an absolutely amazing class because of Prof Miller. He cares about his students and their success. He is also deeply passionate about his subject. There was lots of reading, but as long as you show up to class and know examples from the reading you're good. Graded on 3 tests and paper, but they're pretty easy as long as you pay attention.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor, very interesting readings and lectures if you're into the course material. Also very helpful during office hours. It is important to do the readings and participate in class, or else tests will sneak up on you.

Professor Miller is an amazing professor. For something like Philosophy, which can be difficult to understand, he goes out of his way to make sure the content is digestible. Even if you do not understand, he is more than willing to help. His tests are very specific, but if you engage and do the notes/readings, they are relatively tame.

Dr. Miller is easily one of the top professors at WFU. He's nationally renowned in the Philosophy community, is an amazing lecturer, and makes it feasible to do well in the class. Do the readings before each class, participate in the lectures, and you'll do great. Don't pass up an opportunity to take one of his courses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Miller is so knowledgable and caring, is very accessible outside of class and is willing to hep when you are struggling. the readings in the textbook are somewhat horrible and unimportant but make sure you know the examples from them, not necessarily the general idea- Paper is pretty easy if you paid attention, and tests are memorization
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This class is really hard. The lack of assignments makes it hard to climb out of a hole once you are in one (3 exams (90%) and 1 paper (10%)). If you are interested in Philosophy take this class. If you are trying to get a divisional covered, run like the wind.  Tough grader on exams so you have to know your stuff backward and forwards don't take
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Nice guy great lectures but the class is straight-up hard. And you do not get a lot of chances 3 exams and a paper that's it. Philosophy is just extremely confusing and he grades really hard on exams so u gotta know everything like word for word. Overall, would not take this class again especially since I was just trying to fill a divisional.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Miller is a great teacher. He brings a lot of energy to the classroom and is one of my favorite teachers here at Wake. Participation is very important in his classroom so make sure to respond to some of his questions. There is reading due every class, but it is manageable. He grades using a few exams and a final paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Wonderful professor! Take his class. He is brilliant, funny, accessible, and lectures are so entertaining! Only con I can think of is his class is graded on just a few tests and he is a tough grader but take any of this mans classes!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof Miller is a great philosophy professor. He loves to teach and engage with the class. He makes complex topic easy to understand. He remanded very unbiased toward difficult topics. His exams are very fair. He is an overall great person; he truly cares about your wellbeing. You'll need to read a lot for class. And participation is important.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Probably one of the best professors at Wake. Make sure you know your stuff when it comes to exam time because that is all your grade is composed of except for a small three page paper at the end of the semester. Concepts can be difficult, but if you actually do the readings and study, you'll be fine.

She is great. Really cares about students. Flexible and wants students to do well. Always willing to answer questions and even let me resubmit something late for full credit. Content can be hard but she provides enough examples and help.

Dr. Venegas is a great professor but doesn't allow technology in class. She assigns a fair amount of homework and is always willing to help if you ask. Participation is important, so make an effort to contribute. Overall her lectures are very easy going and fun, she makes Spanish enjoyable. I would definitely recommend if you want to learn.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved Dr. Venegas. She was an amazing Spanish professor and I thought the class was manageable. She really cares about her students and puts a lot of effort in to make sure they understand hard concepts. She also made the class as fun as possible and prepared us well for all assessments. Would recommend if you need to take SPA 212.

Great prof! Class is fast so pay attention. Daily quizzes can be hard so def do all readings and hw. Grade is heavily based upon exams and compositions. If you show you care she will give you benefit of the doubt. Fun games played in class. Heavy discussion. Hard to get an A unless naturally inclined to spanish as she is tough grader. Nice lady!

I loved her. I actually enjoyed her class, and I don't really enjoy spanish. She gives a decent amount of work, but I found it very easy to manage. She's funny and chill, and in my opinion a good teacher.

Professor Venegas was the best Spanish professor I had at Wake. I had her for 153 and she was entertaining in lectures, friendly, and would provide help. Out of all of my Spanish professors, she explained the most in English, especially when presenting new topics. Still a tough grader, but everyone is in this department. Take if possible!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is very accomadating and the best professor i have taken at wake she also teaches things very very well

She's a pretty fun and interesting teacher, although the curriculum can be a little annoying sometimes. You start with short stories, then poems, music, and then movies. Lot's of interpretive discussion.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is an amazing professor, she really explains things and takes her time understanding your perspective. Grade was mostly based on test and compositions, and one presentation. Would definitely recommend, didn't really study for exams and got at least above an 80 for each.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: very nice teacher, grade is mostly based on tests and a couple writing assignments. Participate in class! Only one presentation all year. very conversational course
didn't like how she teaches but her class is ok

Dr. Kenny was a phenomenal professor. I had her for EGR 216 and she was very passionate about Matlab. She ensured everybody in class understood the material being taught, and honestly that class has been one of my favorites I have ever taken because of her.

Dr Kenny is knowledgeable on the material and classes are engaging, with some interesting projects. As long as you complete assignments with some effort your grade should not be an issue and resubmissions are available consistently. She is kind and works to form connections with students.

Dr. Kenny is great! Very engaging and super enthusiastic about what she does. Very helpful when answering questions. Allows resubmissions on almost all assignments so if you put in actual effort, your grade will reflect it.

Ignore those who rated her 1 and 2. She is fantastic, down to earth, and just wants the students to learn a little bit. She's one of the more engaging professors and would like students to at least act interested, raise their hand a bit, and participate a bit. The actual course work is so easy if you just give it any attention at all. She's amazing

Dr. Kenny is a superwoman. She is a good lecturer and also a great advisor. However, it has to be said that in 111 she felt to be more strict and distant than in the higher classes. Having her beyond 111 was very fun. She is a somewhat harsh grader and has high expectations, but is very helpful. Like her a lot!

I TOOK HER FOR 212 and 111 so I have some real experience in a higher level class with Dr. Kenny. All the 111 student reviews are kinda BS to be honest. Dr. Kenny is a good professor and cares about her students and acts like a real person. She can be a little mean but I think that's just how she is. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is the worst professor I had so far. Her attitude in class is just awful and always demands too much. There is homework almost all the time and her grading is just terrible considering the amount of work you put in. I also personally think she treats students differently and always has an irritated manner when talking personally.

She is a very mid professor in terms of teaching ability, and her lectures are very boring. She will definitely hold grudges against certain students and is extremely rigid in grading and working with students. She also is very condescending all of the time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is very resentful towards people doing things at the last second and constantly talks about it. Lectures in the class are super boring and everyone pays zero attention. Thinks she is a saint by not giving tests but makes up for it with a million assignments that are 100% busy work
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr Kenny is so nice and really cares about students/ her classes. She teaches her classes in an engaging and interesting way so you are rarely bored. You definitely have to do a lot of work but shes pretty fair with the grading and is always open to an email about your grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Kenny is a fantastic teacher but you have to be willing to put the work in on your end too. Getting an A is completely attainable if you're willing to put the work in, and its usually not that hard. I would absolutely (and prob will have to anyway) take a class with her again. He can come off a little heavy at times, but she's not. Great teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Yamane is a great professor--his lectures are always engaging, he makes sure each student has access to all available knowledge, and is very easy to reach if you have questions. His class is extremely participation based (20% of the final grade), but if you do the reading, it is never particularly difficult.

Lectures are not boring, must read textbook for context (it helps promise and it's free), graded by 3 tests and participation. Participation is emphasized! You have to speak at least once per class. Weird sense of humor but keeps class interesting. Easy A or B for a divisional so go for it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Good teacher and an easy class to pass. The one thing that REALLY bugged me was the heavy emphasis on participation. It's hard to get a good grade if you don't have insightful questions and out-of-the-box answers every class. Wouldn't be so bad if it weren't a majority of your grade. Beware!
Incredibly funny, makes class entertaining no matter the subject. Super flexible with grades and readings.

Super interesting lectures and class is genuinely enjoyable. Graded by three tests and participation, all of which are unnecessarily difficult. Average class grade is around a B or B+. Very hard to get a good participation grade and that can make or break your grade. Test questions aren't just taken from textbook, also taken from extra reading.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Makes lectures very interesting, and you will learn a lot. Not a lot of work, but exams are very difficult and he very harshly grades you on participation. This year the Avg test grades are 83 and avg participation grades are 72. Not easy but would recommend for divisional
He is so funny and kind, always caring about his students. He understands the intense workload at Wake and doesn't give a lot of work.
A very interesting guy! His class is so chill and his tests are easy. As long as you are willing to participate in class you will get a decent grade.
Interesting lectures. Participation is most important part of the class. Easy divisional.

I took SOC 151 with him and it was by far one of my favorite classes. The work load is pretty reasonable, but if you can't participate in class then don't take him because its 20% of your grade. He's very friendly and cracks jokes all the time and even listens to rap so if you want a chill teacher and an interesting class i highly recommend.
I recommend taking his FYS on Sports and Society. Minimal work given and he gives 100s on the discussions. Fun class

Adam Kadlac is a great professor! His bioethics class is very interesting, but classes are mostly discussion. He gives super easy random weekly quizzes on the reading so make sure you read them (3 lowest quiz grades get dropped). Grade is based on the quizes, 
 group project, and 2 papers. Really liked the class, great professor overall.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He gives every student excellent feedback on essays. Additionally, he assigns short essays frequently, as opposed to infrequent long essays, which is a plus for me. Also, the essays are all INTERESTING, instead of boring exegetical papers. His classes often result in fantastic discussion, which is always a plus.

He makes class enjoyable and entertaining. Even though there were a lot short readings, he gives you all the links to access them. As long as you are engaged in class and do your work then you'll do well in the class. Majority of discussion boards are graded on completion and there are only 2 papers. I would definitely take his class again.

I took Intro to Bioethics with Dr. Kadlac online over the summer and he was great! The class was interesting and engaging, even asynchronously, and Dr. Kadlac was always available and accessible. As long as you do your work, you will do just fine. There was a decent amount of reading, but nothing overwhelming. Would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Classes were always thought-provoking and really changed the way I thought about various philosophical topics. Despite there not being an attendance requirement for my class, I always wanted to attend classes. Readings were often very interesting, and the grading was clear and fair. Basically, if you do the required assignments, you will do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: He is a great guy who genuinely wants his students to engage. This class was basically do a little reading and annotate a bit, and then discuss this reading in class as a group. It was so easy and actually interesting topics. Great professor!

Took his PHI 161 and PHI 164. Great professor that encourages thinking and participation. Most of the class is canvas discussion board based but lecture allows for free thinking. You basically determine your grade with what you want to complete.
Great guy. Very easy to talk to and loves engaging in conversation. Really enjoy taking his Sports and Society class as a freshmen!

I've taken 2 classes with him and he's amazing. Highly recommend. He makes class interesting and we have good discussions. He really cares about his students and what he teaches. Pretty easy grader. I have learned a lot from him and plan on taking more classes with him in the future. Content and lectures well organized. Take his classes :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He is one of the best professors in the MSBA program. Class is curved to a B+ so do your best. He genuinely wants his students to succeed and gives tons of opportunities for extra credit. Changed his curriculum plans, lecture design, and pace of the class due to student feedback halfway through the course. Awesome professor.

The greatest professor at MSBA program! He is constantly seeking to improve and have improved greatly over the course of the semester. The assignments are relevant to the real world and the guest speakers offer great application of the concepts! Great Professor, perhaps the greatest!

As long as you participate in class and show up on time you will be fine. He takes attendance daily - even if you are 5 minutes late and he has taken attendance you will be counted absent. That being said many of the concepts you learn in class are applicable in the real world. Don't be scared of his low rating if you are interested in the subject

Professor Li is a control freak. If you send a message to the wrong slack channel, he will make you move and resend it. For his exam... check this out. It's online, but you have to take it in the classroom, and it's proctored using proctorio which everyone hates... but yet he would be "nice" and give you a cheat sheet... oxymoron much?

I’m sure Li is a smart guy. But he just can’t teach! The class is boring as he reads off his slide. Then you go home and stare at his homework and wonder if it’s from a different class. His homework draws nothing his lectures/ readings! Li has mandatory attendance as well but honestly I would rather teach myself
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Don't waste your time on this professor. His class is boring with lots of information that does not matter at all. He talks nothing but broad and general concepts. But he expects so much more in homework. And nothing in the homework is covered in his lecture.

If you want to waste your tuition teaching yourself all the codings, then choose him. He taught nothing relevant to his homework in class. All he did is talking about "oh you will meet this question in your interview blablabla". All his class teaches you definitions, and gives you homeworks that graded like xxxx.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Boring class and if you miss two classes, you fail. Tough grader

Professor Li is the worst professor I've ever had throughout my undergrad and grad school. He uses examples and slides that are ancient. His homework represents nothing we do in class and the class average is at 50%, and still provides zero actionable feedback to improve. He takes pride in being a hard grade and taxing everyone's mental health.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Professor Li is literally the worst professor I have ever had in my life. He can't teach for sh*t, he is an ego-tistical jerk who will make you feel stupid about asking questions, and he plays favorites hard. While this class is not overly difficult, it is not worth the rage you will feel showing up to class every day and having to see him.

Super funny and very intelligent! He explains concepts very well, especially before exams. There's a midterm and a final but if you're paying attention, it's easy to do well on them. The content/readings were thought-provoking and they all tied together.

Look for the books online so you don't have to buy a bunch of books.

This guy gives good lectures and is pretty funny. There are two exams worth a third of your grade each but they aren't to hard. If you want to make sure you do well, you have to read a lot. He also is very conservative.

He's fantastic. Literally just go to class, sit, and listen. Guaranteed he will say something almost every class that's entertaining to ponder, gives you a little revelation about the world, gets you excited about the ideas of philosophy, or whatever. He rants, he's quite christian, and obviously incredibly intelligent. Take

Toner is the GOAT. Super easy prof. Class is just a really long rant but it's nice bc the only work he gives is readings and you don't really have to read. There is a midterm and a final and that's pretty much it. 100% recommend. Don't worry about his conservative, Catholic views, he welcomes all opinions and mostly refers to his views jokingly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: His class is usually him going on a rant, but if you do the readings and take good notes it's very easy to do well. He's a generous grader, always available during and outside of office hours or class, and is a genuinely good guy that wants you to do well. He is hilarious too. Best professor I've had at Wake

Toner is certainly one of the more conservative members of Wake Forest's Philosophy Department, but do not let this discourage you. He is eccentric, but this comes with the territory in the philosophy department. He usually gives 2 essays, and then a final exam, and I have never seen someone do poorly on this assignments. Straightforward.

Professor Toner is absolutely hilarious, and his lectures, although long, are incredibly engaging. He tells you the exact prompts for each exam, and he leads study sessions, and if you go, he will tell you exactly what to write. He's one of the best professors, but be prepared to hear his political views a lot. Otherwise, he's a 10/10

I'm pretty sure my final grade was just decided randomly. There were no criteria for the only 2 exams (and only 2 grades) for the entire semester. I didn't mind his lectures, they simply did not pertain to the material half of the time and were not helpful in preparing for either exam. An unfair class in terms of grading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This ignorant prof wasted a good reading list by giving inconsistent, unorganized lectures during which he'd often go on offensive tangents. He admits that he does not believe classrooms should be safe spaces and thrives on making students uncomfortable. With 2 essays being the only grades he should've actually covered material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: If you're not ready to listen to random tangents, I would not recommend this course. He's disorganized and talks off topic quite a bit. Not entirely sure that I learned anything in this course. You're graded upon two essays with no clear rubric or criteria. You can sit there and passively listen to him but its not super enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Hilarious, brilliant professor, my only complaint wit him is that he was pretty disorganized. Took forever to get tests back and didnt give information about them very far in advance, which meant I had no idea how I was doing in the class.

Great professor, explains things very well. Isn't a hardo about speaking strictly Spanish, but still challenges you to learn the language and apply it. Tests are somewhat difficult but the study guides are incredibly helpful, and he always helps with questions.
Pretty good professor. Awesome guy and is pretty helpful, classes aren't ever really boring. Homework is definitely straightforward and he's a fair grader.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Kozey is an extremely nice and good professor. I learned a lot from him and he was always helpful when you had questions. I am simply just bad at Spanish so that is why I found the class a little difficult, but overall for most, it is very easy. I definitely recommend him!
Super Nice! The class isn't very difficult! Super clear and a great teacher for learning a new language! 3 test and a final!

Highly recommend Professor Kozey! He's a very clear and understanding teacher. He clearly cares about his students, and classes are always engaging. The workload is reasonable for a 4 credit class with around 2 hours of homework a week (not including studying). It is very clear what will be on each test, so it is easy to study.

Dr. Kozey was awesome! You get the sense he really cares about his students. Yes, there were pop quizzes everyday but I am pretty sure that is a department thing and not just him. He has super accessible office hours, and will probably work with you if you need to meet outside of those times. Definitely take him if you get the chance :)

Super nice and cares about his students. It is a tough class but he is very clear about grading and what he expects (gives us the exact format of each test). 3 exams and a final with some oral and writing exams thrown in.
I loved him. It was a hard class for sure, but he was sure sweet and funny. I recommend. There are quizzes everyday and he speaks in Spanish 90% of the class so its hard to learn some times.

The only complaint I would have about the class was that it started at 3:30. Dr. Kozey is caring and engaging in class, and was great at answering questions and being accessible outside class to go over tests and grades. His tests are long but he's an extremely fair grader, and very open to discussing what went wrong. Overall, he's a great teacher.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Kozey is a great professor! He clearly enjoys teaching students and cares about their success. He appreciates participation in class, and gives clear grading criteria for assignments. Small pop quizzes everyday, but 9/10 times they are easy and they are made to boost your grade. I would take him again if his class wasn't at 8am next semester
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Grigoni is the man. Class is somewhat discussion oriented. Weekly 300 word writing responses about things we learned during the week. Midterm and final, non cumulative. Group project is a big part of your grade too. He does a study review each class before a test on the things to know. Start studying a few days before so this is a review.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class is not an easy A. Pay attention in class. He has such amazing lectures. Definitely recommend this class.

Dr. Grigoni is great! His passion and personality made every class interesting! Hes always happy to be in class and genuinely curious and excited to know everyone! There are readings but they just give you more context.Theres a midterm and a final, and Dr. Grigoni is very helpful in prepping. Go to class and take good notes and you should be fine.
took for a religion divisional, would definitely take again

I like Dr. Grigoni, but this class is hard ngl. There are lots of readings and his tests (midterm and final) were hard. Just super detailed with quote identification and stuff like that. Class is lecture and discussion based which I liked but the tests were jarring. A lot of short papers and one long one. Actually do the readings it helped a lot.

The most caring professor I've ever had. He's passionate about his job and does a great job teaching and engaging the class. Also a very easy grader so I would highly recommend taking his courses for divisional requirements.

My class with Professor Grigoni was really great! It was very interesting and very accessible and doable. He did a great job at keeping class interesting and added in discussions and activities along with lectures. There were two exams and a group presentation but all were very doable! Awesome class.

Definitely take his class! Dr. G is super nice and genuinely cares about all of his students. There are 2 exams; however, he is very clear about the material that will be on the exam and you will do good as long as you pay attention on review day. I very highly recommend taking this class with Dr. G because I am sure that you will not regret it.
N/a

Dr Grigoni is the best! He cares so much for his students both inside and outside of the classroom. His lectures are fascinating and very engaging. I definitely want to take another class with Dr Grigoni, and I highly recommend him to anyone who has any kind of interest in religion!
great, GREAT professor, really cares about his students and is excited about the material, would definitely take again
Dr, Grigoni is literally SO incredible. Take him. He is so caring, class was not difficult but I learned SO much. Great class. 10/10 human being. He is a king.

This class is lowkey tough mostly because the material covered on tests you can't really find on Canvas, even though she posts the slideshows. You really have to listen in class because she'll present terms and concepts you won't find on Canvas. She grades the tests hard too.
Awesome teacher! The class is easy! All exams are take home exams!

She'll make you buy the textbook (taking points off of your grade until you prove you have it), but you won't need it. You will need the anthologies which are kind of expensive. She gives a study guide for each test aka tells you exactly what you need to know for the test. Use those and you'll be golden. 

Classes can be awk, but that's the worst.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Super cool class and prof, should be an easy A as long as you stay on top of things and study for the tests.

Dr. Francisco is great! She's very caring and wants to get to know her students. There are a few tests and assignments throughout the semester, but they are all very easy if you stay engaged during the lectures. Great divisional class for anyone interested in the history of American music.

The course was pretty easy - there's a textbook that you don't necessarily need, but I kept up with the readings anyway and felt like I got a lot out of it. Exams were easy as well, and you get a study guide in advance. Dr. Francisco is wonderful. She's very sweet and encouraging and her lectures are really entertaining.
I took MUS 101 with her, really nice professor! The class was easy too. Had a textbook but never needed to do the reading. The lectures and notes I took in class were enough to get an A.

I took 208: women in music. She was a great professor! You had to study but she was extremely generous and valued your mental health more than anything. I would definitely reccomend if you are picking your arts divisional!

She is a good professor for the most part but aware of her lecturing style. She uses PowerPoints to lecture but she just writes words and not their definitions. She says their definitions out loud but she adds a bunch of other fluff while also saying it too fast so you can barely write down what she says before she moves on to something else.

an amazing teacher! I switched into her class in the beginning of the semester and i don't regret it. she definitely kept lectures interesting. literally show up and take notes, you'll be fine. we didn't really have homework and the textbook was unnecessary. the material was straightforward. she even allowed us to have a flashcard on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Most of these ratings make it sound like she's evil- which is not true. She's not mean, just assigns way too much work and expects us to teach the grammar to ourselves. She will say homework is "optional" prep, but it's necessary to do in order to participate in class, which is very important. If you don't speak much she will cold call you.

She's super nice but I would recommend avoiding this class unless you're okay with a bad grade. She's the kind of professor who doesn't believe in giving As and takes at least a point off every assignment, even the small ones. Definitely improved my spanish, but very frustrating.

Very hard class as a required course. Lots of "homework" that she says is optional, but it really isn't. Your participation grade is 9%. She has daily quizzes/ check-ins before every class. She takes off lots of little points on tests which add up. Would not recommend if you're not proficient in Spanish.
Avoid at all costs.
awful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Let me start off by saying I am very proficient in Spanish but I chose to take this class as an easy A, it was anything but that. Every little mistake takes off points every time you do it. She gives no extra credit and most of your grade comes from writing not speaking which hurt me a lot and that might be the case for others. DO NOT TAKE HER!

Sweet professor however, the grading in the class is harsh. Professor Ewalt deflates grades, believing that there is no 100% correct in Spanish. The class requires a lot of books, half of which you don't need. You will take mini quizzes before every class that count towards your grade, they are online and timed (5 min for 5 multi-part questions).

You have to go to every single class and participate if you want a good grade. Incredibly tough grader on writing assignments and on tests, but at the same time gives pretty good feedback to make up for it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is friendly and the class has minimal homework. Semi tough grader but has clear and helpful feedback. While not a super easy class, she's nice and a viable option for Spanish.

The other reviews are harsh, if you are willing to participate, even if you are wrong she is nice. There is daily homework but it takes a maximum of 30 minutes, and if it will take longer it is given far in advance. Her grading on tests is specific and sometimes tough but she is nice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Unforgiving and will call on you when your hand isn't raised. Tough grader. Lots of work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Honestly such a weird teacher. I would never take her again. She is so strict and calls on people randomly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Don't miss a class or you will fall behind. The professor is good. She knows her stuff well and answers questions. Try to sit near the front of the class bc the back can get loud.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Rudock was an awesome professor, but this class was hard! If I had to take it again, I would take her!
I loved Dr. Rudock. This class was definitely hard, but I would take it again with her!
Depended heavily on lecture slides but provided examples and practice problems.
She was a good professor but it was almost as if she needed her notes in order to teach the material.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hard course, hard tests, but a good professor!
She was an okay teacher.  Very helpful if you go during office hours.
She made chemistry interesting and tried to relate it to everyday things.
Teaches straight from textbook.  Works problems with class.  She was always available to meet with me and help me work through problems
TERRIBLE. Read the class her slides, offered no assistance, could not do calculations without her notes.

I took her for SPA331 but the website wont let me select that. She is a sweet woman who is an amazing professor, but she expects good quality work from her students. Treat it as a class that requires real thought and you will enjoy it, especially if you like history. She is a great lecturer and is one of the most caring professors at Wake.

Prof. Sol is great! (she can be annoying at times)Her class is based on homework, essays, and tests. You have to do the HW; the class is based on the readings, and so are the essays. Participation is a big deal to her, so try to speak at least once or twice. Her grading is pretty clear and will allow you to make corrections on essays to get a 100.

Grade was based on a few essays a few exams +participation. The class overall was not difficult just a homework assignment every night and the class was based on the homework we were supposed to do. Sometimes she cold calls so you need to be prepared, as participation was pretty important. Attendance was mandatory but not considered in the grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Pretty flexible and easy overall, especially if you do the readings (at least most of the time). She doesn't collect homework, but it'll be hard to answer the questions if you don't at least skim. Usually test questions come directly from the homework. You will have to participate though, try for once a class esp bc she does sometimes cold call.

She's difficult to work with if you need help and are struggling in the class due to mental health issues, often rude to her students. Attendance isn't technically mandatory for a grade but if you don't attend she will lower your grade, even if you're sick. She assigns a lot of work outside of class and goes over it in class instead of teaching.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She is by far one of my favorite professors that I have had this semester! She is funny and super compassionate! Even though there is a lot of homework, it is never graded. As long as you did your homework and used that to participate in class, you are set. She explains the material clearly and is super down to earth.

Profesora Miguel-Prendes is so sweet, compassionate, and funny! She tells us stories about words and phrases that she messed up when first coming to the States and I crack up. She is very understanding with illness and offers lengthy extensions. DO THE READINGS or else you can't participate in class. She values participation heavily.

Took her for 280 and 310. Very sweet lady, but lecture styles are repetitive. Always based on HW from night before, so do the readings. Exams are doable but can be tough at times. Some papers/projects. Oral presentations graded easily.

Class consists of discussions based entirely on the homework due the day before. She calls on students randomly to answer questions, so if you don't do the homework she will know. She is a fair grader though. Expect to write 2-3 page papers somewhat frequently and the occasional project. She is kinda boring but will help you improve your skills.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Actually from Spain so she speaks quickly and with an accent. Super nice and passionate about what she teaches. No tests, only papers and small quizzes, but I really enjoyed what we read/watched/studied and I loved having her

While I am terrified of her upcoming exam, Professor Parker is easily one of the best instructors I have ever had. She is obviously smart, but is also organized, approachable and funny. She made me actually look forward to learning Civil Procedure.
She is the best professor at Wake Forest.

She is an AMAZING professor! I had her for Civil Procedure and, while I don't care for civ pro, she made the class really fun and interesting. She is one of those professors who is really approachable and fun and it's not until you listen to her teach the you realize she's brilliant too. I recommend any class she teaches!

This is a very delayed review. I took professor Parker in the fall of 2008 and she was far and above the best professor I have had in my life. I am now an academic myself and aspire to reach the lofty bar she set in my mind for what defines truly exceptional teaching.

She tries to make class fun, and does a pretty good job.  She is also very organized and gives you the material in a straightforward way. However, it's very apparent that she really prefers male students over females.  She is just much nicer to them and more interactive.  This isn't a huge deal, but it bothers some people.
Great costumes. Drinks lots of seltzer.
Hard grader but excellent  professor.

Very organized; easy to outline.  She does however, use the same examples EVERY year; ie Monk.  And, she knows what an ATV is - don't fall for that.  Pretty straightfoward if you pay attention in class and write up a decent outline.
I love you Wendy Parker.  You are a great teacher.  Thanks for making my first year at law school so much fun in the mornings.
yow; she's good.
Professor Smeekens is very caring and supportive of her students. She also able to make lectures interesting.

Professor Smeekens is a nice professor and her class isn't difficult, but her lectures are just extremely boring and repetitive. If you want an easy grade then definitely take her class, but if you want to really learn for psychology, I suggest a major to find another professor.

Professor Smeekens really understands that being a student can be difficult at times. She gives quite a bit of quizzes and a few tests; however, they are straightforward and are not too difficult. Grading is straightforward and fair. She also has a great sense of humor and sometimes brings her dog to lecture (on zoom).

Five tests make up 80% of your grade but you drop the lowest one. They are all multiple choice and easy. I probably spent a maximum of 2-3 hours a week on this class. The research requirement was interesting and a good opportunity to get extra credit. Prof. Smeekens is very nice and conscious about mental health which is important for a divisional.

She is a good prof if you just want an easy grade, she is very understanding when it comes to extensions, all the quizzes are take home and taken directly from quizlet and she gives you plenty of time to complete them. I recommend her if you taking psy as a requirement but if you actually want to learn I wouldn't recommend.

This is a very easy class it won't even matter if you show up or not all the info is in the power points and all the questions from her exams are directly from quizlet. If you just need to take psy as a requirement I recommend her but if you actually want to learn I wouldn't recommend her.

Prof. Smeekens is a great professor if you're taking psych as your divisional. You can retake all her exams. Her class material is very clear. Definitely an easy A if you show up to class and pay attentions to her powerpoints.

Professor reads directly off power points in class that she posts the morning of - makes it pointless to go to class. You could teach yourself from the PPs and still pass. All exams can be retaken and the final is optional. Material is interesting, but don't expect to learn anything from her. Never responds to emails, cancels class often.

Professor Smeekens was a great professor for intro psych if you're looking to get a basic understanding of psychology and an easy A. If you show up to class and take notes, you'll succeed. Every exam could be retaken for extra credit. Not great with out-of-class communication, so don't expect a quick reply on emails, but Smeekens is a solid choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Smeekens is so nice!! and willing to help others outside of class too! I just sat in class every day and typed my notes into quizlet and it was the easiest way to study. The quizzes are all taken at home so its an easy A, and you get retakes on all the tests. She also drops your lowest test and quiz scores. Definitely recommend!

The easiest class I've ever taken, but I still learned a ton that positively impacts my daily life. She accommodated us when she knew we were struggling with other classes and really did care. The only "downside" was that she probably accommodated us too much and made the class easier than it needed to be. Lovely person and a class you should take.
Very sweet professor and is very lenient with grading and due dates.

She was an amazing professor and also hilarious. She cares about her students and how they're doing. There are 2 tests and they are take home. There are weekly homework assignments and those weren't bad at all. The final is a project on any topic you choose that relates to the class. If you need an easy divisional I recommend taking her class.

Dr. Nelly is amazing, one of my favorite professors at wake so far! She is so sweet and cares deeply about all of her students. Her meditation FYS was relaxing and fun, very easy, & more about the experience than studying. Barely even felt like a class, I wish I could take it again just for fun!
Dr. Nelly is the absolute best. Class was an easy A if you put in some effort and do your assignments on time but she gives you ample time to complete them.

FYS 100 Considering Contemplative Practices From Around the World was a great first year seminar! We read four chapter books and discussed them openly in class. Our final consisted of a research project whether it was a paper or PowerPoint was completely up to you! Dr. Nelly is wonderful and cares deeply about her students!

Her FYS on Islam mostly just focuses on Egypt - she is very passionate about teaching the subject and has an interesting background - homework was  a short one page double spaced essay every week - final was a powerpoint - she is flexible - 11/10 would take again
The most caring and understanding professor imaginable

She's a very nice woman. Her FYS can seem a little pointless at times, as it was literally all about Egypt. The entire class was partner oriented, as you pick another person to work with early on. It's a super easy class and she was very chill. Also, nobody does the homework readings.

Dr. Nelly is genuinely such a gem! She is the kindest woman ever and is everyone's mom. She is my classes freshman advisor as well, and so we were all so sad when the semester ended. She is very chill and understanding. Very easy class and interesting, learned a lot.

She's very understanding and cares about her students holistically. She wants everyone to succeed academically but also cares a lot about mental and physical health. Her class is very straightforward and the work is relevant. Only requires readings and short responses and a couple test throughout the semester. Take this class. She's great and funny

Dr. Echols is easily one of the most caring and knowledgable professors I've had. He made a conceptually difficult lab manageable. Prepare for very long midterm/final. There are many chances for extra credit to change precision and accuracy grades from U (unsatisfactory) to S (satisfactory).
great guy, super funny and caring. the tokens are a great tool!

the class has a good bit of homework. The deadlines for labs are shorter than other professors, and you have to come in on non-lab days occasionally to weigh out dried mass. Format was super clear, and canvas was used very well. The pre lab and post lab work is time consuming, but not that hard.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Obviously chemistry is hard but this professor makes everything easy. He has pre-labs which make everything so much easier to understand. There are a ridiculous amount of opportunities to get extra credit. Never gets tired of answering questions. Responds to an email in less than five minutes. Everything except the written exams is pass or fail
He is such a nice and approachable professor! He also went to Wake when he was an undergrad which is super cool. He is very helpful and good at explaining concepts

I had Dr.Echols for Chem 111 (not lab) and he is amazing!!! He always makes himself available outside of class and is so caring. His tests are difficult but he prepares his students very well and as long as you put in the effort with the reading and homework, an A is definitely achievable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Echols is very passionate about teaching chem and is very kind to students. He offers a lot of extra credit and is available for office hours almost every day. His tests are manageable and he outlines what's on the test beforehand.

I took Echols as my Chem 111 professor and he was the most caring teacher ever. I had never taken chem before and he was amazing at explaining the material and being accessible for me. There was a good amount of homework but it made it so our class was so much more knowledgable about chemistry and scored much higher than other classes on tests.

Currently have him for CHM111(not lab). He's the absolute sweetest! A little disorganized and hard to follow in class sometimes. Gives a manageable amount of work with extra credit on HW, which really help boast your grade. Tests are very straightforward and he's ALWAYS holding office hours! Chem is not my best subject, but he helped me succeed!

For a lab class, attendance is obviously mandatory or you will not get an A. For our class, things were graded on a Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory scale and has clear criteria for everything, so just make sure you follow directions. Gives good feedback and there are opportunities to make up for an "unsatisfactory" grade. 10/10 would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Echol's general chemistry lab is a good one. He is very straightforward in his instructions and what he expects from you. He is willing to help you while doing your experiments and is a fair grader.

I loved ENG 175 with her. Her class was engaging and fun, she always kept it casual and open for class discussion. She is also really funny and was a good break from more serious, old-school professors. Would highly recommend if you enjoy making good connections with professors.

This professor was great! I would highly recommend this class to students who don't like Literature courses as this made it fun. She is extremely nice and also relaxed with deadlines. We were given additional time when needed on our projects, as she is understanding. We only had to write one essay because she doesn't like forcing students to suffer

I loveddd Professor Farmer! She was so sweet and understanding throughout the entire class. I would take her again if I could. I am not an English Major but she made this class not only bearable, but I actually looked forward to it. TAKE HER!

ENG 361 (Env. Destruction): Farmer is fantastic, hilarious, and kind. She is incredibly caring for her students, and very understanding that we have busy lives and sometimes unexpected things happen. She doesn't have too many assignments... just a short, informal discussion post once a week and one or two group projects (we did podcasts). Take her!

The lower level had way too much reading and writting. How strict grading was also inproportional to an introductory class. She does care but do mix many politics with her teaching as many other English professors. People who do not intend to be a literature major or cannot stand too much politics in class avoid taking it as a introductory class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I absolutely loved this course taught by Dr. Farmer. She is so kind, patient, and personable. I learned a ton about the world, American literature, and politics in what I thought would be a rather average gateway course for underclassmen. I was so pleasantly surprised by this class and as far as I'm concerned, everyone should take a class with her.

Dr. Farmer genuinely cares about her students and it is evident, through her actions and passion, that she wants every student to succeed. Whether you are taking one of her classes for the major or a divisional, the class will be interesting, engaging, and the challenges (due to rigor and being asked to actually think) will bear success in the end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Farmer is one of my favorite professors. I cannot recommend her enough. Her classes are engaging and thought provoking. She always brings a new light to any text being read and is extremely accessible outside of class regardless of how busy she is. If you came to Wake expecting to coast through without learning anything - thats on you.

Lazy, unprepared, arrogant & political. Expects agreement w/ her views. Won't offer feedback w/ grades. If asked, she evades the question, directs you to syllabus, or says she just doesn't have time (to do her job..?) Ambiguous/weighty participation grade. Consistently vague expectations. She expects a lot, grades tough, yet does nothing herself.
She is a very nice person, but constantly pushes her political agenda. She does not seem to understand that she is not always right. That being said, she does want her students to succeed.
Take Profe Turner lock. There is a lot of work but she is very helpful in helping you succeed within the class. Prepares you for tests unlike any other.

SPA153 is a difficult class in general but Encarna makes it bearable. LOTS of homework and daily quizzes. 2 large exams and a final. Lots of little grades but the exams and compositions make up most of the overall average. Encarna cares a lot about her students and tries to make it easier in any way she can. Available outside of class

Profe Turner is great and very fun! I had her 8am, not by choice, but it ended up being one of my favs. She always brought fun energy. Daily quizzes-> basically an 100 if do HW. Lots of HW but it prepares you for the exams. She gives great study guides and practice q's. 2 in class compositions. Very easy to meet with! Want to take her again!

The class itself is a bit hard because she is very fast-paced but easy. There is a group project, mini-presentations, 2 midterms, and a final. She gives her slides on paper before each test so that we have all the information. The tests are fairly easy for me but I am a native Spanish speaker. I would recommend this class as a Spanish elective.

Runs her classes really fast paced, but it's easy to get with the flow after the first couple of classes. Really good personality, and cares about her students a lot. 153 can be a really tricky class, but she gets that and does everything she can for her classes to succeed.
Super Sweet! It's a fast course but she is a good teacher. 2 tests along with a final. Gives you lots of resources to prepare for the test. If you put in the work you will do great!
LOVE professor Turner! Her class was super fun and engaging! Would recommend her to anyone.

Professor Turner is the best for Spanish and she truly cares about all of her students!! She does give a lot of homework but the assignments are just grade boosters. She prepares you very well for the 3 exams and 2 oral assessments. I highly recommend taking her for SPA153.

One of the kindest Spanish teachers I have ever had. This teacher is a gem. Lots of homework, but prepares you for exams. She seriously cares about her students. Gives lots of opportunities to increase grades other than exams.

I really enjoyed her class. I think she is a great professor even though I despised Spanish. Would take her again as I think she had a good balance of assignments that made u learn but weren't overwhelming.

Very nice and her grading is reasonable. There are daily short quizzes, but they ensure you really learn the material. Homework can take some time, but putting in the work will boost your grade. Prof Turner always does what is best for her students in planning, teaching, and assigning work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Vague instructions when he really wanted certain outcome. Does not answer questions clearly in office hours and tries to avoid helping. No clear direction of the class or how to do well, which was frustrating because I really wanted to like the class. Makes me not want to take more philosophy classes. 50% of grades come from final tests and papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: He is a very nice teacher who really cares about his students. However, the class can be really boring at times. Also tests are worth too much of the grade which doesn't seem like a good representation of a discussion based class.

I took this class for a divisional and loved it. Dr. Flattery is one of the best professors at Wake and genuinely cares about all his students. I learned a lot and I liked how he integrates group discussions into lecture.
Professor is a nice guy. The class description doesn't line up with the course in actuality.

He was a chill, funny guy. Teaches from a slideshow, but he always has time for students to discuss what is taught. There's a lot of reading each day and most of them are not easy to get through, but everything is gone over in detail in class. Only two exams, and if you can know the answers to everything on the study guide, you'll ace them.
Just a really nice guy who cares a lot. Low-stress environment.
He is incredibly caring, considerate, and intelligent. If given the opportunity, everyone should take this class.
Awesome professor and lectures are nice. Provides valuable review material but has good amounts of reading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: This class was confusing. I found the concepts to be very weird. However, he posts all of the PowerPoints and I felt that the midterm or final were representative of the class. It just takes some outside studying to understand the concepts. It definitely helps in this class if you have strong philosophical opinions. There is a lot of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm taking Philosophy with Prof Flattery. He's nice, caring, and he wants his students to succeed. However, the class is based only on grades from homework, a midterm, a final, and a final paper. Homework is a grade booster, but it would be hard to recover if you bomb the midterm or final. The class is lecture heavy with some confusing concepts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Philosophy of Human Nature to get my humanities divisional done, so I wasn't super enthused about the class, but Dr. Flattery made it super interesting. It's very lecture heavy, but he explains readings extremely well and gave us possible exam questions beforehand. He memorized everyone's name and where they're from after 1 day.
Dr. Bulbul is a very strong professor and I enjoyed her class this semester. It is the best of both worlds where you learn and can get good grades. I highly recommend taking her.
Dr. Bulbul is very nice and her tests are easy. But you won't learn much from her lectures.

Very kind person who cares about her students and does not design difficult tests. However, be prepared to be learning material outside of class as sometimes in-class explanations are not particularly effective. Her teaching style has improved throughout the semester and she has potential to be a great professor.
Kind, but a little hard to understand. Accessible and cares.

Dr. Bulbul was a little tough to understand at the beginning of the semester and learned very quickly how to teach effectively and communicate better with her students. She clearly cares a lot about our opinions and success in the classroom and I am so glad I got to learn from her over the past semester. She is very smart and kind.

Very nice teacher. Lectures are difficult to understand because of her accent. Tests are graded on the easier side and she gives practice problems that are similar to those on the tests. There's about one homework assignment every week. She takes attendance for class usually but puts the presentations that we covered on Canvas.

She is very kind and respectful to her students. She can be hard to understand at times because English isn't her first language, but she has a ton of knowledge about the subject. She is a very fair and lenient grader and the tests are very similar to the questions from the practice test and homework. You have a high chance to get a good grade.

Taught and outlined important concepts well, clear and obvious material to focus on, rather than teaching broadly on a lot of topics. Cares about students, will work with you is is understanding about student's concerns. Sometimes lectures can be hard to follow, but they align well with textbook well. Fair tests and partial credit for problems.
So kind and willing to work with you. Dr. Bulbul cared about me inside and outside of the classroom and I wish I could take her again.
Don't understand her at all
Super nice guy and a great intro to Buddhism class, good divisional option

Prof Ford is a great guy :D! He definitely picks favorites based on who participates more so try to talk and you will be graded easily. It's clear that he loves what he teaches and makes each class very enriching!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Ford is really good at his job. I took Intro to East Asian Religions and it was quite enjoyable. The course was not too hard in general, he even let us vote on changing our final from in person to two essays over a week which was very nice. He assigns a decent amount of reading but I never did it and was able to understand the class

I had Dr. Ford for Introduction to Buddhism, and I can't recommend him or this class enough. I initially took this class to fulfill a religion divisional, but I left it with an entirely new world perspective that has honestly had a positive impact on my life outside of academics. This class is not necessarily an easy A, but definitely worth it.
Fantastic professor. Not the easiest class, but he was worth it. LOTS of reading
Awesome prof.

Had Prof. Ford for Intro. to World Religion; I had no idea what to expect but it turned out to be an awesome class. Prof. Ford is very, very nice and knowledgeable, class's organized well and there's never any confusion, I liked it a lot, make sure to take him!
No Comments
Most excellent professor.
This teacher ROCKS!!  Possibly the greatest person alive!

Professor Breckenridge is a very interesting man who you can tell absolutely loves what he does. He drops your lowest exam grade, which is amazing. Loved this class and found it very interesting! Highly suggest taking him!

Professor Breckenridge is AMAZING! I took his class fall semester of my freshman year and he inspired me to minor in Sociology. He is energetic, funny, caring, and honest; but most of all he cares about teaching and about making sure we all understand the content. He is a phenomenal professor.
Love this teacher! Take his class 100%, really smart and cares about eveyone.
Saylor was an interesting man without a doubt. He brought many interesting topics to class. However, his teaching style didn't fit with my learning style.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Intro. Soc. at 8AM, a class I initially *dreaded* but ended up my favorite. Saylor is a wonderful human being, the class is perfect in every sense, he's exceptionally knowledgeable and was my best professor. As a recent graduate to all underclassmen: Take him!!!

Intro. Sociology 8AM; what was a class I initially  cringed at turned out to be my very favorite of college. Saylor is a terrific human being, extremely knowledgeable & an awesome and FUN professor. As a recent graduate, to any underclassmen: Take him if you can!!!
who couldn't love a rooster!
Great teacher, even better person. Take his classes and you WILL laugh and learn at the same time.
Saylor is a great professor: energectic, helpful and smart!
Geniunely the worst experience I've ever had in a classroom

Does not give any partial credit on tests, and other professors give test corrections she does not. Does not explain information well, and expects us to know more than she teaches. Also, has very sassy answers to questions.
Bad
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly worst teacher I've ever had. Solely goes super fast through lectures, and dosen't give much leeway with grades.

Worst professor I've ever taken in my 21 yrs of life. All she does is write on the board and not explain anything as she does. She expects you to already know what's going on in the class 3 weeks in advance. Do not DARE ask her a question in class or office hours, because she'll not only verbally abuse you, but tell you that you're going to fail.

This teacher is genuinely the worst teacher I have ever had. Her teaching style is just writes notes on the board at mach 5. The tests are always awful, contain problems you've never seen, and your grade rests almost entirely on them. She blames the students for not being able to understand the concepts and gets annoyed whenever you ask questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: DO NOT TAKE. So often did she say that her lectures and concepts were "easy" as she barely gave students enough time to finish copying her writing on the board before she moved on. And god forbid if you ask a question, she'll explain once, and if you don't immediately understand she gets mad. Office hours were so demeaning that I stoped going.

First, her lectures are insanely hard. She never explains how it works but she expects you to know it. Second, she constantly suggests all her materials are easy and adds it should also be easy for her students. Third, the class average is below B-. No matter how hard you study, you will encounter questions that you have never seen before in test.

Doesn't care at all about teaching intro level classes. No passion or enthusiasm whatsoever. Only lives to teach stuff Like Algebraic Geometry which isn't even necessary for Most math Majors. Hands back low grades with a frightening smile and resembles Mrs. Puff from Spongebob.
Do not take Kirkman!!

Jeremy was my favorite professor for such a difficult subject. I never enjoyed calculus, and ended with a B in the class, but Jeremy made me *want* to learn. His office hours are fun and he makes everyone feel smart. Study HARD for his exams, but he gives generous partial credit where credit is due.

Jeremy is awesome. I had him for cryptography and the homework and tests were pretty challenging but  everything is open notes and he gives you notes for the lectures before class. Super interesting course, only issue is that he isn't an expert on cryptography (and he will admit that) so you don't go into depth on a lot of concepts.
Great professor, very nice, organized and helpful. Definitely recommend.

Such a great professor and person! Rouse answers any questions and always invites students to office hours/study group sessions. The workload for the class was pretty heavy but definitely manageable. Overall, I had a very good experience, and I would recommend taking him!
Probably the best teacher for MTH 113. Super smart and able to make difficult concepts easy to understand

Take him if you have the opportunity. He cares about his students passing and will meet whenever you need outside of class to help. He also knows the material very well and provides many examples and extra work so you can fully understand what you are doing.

I mean this man is amazing! He is so sweet, and you can tell that he really wants everyone to succeed. The workload is light, and the exams aren't bad, it's really about how you spend your time and whether you choose to study or not. He also makes himself available and makes it clear that he is a resource to everyone. Absolutely love Jeremy,

Great Professor. Made online classes very enjoyable and he really knows what he's talking about. If you're trying to decide on a professor, I totally recommend Rouse. Great guy who really wants his students to succeed. The first test hit me hard, but he definitely helped me rally back and get my grade back up.

Professor Rouse is the best! I took AP Calc in high school and never understood it, but when I took calc with Rouse I was not only able to do the problems needed to get a good grade, but I actually understood the concepts/reasoning behind them. Honestly one of my favorite professors on this campus!
Rouse is one of the nicest people I have ever met. Very accesible and genuinely cares about his students. TAKE HIM FOR SURE!

Dr. Rouse was hands down the best professor I've ever had. I took a second semester with him just because he was teaching. I'll be taking another of his classes next semester ONLY because he's teaching it. You definitely have to work, but he's absolutely fair and VERY approachable and obviously HIGHLY recommended.

Professor Marcum is an entertaining professor and makes the course content interesting. His exams are very difficult and your grade basically consists of 3 exams. The class averages are often low on the exams, but if you stay ahead of the curve you will be fine.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are interested in learning about finance you'll love him. If you're a business major taking your only finance class you'll probably hate him. Great teacher who's incredibly knowledgeable and he has hilarious lectures. Tough exams but if you understand the material and practice a bunch you will be fine
He just straight up screws the entire class on tests, average was always around a 50-60. A reflection on the lack of teaching ability
GOAT.

Your only real grade is the final so its tough to do super well in the course. With that being said I didn't do great in the course yet Marcum is still by far my favorite teacher I've had at Wake Forest. He's super funny and usually says some absurd comment in class that makes the lecture worth going to. Highly recommend!

Marcum is probably the funniest guy in the B-school. His tests will destroy you but he drops the midterms and I know plenty of extremely smart people who got killed on the midterm but saved themselves in the final. Overall, my favorite professor at Wake even though it is crazy hard.

He makes his class really hard, but he does this on purpose and he usually has a huge curve. The guy is hilarious and is very knowledgeable. Probably one of my favorite teachers even though he might not know my name.
William..Billy..Markum is as difficult as they come.  He also has a tendency to date undgrad's here at Wake.  Not good or cool.
No Comments

Marcum will be the first one to tell you how hard his class is and often says "There are a lot of people making a lot of money who have failed these tests before you."  BUS 232 isn't about getting a good grade, but about learning a lot of finance and if you pay attention that is what will happen.  Also, Marcum is hilarious in class.
Lovely lady and a great professor. Assignments were never hard and she grades pretty light. Grade dropped from an A to a B+ because participation is 20% of your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Beware. Her class was insanely hard. She lectures in a pretentious, academic way that doesn't help clarify readings that are already tough. We were graded almost entirely on written assignments for which she provided no guidelines and minimal feedback, even when asked often for clarification. Would've dropped if I didn't need the class to gradate.
