rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Super nice! Only two tests and they are soooooo easy if you study the study guide she gives. There are 3 other writing assignments, but they are also super easy and short. Make sure to participate because she is a harsh participation grader. She's the best!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: She was kind of snobby because she went to Yale. She's grades papers kinda hard but it's near impossible not to get an A in the class. Participation is super important though.

Very nice but doesn't grade participation until end and grades were not very fair. Never missed a class and talked almost everyday but participation my final grade from A to A- even though I did well on all the tests and projects. Easier professors out there.

This class was a pretty good one, mainly graded by (pretty easy) tests and some projects which she grades pretty easily. Make sure to participate in class, but focus on comment quality rather than quantity, as she looks for quality, and it is worth 25% of your grade. Her lectures are very well planned and she posts slides. There is lots of reading.

Really nice person and easy to listen to. Participation and attendance are mandatory, but the readings are fairly short and tests are pretty easy. A few projects and papers but nothing too difficult. Def would take again. Super chill class.

One of the best professors ever. She assigns quite a lot of readings BUT extremely little assignments/exams. She also graduated from top tier universities (Yale and UVA). You also don't have to talk in class as she made it very clear that she understands different personalities or mental challenges when it comes to speaking publicly. 10/10

I had Dr. Moore for Sociology 151. She had great lectures and is really good at articulating her thoughts. She posts the powerpoints so you really don't have to take notes in class. She does give readings for homework multiple times a week but they are all very manageable and interesting. Doesn't give many assignments other than that. She's great!
Fantastic professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Very funny professor. Lots of reading and should be prepared for class. All tests were written. Pretty easy grader
Professor Lerner cares about his student's success and just wants to see them engage with the material. Class is reading heavy and requires consistent work effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Lerner is very opinionated. Do not bother speaking up on your opinions. If he likes you, you get an A. If he does not then he will grade you harshly. It is a lot of work for an "easy divisional". There are easier options. He totally threw away his curriculum that Wake thinks he's teaching and his doing his own thing. He is a nice guy though.

I took this class for a divisional requirement and absolutely loved it. Dr. Lerner is extremely nice and funny. You have to write a lot of papers for homework, and the exams are also papers. They are completely doable. If you enjoy learning about the development, culture, practices, and religions of different civilizations, take this class!
There's A LOT of writing. You have to write a paragraph response after every class. With that being said, pretty easy A.

You have to write between 2 and 4 500-word essays every week about ancient documents that are really hard to understand. You have to LOVE the topic in order to actually enjoy the class. As someone who was just taking it as a divisional, I didn't like the lectures or readings. You can get an A pretty easily though

This class was so interesting, but you do have to be prepared for writing a short paper (around 1.5 pages) a week on your readings. But this guy was hilarious, and wanted his students to do well. Took it as a requirement for my major, but am actively trying to take more classes with him because he was so good. But be prepared to read and write.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Absolutely fantastic professor. Even though the class was online, Prof. Lerner made the class incredibly entertaining. Took the course for a requirement for my history major, but am planning on taking more courses with him in the upcoming semesters.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: He's a great guy, always willing to help, always trying to make class interesting and entertaining. Highly recommended.

Doctor Khedher will completely change the way that you think about your studies. He is a knowledgeable instructor who has mastered the art of lecturing with passion.
Has a way of giving advice which has implications far beyond the world of Arabic.
He is incredibly committed to the success of his students, caring, knowledgeable, and deeply inspiring

Dr. K is funny and offers amazing feedback on homework and tests. He really cares if his students are successful in his classes, all he asks is for active participation and your attendance in class. It is super important that you do the homework before each class.

Dr. Khedher is a passionate instructor that will let you know upfront that your effort in class is what matters the most. He is very nice and often gives students the ability to be flexible with their schedules. As far as class goes completing homework is super important and there are only a few tests.

Dr. Khedher is an incredible professor and an even better person -- I truly see him as a friend and a mentor. His teaching style is engaging and he ensures that your Arabic skills are improving, while also incorporating other areas of study into the coursework. He is very knowledgeable and I would highly recommend taking one of his courses!

Among one of my favorite professors here at Wake, Professor Khedher is one of the most knowledgeable and kind-hearted professors I know. Professor Khedher adjusts his lectures to make sure students understand and master Arabic, and brings in additional information from different fields to make your learning experience unique and enriched.

Dr. Khedher is my favorite professor at Wake, period. He is passionate and knowledgeable about not only the Arabic language, but Arab culture, religion, history, and anthropology. I consider him a friend. He is always open to talk about anything, offer extra help, etc. I highly encourage you take Arabic because with Rayed it is a lovely experience.

At Middlebury's Arabic language school (2022), Rayed prevented me from suffering in such an intense environment and helped me thrive. He leveraged his Anthropological background to give our language learning more purpose. In his wisdom, he challenged each of us, and also could fully celebrate our successes with us. I cannot say enough about him! :)

Rayed is an awesome professor that really cares about his students learning the language. He tries to make classes and the overall experience fun and enjoyable. There is a lot of homework with this class but that is to be expected of any language class. Really a kind-hearted soul and is very understanding. Take him if you can!
Rayed is an amazing professor. You work for your A, but you learn holistically all about the Arab world, as he is an anthropologist by trade. Highly recommend
She is a nice person but doesn't really provide clear instructions about what she looks for. Way too many readings that nobody reads and long essay assignments. Super cool person tho
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: As many other reviews have mentioned, Professor Rahal is a very nice woman. However, she assigns ludicrous amounts of readings which are often only partially related to the lecture, goes over things very quickly during the lectures, gives almost no description for assignments, and takes points off for no clear reason.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She is super nice but very hard on grading. She also assigns tons of reading and too much writing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She is nice, but very hard to get an A. She is very knowledgeable. Personally, I did not enjoy this class. Also, get ready to read, she tests you if you read through daily discussions.
this class is so writing heavy. you have 5 big essays and her slideshows from lectures will not help at all. the readings are so long and unbearable. but shes nice!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: This was possibly the worst class I've ever taken. I'm stunned at how boring and just awful this was. I feel like I wasted countless hours dealing with this class. Nobody in the class cared and just plays on their computers the whole time. Her assignments are super vague and she gives very little instruction but will penalize for things not listed.

Dr. Rahal is a really good professor. The class is VERY reading-heavy, but you don't actually need to do a lot of the readings since she never has quizzes. The midterm and the final are both essays. She's very understanding and kind and you can tell she cares about what she's teaching. She's also pretty funny and promotes discussion in class. 10/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: The only problem that I had was that her HIS 102 class felt like it was a 200 level class. Otherwise, I love her to death and she is such a cool professor. Very open for office hours and gives great feedback.

She is very sweet and the class was somewhat interesting but for a 100 level divisional there was too much work and she was too harsh of a grader. Especially in comparison to other classes taught by different professors her version of HIS 102 feels more like a 200 level class.

Dr. Raynor was very helpful with any assignment given and was able to clearly explain topics in an understandable way, but the difficulty comes from the course's "mastery-based grading," which is like this:

You must get a 100 on all quizzes
You must get a 100 on most homeworks
You must study for hundreds of hours

Otherwise, you fail the class ;(
If you are not future Einstein or something, just do not take her class.

After taking many of her classes, I realized how hard her classes are in general. She is a very tough grader, kind of different from the rest of math profs at Wake in terms expectations and grading. It's not like she's a bad teacher, either. You need to study harder than you've ever done to even get a B-.
amazing professor
She expects a lot from her students. Impossible to get an A unless you are a Physics Major and have used differential equations in Physical problems before.
Very difficult course, and Dr. Raynor doesn't make it any easier.  She's tough, but I sure learned a lot.

If you go to class, do your homework religiously, and really study and understand the concepts, you will do fine.  That is afterall Wake Forest.  Dr. Raynor can be helpful if you ask for help.  113 in general was just a very difficult course.
She goes way too fast.  She talks down to her class and speaks in the third person.  I did not like calculus to begin with, and this class sure didn't help.

She's not a horrible teacher or anything, but... good lord, the homework! It's insane! Holy Toledo Batman, I've had more homework in this class than in all my other classes put together! For the past two semesters!

Professor Amoureux was difficult but the class was interesting. It's LOTS of reading and the discussion posts took me a while. He is a tough grader but it isn't impossible to do well. Lectures were sometimes boring but the simulation is very fun and a grade booster. Participation matters!! Come to class prepared.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This was one of the worst professors I've ever had. Nothing you do will ever be good enough for him. You could do everything right on an assignment and he will still not give you an A. Do not take this course.

Professor Amoureux is a nice professor. However, his class was needlessly difficult. He is a harsh grader and does not elaborate on the grades he gives. He grades participation; however, he does not provide a metric and will still give you a low A even if you speak multiple times in a class.

POL 115 - As long as you're somewhat interested in the material you'll be fine. I don't recommend taking it as a divisional, there are easier courses. Only grades are participation, a mid term, a pretty fun simulation, and a final. Expect 25-50 pages of reading per class as well as a weekly 300-500 word discussion post about the reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Unclear grading criteria and unnecessarily tough grader, always late to class, takes himself too seriously, his class is boring and it was overall dreadful to go to class.

Showed up late to every class, very disorganized, huge emphasis on participation but never calls on you, and grades very harshly without clear feedback. He's also not very accessible outside of class and doesn't answer his emails reliably. There was also a lot of reading that we never talked about in class.

In this class, my classmates and I learned that nothing is ever good enough for Professor Amoureux. Don't expect much feedback on your assignments either. Participation is a big part of this class, but you might not ever get called on. He doesn't typically answer questions, but instead, he asks other students to answer for him. Do not recommend.

He is very relaxed which makes him very approachable in terms of getting help. The readings were very interesting and he tries to really engage the class. The assignments were straightforward. Would take again. If you put in the work he asks, you will get a good grade

Really chill professor, if you show up to class and participate you will pass. Shows up to class a few minutes late. Lecture are long and kinda boring, but some of the material is covered in class. Gives study guides before exams which are extremely helpful. He will boost your participation grade if you go to office hours. Really nice guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take him. He showed up late to literally every class we had and was almost always disorganized. Would go on tangents that had nothing to do with what we were learning or what he tested us on and these made it so his lecturers were pretty bad. He is the only politics teacher that I would never take again or recommend to people. took in 2018.

Dr. Amoureux was a really good professor to take for an introductory politics class. He is very clear during the lectures and as long as you do the reading you should be good for quizzes, tests and other assignments. Lectures can sometimes be a bit difficult to follow because he typically doesn't use powerpoints and they can be a bit dull.

I had a good experience! We used a $30 app to do live participation questions on the lectures throughout the class, so attendance is a must. He gives old tests, so the exams are veryyy predictable. He also gives bonus points if you ask questions and is helpful during office hours. Just study the slides and old tests, and you'll do well!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Carlson reads directly from his presentation slides with no additional information. He teaches nothing and provides no examples of anything (calculations) in class. He does do some demonstrations which are entertaining but do not add to the overall understanding of the material. He flies through the material in class. Do not recommend.

The content in 215 is challenging, so don't expect an easy A from this class, but Carlson's lectures are hilarious and the tests are actually really easy, he also gives you ~3 practice tests from past yrs which is all the studying necessary. Participation matters and he will call you out. Funniest guy, ask him about his numerology career.

Dr. Carlson is so funny and endearing. His lectures are god-awful to understand because he moves at a very fast pace and it makes his class feel terrifying. But the exams are easy. He's such an awesome person, with a precious personality. He's also ridiculously smart too, but it makes him forget that his definition of easy is our definition of hell

I took modern physics with Dr. Carlson and it's difficult but manageable. Lectures move very fast and are very difficult to keep up with, but you can get extra credit by participating. Exams are not too bad either, he gives you practice tests to study. I'd recommend forming study groups with other students. He is very smart and cares about students

Professor Carlson is an incredible professor who genuinely cares about his students and is very passionate about what he teaches. The reading can be a lot at times, but it's manageable and not very difficult. He is very accessible and helps you a lot if you go to his office hours. Take his class! You won't regret it.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: hilarious and a great teacher. probably the best science teacher I've ever had.
Taken him for several classes.  Hilarious and wonderfully interesting.  You know what to expect on tests, easy to succeed if you try.
Awesome lecturer, keeps on topic for the most part, keeps classes attention well, answers questions sometimes too much.  Stellar demos
No Comments
hilarious, brilliant

Generally, Hinze is known as one of the easier professors. He's a fair test maker and grader. He doesn't ask trick questions and offers generous partial credit on many problems. Put in the work to understand the material and you should be fine. Plus, he's empathetic and accommodating if you miss lectures due to sickness/covid/quarantine/etc.

The lectures can be boring sometimes but as long as you study the notes he gives you this class is an easy A. Dr. Hinze is a very fair grader and always available by email or after class. I never went to his office hours so I can't attest to that.

Dr. Hinze is a caring and super fair professor. He is not there to confuse you. His grading is clear and if you put in the work you will get the grade. Other comments claim he is "an easy A", but this is still chemistry. It is an "easy A" if you do the work. However, the workload is manageable and fair.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Hinze is a nice person. But nice people arent good professors. Hinze doesnt teach. He hands you 80 page notes for 1 chapter and expects you to know it in 20 minutes. The tests are harder than one would expect, and while his office hours are "24/7" he is usually in a lab or busy with another class (not easily accessible). Take a different chem prof

Professor Hinze is a great professor, but it was one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. If you are not good at chemistry or not willing to put in a lot of work, I don't recommend. He is available for office hours and is understanding but don't expect extra credit or an easy A. I spend easily over 10 hours a week on that class :(
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Really enjoyed his class. Easy A for sure.

I had Dr. Hinze for lab during the 2020 spring pandemic semester, so I saw him both in-person and online. Dr. Hinze was very caring and tried to keep his students engaged at all times. He would crack jokes during lab and was very happy to help his students. His lectures were a little dry, but then again so are almost all lab lectures. Solid choice.

Highly recommend for first years. Lectures are sometimes dry but he prints out the notes for everyone so its very easy to relearn the information on your own. He is funny and tries to keep the class engaged. Has about two homework sets per unit but they only boost your grade. Having an AP background will help though. Take this man.
Really good professor. He makes everything as simple as possible and takes his time to explain the harder concepts. He is also pretty entertaining.

I really liked dr. Y! She is a little confusing sometimes but she is extremely willing to help if you go to office hours and she'll literally explain everything for you. I found all the exams and the final extremely easy
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Y is a very sweet person, but not the most engaging teacher. She really does try her best, but it's a lot of just copying down notes. She's very clear about criteria, and a very forgiving grader. I've found that the notes and homework tend to be significantly harder than the exams.
She is a good person and very funny but her lectures are very boring and every class is the exact same. Her lectures can also be hard to follow.

I had Dr. Yengulalp for STA111 and she was amazing! All the notes she uses for the lectures are posted so you don't have to take notes and you can come back to it later. The tests were easy and she prepares you well for them. The final exam was also super easy. She is also extremely nice and helpful if you go to office hours

Dr. Y is a fantastic person but struggles in teaching statistics- im sure she is better with mathematics but statistics is difficult for her to teach. anyway my homework grades saved me and she gives a lot of extensions and excuses absences. if you have decent background in stats you're fine just not if you're clueless like me!
Terrible lectures. Extremely tough grader. Robot. Horrible. Do not take. Hard on HW. Weekly quizzes.

Due to the pandemic, I took Dr. Y's 111 class online. I think she is an amazing teacher that definitely cares about her students well being. The class was asynchronous for the most part. You would have to watch the lectures and take notes on your own. She gives biweekly quizzes and we had no tests, however participation in classwork was essential.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Y is a very hard grader with no chance for partial credit. I found this very annoying as I would often get all the steps of a problem right and then the answer wrong. I also did not like the format of this class she teaches like her students have all taken AP Calculus and the quizzes are impossible. I know a lot of people who did poorly.

Although in the beginning I was not a big fan I ended up liking dr. Yengulalp and the class a lot. There is homework, weekly quizzes and exams but as long as you study hard and visit office hours you will be fine. However, while I found the exams not to be that hard I know a lot of people who did very poorly on them so it really depends.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: By far the best out of all Calc teachers. She does her notes digitally instead of the chalkboard so they are a lot easier to follow and she always posts them online after class. Not a lot of regular homework, but there is a 1 question quiz at the start of each week. She always makes sure people understand something before moving on the next topic.

Just don't do it. She doesn't really know how to teach and doesn't understand that not everyone in her class took AP Calculus at some point in high school. Her tests are impossible. Impossible. Examples in class, homeworks, quizzes, and reviews look nothing like the test. She doesn't really want you to succeed or at least that's what it looks like.

A fine professor. Lectures are sorta boring (*tons* of constant over-explaining), but it's psych so still interesting. Slightly insensitive in the way a lot of psych profs are - desensitized ig. Very doable A though and an interesting class in which you get done what you need to. No super strong feelings - take her if it makes sense.

Every day is just slideshows of information and (rarely) worksheets. Definitely get the textbook because tests are maybe 20% based on information only found in the textbook and don't just passively read. It's a very interesting class and there is little homework (usually reading a 10-25 page article once a month). Dr. Watson is very sweet too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She is sweet but extremely boring. The course entails of just lectures and tests. There are no participation grades and no homework, so you have to do extremely well on the exams to get a good grade. Lucky the tests are not hard at all if you study. I also showed up late to class every day and she never cared so I didn't mind this class at all.

Dr. Watson is a very nice teacher and very sweet. The class only has 4 tests and a final so you can either do really well or really bad. There is no homework, only research credits which can count toward extra credit if you do enough. Overall, not too time consuming but the tests are very important to do well on.
She really cares about her students and is so incredibly kind; a bit of a tough grader on the short response questions but her tests aren't especially hard.

Very sweet and seems like she cares about her students, but she doesn't really engage with the class during her lectures which makes it difficult to actually enjoy it. Also, she barely uses the book BUT there's a few questions on the tests that do come from the book so look out for that.

Grade is only comprised of four exams + big final exam, and then the research study/paper grade. She lectures for the whole class, and although she's a nice, sweet lady, her voice is very quiet and monotone, so it's hard to stay focused.

Attendance not graded, but lots of content so show up. Recommend only renting the textbook bc you don't really use it as she teaches the content in the lectures (save your money yall). Class is not difficult just a lot to remember. Exams and final exam are based on the slides (exams may be on lecture) and are your only grades so study.

There is a textbook but I recommend only renting a digital copy bc you don't really need to use it (she teaches it through PPT lectures), lecture heavy- just memorize what's on the slides. The exams are based on the slides and class and the final exam is only the slides. Not much group work, just need to memorize the content to pass. A lot but easy
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She's not the most interesting teacher in the world and mostly teaches solely through slideshows. Her tests are not super hard but she does like to take a few random questions from the textbook. She seems to be only fairly knowledgable about Psychology but she's fine for an intro course.

cares a lot about the subject but doesn't do a good job clarifying assignments or material. I spent most of the class feeling confused or behind. She is very accessible for office hours but I wouldn't take it for a divisional.
Impossible tests, grading criteria unknown, unclear on projects and content, very passive aggressive.

She made my life so stressful and difficult. I would study for quizzes for hours just to get a 60. Have cried about this class so many times it made me feel so defeated and stupid. I would NEVER recommend taking any of her classes unless you are a mind reader and have a photographic memory. She turned a topic I found interesting into a nightmare.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Very nice professor, extremely harsh grader and disorganized class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: not nice
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Would not recommend taking this class for the com requirement. Take any other professor. Never have had a teacher make something so easy to be incredibly complicated. Don't put yourself through through this unless you absolutely have to. 
Teaching ability is fine, but she will destroy your thoughts in front of the whole class.
disorganized, unclear, hard to reach during office hours
I have taken Dr. Rowie's class three times and she is a very charming lady. She cares about students and listens to our feedback. The assignments she gives allow you to think and learn critically.
Very disorganized, bad feedback, not helpful
Bro is the goat

I loved taking Orgo II with Dr. Lukesh. His lectures are well organized. He sets clear expectations, and if you put in the work, you will do well in his class. He is very accessible outside the class room and genuinely wants to help you. Orgo II can be challenging but it shouldn't be traumatic. Take his class. You won't regret it.

Had Dr. Lukesh for 324 lab. Kind of blunt but still personable and fun. Super helpful and knowledgeable in lab and willing to work with you to acommodate you schedule. One of the better lab's I've taken.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Loved Dr.Lukesh! I made a C in Orgo 1 and was so scared to take Orgo 2 but he made this class so enjoyable. He never made me feel dumb and was always willing to help. I loved his lectures, they are very active and do not make me want to sleep. Take him for anything!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He is such a terrific Chem prof! If you take this course, definitely tru to get in his class because he is a really good guy and smart and you'll learn a hard subject but it won't be torture, He is fair and really cares about his students and wants you to learn and accomplish things.

Dr. Lukesh gives very clear lectures and fair quizzes/exams. He makes organic chemistry as easy to learn as possible, and is extremely organized. He is clearly passionate about the subject and wants students to do well.
Dr. Lukesh gives great lectures, and it's clear that he knows the material well and can explain it well also. His tests are extremely fair, and is patient when you have questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Extremely organized and a Chemistry virtuoso in every sense of the word.

If you want an easy A and don't want to do work take his class. if you want to actually learn how to be a better writer DONT because he literally doesn't even read the short essays we submitted. He is a relatively funny guy, but sometimes tries a little too hard to be "quirky" and "cool." Overall loved it because I barely did any work and got an A.

I'm not going to lie--sometimes the lectures could be a little hard to get through. But that is the one complaint I could ever give for this professor. He helped me improve my writing skills so much, while still giving out easy A's. He will do anything to help his students. I could not recommend his class any more. He wants us to be interested.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Fiander was my best professor this semester. There is not a lot of work throughout the semester, just occasional essays. He is open to changing and adapting the assignments and is always available to help. Take his class for the writing requirement.

Prof. Fiander is hands down the best writing professor I've ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and cares about mental health before anything else. At the end of the semester if you've only missed 1 or less hw, you can bump up your grade from a B+ to A- if needed. I'm so sad the semester's over because I always look forward to class. :(
Professor Fiander is the best I highly recommend to take him hes so nice and genuinely cares about his students.

Absolutely love Mr. Fiander. Best professor at Wake Forest. Let us out early for Pitsgiving. Gives a lot of feedback on essays and is super understanding and easy going. I would definitely take him again if I could!

He's great professor and gives great feedback on papers. He also answers in a timely fashion and is very understanding when it comes to asking for extensions. He is so respectful and you can tell he wants you to actually care about the class and what you learned instead of your grade.
One of the best professors at Wake. He is so caring and hilarious. I would 100% recommend taking him.

Often cancels class or has a sub so you rarely have time with her. Lacks the ability to effectively communicate course material in a clear and concise way. Just sits behind her desks, with no slideshow, and reads off her notes -- very disengaging. I would strongly recommend against taking a class with her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Don't take Dr. Battle

Professor does not teach material well. Instructions are often unclear and students left very confused. Lots of random quizzes and grades that are graded very harshly. She often isn't even teaching the class bc she has a sub or just cancels all together. Would not want to ever take a class with her again!

Dr. Battle's a very nice person, but her expectations were rly unclear & everyone was always confused. no tests/essays which was great, but lots of random quizzes and assignments. they're rly easy though, & there's barely any work outside of class so it was easy to fulfill the requirement. not a hard class, just frustrating at times.

Professor lectures without slideshow or notes so this class is very difficult if you do not actively listen and take notes. Instructions are often unclear but can be clarified if you go to office hours. Grades very tough even if little explanation is given. Whole class is often left confused.

Dr. Battle's Sociology 151 class was challenging, not because of the content, but because of the grading scale. The class is made up of 100 points, meaning that any point you lose on an assignment or quiz counts as a percentage of your grade. Be careful before signing up

Guidelines for what she wanted were frequently very unclear but still gradely harshly. Had students read an article before coming into class with no reading checks. She had no powerpoints or notes, so if you weren't actively listening to her speak, you missed everything. Several group projects throughout the semester, no tests. Few mini quizzes

Dr. Battle gave limited instruction as we only met five times during the semester. We learned key course content through weekly documentaries and readings outside class. In class, she had 3 selected people discuss a reading that no one else was assigned to read, and she had everyone put random words in the chat 3 times to ensure we were still there

Professor Alesandroni is a really nice and personal guy who clearly knows his stuff. Most of your grade is dependent on weekly quizzes out of two questions and if you get one question wrong you're at a 50%, and homework is graded on accuracy. If you show up to class, take notes, and practice the material you should be fine-- he wasn't too terrible.

I lovvvveeeed Alesandroni! Literally the sweetest man ever. His exams and grading criteria are very clear. Often before quizzes and exams he would give us example problems very similar to the problems that would appear on the exam, so I always felt very prepared. He also offered extra credit opportunities after exams. Such a great professor!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a very nice, casual, and understanding guy, but as a professor, he is not great. Firstly, he reads directly from the textbook without providing much in terms of additional explanation. His tests are also only out of 4 questions, so if you get one question wrong you're screwed for the semester. He is also a very tough grader with homework.

Nice guy but harsh grader (no partial credit). Doesn't teach from textbook you buy. Puts random examples on screen but you never get a copy of any real work. Quizzes and tests sometimes have questions that he has not prepared you for. Lectures are disorganized. Gives formulas in class that aren't in book. Don't take if you have no stat knowledge.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Not consistent or fair in how he grades. Quizzes and tests are short. If I did not take a stat class in high school I am sure I would be even more lost during class lectures.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Seems like a nice guy until it comes to grading. Weekly quizzes and 2 midterms are short, but he never likes to give partial credit on a question. Not too much homework, however, it's assigned from the department textbook for accuracy, even though he states he does not like this textbook and never uses it. Go to office hours if you are new to Stat

Professor Alesandroni is a nice guy. His class is tough, not impossible. If you are looking for a super easy A, this isn't the place for you, but if you're thinking stats could be interesting I say give it a shot. Weekly quizzes, weekly homework, 2 midterms, 1 test. If you show up and put in a decent amount of effort outside of class you'll survive
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Alesandroni is an excellent professor. He is a great lecturer and his lessons are clear and easy to follow. Very kind and caring guy. He is an extremely tough grader. However, if you show up to class, put in the work, and go to office hours, you will do just fine and will learn a lot. I would recommend him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Tough grader

comment: FYS class was harder than I expected and had a lottt of political history
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: i liked taking mr. brister's class. he is very knowledgable and excited about the info, however you should be wary of pop quizzes. also, it seems like he forgets to give assignments, so the last few weeks of the year are hell as he tries to catch up
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a genuinely sweet guy who makes class super interesting, but he is an extremely harsh grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Really like Brister. He is the goat. He was my first politics professor and inspired a love for international politics. The class itself was pretty easy. 3 tests and a research paper (you can choose the topic). He used powerpoint and if you missed anything he posts them. It's clear that he is very intelligible and very interested in the topic.
Great teacher with interesting lectures and lots of experience to back it up. Taken multiple classes with him, and would take another if not graduating.
Professor Brister is a very knowledgeable and nice guy, but he makes his FYS class very difficult.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took him for the Nationalism class. Part of it was online (COVID), so the experience was a little different. Always takes attendance. His lectures can be a little long and at times but he is very knowledgeable. One group presentation and exams (modified to all essays but in the past has done exams ). Lots of reading but covers it in lecture.

I took International Politics with him and really enjoyed the class. I would say that the tests are pretty challenging, so it's not an easy A or B class - you really have to study. Regardless, he knows so much about politics in general and has traveled so many places which always makes the class more interesting.
BEST CLASS EVER!!!!

If you somehow see open seats in a Haynes class, go ahead and register because you're pretty lucky. Her classes fill up quick. She's a fairly recent Wake alumni, so she relates well with the students. She's more focused on you getting something out of the class than she is with "perfect writing". There are flexible deadlines and self-grading.

This was without a doubt the best class I took this semester! Haynes genuinely cares about her students' well-being and is very understanding of your situation. There are many short readings that are particularly enjoyable and many weekly writing assignments that are satisfying and not graded! If I could, I would take this class a million times.

She is so nice, really cares about her students preforming well in the class. She understands that other classes are difficult, so she doesn't give much work. Make sure you ask plenty of questions about essay topics, because some are a little unclear.
Haynes is amazing! Shes so chill its literally impossible to fail her class. There are only 3 big papers and they really aren't hard. Just do the work and show up and you can pick your own grades.

Amazing!! Literally move mountains to be in her class. She went to Wake so she's knows how hard it is so wants her class to be interesting and less stressful. The class is self graded. Only 3 big essays and they are actually really interesting. I learned more this semester than all of high school about writing

You choose your own grade based on what you feel you deserve which helped me as a writer by making me not scared to take risks in my writing. She was very good at giving feedback on writing and making students feel more comfortable writing. Overall great course and professor. The workload was very manageable.

She is really sweet and tries to get you out of your comfort zone in writing and write how you want without worry of grades. She is very understanding of college and allows you to miss class and turn in papers later. It is a lot of writing but it is a writing class. Very easy A if you put in some effort.
Dr. Epps is amazing! She really wants her students to succeed, and she gives great feedback on your writing.

I LOVE Dr. Epps!! She is amazing; the lectures were fun, she is super understanding and caring, and the class was easy. Though it was a little boring at times, she made it worth it. DON'T USE HER CARINGNESS TO YOUR ADVANTAGE, be nice, pay attention, and participate. She deserves to be respected
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She is my favorite human on this planet. Participation is big, mainly during class discussions on readings for hw. Gives frequent and thoughtful feedback on writing before the final paper or portfolio is due. So insanely supportive. She makes me want to be a writing major even tho I'm going into STEM lol.

I highly recommend Dr. Epps as a professor you have to take at Wake! She is so kind to students and the class will change your perspective on academic writing. She's a fairly easy grader, lets you redo papers, and is good at leading class discussions. One of the best professors I've ever had!
Super Nice! Very big on attendance and takes off your grade if you miss. There are like three papers and a project that you are graded on. Let's you rewrite your essays for points back

Dr. Epps is amazing and the class really helps with writing style and structure. Three major projects and a ton of discussion boards was all the class really consisted of. Dr. Epps is there to pace you and encourage you to do the best you can. Definitely try to take her class!
Dr. Epps develops a great relationship with her students. As long as you adhere to the rubric for the given writing assignment, you should receive at least a B+ in the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This was such an interesting course and Dr. Epps is a great teacher. She takes attendance but makes classes fun. Cares about her students and is not a harsh grader.

She was a very tough grader and had extremely high expectations of her students however she was funny and made the course material interesting. However, there is a lot to learn so use lectures as a review not as your first time seeing the material. She also talks very fast is hard to follow and is a tough grader.

She's all over the place, wasting time talking at her captive audience re: personal stuff like her kid or horse. Her whole class is a confused, conflicting mess. She also likes to self-empower by embarrassing some of the awkward or quiet people like a mean high school girl, except has real power harm futures.

Dr. Martyn reads directly off her slides but often makes mistakes. A lot of other reviews say this, but her expectations are wildly unclear making it difficult to know what she's looking for. You can answer things correctly but not get credit because it wasn't her way. She also has a weird sense of humor that often involves putting students down.
unclear lectures, unclear expectations

Dr. Martyn was consistently unprepared for class, reading directly off slides and often getting information wrong. Students would correct her in class, and then she would backtrack on the last 10 minutes of lecture because it wasn't correct. This made class incredibly confusing and difficult to follow. I can't say that I learned much.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Martyn is one of the "rent-a profs" the Bio Dept regularly uses. She grades like you're in grad school but runs class like it's middle school, ie mandatory attendance. Sit in the back, stay quiet and look riveted by her at all times, even if she yammering on about horses, and you'll survive. PS - the 3 hr exams taken on your own time are brutal.

I took BIO 372 with her. I would like to grade Dr. Martyn based on the rubric that she gave us. According to her, a good, satisfactory answer is a 4/10 (40%) and a good answer is a 6/10 (60%). Thus, I would give her 2/5 (40%) to be fair to her. The material wasn't too hard, but she couldn't answer questions and always graded harshly, odd deadlines.

I I did not love this class. Unclear if it was Dr. Martyn or the horrible course planning and structuring that the biology department is known for, but it was all based on group assignments and a few tests that were several hours long each. Literally felt like some form of torture to be assigned a 3-hour test outside of class in a 2-day window.

I LOVE her! She is my absolute favorite professor at Wake. She is extremely passionate about her subject, her lectures are interesting and she cares a lot about her students. I cannot recommend taking her enough

Attendance mandatory!! Her expectations for a divisional were a bit extreme: 4 papers and 3 tests has to be a record number of big point assignments that I have had for a class, especially a divisional. She does make expectations clear and you don't have to study for tests so long as you prepare good notes which can be taxing given all the videos
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: Dr O'Neill is amazing!! She's funny and really tries to get to know each individual person. She is willing to help students outside of class and provides great feedback. There are 3 papers throughout the semester which aren't too bad and 2 tests that are take home. I highly recommend taking her class!

LOVE HER! She is such a mom and is so sweet. She grades so easily and there's not that much he. You need to study for the tests, but if you do then you can easily get a 100. She never tries to trick you out of points. Class can get boring but for the most part is engaging. This class made me love art museums when I hated them before.
Dr. ONeill is so kind, engaging and an overall amazing professor. She will do her best to help you succeed/learn and provide personalized feedback to help you improve.
She is awesome. Take her class.
Very clear on expectations.  Don't need to do much work outside of class.  Very easy to talk to and get help from.  Best teacher I've had at Wake
very enthusiastic professor, loves her subject, always willing to help, makes topics very clear, very friendly, mad me interested in art, study and you will do well
Awesome professor. Fun class. Study the material and you will do fine. Very clear and good at getting the class to participate

She is a pretty good professor. She is now at UNCG. The classes are based on powerpoints that you HAVE TO KNOW to do well on the tests, but you also should invest in reading the book. She offers extra credit in the form of outside lectures, and she makes your lowest grade count for less.

I had Prof B for Developmental.  She knows her stuff really well.  Mostly a powerpoint oriented class, tests are not easy, but not impossible.  There is also a 20-hour community service requirement for this class, which wasn't bad at all.  Good class, good teacher.

Class mostly consists of PowerPoints. Decent teacher, but major control freak. Sets a lot of very particular picky rules about the class - they aren't particularly burdensome, but they get to be extremely annoying. Respect is something earned, Ms. B, it's not something you can drag out of people with Rules.
Excellent class.  Doesn't give out A's, but tries her best for everyone to do well.  Highly recommend taking her...
Great professor, interesting class, drops your lowest exam grade which is always appreciated
Great prof. Great dresser. Go Yankees.
No Comments
Nice enough lady, tests are ridiculous

Great fella. Your grade consists of 10% participation (show up to class once a month), 30% midterm 1, 30% midterm 2, and 30% final exam. He gives you the exact format of the exam questions before each exam just go over them the night before and granted you have attended at least 2/3rds of the lectures you will get 100%. It is not a difficult class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He does not take attendance so a third of the students do not come to class at all. Maybe that is why some people get bad grades. Overall his classes are EASY. The exams are open book open notes and are exactly what he teaches. He walks you through practice problems in class for many times and that is exactly what will appear in his tests.

Dr. Calabrese is a very good person. Always willing to help and very patient with students. I took 2 courses with him in a row (public finance and cost benefit analysis). If you learn the material, pay some attention to class, do his practice problems, you will get good grades in his class. His exams are literally the same with his problem sets!!!
He's a great person and very patient during office hours. He literally give the exam to students before midterms. It's not his fault that some people don't study at all.
The class is very quick paced and I had to meet with the TA and peer tutors a lot to be able to do somewhat well in the class.

Grade is based on 3 exams, but he gives a generous curve to his exams. If you have a background in Econ you'll probably be fine, but as someone who has no experience it was awful. He acts like his students are a panel and he has to prove he knows the material instead of teaching it. Don't get me wrong he's a good guy, just not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Your overall average is dependent on three exam grades, making it very difficult to do well in the course. He is very intelligent and knows what he is talking about, but the lectures are very hard to follow and he goes way too fast. I had to completely rely on textbooks and the internet to really learn the material.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: SUPER lecture heavy & goes really fast. Every new unit I tell myself I'm going to focus but I honestly can't and just had to get a tutor outside of class to teach it to me. Only graded on 3 exams but he curves them greatly so you're grade isn't an F. Very hard to learn if you haven't taken econ yet. Doesn't know our names or if you skip class lol.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Mayle is the goattt. Please take from him. He designs the course in such a good way. He makes you do groupwork so you get to know the people in your class & lectures profoundly. And he is a real caring dude. Mayle is awesome

Great Professor. The course material is hard, but he delivered it so clear and logical. Outside of classroom, he shows a lot of caring to every student. If I could choose, I will definitely take him again.

Dr. Mayle was an excellent professor. I took him for Calc 3, having not taken Calculus in 3 years, but he explained concepts so well and his notes were very easy to follow along with. The examples in notes, homework, and on tests were very similar. He does assign a lot of homework, including daily online and weekly written, but it is very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Mayle made Calc 3 both challenging and fun, with a teaching style that kept the material engaging and mostly straightforward. He's incredibly kind and always willing to work with his students to ensure they succeed. Highly recommend taking his class!

Such a caring and involved professor. He makes it a point to learn every student's name. He explains things very clearly. WebAssign homework is due before every class, may be a bit tedious. Problem of the Day questions at the beginning of every class, which you collaborate on in groups that alternate for each section.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: This man puts in so much work to help his students succeed. There is new content everyday, but he also has office hours after class in case you didn't catch something. I'm not the best at math at all, but if you put in your share he'll help you get a good grade.

This guy is the man. I was terrified of calc111, but he was a fantastic teacher and I never really struggled. His office hours are very accessible, and he is not afraid to help you through the homework if you need it. He will not give you the answers, however. Also, he makes great use of groupwork. Your groupmates will help you immensely!

Dr. Mayle is great! Very understanding, accessible and passionate about math. There is a lot of work (about 5 problems/night and 1 group assignment/week for hw) but it's not hard to do well. Tests are also easy with reviews. I took 2 years of calc in high school so it's all review for me, but I don't know anyone who isn't doing well in the course!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I LOVED Dr. Mayle. I took him for MTH111 and he did a phenomenal job. It did help a bit that I took Calc AB in junior year, but regardless, Mayle is a great choice. He's quirky, passionate about math, and really helps to explain the why of calculus, not just the how. weekly homework was difficult but manageable. couldn't recommend him anymore!!!

I love Dr. Mayle. I took him for Calc 1, which I took in high school. The class was difficult, but any Calc 111 class is going to be challenging. His lectures are thorough, and attendance is highly encouraged. He has many office hours available and is very helpful during them. He appreciates participation during class. Great Prof + would take again

Olga Furmanek is a textbook example of someone who is tough but loving. Her sweet voice and curvy physique made the class an emotional, and sexual, roller coaster for me. My palpable attraction to her every move made focusing very difficult, and my grade suffered as a result. As far as her actual teaching goes I would definitely not recommend her

ola furmanek is definitely the hardest professor i have ever had but by far the most influential. she expects effort and will not allow for anything other than your best. she pushes her students but it really just helps her students improve. she is wonderful and i have so much respect. take her class. highly recommended

She is a difficult professor. In our (interpreting) class the homework was vague, unclear and exceptionally random. The last presentation (an entire class period powerpoint) was very vague, and I remember one group had to redo their project because they didn't have what she was looking for. Many students did feel embarrassed at some point.

Professor Furmanek DOES talk down to students and she has laughed at serious answers students have given in class. Her notes are not comprehendable what-so-ever, she just writes random words in sloppy hand writing all over the board in every direction. She does not use powerpoints, over heads or blackboard nor does she prepare notes prior to class
It's been forever since I took this class, but I remember loving it.  Furmanek is a very brilliant, passionate teacher.  Talk philosophy in Spanish, she will love you forever!!!

What shocked me was Furmanek's treatment of her students. Some she embarassed in front of the class, others she held to unrealistic standards they couldn't meet & then she'd get angry. She got snippy if you asked for help or clarification. But then she did let me reschedule my final Fall Semester.

This course was very demanding and you really have to know Spanish.  The class is conducted entirely in Spanish and is very challenging.  On another note, Professor Furmanek's notes are not always coherent and hard to follow.  Take her if you a SPA Major.

Furmanek was challenging for my honors 213 class, but our class learned a lot and I know I improved my spanish skills.  Participate in class and you will do well.  The funniest thing-she kind of joked some other Spanish profs once (giving us sched. advice

Freshmen, avoid this FYS if you can. Way too much work for a first year seminar- trust me there are easier ones out there. Lots of readings, in class participation, and harshly graded research papers. Plus the professor required us use his own research papers as references for the first paper which came off as a bit egotistical tbh. Don't recommend
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I don't recommend this guy for FYS. He is a very harsh grader when it comes to papers and participation. This was probably my most stressful class my freshman year. Take an easy FYS and try to enjoy your first year if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: If you want to teach yourself take him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Anderson is a good teacher. He tries to relate to students and its obvious that he is very passionate about his research. He records every lecture and posts it online. The class is really easy until the tests come around. Beware, trick questions are everywhere. Overall not bad, just be prepared.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Great organized lectures, well prepared professor. Eye candy but tests are terribly tricky and hard.

He is a nice guy. He is really relaxed and wears cargo sorts and tshirts to class. He sometimes wears shirts that relate to lecture like a blue boobies shirt when we are talking about Darwin.. He is a good professor. There is a lot of material in this class and the ONE test is very challenging. It is all multiple choice and is tricky and long.
Extremely interesting class. He is a good teacher and his lectures are very structured.
Dr. Anderson is full of energy, clear and concise in his lectures, and easy to talk to.  He is truly an amazing teacher--although in Bio 113 you MUST learn the material to do well.

Margaret Bender is excellent as a professor. Her class greatly enhanced my knowledge of the material and taught me much about a fundamental aspect of our lives, language. The work is quite light and she makes her tests easy as long as you carefully study all the material on the study guide.

Dr. Bender is encouraging and passionate. Cherokee unit is awesome and shows her expertise and enthusiasm. Class is very participatory. She explains topics and answers questions well. Wish there were more opportunities for grading - each of the 3 exams counts for 28% of final grade. Complete your homework credit asap to avoid scrambling at the end.

Bender was a good professor, very knowledgeable. However expects there to be one answer and that is the only right answer. I thought she was a tough grader when it came to certain exams. I thought for the amount she wanted us to know she didn't instruct or really supplement us with much information in class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Bender is awesome, definitely one of my favorite profs! She made linguistics super interesting and an absolute blast. Not too much work at all, pretty easy grader, and is very accessible for help. She somehow makes you want to participate even if you're shy. I adored this class, take it!!

Professor Bender is absolutely amazing! While LIN 150 relies a lot on textbook and study guide/workbook usage, her lectures clear up most confusion about the readings and homework is a participation grade. Her exams are not too hard as long as you pay attention in class and do the readings in the study guide. She also teaches a bit about Cherokee!

Dr. B was a kind/passionate prof. Class almost fully lecture/no homework other than long readings. Can get away with not doing them you just need to study much harder for the exams. Class is easy until 
an exam/paper. You will study a ton of material only to be asked a few questions which you are expected to know a lot about making the exams hard.
So sweet and cares so much for her students and the topic! She was so silly and made each class enjoyable-- would 100% take again

Dr. Bender is an amazing professor and really aims to inspire her students. She keeps her lectures interesting and does not assign an excessive amount of homework. She is very caring and finds the best in all of her students.

Dr. Bender is a great teacher. Although sometimes unorganized, she expects you to come to class ready to discuss what you read for homework. She is really good at engaging the class and stimulating different ways of thinking.

This is not the easy way out for FYS. The lectures are long (2.5) however the class is doable. There can be about 150 pages of reading due for each class, but most people read 10 at max. Try and participate as much as possible because he is kind of a biased grader when it comes to the midterm and final papers. Overall a nice man, but good luck...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Kennedy is absolutely lovely, he is one of the most intelligent people I have ever had the chance to learn from, and if you are a politics student you should try to take a class with him before he retires. He is a harsh grader, however, if you put effort into the class and ask him questions he will be more than happy to help.

Doesn't use Canvas or much tech at all, so you can only reach him through email. Pretty biased grader and assigns lots of reading (no one really does it though). Lectures are LONG and boring, but he doesn't keep you for the full 2.5 hours usually. Very old fashioned teacher, nice guy and very unique to say the least. Participate as much as you can.

He's a very nice guy and genuinely wants you to do well, at the same time he's very old fashioned and lectures can be very boring. You don't know what grade you have in the class until the end of the semester, and can be difficult to reach through email. He seems to be disorganized with some things, which can be seen if you visit his office.

The class is an introduction to a thorny subject that coincided with turmoil in the Middle East. He kept the class focused on the subject while connecting it to the unfolding events. There is a midterm, a paper, and a final policy brief. He is very knowledgeable about the subject and passionate about teaching it. I thoroughly enjoyed this class.

Great dude, but you will NOT know what you have in the class until the report card come out. I found that you will get straight B-/Cs all semester but end with an A-. He also only teaches lecture style and has a very monotone voice, so if you doze/get distracted easy don't take his class.

I would not suggest taking this professors class unless you have a passion for the material or theme of the course. Lectures are very hard to sit through and he is very old school. However, he does really want his students to succeed and if you go to his office hours he will help you!

Professor Kennedy is an excellent professor. The work is very lecture-heavy but if you are engaged and read the material you will do fine. I have found him to be kind and available to his students. He is esteemed and an authority in his field. If you need a powerpoint presentation to pay attention, college may not be the right place for you. :)

I would not recommend taking Professor Kennedy. He sits and lectures the entire time without using powerpoints, images, or any other resources to supplement his lectures, so it can be very boring. The material is hard to learn because he fails to explain the basic topics in an easy manner. Very strict grader, is not open to new ideas.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had Professor Kennedy for my First Year Seminar, so likely disregard this if you are taking a politics course with him. But for my seminar, the course was incredibly bland and felt like it dragged on for years. I don't think he learned some of the names of the students and had a co-teacher who generally did more teaching than him. Would not rec.
Excellent professor, old school and lecture based. Doesnt give rubrics but isnt too harsh a grader so it works out.
I love Dr. Allman, would definitely take again

Dr. Allman is the only reason that made me fall in love with math again after having a not-so-nice experience with 112 (Calc 2). Calc 3 was actually fun because he is very passionate about the subject. His office hours were fun to attend. He also can find a way to make you understand by providing different analogies & approaches. Highly recommend!
Flip class style, and the jamboard is very useful for review and learning.

The term isn't over yet but i am really enjoying having Dr. Allman as my MTH 113 professor. Other reviews have complained about the somewhat unorthodox teaching style but I find it to be very effective.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: he doesn't actually teach. the textbook he gives just has problems, maybe one definition if you're lucky. you have to figure out how to solve all the problems yourself. in class, we are put into groups to solve the problems from the night before and then spend the entire class going over them and not actually learning.

Dr. Allman is a great Math professor. Most Math professors lecture for the entire time and dont care if their students check out or fail. Dr. Allmans class has a mix of lecture and group-based problem solving. It took some time to get used to, but I ended up really liking the class format. I learned a lot more than friends in other Calc classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Allmans class is a great balance of lecture and students solving problems in small groups with his help. Hes hilarious, so class was fun. He also was very available to talk through questions during office hours. I ended up learning more math than I ever have in this course. Definitely recommend!

Id say Dr Allman is a pretty good professor. He makes himself available in office hours but the class structure is kind of weird- he relies heavily on group work instead of lectures. Tests werent too bad tho and he has a nice curving system. We also did two projects in Mathematica that were difficult, but I think other sections had to as well.

Fine math teacher. Really nice guy. The first half of the semester is definitely better. He works through problems fully and moves at a very good pace. Later in the year however it's more of a study hall every class. Overall would take again great guy.

He is genuinely the best professor/teacher I've had. He is really good at breaking down problems and teaching the subject overall. He is also a great guy, and he even gives nice curves on tests. If you just show up and pay attention you'll do just fine. I had a C+ in AB calc in high school and ended this class with an A.

Took for MTH 111, does a good job of balancing tests and quizzes so nothing is worth too much. If you've taken calc before and were decent at it it's an easy A. He's very accessible outside of class for the most part, and does a pretty good job explaining the material.

Very kind and caring professor who knows the material in and out. Always offering extra office hours, especially around exams. Weekly quizzes, 3 exams, and a final, so nothing is worth too much. He moves a little slower than he has to and sometimes teaches to the bottom of the class, but that's not always a bad thing

Has guided notes but skips around through them and half of the notes won't be filled out. Lots of homework, but graded lightly and not for a lot of points so not a huge impact on grading. In his defense, the material is very difficult to understand, but he doesn't necessarily make it easier. Office hours are very helpful. Doesn't respond to emails.

I took Dr. Kindred for discrete mathematics and he was excellent. Some sections were pretty difficult to understand, so he tried his best to help work us through the process. He also has lots of office hours to come talk to him. He gives lots of homework, but test questions are very similar to homework questions. He also curves tests.

I found Kindred to be both good and bad. His class had lots of opportunities to improve your grade through weekly quizzes and homework assignments. Quizzes were sometimes harsh and half the class fails them. During office hours he was helpful but he isn't very flexible if you can't meet during these hours. Midterms and final were fair; study a lot

If you have taken calculus before, you will be fine in this course. Dr. Kindred is a great professor and always gives the opportunity to ask questions or meet outside of class. It is a very fast paced course. The quizzes are weekly, but he is very flexible when considering grades, especially at the end of the semester.

Dr. Kindred is the best math teacher/professor Ive ever had in my life. His lectures are extremely thorough, so you dont have to read the textbook and re-teach yourself. Exams are amazing because you can drop your lowest section. A bit odd at times when he leaves class to cough and when he drops the whiteboard markers consistently. Take Kindred!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Definitely not the easiest Calc 1 Professor - sometimes is mean and makes the quizzes so half the kids fail them but he grades the midterms in sections so its easy to get a high grade - really really cares about helping kids and is really rigorous with proving everything which makes it hard sometimes but I really like him

Currently about to finish JPN153 as a freshman and I love Takata sensei! She's very caring and has consistently asked to meet with me to see how I was adjusting. My only complaint is the amount of homework and the fact that it's due before class the next day and not at 11:59, meaning it's basically due the day she assigns the work.

Takata sensei is absolutely wonderful! One of the best educators I have ever had. She is very passionate about teaching and really deeply cares about her students. It is so much fun to be in her class. Yes, the coursework might be challenging at times, but she makes it so much more interesting and enjoyable. I looked forward to her class every day.
Literally the best teacher ever. She really loves her students to death and is always there for you. If you love the language, put in the time, and communicate with her, you can only do well.

Great professor, who actually cares about her students. Participate in class and keep up with the work, and you should do just fine. Japanese is one of the hardest languages to learn, but she makes it fun
Great professor. She makes learning an extremely difficult language a little easier. She also REALLY cares about her students. I give her five gold stars.
No Comments
No Comments
Takata-sensei is a very good Japanese language teacher.  While the language is very different from english, she does a good job of presenting it in a very clear way.  She also makes very good sushi.

Dr. Stone himself is a nice enough guy, but his tests are so incredibly hard for no reason. Most people in the class bombed the first one. If you're wanting to get a good grade in Research Methods 2, this isn't the professor to take!
i will never not know error variance~~he taught us well. deeply wry and clever man, very kind soul. wise af as well.

He is not an easy grader but he explains things so well that you could not be confused about obscure concepts after his class. Exams are mostly on the things he said in class, so the key is to pay close attention to what he talks about, i.e.. examples. A very logical and funny professor! Will def take his class again if I have the chance.
Would not recommended, Professor Stone's exams are very long and much more challenging than they need to be.

Took this class thinking it would be a relatively easy divisional. WRONG. Extensive reading with quizzes and in addition, we are expected to write 2 papers per week and are graded EXTREMELY harshly. That does not include the 10-page paper we have to do on top of that. I spend more time on this class than any other and it's my worst grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I have Dr. Stone currently for FYS and he made the class out to seem so easy but there is actually so much work. Basically a book per week in addition to many other writing assignments including multiple almost 10 page long papers. VERY harsh grader with no feedback. More work in this than I did in my writing seminar and English class combined.

I'm taking Dr. Stone's Life Perspectives class this semester. He is a very kind a passionate man and our group conversations have all been extremely insightful. While I enjoy the topics we discuss, the amount of work required outside of class is overwhelming. Extensive reading (with quizzes), papers every week etc. He is also not an easy grader.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Had him for a first year seminar and he really cares about his students. If you have the opportunity to take him then do it. He is more focused on the the views and insight gained by students, rather than them being able to just spit out memorized information.

I saw he didn't have any ratings, which is a crime, so I had to post even though I took his class over 2 years ago.  Easily the single best professor I have ever had.  Had him for graduate statistics, and his teaching in that class single-handedly shaped my interest in the a major aspect of the field I'm currently in.
Chris is amazing. Take him.

Love Chris (you can call him by his first name). Amazing mustache. Lot of reading (like 1 book per week or two). Class is literally only discussion-based except for the occasional quiz at the start to make sure you read (very easy). He is engaging, wants everyone to talk, even if it's for something small. Participate a bit and you'll enjoy it.

FYS 100 is a super cool class with lots of interesting material. Professor Brown is also an easy grader who makes the class engaging. However, be prepared for a lot of work: much more reading + assignments than other FYS classes, and a midterm/final.

Super cool guy, available, actually asks how you're doing. I recommend going to his office hours, because he'll actually help you out and talk to you. The class does have real work, namely readings, which make it a little labor intensive than most FYS classes, but it's still easy and a fun and engaging class if you participate and pay attention.

GIVE THIS MAN TENURE. Professor Brown is fantastic. the best professor you will ever have at wake! he gives a lot of readings but he will do a back flip if you ask him to. he is a super fun guy and his class is very interesting. would highly recommend, please answer a million questions in class he loves a participant. he also loves zebras.

He is a really chill professor and he makes it easy to participate in class. You have to write a short essay every two weeks, but the grading is very easy. The only problem is the amount of reading it requires for just an FYS course. We would have 150-page reading assignments between classes and pop quizzes to make sure you read.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Brown was a good professor and his class was very informative. However, the class was very heavy on the reading (150 pages of reading between classes) and he sometimes takes a while to reply to emails. That being said, the class was very interesting and Professor Brown made the class very fun.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Took him for FYS. He is super cool and laid back, always available for any questions you might have. Class is strictly discussion-based, so get prepared to share your thoughts. Occasional 1-2 page papers, but he is pretty lenient with them. If you do the reading and speak in class, you will get a good grade.

Awesome professor. Classes can be boring and weekly quizzes are annoying, but if you write down everything he writes on the board and memorize it before tests/quizzes you will do well because it's exactly what he does in class. Clearly very smart and answers questions really well

I really enjoyed him! He made sure that students were doing well. Class is a bit boring. Make sure you study the study guides for the tests. They are pretty much the same. There arent a ton of assessments so make sure you work hard and do well on the weekly quizzes and exams!
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Take Dr. Puri! He is a very knowledgable professor who clearly cares about his students and their success. He lets you have a sheet with whatever you want on it for the tests, so if you prepare well, the 3 tests and exam are quite manageable - and his tests have very few surprises. If you enjoy math and put in the effort, you will love his class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Dr. Puri is a great professor who cares about the success of his students. He had office hours almost every day of the week, where he was always willing to walk through problems and answer questions. He is a very fair grader too. His final was a bit difficult, but he graded it fairly. I learned a lot from his class and will be taking one again.

Rajan Puri is a very intelligent professor who understands all the material he goes over. However, he is not a very good grader, and due to the multitude quizzes/tests, this makes his class difficult. He will take off points for not showing unnecessary work and requires that we can not use prior knowledge to our advantage. Would not recommend. :(

I strongly believe that Dr. Puri was fully committed to ensuring that every individual in the class learned the material. If anyone failed this class, it could not possibly be the fault of the teacher. I've learned a great deal in this class, and feel prepared for my next semester classes.
