in class rajan makes a lot of mistakes on the board and its hard to follow along with what he is trying to say. he makes up for it by giving you the questions for each midterm. his grading is pretty hard and u get screwed for the final because its standardized for each class and he cant give u the questions but u will make up for it on the midterms

Take Rajan!! He always tries to make sure everyone understands what's happening in class. Sometimes what he says doesn't make sense in class but tests are so easy and he will tell you exactly what type of problems will be on it. There are only 4 exams and usually 1 WebAssign every week 10/10 recommend.

Professor Pendergraft is completely unprepared in general. She assigns three hours of homework on a Sunday night due Monday morning. She often forgets to post the homework and is forced to catch up later in the week with multiple assignments in one day, and she is a critical grader as she wants as much power as possible. Would not take again.

She's a good professor and is very understanding, I feel like if you need extra help with latin you should look for other resources because she's so advanced she doesn't know how to dumb it down when you need help if that makes sense.
She doesn't give clear explanations and gives very vague directions on assignments and tests but is a very specific and picky grader. Her feedback is also not very helpful.

This class is a complete joke. Good ole Mary just stands in front of class talking about Greek history which we do nothing with. You write 10 pages double space (so easy) and you share them with her in a google folder and she makes comments. You have time to edit them but her "edits" are horrendous and misguiding. Shes cold hearted and unforgiving
She is very vague when it comes to tests and quizzes. The way she teaches isn't very effective but if you do the work and participate in class then you should do fine.
For lat 212 it's a must to read before class every day. Great person and very nice but extremelyyyy boring in class. Directions on tests can be very vague and she's very picky on them.

She teaches Greek thoroughly and is painfully nice, but lecture classes with her...  don't put yourself through the torture.  She knows her stuff, but she's incredibly monotonous and boring to listen to.  I love ancient history, but not with her.

This class is horrible, simply put. Pendergraft is a nice person but as a teacher she just doesn't have it. She is very smart but rambles constantly and does not specify direction well for tests and papers. The class is taught directly from the textbook, which is pretty dry reading material. She is also an extremely weird grader, giving vague and u

Dr. Forti is SOOO sweet and nice. She really cares about her students and makes adjustments if class expresses stress. If FYS 100 THRIVE is offered def take it. There are like 3/4 total papers but gave everyone 100s.

Dr. Forti was amazing for FYS-100. She is super caring and wants all of her students to succeed. The only assignments are a few papers and she grades them fairly. I absolutely loved her and would recommend her.

She is extremely caring and cares about her students. She is also super flexible and will give extensions as needed. There are a lot of readings and papers but they're easy readings and as long as you do what is expected for the papers you get a 100.

Dr.Forti was a great FYS professor, she is very understanding and tries to make every class engaging. While the class is essay heavy, the instructions are clear, the assignments are given in advance, and she is not a harsh grader.

Dr. Forti is just the best. We had to write 4 papers but that was it and she gave everyone good grades. She is super understanding and we basically just talk about life the whole time. This was my fav class during the semester.
She is super kind and passionate about what she teaches. I took her Thrive FYS and would recommend to anyone.

Dr. Forti led an amazing FYS 100 Course! She is so engaging and always encourages student led conversation. She makes an effort to get to know every single one of her students and is continually happy to celebrate meaningful remarks shared in class. Definitely take her class (FYS 100 Thrive) if you can!!

Dr Forti was my teacher for my FYS this semester. She so cute and such a sweet person. I enjoyed her teaching style and was interested in the course because of her. We only had a few assignments throughout the semester which were projects and papers. She is flexible and a fair grader.

This professor is absolutely TERRIBLE. She has no idea what she is teaching and is not even able to answer students' questions. She is not clear at all on what will be on exams and none of what she teaches translates to our quizzes or tests. The exams are significantly more difficult and no amount of studying will help you pass them. NEVER TAKE!

How is she a professor? I'm very glad there are only a few weeks left in the semester, and from talking to my peers in other sections I know that I have some serious catching up to do. She is funny, and nice, but she doesn't really seem to know much about anything. She often googles answers, and appears to be confused in general. Embarrassing!

She seems completely out of her comfort zone. She seems nice and supportive, but that doesn't help much in the end. If you learn from an idiot, you'll probably end up with the knowledge of an idiot. I tried switching into a different section. My advice: Run! You won't learn anything.
She is one of the best professors I have ever had in my life. Always available after class and tries to find new ways to make you understand a concept.

Awful. I agree with the other ratings on the brownies. They are amazing. But that doesn't exactly make for a qualified chemistry instructor. I had no idea that she was still a graduate student, but I guess that explains why she has no idea how to teach. She does treat us like little children. Worried that I will be unprepared for future courses.

She is the most amazing chemistry teacher ever!! she is the one who persuade me to continue on with chemistry and I truly feel like I am learning a lot. She is my favorite professor at Wake Forest thus far and truly does know chemistry. I 100% recommend taking her!! SHE MAKES AMAZING BROWNIES!!!

She doesn't know how to teach and is clearly completely inexperienced. She has not even finished her degree yet. I didn't come to Wake Forest to be taught by an incompetent graduate student. The milk and brownies she brought for our first exam were delicious, but this is college, not kindergarten. Easy exam. Overall a very disappointing experience.

Dr. Albrecht clearly cares about her students, which shows with progress checks and feedback in class. She makes sure students understand what is being taught, and if there are any questions, she is easily accessible. The grading is very emphasized on grammar and other concepts, so you have to be spot on, but other than that, it is a solid class.
212 is tough, you need her to like you. All you gotta do is go to a couple office hours, which are helpful too, and participate a lot in class. If you do that, and study hard, youll get an A

I love Dr. Albrecht. While her homework does feel like busy work, she really cares about her students and respects different learning styles. If you work hard and ask for help, she tends to be a nice grader. She clearly knows that 212 is a required level, and she does not grade it outrageously harshly.

Do not take this class unless you want to take a divisional class that is harder than organic chemistry. I worked my butt off for this class which should have been my easiest with science classes, but never received above a 90 for anything. Refused to bump up my grade slightly even though I never missed a single class and its impossible to do well.
HARD GRADER. Loved Spanish before this class, I have now vowed to never take another college Spanish class again. She's a sweet lady, just not a professor I would ever take again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I came into the class with the idea that Spanish was my favorite subject. However, after Dr. Albrecht's class, my passion is no where near where it used to be. She is a tough grader, assigns unreasonable amounts of homework and teaches mainly about Art History from the 1600s. She does not do a great job teaching students the importance of languages
VERY HARD GRADER. I haven't gotten above a 90 on any of the tests or papers. It's a lot of reading, oral reports, writing, and discussing so be prepared everyday
Dr. Judy is one of the best Spanish professors at Wake! Very caring and engaging teaching style. Grading is fair, and the class is straightforward and not overly burdensome. I would recommend!

The teacher gives discussions post for every class that are due at 5pm the day BEFORE class (Sundays 5pm or Tuesdays 5pm). This is extremely irritating and even had times where homework was due at 5pm on FRIDAYS. Very critical with participation grades, if people had to miss class or leave early (even for good reason) we would be docked points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: avoid at all costs
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Do NOT take if you don't participate. She is the harshest grader I've ever had even going to the bathroom for too long decreases your participation points. She tries to ask how we're dealing with stress at the beginning of class, yet, is the fuel of my stress. Very interesting material and class though. SUNDAY 5PM DISCUSSION POSTS are death
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Too much work for a fys. Im taking hard classes this semester and this class had the most work by FAR. Strictest grader and doesnt take any excuses even when youre sick. Do not take if you can help it unless youre interested in language. Have to read articles/watch videos that can take up to 2 hours before the 2 discussion posts each week.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: For a FYS class seems much more difficult than friends that had other FYS classes. It was linguistic discrimination and I definitely learned a lot, but not exactly what you want to take for your GPA. She is amazing, but grades harsher than necessary.

Tiffany is a great professor! This was my first time taking spanish and she did a wonderful job at teaching us loads of material without it being too overwhelming. She is such a sweetheart and really wants to see you do well. She's always available for extra help. And she sometimes brings her precious dog to class!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: he rambles about funny stuff then grades u pretty light, tests are online. goat
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: he is a legend. may he come back one day.

Professor Moog is defenitely a character but a great prof! Actually learned a lot about culture through his interesting stories. He goes on rants a lot so the class ends up being funny. Def great divisional as hw is readings that can be easily skimmed. Only a few pop quizzes that were broad. 2 online midterms with study guides and one final paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Lots of talking about random topics yet the class is easy to follow along. He is a weird yet funny guy who will ask the class lots of questions. We had two online tests with a few in-class reading reading quizzes that were simple.

Dr. Moog is an awesome guy. We only had about 3 quizzes in his class and they were based on the reading and were super broad. Even if you just skimmed the book, you would be fine. There is hardly any assignments besides the 2 exams and one final paper since his class is genuinely just talking in lecture. I love this guy!

Great! Ant 114 had reading quizzes, a midterm + final(not cumulative), and one paper. He was a good communicator and tried to make the class interesting. You can tell he enjoys what he is teaching about.  There are pop reading quizzes worth a good percent of your grade but they are pass/fail so you should be fine if you even skimmed the chapter

Professor Moog is awesome, he really cares about the topics that we talk about in class. It may seem like he gives a good amount of reading but he does a great job covering material in class so if you miss reading every once in a while it isn't hard to follow along. I highly recommend it for divisional. Two tests, an essay, and participation.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Wilkins is one of the nicest professors I've had at Wake. Would recommend him for a divisional. There are three exams, two papers, and an out-of-class activity, so it's not too bad. There are a lot of readings, but that is typical of the history department and he rarely gave pop quizzes. The only complaint is it takes him a while to grade.

Dr. Wilkins is so nice, and you can really tell he loves what he does. There are not too many long assignments, mainly just essays for exams, and only reading for homework. Nothing we had to read was unmanageable. Sometimes his lectures were boring, but they were helpful to pay attention to for the discussion afterward. He responds to emails fast.

I genuinely enjoyed his class because he is such a nice professor. You can tell he is very invested into this course and loves what he does. The outside of class events he held were great as well. I did not regret going to them. The only downside are the some of the lectures are boring at times.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: When you think of stereotypical college professors, this is your guy. He is an amazing teacher that gives so many opportunities to get a good grade with multiple bonus opportunities, office hours that practically give you the answer and a simple grading structure. He doesn’t put grades in Canvas.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: hes a solid teacher and I would take his class again. His lectures can be a little boring at times but he's very helpful and cares about his students. participation is key in his class.

Kind of a strange guy, his lectures can be mundane and boring but he is very clear during them. A lot of reading that is sometimes unrelated to anything course wise. Still, he is a thoughtful and smart professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Wilkins is a very thoughtful and nice professor. Online classes required active participation, so be prepared for it but don't feel discourages if you don't participate much. You should do your readings and assignments on time to get an A. Although sometimes it can be a little overwhelming, Dr. Wilkins is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Ruddiman is awesome. You will be pushed in this class, but in the best way possible. He makes lectures fun and interesting, and is extremely helpful outside of class.

Amazing professor, very funny, knows his stuff. LOTS of readings, sometimes over 150 pages for a one class. That being said, he doesn't expect you to closely read the longer readings, more just skim and pull out key details. If you need any help with essays he is super helpful to talk to, and he has a no questions asked extension form.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Save yourself, do not take.

Dr. Ruddiman is the best and he's so funny. Even if you're not a history major, you should definitely take a class with Professor Ruddiman. He's a super chill guy, he cares for his students, and he makes history fun. He's an easy grader and he's always down to talk and answer any questions. It's impossible to fail this class.

This class was a lot of work, but Professor Ruddiman is a great teacher! There is a lot of reading (around 200 pages a week), and participation is required every class. There are two take home essays, and two in class essays (midterm and final). Professor Ruddiman is very engaging and cares about his students.
Very likable professor. Nice on grading if you participate. Lot of reading but only two essays in the semester no tests.
Fantastic professor. If you read the assignments closely and show thoughtful consideration of the material, you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Amazing and kind! His Wander and Write class was so fun. His lectures are well-thought out. Readings assigned at every class are usually easy and fun reads. There are 3 major papers and one fun final group project. Stress free class, writing prompts are pretty open to interpretation. Dr. Witzel leaves very inspiration comments and suggestions.

Super chill and laidback guy with good ideas to share. The essay prompts were flexible and outside of the box, so he lets you write and research what you're interested in. Rubrics were vague but he was an easy grader. His class can get a little boring and awkward when people aren't participating, so just read and prepare ahead of time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: There are three major writing assignments in his class and it wrapped up with a group project. There were also discussion posts and readings that were assigned. Take the class if you want to learn something and develop your skills. The textbook used was very practical and Witzel really knows how to engage a class. He grades fairly and is accessible
Love this man. He always trips over objects but is very inspirational. Easy grader too. Take his Tech Troubles class!

I loved Dr. Witzel's Werid nature writing course. Dr. Witzel is the sweetest man ever and he grades very reasonable and most assignments are graded for completion. Theres a few essays and a project within the curriculum but the topics are very interesting, and the class is very low stress.

Dr. Witzel is a great professor. His tech troubles writing course is both interesting and engaging. While he assigns a good amount of shorter writing assignments, the prompts are thought provoking and graded off of completion. When it comes to essays, Dr. W is a very fair grader and I feel he gives students deserving grades. Highly recommend Dr. W!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Witzel really makes you think about the topics covered in the course. Love his thoughts and feedback on the weird nature course. His expectations are clear and he grades more on content and analyses, rather than mechanical. Very understanding and also a good person in general. His class is very fun and interesting.

Dr. Witzel was an awesome WRI111 professor. We read and wrote a lot, but it was on fun and interesting stuff about how humans interact with the environment. We even wrote an analysis on Mad Max: Fury Road. At the end of the class, there is a group project, but I actually found it fun (highly dependent on the group assigned though).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I LOVE PROFESSOR RUSSELL. She is so nice and caring and you learn so much. There are no grades in this class which does make it easy but the way she taught I always wanted to put my best work out there. Her feedback is also so amazing. Take this class.
Take any class with Dr. Russell, she is the best professor!!! Very easy HW, essays are graded off completion, and you will become a better writer! I have recommened her class to everyone I know.

Dr. Russell was the best professor I had for freshman year and will remain the best throughout the rest of my college experience. I tried in class because I enjoyed the material about genre; it gave way to new thinking. Dr. Russell ensures each student gets the proper education and adapts her teaching style to each students learning style. Love her
Dr. Russell is the best!!!!!!!!

Dr. Russell is a great professor and makes the classroom environment very comforting for WRI-111. The workload is manageable, and she is very understanding if you genuinely need time to manage other classes. The class discussions are super enjoyable as well. I definitely recommend.
Take her for 111! great prof and makes writing super fun and unstressful

Prof Russell is the best and I really recommend her for WRI 111. The class brought me no stress, which could not be said for other WRI 111 profs at Wake. She does not believe in assigning writing a grade, so she grades you on the improvement and how you revise your rough draft compared to your final project. Take this course!!

The absolute nicest professor! Very caring and thoughtful with assignments, assessments and grading. You can tell she is an extremely smart person as well. Always provides good insight and feedback. Would recommend to anyone.

Dr. GT is actually such a kind person who really cares for her student's well-being. There is a good amt of reading outside of class and have pop quizzes based on them, but she always emailed out the questions the night before. Our midterm was take home and because our class was stressed about the final he made it take home too. DEF RECOMMEND.
a ridiculous amount of reading.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: super sweet and understanding! make sure you do your reading! can easily get an a!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr GT cares a lot about all her students. There is a lot of reading so you really have to be interested in the topic to understand the reading and apply them to the quiz questions, which are specific and to be able to participate in class which she really emphasizes. She does offer a lot of accommodations like a take home midterm.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Super nice and caring. Wants you to enjoy learning. Take home midterm as well

Dr. GT is such a character I love her. I took this class originally just to knock out the divisional, but it ended up being super interesting and I actually really enjoyed it. It is a lot of reading I will say, but it isn't too hard. The pop quizzes scared me at first, but as long as you do the reading you're good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: REL113 or Jewish Traditions. Take the other teacher. Most people dropped our class and there is an unreasonable amount of reading.

Stay away. - easily the worst professor I've had at WFU. Professor Heckelman is a mean-spirited individual and grades correspondingly. I found him funny/quirky after the first few classes, but this feeling quickly dissipated as his true self came out. Wouldn't recommend any interactions with Heckelman, let alone taking his classes.
Professor Heckelman is a great professor! He cares about his students and willing to help outside of classroom.
Took for social choice and he didn't make it very interesting.  Tests were pretty tough and they were the only thing you were graded on besides a paper at the end. Hard to sit through dry class.
Daily quizzes, tests are extremely hard. Class is a drag you need to teach the material to yourself to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He is a good teacher but tests are near impossible. Doesnt seem like the tests parallel what is taught in the class and your whole grade is based on three tests and some homework.
he knows what he's talking about and teaches the material interestingly
No Comments

Dr. Silman is a super great professor. His slides are confusing, but the test will not be hard as long as you follow the tutorial and go to his office hours. The test he graded boosted my grades by a lot! Take him if he is the prof for the second half of Bio 160. He knows a lot of ecology stuff, which is super cool!

Professor Silman is a great person, his dry humor sprinkled into lectures makes them go by quickly. Be warned, make sure to read the texts before class, since he cold calls, and prepares us well for the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Silman was so kind. He explains the material very clearly, and will take great measures to ensure you understand course concepts if you come to him with questions.

The course is very interesting, but his lectures were kind of all over the place and difficult to follow. They also moved to quickly. He is available for extra help, so if you put in the work you can do fine in the class.

Really confusing professor.  Would not reccommend him for ecological and evolutionary biology, especially because it is half taught by Silman and half taught by Anderson, which makes it even more confusing.

Silman was a great professor and definitely go to Peru with him if you can!  He's not the most helpful teacher outside of class though; he just seems like he's a little more interested in his research than his students.
Awesome prof, knows everything... go to Peru
Great professor in class but is a tough grader. Students normally get a B in the class.
DO NOT TAKE HER.

Dr. Brown really cared about the lectures and material she was teaching. She had high expectations for assignments but often took time to give clear instructions prior to submitting. Her exams were fair, and she provided a lot of partial credit on them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: would never take again. she was not understanding of personal circumstances and graded unnecessarily hard for a divisional class

Dr. Brown is one of my favorite professors I've had. You can tell she really enjoys teaching and cares about her students, and is super understanding. We did have readings for every class but they were usually a pretty manageable length and as long as you stay on top of your readings you'll be fine.
Take this professor. Trust me. It doesn't matter what class you take her for. You'll be glad you read this post. She's by far the best professor I've had.

Dr. Brown is fun and loves what she does. She emphasizes the importance of going to her office hours and she loves to just get to know all of her students. In the classroom, the workload is just enough to not be overwhelming. She doesn't grade papers hard at all. Also, if you can't/don't want to go to class, she says it's okay as long as you email.

It's an hour and 15 of straight lectures that really don't convert to any assignment. You use the textbook to write the 4 essays throughout the class. Participation is somewhat considered. Neal himself is actually a really funny guy but I'm not sure he has any self-awareness to the fact that no one listens to his lectures.

A roller coaster of a class but it's very easy to get a 100. He just talks the whole time, no need to pay attention. Easy to fade class. There's 4 essays and a project and no other grades. Make sure to look at syllabus because I missed one of the essays.

Dr. Neal is an interesting professor, and man overall. He is able to rant about religion and the studies of various religions in one stream of consciousness and is sometimes hard to follow. There are few grades aside from four 1,000 word papers and attendance. There was no final exam given to my class.

This course was for the most part a study hall. The grade is composed of three papers and a group project. The papers arent graded hard if you just answer the prompt and follow the order of the textbook. You don't have to listen in class because there are no tests or final. The group project is graded hard though and it's a big part of your grade.

He's a very smart guy, but I think he's kinda lost his mind. The way he repeats everything he says is really funny. His lectures are just rambling, so you can just look at your computer the whole time. It's easy if you complete the essays on time, but I didn't and he isn't lenient with late work. There's also no final, even though he says there is.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Bizarre class here. only take it if you never plan to study religion again. essentially everyone gets a 100 if you follow directions. class is basically a proctored study hall. good for freshman fall divisional

Prof. Neal is odd. His lectures are extremely confusing to follow. Your grade is only made up of 4 papers and a final presentation. You can get a 10/10 on all your papers, and then end up with an A-/B+ because of your presentation. Class participation will earn you some credit in the class. Do not take him if you want to continue in religion.
She's s great professor she's not going to make it easy on you. She's getting us prepared for being great lawyers. I would take her again.

Professor Curry is the single worst professor I have ever had. Merely getting her in law school is an indication that maybe you should just leave and come back next year- you're not going to be learning anything this time around. Is unable to follow deadlines, fails to follow her own advice, grades arbitrarily. Drop out if you get her.
Awful.  Will never take her again.

She is by far the worst professor I have ever had. I'm not sure what she is doing at wake law. She is not prompt with grading or even handing out assignments. She rambles on and on and on, and she changes class times at the last minute. She has no respect for her students time. I will never take a course from her again.
Prof. Curry is great!  Her expectations are high and you learn a lot.  Most importantly, she prepares you for practice. Her wry sense of humor is also entertaining.
awful

She seems to have zero respect for any of the qualities that will encourage success in our profession.  She ignores deadlines and standards.  She is also inconsistent with what she says in class and her comments when she grades the papers.  I don't think she actually abides by the anonymous grading policy either.

Dr Powell is easily the best professor I have ever had. Granted he teaches my favorite subject, but he is extremely helpful and always willing to answer questions and meet with students. If you have any interest in Classics do not miss the opportunity to take his classes

extremely knowledgeable about his subject, he talks a lot and quickly but it's because he loves what he teaches that much, he likes to meet with students outside of class, it is a challenging course though so be prepared

Professor Powell is very enthusiastic about his subject matter and expresses a tremendous knowledge about mythology and classical languages.  I found that the tests required a lot of memorization while his papers required more analytical thinking.

Really great teacher.  He is very passionate about teaching and is always willing to help.  Class participation is important, as each day the homework is reviewed in class.  I reccommend taking a class of his!!!
Brilliant professor who expects a lot but will help you if you ask.  Learns the names of all his students by the 2nd class, even in classes of 40 students.

Prof. Powell was one of my absolute favorite professors at WFU.  Yes, he is challenging and he certainly does not give grades, but he is truly a scholar and a fascinating man.  He's very old-school, which is also awesome.  His tests are complex and require more than just cramming, but A's are possible.

His exams are tough because he expects you to remember the names of [spelled correctly] EVERY SINGLE character [minor and major]. I loved mythology, but hated his course. I felt like a machine trying to cram every tiny detail.You really have to work hard and study ALOT.

If you have the chance to take Eric Wilson: do it. The course has a lot of work but every second is worth it. He is an AMAZING Professor I have never learned more from anyone else in my life. If you show up to class and actually listen to what he is saying and take notes, he tells you everything you need to know for the tests! Loved it.

It is a creative non-fiction class, but we also have great discussions of the readings. He's incredibly interesting, and he gives good and helpful feedback on our writing. One of the best classes I have taken at Wake.
Wilson is the best professor I had at Wake.  His class on Romantic Poetry was phenomenal.  He is a tough professor, but if you work for it, you will be rewarded.

Nonfiction workshop is disappointing.  We are asked to read a lot of essays, etc. (good!) but frequently don't talk about some of them in class (bad!).  We also have very silly weekly assignments from a writing book. Come on! Can't you come up with your own prompts for us?! Also, way too much "philosophizing" instead of serious talk about craft.
Self congratulatory hack
He is an awesome professor. One of the best I have ever had. The material is a little challenging but because he is so enthusiastic, students can't help but get into it.
No Comments

Good professor overall, it was a flipped classroom. The tests progressively got harder, I did very well on all of the other assignments but the tests got me to an A-. The oral exams are not terrible, the written exams are the problem. He gives the outline beforehand but the test is always harder than the outline so get ready to study up.
I stink at Spanish and took him for 212 because I had to for a requirement, but he was easily the best spanish teacher I've ever had. Take him for 212 if you can.

For 212 Best Spanish prof here. Super nice and wants you to learn Spanish. Downside is exams are two days long, one has grammar and vocab and the other has culture, but you can study the night before and be fine. Tons of chances to boost your grade w presentations and daily 5Q quizzes. Very talkative and cold calls, but helped me learn better.

He is so kind and passionate about Spanish. He cares about his students and really wants everyone to do the best they can. Study guides before exams helped to outline most everything you need to know! He's amazing and I highly recommend him.

Dr. Francom made class interesting and overall was not as boring as I thought it would be. Do the daily prep stuff and study for the exams and it should be an easy A. Great dude I wish I could take him for my next spanish class. Also he is a charades god iykyk.

Professor Francom had a great deal of passion and cared more about your learning from the course than your mark. Although he was a forgiving grader on the final, make sure you are familiar with the material before the test. Although there were numerous tasks, they were simple and were covered in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Francom is very energetic and clearly wants everyone in the class to do well. He engages with everyone. He also is a lenient grader on tests. Spanish isn't an easy subject but Professor Francom breaks it down well and helps you learn
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Francom is so passionate about what he does. He gets so excited about the language. I heard SPA309 was super hard and miserable to go through, but Dr. Francom's class helped me confirm that I want to major in Spanish. Took another class with him because of how good a professor he is!! 100% would recommend taking any of his classes!

Very kind and caring as a person, but she didn't give adequate feedback for assignments and took a long time to grade major assignments. Since a lot of work was graded at the end of the term, many of us  were blindsided with a grade we didn't expect.
Very unclear on grading and everyones final grade was much lower than expected. Also cold calls in class even if you are paying attention.

Dr. Young is a great professor, meaning she is knowledgeable about her area of study, and she explains how students should properly analyze data and write reports. She is very specific about how she wants the reports to look, and she grades harshly based on the criteria, but she will always give direct responses, reply to emails, and make class fun
Super nice - just sort of assigns arbitrary values for grades and gives vague assignment descriptions.
Dr. Young is a great teacher, always accessible and clear on assignments.
She is an amazing professor, although she does grade tough. Although, she is actually quite sympathetic, and if you can make a good point she is always willing to help you out if needed.

Very fun to work with and discuss engineering problems. Gives great feedback on assignments, but doesn't provide a clear rubric. Major assignments graded by TA, but can ask for her to review it to get points back if graded too harshly. Very lengthy end-of-project paper but very satisfying. Overall, fun professor in a very work-heavy class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Great professor in an insanely boring class. Super great person
Living goat right here

Great class—more work than most FYS classes, but if you like reading, the class is for you. Dr. Green is a great professor and is super helpful. Go to office hours before turning in essays. I will say there are only two grades per semester but participation is a large chunk, so if you can do well in discussions, you're good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Greene's FYS class is just a glorified book club. We read 8 books in the semester and discussed the assigned readings in every class. There were no exams, so you're only graded by a few essays and in-class participation. He's very amicable and never fails to make the class laugh, but I would only recommend if you love reading novels.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Hes so nice and so passionate, amazing prof
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He is the best prof ever! Soooo nice and fun and makes class super interesting. He is sarcastic and funny and cares about his students. His exams are pretty hard tho but if you read the textbook and study you should be fine. Attendance is optional but class is fun so everyone goes. Def take him!

Take Dr. Greene! His class is a lot of fun and actually feels meaningful. His discussion questions really make you think and although there is a lot of reading due for each class, there are only 3 papers. If you want to have genuine discussions about books and write the occasional essay, this is the class for you.

He is so so caring about his students and can sympathize with their work load. His lectures are very interesting, thoughtful, and flexible. He listens to his students and receive that feedback as he is always looking to be a better professor. The books we read are amazing, but I would take this class just to have Professor Greene!

Dr. Greene spends most of the lectures talking about things that are irrelevant. He moves extremely fast through the slides and doesn't leave much time for questions. He'll put a lot of info on exams from the textbook not covered in class. I studied for probably 10 hours for each exam and the highest grade I got was a B-. Will not be taking again.

Super interesting guy with a really unique approach to teaching. At times it was boring but grade wise was super easy and lots of bonus points. Material was pretty interesting and in class exercises were a lot of fun. I recommend it.

Awesome guy. In his FYS we just did team building style games every day which were fun. You have to write for 1 page reports on interviews and one presentation at the end and that's pretty much the only work. You do have to stay on top of what he does assign though and be on time to class because he is strict when it comes to punctuation.

Professor Moser is a really great FYS professor. The course load is manageable and the content is applicable to the real world. I gained a lot from this course. However, he is very old school. You are only allowed to have handwritten notes, no technology is permitted in class unless otherwise told.

Professor Moser has been my favorite professor at Wake. Definitely one of the easiest FYS options out there and also super helpful and inspirational. Classes are always fun with all of the competitions in class.

If you are able to get into this FYS, take it! Professor Moser is an interesting guy and the course itself has a lot of interesting material. I will remember some of this stuff for the rest of my life! On top of that, it's extremely easy. 95% of the class ends with an A or A-, which is unheard of with other professors. Can't recommend it enough.

He is one of my favorite professors I've had. His class is very useful and applicable outside the classroom. Every assignment is purposeful. He is truly a wise guy who genuinely wants the best for his students. We did class exercises and he shared many cool stories. I feel so lucky to of had such an awesome professor! I got a lot out of the class.

SUCH A GEM!! I love Professor Moser so much. We did fun team building exercises and if you show up you basically get an A. Amazing amazing person, even invites his students over for food at the end of the semester! 10/10 take Buz.
Lectures are really not related to the exams. Super nice professor and funny in class, but exams are mostly on specific material from the textbook not talked about in class.

Nice professor with many corny jokes or bad references. I hate her lectures, slow, numbing, hand written, USLESS, lectures. I only learned form the textbook. Better yet the test format is very different from the lectures. She would offer swaths of information and then nitpick bs material for the exam. God awful class structure and teaching format.

She is kind and relatable, but her lectures focus on definitions, while the tests are math heavy. Homework on Canvas is closer to the tests but isn't always mentioned. Grades rely on two midterms and a final, so prepare well! Overall, she's a good professor, but the disconnect between lectures and tests can be frustrating.

I already knew half of the class from macro in highschool otherwise I probably would have struggled - friendly and caring but not an amazing teacher. No homework except for a 10ish question open notes quiz on canvas every week, you have teach yourself a bit with textbook and online videos but not horrible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not sure why others are saying she's bad, I really liked her. Literally zero homework, just read the txtbook and take in class notes and there's a 10ish question takehome quiz at the end of each week. She drops two lowest quizzes. One project 2 exams and a final.

She is nice but a very tough grader on tests, especially with short answers even when she tells you that she is laidback. You basically have to read the articles to teach yourself the content of the class so you mostly have to teach yourself.
While she was nice, she was not a great professor. I felt as though I taught myself most of the material, and she graded unfairly when it came to short answer.

One of the worst Econ professors. Nice lady and fairly accessible but you basically have to teach yourself everything if you want an A. While we were struggling other Econ  teachers were offering dropped tests and bonus points.
Good teacher overall. She is very nice and tries to make class interesting with her soccer-mom jokes.

Dr H. was on maternity leave when I took this class, but the homework assignments were reading-heavy and long. They help prepare you for papers and count towards your grade, so do it. She considers how much you improve from your rough to the final draft when grading. She cares about what she teaches and says she often gives A's. Easy A class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Easiest A for WRI-111. Took it for rhetoric of food and she was super chill about turning in stuff late occasionally and helping you out if you wanted to learn more. Solid class all around.
Her class was a lot of work, but she is a good instructor and will make you a better writer. She is also very kind to her students.

** I took Dr. Harrison for WRI 340, not WRI 111. Dr. Harrison is one of my favorite professors I have taken at Wake. She genuinely cares about her students and recognizes that we are all just people trying our best. She encourages you to take steps outside of your comfort zone and challenges your ideas on rhetoric. I could not recommend her more!

Dr. Harrison is a great professor for WRI 111! Toward the beginning of the year, it may seem like a lot of work, but it definitely evens out in the end. Dr. Harrison is so understanding, and flexible with due dates. The way she organizes her class makes so much sense and I have learned so much from her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very easy grader. Lots of writing is required, but all the homework is helpful in creating essays later on. All of the homework felt like it had a point. Lots of work, but it pays off when you turn in anything as she gives almost everyone an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She is no doubt my favorite professor during my first semester. She is extremely understanding and says herself that she isn't a fan of the grading system or due dates. As long as you do the work you will get an A. If you ever don't feel like going to class just email her before class and you are good. I recommend her to anyone taking WRI 111.

One of the best professors I've ever had at Wake. She is extremely kind and gives great feedback. Some busy work but the portfolios you create in the course can really be tailored to your interest. If you complete all the work and listen to your feedback you will likely get an A. Also gives tons of examples of the projects and papers to look at.

She always rubbed me the wrong way. She makes you buy a course packet with printed out NYT articles for $40.. She was always extremely picky with your writing, knocking points off for something she never included in the rubric so you would never know. She also NEVER answers emails... Be ready to participate or your grade will drop.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She is very warm and friendly. You do a lot of reading, but many are pretty interesting. There are some fairly easy pop quizzes over them (2 questions each) and other easy assignments throughout the class. Her essay grading is very fair. Probably my favorite writing teacher/professor I've had. She really cares about her students.

I adore Elizabeth. She provides such a calming space, and her course is very intentional. She truly cares about her students! She is clear about assignments, open-minded, and very kind with analysis of poetry and creative writing. I never feel judged or ridiculed. I could write an essay about how safe she makes our class feel!
Thank you, Elizabeth!

Literally one of the kindest and most understanding professors on campus. She makes her classes interesting and engaging, and that's coming from a premed stem major taking the class as a divisional. The workload is not heavy, and classes are always fun
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Nice person. Do the readings. Go to office hours/writing to get to know her! Class is discussion based, so do the readings. Take this WRI 111 class, you'll be better for it. She encourages class meditation, which feels goofy but is actually really nice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Whitehead is a great Writing 111 teacher! You still have work in this class (3 papers) but it is super manageable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Whitehead was an incredible professor as well as a mentor. She genuinely cares about her students and it shows in her class and in the workshops that she holds. As a first-year student, I felt very comfortable and welcomed by her. Great class, you should definitely take it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a really nice person and is clearly passionate about the subject he teaches. Sometimes, however, he does not explain the problem(s) or topic(s) as thoroughly as he should, which can cause some confusion. I would suggest doing as many of the bonus questions as you can and memorizing not only how to do certain problems, but the theorems.

Before I took this class, I really hated math. It confused me, and just didn't make sense. I can honestly say this professor has really changed my outlook on the whole thing. He doesn't start with high up theorems, but rather with a problem solving approach. His tests are very fair, and the homework he assigns really helps. Highly recommended!
Great teacher. Great class. Just keep up with all the homeworks and ask questions whenever you have them and you will be fine. Also make sure to do all the extra credit assignments.
Excellent and one of the best teachers - EVER!!!
No Comments

Professor Robinson is easily the best teacher that I have had so far here at Wake.  He truly cares that his students learn the material and explains complicated math equations clearly enough to make them seem obvious.  Take him!!
This is the nicest guy you will ever meet.  Also, he knows his material and keeps you interested in what he is teaching.

Professor Rabby is very accommodating and you can tell he wants you to succeed in his class. Tests weigh a good amount so it's difficult to get an A in the class without receiving A's on exams. Labs and Homework are simple and he gives lots of time to complete. Although lectures are a bit boring you must pay attention to understand the material.

Dr. Rabby is a really nice guy and a funny little man. Stats is not my favorite, but I'm sure if you like it more you'll be fine. His class was lecture-based with 5 lab assignments, 5 homeworks, 5 in-class activities, and 3 exams and a cumulative final. I would recommend if you have to take it for your major even though I didn't love the class.

The content is hard and lectures are honestly boring but it's easy to get lost so pay attention. Multiple assignments that allow you to keep average up or bring it up if needed. There are 3 major exams plus the final and a bunch of homework and lab assignments that are work but help you keep your grade up.

Dr. Rabby's lectures were pretty boring and he would often contradict himself and give out incorrect answers. There isn't a lot of homework given. He rarely takes attendance. If you don't have previous experience in stats, I wouldn't recommend taking his class.

His lectures are so boring and there's no motivation to go to class. Also, he doesn't seem like an expert and often contradicts himself or does problems wrong. The tests were always harder than I thought they were going to be, even though I studied and prepared my cheat sheet. Also, he never gives new practice problems which is super unhelpful.

The class is easy and the exams are fair. However, this class feels super long and the lectures aren't super engaging. If you haven't taken a stat class before, it might be more challenging for you. I wouldn't suggest this class and professor if you don't have previous knowledge of the subject matter. He also sometimes contradicts himself.

Professor Rabby is always very energetic and well prepared. He also really knows his stuff when it comes to statistics and anything related to engineering, and he was willing to help outside whenever needed. I would 10/10 recommend

Really nice and easy teacher. Easy grading structure- lets you drop your worst mid-term (take 3). Not a great teacher though, focuses on teaching the why of topics instead of just simply how to do something. Really great guy though. If you took calc in high school and did fine you should be chilling.

I would recommend Merkx if took Calculus in high school. First, he drops your lowest midterm (you only take 3) and small quizzes/homework boosts your overall grade. He is a super nice teacher, and his tests are much easier and fairer than some other calculus professors. Attendance is only mandatory once a week for easy quizzes.

He is a great guy and the curve is INSANE. A 90 is a A and 87 is A- He drops your two lowest grades from each category (hw, quizzes, and midterms). Only drops one of three midterms. The negative is that he does not really teach so if you have not taken calculus before you will have to learn from videos. If you've taken calc before take him bc curve
Very smart guy and super understanding and nice

He's a really nice guy, but almost too smart to teach such a low level calculus. If you are good at calc you will be fine by just watching khan academy. But his lectures are very boring and super hard to follow because he can't really dumb it down. Quizzes are easy and frequent. And he drops lowest exam grade.

He is a very nice guy and his tests are straight forward, but he is terrible at teaching. You will most likely have to teach everything yourself as his lectures are extremely confusing and very unhelpful. Take another professor, you will thank yourself.

Peter Merkx is very nice but just not a good professor. His lectures are unstructured and he just writes all over the chalkboard with no clear direction. He mumbles and goes on about random stuff as well. If I didn't take calc in high school I would be doing very poorly on the tests. He is very understanding and nice though.

Took this class for a concentration requirement. He can give unclear expectations and he lacks in the communication skills. He is very passionate about his job and cares about how we are in and out of class! I would recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Lots of reading for every class but we usually aren't tested on the material until the tests. Tests are easy if you do the reading. There are only two tests and a few short writing assignments. Class can be boring if you aren't interested in the material but it's not difficult.

While the class has a light workload and he was an easy grader, I needed a recommendation from him for a program I was applying for and even though I asked him well before the deadline, he refused to write me a recommendation which kind of shows his generally lazy personality. Easy grader but not a great professor if that's what you're looking for.

It was a pretty easy course, he was pretty flexible with deadlines and assignments. He can go off-topic but it's usually fairly interesting. There's not too much work other than readings but he gives ample time for written assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: he likes to go off topic and this class was pretty much discussion based everyday about the readings and articles he presents- lots of documentary watching and the reading is not that hard and barely took up any time comparatively; will let class out early and is a pretty easy grader
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Took him for FYS 100. Pretty cool guy, really fun and caring and he seems to really enjoy and get invested in whatever he's teaching. I do believe this was his first time doing an FYS so that could explain it but he did seem unorganized at times and unclear with directions/deadlines, although he was always available to clarify. Graded pretty fairly

Dr. Johnston is allll over the place. Very unorganized, boring lectures, and a relatively harsh grader for FYS. Very nice guy though he is very passionate about what he teaches. Do yourself a favor and just dont take him if you are trying to get divisional out of the way.
I liked the class at first but I wish it had more modern love stories. The whole course was Shakespeare/ancient authors. It would've been cool to analyze modern films/books/music too.
He is a very nice and knowledgeable professor who allows us to grade ourselves. The course is definitely on the hard side for me as a non-native English speaker, but still very inspirational.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Wasn't sure what to expect going in. He is super smart and engaging. I really enjoyed the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: He can be very nice and walk you through questions, but if he doesn't agree with a point you make, he will let you know and you can't really try to make your case more.  He also looks for very specific answers and is occasionally mistaken about plot points, but does try to inspire discussion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He is the absolute best prof I have had. He wants all of his students to succeed and learn no matter what. He is always happy to meet with you outside of class and isn't mad when you can't answer a question. Rather he will walk you through it in a very kind manner.

Dr. Warren is so nice, and wants the best for his students. He puts learning and understanding the material over harsh grading. With my class he did "ungrading" in which we got to pick our final grades and I thought it great to have that freedom and everyone in the class put in the same amount of effort as they would have if he was grading
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I took Warren's class for my FYS: Ancient and Modern Love Stories. It wasn't bad-there was a lot of reading, a few tests, and a paper or two. The main issue was the he does not believe in 100's. There are other FYS's that are easier but there were also harder ones. Also, his lectures are his tests (he even canceled our last test so-not too bad).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: professor Cianci will come to class, she will go at a lightening pace and expect you to keep up with her speed, if you don't keep up and ask for help, she would say other students are keeping up, why can't you? You'll be left wondering what in the world is she talking and then she'll single out good students and be their best buddy
Professor Anna is good but she goes at a pace that no one could catch up and then you will be left wondering what's to be done and how to complete.
Dr. Cianci is a true gem at WFU. She goes above and beyond for her students. I can't say enough kind things about her
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Tough class but Cianci is super sweet and awesome. Otherwise her stuff is standardized with other ACC 111 sections

She is nice and is always available to meet with outside of class. She is good at answering questions and willing to help when you get confused. The class is hard but it doesn't really matter what ACC 111 professor you get because all of the hw, quizzes, lectures, and exams are exactly the same. Cianci is a little bit nicer than Hudson though.

Professor Cianci was one of the best professors I've ever had. She is the kind of professor that really wants her students to learn even if it means pushing yourself a little. She genuinely cares about her students and goes over concepts very clearly and extensively

Very passionate teacher about accounting but moves too fast and inadvertently causes it to become an almost entirely self-taught course. Students are expected to keep at her pace when the material is too hard to simply learn at the rate she teaches and too hard for one to learn on one's own.

Dr. Gonzalez makes this class so hard because he's so disorganized. I never knew my grade in this class until the very end. Class is funny but it's not helpful because he doesn't teach any content. We just practice in class but nobody gets it so we're like bulldozing through examples. Unless you're good at Spanish, don't take him.

He is a pretty entertaining lecturer but teaches in a really difficult way. The assignments are not posted on canvas, only on the syllabus, and he barely follows the textbook. He will email you what to do for class the next day the night before and has no idea how to use canvas or vhl. Awful organization would not take again. Easy grader though.

Not a huge Spanish fan, but he's THE MAN! You can tell he wants everyone to succeed. He almost gets disappointed when you don't participate. He wants you to participate even if the answer is wrong. Do the readings and VHL assignments for your own benefit, and you'll do well. Cucurrucucu!!!!!

LUIS IS THE MAN! He genuinely cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed. He never failed to make us laugh and engage with the class. Do the readings and quizzes before class for your own good, and you'll do fine. Make sure to participate!! Couldn't recommend more!!

Prof. Gonzalez CARES about his students and is the most genuine professor I have ever had. 309 is a difficult class, but he makes it less stressful by being funny and honest about how he wants you to succeed. He takes an incredibly difficult class and makes it fun.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor that genuinely cares about his students. Make sure to do the readings and practice before attending class, as it is to your own benefit. Not too many assignments to be turned in, and is up to each individual to practice for the class. Participation is a must!

I took him for 309, considered one of the hardest classes for majors/minors no matter who you take. He's a nice guy and very smart, but be prepared for tough exams. The compositions are okay, you can revise them but count as two separate grades. Also, he wrote the textbook so you use it frequently in class. I wouldn't take him again.

She's great and she actually want students to improve their writing. She's not the easiest and there is a lot of work but nothing too crazy. A lot of people in my class didn't do well but that was just because they were never showing up to class or doing anything for it. As long as you are present and participate in some way, you'll get an A.

Professor Branch is a great teacher. There are 4 major writing assignments that are not difficult and usually only a couple pages. You will have to do a reading note which can take like 45 minutes to an hour on about half of the readings, but besides that the class is not intensive at all, and you really just talk about the readings in class.

If you want an easy WRI 111 class, this is not it. There was reading notes due almost every class, with the readings being over 20 pages. Theres around 5 major projects, but she's honestly a really fair grader and will help you improve your writing. She's super sweet and truly cares about her students and is really flexible with extensions.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: she gives 100s if you do the work and it isn't a lot
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Branch is an extremely kind teacher who cares about writing. There are only 5 big writing assignments throughout the semester, with the longest of them being only 5 pages. Be prepared for a decent amount of group work in this class. As long as you do the work, you're guaranteed to have at least an 80. Loved the class and would take again!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things
Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Branch is a great teacher and definitely helps improve your writing. Reading load is difficult at times, and there is a good amount of writing. She's a tough grader but is clear about how she grades and gives solid feedback. Would take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you like to write, whether you are good or bad, take this class. There sort of was a lot of writing, but it became manageable. Some WRI 111 courses at Wake are jokes - she takes it seriously. Branch really cares about students' individual progress, and she will absolutely help you become a better writer if you take this course. She's great!
Super kind professor, but would grade writing assignments harshly. There were only a total of 5 writing assignments the whole semester, so each one matters.

I would literally rather gauge my eyes out with a rusty spoon coated in concentrated Hydrochloric Acid then take her class again. Terrible, absolutely terrible. She didn't even teach the material. I'm not taking out thousands of dollars of student loans to teach myself Spanish, that's your job Profesora Reliford.

In class we literally just went over the textbook activities and she never lectured us once; you really have to teach yourself the material. At the very least, she is quick with her grading and was not too harsh on compositions and orals. Daily quizzes were never on the assigned textbook pgs for that day, it was always on pgs from a few days before

This professor does not teach at all. I basically taught myself the entire material for this course. There are daily evaluations everyday and then during class you just go through activities in the book while she stand on her phone timing you. If you are willing to teach yourself and put a lot of work can still get a good grade.

The other reviews are spot on in every aspect except for the fact that she is a tough grader. Typically, my class would average an A on every composition, PE, and oral exam. Class doesn't have much homework, just to study for the daily evaluations and a PE per unit. As long as you are prepared and do your work you will get a good grade.

Nice lady, caring, and accessible, but very tough grader, assigns a ton of homework, and relies on the fact that you teach yourself everything based on assigned textbook reading. No teaching is done in class. Go to office hours, and she will help you when you are struggling. But overall an unnecessarily tough class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Does not teach and is very rude. Does not welcome conversation or give much help when you ask. All she does is practice activities and you have to teach all the lessons to yourself. Makes you feel dumb if you don't know an answer. Also only cold calls. Very harsh grader

This  teacher  does not teach. She assigns  VHL  then class is only devoted towards practice exercise. No teaching is done. She has a rather unpleasant demeanor also and is not open to conversations with students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The lab reports in this class are tedious and long, but they really help you understand the topics and improve writing in physics. Bonin does not deserve the hate because he is super caring and passionate. You might get stuck in a ten m convo w him after asking a simple question, but if you like physics it's great and he's always open to help/talk.

I'm not sure why there has been criticism of Dr. Bonin, this guy is amazing!! He has a great sense of humor and a real passion about physics that he shares with his students. He sometimes gets so excited when explaining physics that it's almost hilarious. He's also readily available to chat outside class. Real warm and friendly guy, love him!!

I dont understand why its being said that he is arrogant because I honestly dont see it. Hes super friendly and accessible, always willing to help and wants to make sure you understand stuff. He also tells funny stories and has a good sense of humor. The first lab report is graded harshly but after that the TAs grade them more nicely.

Bonin is very standoffish and arrogant and it makes getting any sort of help from him difficult. Kind of a hindrance when you're trying to figure out how to count microscopic oil droplets. Do not recommend.

Loves the subject he teaches, and loves teaching. The course takes a lot of hard work (it's physics), but there are plenty of laughs in class. He's got a good sense of humor. Keeps an open door policy, enjoys when students ask questions, always willing to help outside class. Curves. Fantastic prof, one of the best- I was sad when the year was over!
Easy to do well.
meh
We read four books. Write two papers (one is 1-2 pages and the other is 5 pages). Four small quizzes are included but they are super easy, you can drop one. Super easy divisional.

Easy divisional, there were 4 books and lectures during class time that the midterm pulls heavily from. A lot of it is just memorization and vocabulary. Nothing too complex or difficult and her grading is pretty lenient.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: We read four books that were pretty dense, but have to read them in order to do well on Final and Midterm. Also, you write two papers (one is 1-2 pages and the other is 5 pages). Four small quizzes are included but they are super easy. Dr. Clark is hilarious with the lectures, and this is a great divisional to take!
Great professor, cares about teaching, pretty easy class. Would highly recommend.
She's funny and the class is easy but not really worth it in my opinion . It gets repetitive, but its okay as a divisional.

Dr. Clark has an interesting FYS topic, but teaches it horribly. Get ready to go to an hour and fifteen minute class just to listen to lectures and questions that she answers herself. Not worth the time going in person. Workload is definitely manageable but such a boring lecture. Easy A but seriously not worth your time.

Dr. Clark was a good professor who makes you work for your grade in her class. She doesn't lecture quite a bit, but it is balanced out with her quirky sense of humor and anecdotal stories about the research that she's done. I enjoyed learning about the intersectionalities of poverty, race and gender and I would take a class taught by her again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I do not have a bad thing to say about Dr. Sakkal. I would take his class over and over again if I could. He is incredibly funny and kind, and is understanding about personal situations. Participation is a huge part of his classes, so if you want to sit in the back and tune out, don't take the class. But he is the best professor I have ever had!!

One of the best professors I've had at Wake. He pushes you to participate and you usually get lengthy readings for homework, but they're worth it. If you put in the work, this class & Dr. Sakkal will be great for you
One of the best professors I've had at Wake. Would take him over and over again if I could. Really cares about his students
One of my favorite professors at Wake I can only say good things about him.

Dr. Sakkal is amazing! The class was so easy all you had to do was show up and act interested. He cares so much about his students and what he is teaching. You might have to put some effort into actual class time but other than that the workload is so manageable and barely anything besides a project and 1 paper.

I had Dr. Sakkal for his Play in Physical and Digital Worlds FYS, and it was quite fun! He deeply cares about student learning and success, and is a nice, funny person. Grades were based on written work and projects, not exams.

I had Dr. Sakkal for EDU 311 in Fall 2021 and loved it! He's a great, funny guy who clearly cares about the subject and his students. The course is very interactive and participation-based, and there are no tests, only projects and papers. I highly recommend, one of my favorite classes I've had at Wake!
When emailed or asked to talk to out of class, he is not accommodating and can be very rude to students. He will grade assignments harshly and not give good feedback.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I really liked the layout of Dr. Plageman's class and while there were a lot of readings, the class was pretty manageable. There were several group projects and papers all of which were pretty enjoyable and fairly graded. He is a very understanding guy!
A lot of reading!!!! Lots of assignments as well, but also insightful and fair grading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Plageman is a wonderful professor who really cares about his student's successes. His comments are super helpful, and as long as you do the work you'll be fine. Highly recommend taking at least one of his classes during your time at Wake!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: took him for an online class last year. he was nice and chill. there are a lot of readings and discussions so make sure you do those. he also talks a lot too, but the class is easy as long as you do the homework.
The best professor ever. Love his content and moreover his passion for the subject of African History. He's the reason I chose to minor in the discipline.

I enjoyed having Dr. Plageman as my history teacher. The only thing is there is a lot of discussions and readings in his classes so be prepared for those. He also tends to talk a lot too, but he's nice and cool.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Loved this class, would take it again 100 times. Easy divisonal out of the way and was very interesting. She is very passionate and cares about her students. Some of the readings are long but she goes over them in class.
Easy A in my opinion. There is a bunch of reading but she makes it interesting and it's honestly not that much work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Wortmann was incredible in this class. We covered tons of scholarship and she was enthusiastic for every single one. Just beware the readings are super dense and long. Three papers, twelve discussion boards, and a presentation are required for coursework. Very easy grader. This is a great class to explore potential major/minor interests!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Wortmann is so nice and a great professor! You can really tell that she cares about her students and the subject. She is very informative and there is very little work involved in her class. She is also super understanding and a very easy grader. I would recommend this class to anyone!

Loved her! Very accommodating and not a lot of work. As long as you put in a little effort, it is not hard. The midterm was a group presentation and the final was taken in class. She also gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. Participating in class a bit is also beneficial.

Professor Wortmann comes to class super engaged with students and is very passionate about her area of expertise. There is a lot of reading, but doable with time management. Some major components of the course were a group project, art project, book review, and a short final exam. All were not very difficult and overall this is a great divisional!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: A lot of material at once but this class is very easy if you meet the bar for effort
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very annoying and super stubborn. I ended up with an A- only because the final was online. I would definitely not take him again and I did not enjoy the class at all.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Friendly good professor Never studied statistics but got A Just stay awake during his class
Worst. Professor. Ever. Do not take this class. I did not learn a single thing. This isnt what I imagined a Wake professor would be.

Unless you enjoy confusing exams and lectures and teaching yourself everything, avoid him at all costs. The number of times I cried over this class and the number of mental breakdowns I had were unreal. I hope he gets fired. He puts no effort into teaching. I thought Wake professors were known for caring about their students. He does not care

DON'T TAKE STATS WITH THIS PROFESSOR! I took AP stats in high school and was pretty good at it and actually enjoyed the class. Stats in college, however, was hell. He ruined my interest in the subject, made everything confusing, and was just overall extremely bad. Professor seems completely illiterate. Be prepared to teach yourself everything.

He is by far the worst math teacher I have ever had. His lectures were often confusing and I spent more time on youtube figuring out what he meant than actually in his class. His exams were riddled with significant typos that he was not available to clarify. He regularly ignored emails asking questions or for clarification. Avoid at all costs.

Do not take this professor plain and simple. The Stats department at wake is notorious for having bad professors at the lower levels, and this is a prime example of one. Essentially this class has no syllabus, no schedule, no plan. Very unclear at any given time what we are doing. Day to day instruction is poor, and assessments are weird and hard

The papers are challenging. He will deduct points for arbitrary reasons on essays, and there are no rubrics for any of them, so you do not understand what the expectations are. There will be listening quizzes, which are difficult since you are expected to provide specific details about the instruments but he will not tell you what the details are

Actually not what you expect at all. You will not be playing instruments. You will be learning about every instrument known to man and the history of each of them. There is no clear criteria for your writings and he doesn't give you any guidance for what to write.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Lots of pointless readings and discussions, multiple reflection papers plus a term paper, listening quizzes, pop quizzes, a midterm and final, and requirements to attend concerts outside of class -- just wayyy to much useless work for an fys, avoid if at all possible. That being said, there are definitely worse fys to take

Writing this before end of semester so people know what's up before course registration. Other reviews are spot on. Excessive amount of work for an FYS. Very picky - will take off points for what seems to be the tiniest things. Readings are long, boring, and frequent. Have to juggle a lot of different tasks. Avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I've never taken an his FYS (I wish I had), but he is generally serious with what he does - so it's not going to be a piece of cake if you take his class. Some of the things that other people say about him is just not true. He's a 5/5 in my opinion as someone who worked closely with him before. Very, very caring, intelligent and patient.
He does not provide feedback for papers. He is somewhat understanding, an a is a lot of hard work and even then it is very hard to obtain. Good luck
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: For his FYS, it's a lot of readings, a few papers on the readings scattered throughout, and a few "listening quizzes".
