He can be inconsistent with grading papers/quizzes and sometimes not clear on where points were lost. For the most part his assignments are straightforward but there are definitely better profs to take for fys.

Dr. Carter does not give feedback on your papers so you can't really improve and the papers make up a huge part of your grade. He assigns a lot of readings and it not tech savvy at all. If you want an easy FYS then don't pick this one.

This class is quite easy, featuring just one assignment per week and a quiz every three weeks that covers three units. The final exam is oral, with questions provided in advance, making it manageable. I highly recommend it to anyone seeking an easier divisional course. While the lectures can be a bit dull, the relaxed and easy makes up for it.

LOVED this class. Super interesting material that is applicable to real life. Class is super laid back and professor Johnson is very very nice. There's one quick assignment per week (10-20 minutes) and a 20 question multiple choice take home quiz once every three weeks. Professor Johnson also brings dogs to class pretty often. Easy A+. RECOMMEND!!

Dr. Johnson is very chill and this is a super easy class, even for people who hate public speaking. She is the easiest grader I have ever seen and it's not hard to end with an A+. There's also no homework or tests, only three major speeches that you have plenty of time to prepare for.
s
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Super sweet. There are 4 speeches that she grades pretty easy. Extra credit opportunities. She truly cares about her students.
Love!!

LOVE her. The chapters you're supposed to read are long, but I don't read them, I just look over the slides. There is a take-home quiz every other week, one super easy assignment every Friday (literally just find a video on a social media platform and connect it to the lecture content), and an oral final exam (you get the questions beforehand).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Very chill guy, lots of open discussion in class made it a nice environment. If you like writing and are good at it this class is pretty easy, if you struggle with it he's very available to ask for help from and there are peer reviews and rewrite opportunities for the 2 papers.

This course was a breeze compared to other WRI 111s. There's 2 main essays, a decent amount of reading, and some other small assignments for homework, but it's all graded as pass-fail. Lots of peer review and open-ended conversations in a small class, so be prepared to participate. Eric is very funny, open, and caring. Overall, it's a very easy A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Loved having Ekstrand, he held relevant discussions and is just a chill and entertaining teacher. Occasional readings before class but if you don't you're not penalized, just wouldn't be able to participate. Entire class is literally two papers. Any work we've done other than that has been annotating old essays like the ones we were working on.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I took Prof. Ekstrand for wri 109 and it was such an easy A. There is rarely homework (sometimes annotations) but overall really easy class. There are no tests or quizzes, and the papers that we wrote in this class aren't graded--but handed back for edits. I really liked Prof. Ekstrand because he always cares about his students.

I had him for wri109, overall the class's content was not at all interesting to me, and I'm not much of a fan of writing. The class was easy though and the activities we did were fun sometimes. Overall super chill, great vibes.
This professor is a super nice guy, I just hated the class (I hate writing). If you do your job, you will get a good grade. He's very open-minded which i appreciate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He was a great professor! he managed to make a writing class pretty interesting and fun. The assignments were cool and the class wasn't too much work.

I have never commented on this site before and I specifically created an account in order to comment about this professor. Out of all of my years of college I have never had as useless of a professor as Ekstrand. He graded extremely hard and was a terrible teacher. I learned absolutely nothing about the writing process. STAY AWAY!!!!!
Do not take for a divisional, way too hard
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Some of the readings were unnecessarily long (like 40 to 50 pages a night). Also the "study guide" you get is the most vague thing to ever exist and doesn't properly prepare you for the exam. Her lectures were really interesting though and she is super nice!
Horrible. Worst professor and instructor I have ever had. Exepcts you to learn when doesn't supply enough information to do so. On our midterm more people got C's and Ds then A's and B's
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I would not take Professor Gengler if you're looking for a good divisional. Your grade is heavily based on the two tests you take and at least 3/4 of the class got a C or below.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Gives awful feedback. Just tells you to "check your notes" instead of helping you understand aspects of a topic. She is also one of the few SOC professors who gives exams. Everyone felt great about the first exam, but EVERYONE got C's. Feels like you are being talked down to half the time. NOT A GPA BOOSTER. Not the easy SOC class to get a 99.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The class material is interesting and the professor clearly loves what she's doing and knows a lot about the subject. There are weekly videos/readings/quizzes to do outside of class so classes are async because of this, so a lot of times you only have to go to class 1 day a week. Tests are worth a lot of points and will make or break your grade.

Dr. Gengler is amazing! Her lectures are always very engaging and you can tell she loves her job. However, her style of teaching involves completing lots of video lectures and readings outside of class and then discussion in class, so if you don't stay on top of the workload, you'll be screwed. There are short weekly quizzes, 2 exams, and an essay
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Best strategy lecture I have taken so far. Mr. Baliga is one of our guest lecturers at University of Kaiserslautern (TU KL).
Very knowledgable Professor with great industry insight. Made learning a lot more analytical & fun
Brilliant professor with immense industry knowledge and insights
Sharp, engaging, discussions are  focused, but no powerpoint.
best prof in b school.
No Comments

Dr. Sara is the best. Here class is highly engaging and you will learn a lot especially when it comes to Spanish culture. Her class is not the easiest and you do have to put it in the work to get a decent grade, but she's fair and is more than happy to help you understand where you went wrong on assignments.
I love her!!! This class is a good amount of work but she's great.

The Language department here at Wake is standardized, and homeworks are pretty common among courses as well. Cuenca seemed to give an average amount of HW for SPA 153 courses, very manageable. I would for sure take this prof again - gave clear feedback, really tried to encourage and motivate students. She really enjoys seeing the students learn

Good professor. Very good at explaining concepts and clearly lays out what you need to know for the class. Written assignments are graded somewhat tough, but you shouldn't get below a B on them as long as you apply the class concepts. Tests are kinda hard but you see what you expect to see on them. Would recommend
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Amazing teacher and very nice person. Tests weren't easy but also not super hard and are very straightforward.

Sara Fernandez Cuenca is very nice, chill, and understanding. She is just a tough grader on writing and the tests are difficult. She is available for help and does care about her students. It is not a lot of homework and she keeps the class interesting.

Dr. Bowen is an amazing conductor and director, always giving great feedback on all sorts of music. His music selections are great and fun for almost all instruments (sorry percussion). I am most definitely taking his wind ensemble class again next semester.
Dr. Bowen was the best conductor and director I have ever been under. As a conductor and music teacher now, I strive to be just like him!
No Comments

Dr. B is on the of the professors who knows how to get **** done, and not be a hard@ss. Rarely do we (band members) have conflict with him except for music choices, which he has begun to correct this year with the implementation of a polling sytstem for each song.
Dr. Bowen is great. One of my favorite professors ever.

By far THE BEST band director that I have ever been under in my life.I haven't attended WFU for 2 years now,but I just had to add him here.Shame on WFUMB members for not adding him before to give him the credit he deserves.Join the Band, you'll Love it!!

He's a great guy who clearly loves the subject, but his grading criteria doesn't really make much sense. The tests are the main determinants of your grade so if you do bad on one you're basically not getting an A. His test formats are weird in that your multiple choice options are a-g. But, if you study a lot and pay attention in class you'll pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Funny teacher. Engaging lectures. Would definitely take again.

He is funny. If that is worth the torture of his lack of organization and mystery grading criteria, then maybe he is your guy. Legit would not be able to point to where he is taking points off your stuff. Completely ridiculous. If you like clear instructions and exams that are not riddled with mistakes, AVOID. Cool dude, horrible organizer.
avoid at all costs. trust.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Tests are extremely challenging but he grades holistically. If you go to office hours he will like you. Super interesting guy who is always willing to give extra help. Couldn't recommend enough!!!

It is clear McFall cares about his students. He is very accessible outside of class and wants you to do well. His lectures are very important so, even though attendance isn't mandatory, you should really try to go to every class.

Dr. Clements is absolutely amazing. Definitely take her for wri 111. 3 essays throughout the year, grading system on the essays is super generous. First essay total points off are divided by 3 for what you actually lose, second is divided by 2, and third is straight up. Minimal work outside of class, essays are not super overwhelming.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: There were three essays and a few other assignments. She gives clear instructions on how to do everything. She's a great professor and she keeps the lectures light and funny.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: So I took AP English in high school, and I am a good writer. This class was not hard for me, but I liked the theme and analysis practice of Focault & others. That was new for me. Three papers so that was not too much. Assignments started small (like turning in your intro for feedback first). Helpful with questions & writing during class time.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: only 3 essays and a couple easy completion assignments throughout the semester. Not a super hard grader but kind of inconsistent sometimes
We only had three papers to write throughout the entire time in class. The class was mad boring and se talks about random things but she is willing to work with you and is a easy grader.

My writing class was very boring that I took with Professor Clements, but that being said, I was dreading having to take a writing class and this one was extremely easy. You can turn your essays in early to start with a 110% and you never have work besides 3 essays. She grades fairly easily and she is always there to help you with your writing.
Very easy and I loved this class. There were only 3 papers and 1 project but she grades them pretty easily.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Lots of lecture. Papers are fairly graded (one left to go).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really didn't enjoy this class. Participation really matters. While this is a divisional, she teaches and runs discussions like everyone has taken soc before which I didn't like. Lots of reading. Doesn't post lecture material so PAY ATTENTION. Unclear grading criteria and doesn't let students ask questions about her feedback.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She's chill. LOTS of reading and very heavy on participation (worth 10% of grade). Attendance isn't mandatory but the lectures cover material on the take-home quizzes. No exams but 4 film analyses, 2 research projects, 4 quizzes, and weekly reading reactions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Average teacher, grading criteria is NOT clear, and the reading is heavy towards the beginning of the class (it gets easier). You have to participate as it is a part of the grade, and attendance is not necessarily mandated however the lectures are not shared and they contain important information.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took this class for an easy divisional, but it ended up being a lot of readings and unnecessary assignments, including an entire book. She is nice, but when you participate in class she always seems annoyed with what you're saying, especially if it's something she disagrees with. Overall, the class is interesting but sometimes unnecessary.
Best professor I ever had!

The work in this class is very easy, if you are unwilling to speak in class she will give you a failing participation grade. I ended the semester with my grade in Canvas as an A, but when she entered the participation grade she gave me a 40 and told me it was too late to fix anything. Very harsh grader on participation.

Professor Castelblanco is a very enthusiastic teacher who genuinely wants his students to learn Spanish. But the coursework and the tests are very difficult, especially for an introductory language class. His tests are weighted very heavily and his writing assignments do not have a defined grading criteria. Very time committing.

BEST PROFESSOR EVER!! I love Prof. Daniel and would recommend him to anyone and everyone. He does grade strictly with grammar on written assignments, but he also teaches grammar very well in class, which makes it easier to understand. Overall amazing prof, could not recommend enough.

Dr. Castelblanco is an amazing Spanish teacher and I recommended him to all of my friends! He is very clear on what you need to know for the tests so while they are sometimes difficult, it will never be a shock to see the material there and it makes it easier to study. He is very animated and makes class super interesting!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is super nice and funny however he does grade very harshly. The tests are a lot harder than they need to be and he doesn't curve. However, if you do the reading and homework you should be good, it is just a lot of work and effort and not an easy A.
I'd take another professor if you can. His grading style is ruthless and his tests are way harder than they need to be for just the first level of Spanish.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Castelblanco is an amazing teacher he always knows how to make his students laugh and tries to make learning Spanish as much fun as possible. The only negative thing I would have to say is that the test is hard and they are worth 40% of your grade.

I enjoyed Professor Collins this semester. She is passionate about transnational feminism and the class deals with real world issues. I did not know much about women's experiences outside of the US so to learn so much about it, especially about the Caribbean, was really good. It is alot of reading. But you learn alot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Professor Collins was engaging in class and knowledgeable of the topic. For a divisional it required a good amount of reading. I would take again, only warning is be ready to read.

This professor was thoughtful and cared alot about the subject. It is not what I expected learning about at Wake Forest. Lots of readings and lots of class discussions. Definitely recommend if people want to learn something about the world outside of the USA.

Do not take this course as a divisional requirement!! I love how passionate Dr. Collins is about the topics in the class, but she expects way too much for a course that most people are taking to fulfill a requirement. The lectures are interesting if you ignore the slides and just listen to what she has to say.

Professor Collins is really dedicated to her study and her students . Being her first class it isn't a lot of structure and clear expectations when engaging with the work so beware of that. Collins also doesn't provide grading very fast. Lectures aren't very helpful because often times she reads a few quotes from the readings without explanation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: She is very passionate and knowledge about her work and the topic but her teaching is lackluster. Her slideshows are just word for word copied from the weeks readings and offer no explanation or clarification. She is very disorganized and took 4-5 weeks to return grades for assignments. Her feedback was confusing and didn't really help.

She's not the greatest teacher but she is so much easier than some of the other Econ 150 teachers. Comes across very nervous which is off-putting, but there was not all that much homework and she gives you a lot of time to do it. She grades pretty fairly, and for someone who has never taken Econ before I felt she did a pretty decent job explaining.
3 exams and the final was cumulative. Continued without stopping for questions. Was often times confusing and spent extra time outside of class reading the textbook to better comprehend the material.

Would not recommend if you plan to continue taking econ. This was my first econ class, and her style of teaching made it uninteresting and confusing. There are few assignments, 3 midterms, and the final. If you study outside of class and prepare for the exams, you'll be good. The TA's office hours were really helpful.

The class has 4 homeworks for the semester so it's hard to know how much you comprehend until exams. Final is cumulative and exams were exactly like the study guides. Estonia is unsure in her teaching and classes are just slides. Easy if you've taken econ before and know the material; if not then get a prof who can better explain new information.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the most boring people I've met in my life. All lectures and doesn't engage the class at all. Her class is not that hard but you have few opportunities to boost your grade in these classes. Take someone else, spend your time wisely.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: very hard to pay attention to boring lectures, I would say basically impossible. classes are bland and lack enthusiasm. grade depends on 3 exams and an essay and problem sets that she grades incredibly harshly. she is pretty unaccessible and hides in her office during office hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Black is fine, but nothing special. Mainly just reads of the board and mumbles. The TA was more helpful outside of class with questions. 3 midterms, 1 cumulative final, and 1 essay. would try to get someone else, but it's not the worst thing if you can't because she's an easy grader

Honestly not the most exciting class but very easy to do well in if you study. Basically 0 homework, no need for the textbook, and all that really matters are the 3 midterms and final which a practice test are provided for and very closly mirror the actual exam. If you know how to do practice problems, this is light.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class is very much based off of how much work you put into it. Everything on exams is taken from powerpoints and the practice exams given closely mirror the actual exam. The grading system is great only if you get in the A range. She was fine for econ 150 but often made mistakes on her work
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Black's class is fairly boring, I would not recommend taking this class if you want to gain a deeper understanding of economics. It's a bland class graded mostly by two midterms and the final. Can't say I enjoyed this class, but it's fairly easy.

Graded on very few things, 85% of grade is 3 exams. If you prefer homework, essays, quizzes, take another prof. Problem sets take hours,10%/grade, paper/5%. Rigid grader, will not accept other correct answers that don't match her expected response, you can't really be a free thinker, grading scale not obvious
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I LOVE THIS WOMAN WITH ALL MY HEART!!!!!! IF SHES TAKING A CLASS, TAKE IT. IMMEDIATELY.
If you're looking for a good history divisional, take HST 106. She is an engaging lecturer, there's lot of opportunities for points, and she cares about her students. I got a lot from this course.
A great professor, very interesting class
Great professor.  She really enjoys teaching and her class is always interesting.
No Comments
No Comments

Super interesting! Prof Curley finds a way to make everyone laugh while showing his love for the course. The class is lecture-heavy but with barely any homework (maybe a monthly reading check). There's 3 essays, 3 exams, and no cumulative final. The essays are graded kinda harshly (average is usually a B+) but tests are simpler if you're prepared.

Super funny lectures, but also very interesting. Not too much homework, and tests are fair. He is a nice grader, but is also accessible outside of class for extra help or questions. I now plan to minor in art history after this class. Overall, great prof., I would certainly recommend for an art divisional as long as you can memorize.
Fantastic professor!

You can tell that he loves what he does. Very informative and keeps the lecture interesting. Can't take him for granted- he knows students and makes you work for the grade, but he recognizes hard workers and those with ambition. Definitely not an easy divisional, but the class is interesting, he's hilarious, and he has impeccable outfits.

I had no interest in art history prior to taking Prof. Curley's survey course, but now I am considering grad school in art history. He is fantastic at explaining difficult subjects and concepts. The work load in his classes is both manageable and challenging. I recommend taking a class with his wife, Prof. O'Neill, as well.

He is a great teacher that made me gain an appreciation for art, and I am a science person. However, there are a couple papers that are hard to write. There are definitely easier art divisionals you could take, but this is a pretty interesting class.
Extremely harsh grader when FYS should be an easy A. Too much lecturing and unclear grading when it comes to papers.
Harsh grader. Unclear on rubric and expectations. Freshman seminars are supposed to be light and thought-provoking. This class was dry and unproductive. Sooo many lengthy unnecessary papers for FYS

This class has a lot more work than the average FYS. Papers were frequent and very long including a 10-12 page paper final. She is a very harsh grader. The class itself is very boring and difficult to pay attention

Dr. Kiang is super sweet. Im in her FYS and it's decently interesting, and you don't necessarily need to read the articles beforehand. her class is heavily discussion based but everyone feels welcome to talk. the only downside is that she IS a somewhat tough grader. def have to put in a bit more work than other FYS it seems and not an automatic A

I had Dr. Kiang for her contemporary issues course. She is a nice professor, and cares about the material. Her class is fairly difficult, solely because of the amount of reading that is required each week. Get ready to read multiple, lengthy research papers every week. Plus, the final paper for this course was extremely long, so be prepared.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Love her! She is so nice taught me so much that's actually important to the world right now. She cares a lot about her students. She loves participation and makes you feel comfortable talking in front of the class. There are also lots of small group conversations. She's such a mom prof. Her class is easy and you don't really need to read the hw.

I had Dr. Kiang for my FYS 100 class. She kept the lectures very interesting. She clearly know her psychology. However, when it came to papers, she's a very tough grader. A majority of our grade was made up of essays, so don't expect to get an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dont take her for a divisional class. She is not a good professor in general, and that fact is compounded if your just trying to get your art divisional. Her lectures are kinda all over the place, shes really not that clear what she wants on test and is overall a terrible professor.

caveat: i studied abroad with dr. barnes, so i cannot say i a typical dr. barnes-class  i really enjoyed taking dr. barnes' art history course. some professors treat divisionals as a joke. dr barnes does not. she has high expectations for her students, but nothing unrealistic. put in the work, and you'll get a good grade. lectures are wonderful!
Perhaps she is more engaging in Art History, but in my First Year Seminar class, she was an absolute bore. Take someone else for your FYS

Barnes is an okay lecturer. She seems to be better at teacher Art History. Her voice is a bit monotonous, and may put you to sleep. Textbook use is not very high, but it sucks to buy several books for the seminar. Take her only as an absolute last resort for this class, as many of us did.

she is probably a great professor for art history majors, but for those students taking her class for a divisional, beware. aside from her horrible grammar and inability to give clear lectures (her presentations are so so so confusing), dr. barnes gives the most ridiculous tests that don't cover ANY of the important themes she discusses in class.

Great Prof who really knows her stuff. Classwork and reading are easy to follow and keep up with and are completely reasonable. Pay attention in class and takes notes and it will be easy to get  a decent grade. She was extremely understanding when my health kept me from doing work and allowed me to redeem myself. Good for a divisional class.
Many topics covered are straight up uninteresting. Exams are too complicated as well like he expected students to be expert in the field after a 116 class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Required students to spend more money on materials compared to other classes. Exams are super packed; he always squeezes too many topics on each of them. In general, the course is much harder than a standard 116 should be. TOO MANY TOPICS, many in which do not matter that much. He likes history so he incorporates a lot of that, which is irrelevant.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor Jenkins is a very nice guy and it is clear he cares a lot about his class. He assigned a lot of reading, but I didn't do any of it after the first week and did fine. If you want to get an A you will. Exams were reasonable and the paper was fun to write. Lectures could be boring at times, but he tries to make it as fun as possible.

Dr. Jenkins' class is a great introduction to international politics, however, it is an intense amount of reading. Jenkins is a great professor and he tries to make the class interesting. If you are interested in the subject, it's a great class, but there is a lot of reading and significant material to learn before midterms and finals.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor provided a good amount of energy and information on the topic. He is super knowledgable and sweet.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Homework is for a completion grade, and review guides are given before exams. There are a lot of course readings, but Professor Jenkins goes over them every class period, so even if you don't read all of them, you will understand them by the end of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lecture heavy. No use of phones or computers during lectures which can be tough. The class is worth it though. Only 2 exams which are easy and no textbooks.
Absolute queen, I took her seminar and it was super easy and fun.
I love Leah as a person. She was good as a professor, too. Course wasn't too hard, there was reading every class but skimming worked well.
She's a great teacher, and totally helpful. You have to come to class and do the work though. If you do that, you've secured an excellent grade in the class.

the easiest class at Wake! i only took it to fulfill a divisional, but i lucked out when i got Roy as a prof. she's energetic and is anything but boring. we read some plays that were somewhat on the dull side but she made them fun. clas discussion is a big part of the class a there are small quizzes on the plays, but anyone can get at least a B+.

Very fun class with lots of acting, and minimal use of the textbook. Gave small quizzes ("squizzes") every few weeks, which were all announced on the syllabus. Overall, fairly easy class and very nice/fun teacher.

The class is a lot of work buyt Dr. Boyer is really kind and all of the in-class writings had rewrites that you could do and the rewrite is graded so those are good. The quizzes are incredibly hard, but its chill like you get used to it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Grades harshly and unfairly on essays and her feedback is more mean than it is helpful. Most of the class had scores in the 80s on most essays. When I asked for specific instructions on how to improve my writing, she gave very vague answers. She also expects you to know the readings like the back of your hand. You can definitely find an easier FYS.
Quite possibly my favorite teacher. Such a sweetheart, teaches in an easily understandable way, and makes German fun.

Professor Boyer really cares for her students and respects them. I took her for German and sometimes it is confusing. However, she really helps her students out and actually teaches instead of just lecturing. She does give a lot of homework but it is relatively easy.

The course material was extremely interesting and very challenging (e.g. Hegel in German), but Dr. Boyer explained the material in a way that made it much easier to understand. Grading was definitely fair.  I would certainly recommend taking a class with Dr. Boyer if you have the chance.

I thought her FYS course was cake (very writing based, and she was an easy grader for essays imo) but the class was a lot of fun.  Lots of discussion, and she was always very easy to talk to in and out of class.

Worst professor I've ever had, especially coming straight into college. He was extremely heartless and very inconsiderate. I should've changed my professor from the very jump when about half of the class left. Would not recommend him ever

Woefully unprepared for online courses. Resorted to having us watch Khan Academy videos and read his powerpoints instead of teaching us the materials. More than half the material covered on the exams were briefly mentioned or not mentioned during class. Good guy, but the class format needs HEAVY reworking
Great teacher, just not very personable. Had him for CHM 111 and orgo, a lot of the learning is on your own. Tests are pretty easy though.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: The epitome of 100 level professors who take themselves too seriously. Was the kind of professor to ask if you read the textbook first before asking for help. Assigned way too many ALEKS modules. Was fine at explains topics but still went too fast for me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Hands down the BEST professor in the Chemistry department! Doesn't come off as arrogant, and is EXTREMELY helpful during office hours! I had Dr. Hindo for my second time through Organic Chem, and with his wonderful teaching I was able to earn a B in the class (I received an F the first time I took the class). Wonderful professor and person!

He makes organic chemistry as simple as it can possibly be, which is still pretty complicated. He grades pretty tough, but gives a lot of extra credit and bonus points. I would definitely recommend him.

if you want to take WGS 150 then take it with her!! so sweet and really knowledgeable so class was always super interesting. she always brought her dog to class so that always got everyone in a good mood!!
dr. balzano is the best! She cares about her students so much and is super flexible with students turning things in late. Take her course if you ever get the chance

Dr. Balzano was great. Show up and you'll be fine. You can put very little effort in her class if you want to, but the more you put in the more you'll get out if you're genuinely interested in and care about what she is teaching.

Professor Balzano is a wonderful person who cares deeply about what she teaches. It would be beneficial to show up because she takes attendance and truly values participation in class. Only 3 genuine assignments, all of which she probably gave a passing grade. It's an easy A if you show up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Balzano is a very nice woman and cares about her students. She has a relatively heavy accent, so sometimes it was hard to understand her. She takes attendance and likes when people participate in class, but I rarely did. Lots of reading, but you don't need to do it. A few writing assignments/group presentations. Probably gave everyone an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Dr. Balzano is super chill and easy going. Her class isn't hard and you'll do good as long as you participate and do the basic requirements. Super easy class, easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Balzano is nice and comprehensive. She lets us complete the homework after the due date when we have the time to do it. Overall, easy divisional.

I had Davis for Contracts 1 and 2. His midterms are very difficult. He knows so much about contracts, so you will learn a lot in his class. Take goods notes and don't be afraid to approach him if you don't understand something. Tip: He talks very fast, so I recommend taking notes on a laptop(it is the only way to keep up).
Brilliant in contracts. Makes students rise to his level, which can mean tough tests. 1L is obviously curved so don't feel bad about the raw grades.
Literally knows everything about Contracts- Tough class but very approachable professor

Amazing professor and person.  Very clear, very deep.  The textbook does a great job of explaining the law, and Davis does an excellent job of showing you what's below the surface.  You will learn a great deal in his classes.
Great professor.  If you got him for first year contracts consider yourself lucky.  Very helpful after class.
No Comments
She is really knowledgable of literature in different languages. Very nice and fun, she makes class very entertaining.
Best Professor I have ever had.  I love her to death.  She is seriously amazing.
The best. Period.
She is a sweet lady with a lot of energy and interest in helping you. She really loves what she does, and it shows. Class is fun and she is goofy sometimes.
No Comments
Not too bad of a teacher and the class wasn't particularly difficult. Just your standard language intro class.

I think this class was great, of course there was a lot of HW as is expected with every language class, but it should not be more than maybe 1 hour. In comparison with other language classes, the requirements are definitely easier with Prof. Vincent and as long as you participate in class and study for tests (graded pretty lax) you should do fine.

Professor Vincent is a great professor to have as an adjustment to college from high school. There was a lot of homework based off of the online textbook. The textbook is a must. Overall, the class is straightforward she is dedicated to being present to her students. She is very responsive to emails and organized.

I had Professor Vincent for French 212. She made 212 really easy, which was nice. We had daily homework and four tests throughout the whole semester. Most of class was spent in a class-wide discussion about the readings we had done. Participation is huge with her so super important to find something to speak about.

She is a good professor because she is clear about assignments and makes sure that we know what is upcoming in the class. A lot of the learning is done by yourself though, and her voice is a little annoying. Not that difficult of a class though.

Prof Vincent is pretty chill. She's a good choice for any french class but I would necessarily go out of the way to choose her over any other french prof. She's a sweet lady and classes are fun if you have a good dynamic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: He is a good person and I like him, but his class is extremely hard. Do not take it for an easy divisional.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Came into this class after reading good reviews looking for an easy divisional. This is not it. Tests are challenging, and require more studying than most math classes. Your entire grade is determined by the tests. If you want an easy divisional, take anything else.

Professor Kairoff is a sweetheart. He cares so much about music and is so passionate he is when he speaks. While the class may be a little boring sometimes, it is an easy class with no participation or homework. He gives a study guide with the exact information on the test, but you have to study. He is amazing and plays piano for us !!!

He was a great Professor. He was very engaging and passionate about his work. Such an interesting and fun guy. Just make sure you show up for class and study for the tests. The tests aren't hard if you just review the terms he gives you in the study guide.

Professor Kairoff is extremely kind and knowledgeable about the information he teaches. Class is very entertaining and Kairoff is a very talented pianist. He has been very understanding of the stress of other classes and provides much help if you take the time to meet with him and put in the effort to do well.

Kairoff is an AMAZING professor and musician. His goofy easy-going personality will make you laugh even at 930. His test are very fair. You do not need the book-save your money. Apart from being a great professor, he is a very accomplished pianist. He can sit and play and piece that is talked about! If you need an arts divisional, take Kairoff!!!

I had Sloan for CLA 161 (divisional). He is nice and sassy, he does cold-call during class so know your material. He also grades discussion posts and the exams a bit harshly but if you show that you try and know what you're talking about, you should be okay.
Loves his soap box. Nothing super wrong with him, but likes his inside jokes with people. Do the work he asks and it'll pay off. Study vocab for midterm/final because that's a real kicker.
SUPER BIASED towards athletes. if you're not an athlete, don't take him. also, class average was super low considering it was a divisional.

Dr. Sloan truly cares about his students and wants to make sure they learn and improve in all areas of life. Just to show you how caring he is, he brought a sick student homemade soup to help them feel better. His teaching is meaningful and applicable, and he engages the class well. Every class was hilarious and entertaining, and I learned so much!

Absolutely love Prof. Sloan, one of my fav professors at Wake. Maintains a refreshing level of professionalism mixed with humor and light sarcasm. Always captivating to listen to and extremely intelligent. He loves having students in his office and chatting over a cup of tea - he even invited me to dinner with his family once! 10/10 recommend him.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Sloan is a really great professor. He assigns quite a bit of homework and expects you to keep up on vocab/ grammar skills on your own. He gives students tough love by teasing them in front of the class which can be a little embarrassing, but that's just how he keeps us on our toes. He's brilliant, insightful, and enthusiastic about the class.

One of my favorite professors in the department. Super knowledgeable on international law so class is super entertaining and interesting. He does ramble a lot but you still get all the material covered in that time. Tests are kinda hard, but he gives a study guide so you know what it'll be like going into it.

Dr. Lee is a sneaky-funny and charming guy, but he can sometimes be hard to understand. The lectures are also very dense, and the exams definitely require a lot of studying. The course on IO's is basically all about the UN, and can definitely be tedious. Wasn't the most interesting to me, but you definitely learn a lot.

Things only kick up in this class around exam times and for the term paper. You need to attend class to get the notes (because the slides aren't posted) and read the textbook to study for the exams; otherwise, I don't see how you'll do well. The class is very lecture-heavy, but it's low-maintenance as you don't get homework.

He is very nice and understanding, but you have to pay close attention in class and read the book, if not the exams won't go well. Overall it was an ok class that didn't require much except the exams and the paper.

I LOVE Pressor Lee. While it is very lecture-heavy, Professor Lee is a very enjoyable man and makes lectures interesting by cracking jokes and bringing treats such as cookies as rewards for his students working hard. While this is a difficult class at times, I believe it is a very fair course and I would take any course taught by Professor Lee.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: professor lee is great. although the concepts he teaches are quite boring he tries to liven up the class by making jokes throughout his lecture. he is very clear on what will be included on the tests and although it is a lot as long as you start preparing for the test more than a week in advance you will be fine. would definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Lee is incredibly invested in his students and their success. He makes sure to be accessible outside of class, and sometimes offers donuts as incentive for in person office hours. His class is lecture heavy, which is sometimes difficult when it is online-based, but his tests are fair so long as you do the readings and read the textbook.

Dr Guthold is an amazing professor. Very clear and concise lectures that are engaging with demonstrations and powerpoints. The study guides are very similar to the tests and he always goes above and beyond to provide review sessions. I decided to take him for 114 since he was so amazing, would 100% recommend!

Really nice. Really simple. I got a 5 in AP Physics 1 and breezed through the entire homework for the whole semester in like the first 2 weeks. A bit annoying to pay for Cengage & iClicker but whatever.

Guthold is amazing!! So funny and wholesome!! Makes concepts very clear/straightforward and super helpful in office hours. Tests are very much based off of homework and in-class problems/demonstrations. He also provides lots of test practice which is very helpful.

I love dr guthold but I did so bad in his class because I didn't go enough. I took him freshman year for 113 and I still recommend him because of how good of a professor he was, but the tests are hard.

He is genuinely one of my favorite professors I've ever had. Literally the most precious man ever. I think the only reason the class was hard is because Physics is in and of itself a hard topic. His tests were very fair and questions reflected the homework and study guides he gave.

Professor Guthold is a solid choice for a physics professor - does great class demonstrations that actually help a LOT with conceptually understanding stuff for tests. Tests are hard but have nothing you didn't go over in class. He makes study guides for every test that actually reflect test questions.

The most caring professor you'll have. He ensured he spoke to every student in every class even if the conversation was brief. It was apparent he genuinely wanted to connect with every student. Class content was catered to what the class responded well to. Demonstrate a complete understanding in the reading responses and you'll do great.
talks to you in the most condescending voice you have ever heard in your whole life.
Dr. Gallegos is an amazing professor. His kindness and caring nature make him wonderful to learn from and to interact with. I would recommend him to anyone at Wake Forest.
Took his class 2 yrs ago in online mode. He is helpful, caring, and inspiring.

He really cares about his students and the goal of his class is to learn and self-improve. He grades mainly on completion and self-reflection. Most assignments are somewhat optional (choose 10 out of 15 reading reflections for example) so you choose ones you are more interested in. I highly recommend his intro PHI to anyone regardless of major.
Took his class during covid. Great professor, though lots of readings.

Dr. Schafer was a hilarious and cool guy. You have homework translations from the textbook, but you didn't really need to do them every time since he never collected them. Class was often sidetracked by funny anecdotes about topics of the ancient and modern worlds. An easy A if you study for the few quizzes you end up having, and there are no tests
Amazing professor. Great teacher and great person, explains things very well. He's absolutely hilarious and class is so much fun. Weekly quizzes but it's not too hard.
He is such a good teacher and so funny. his class feels very informal and he is not a harsh grader. i would recommend him to anyone
Amazing professor. Gets so off topic in the best way, always look forward to his class.

Schafer is nothing less than phenomenal. he understands that everyone works hard, so he gives most people an A. he is also the funniest, smartest, most laidback prof I've ever had. he will go on ten-minute tangents about the most random topics, but it makes Latin a class to look forward to. the class itself is challenging, but SO WORTH IT. TAKE HIM
Schafer is excellent
Loved this class. V interesting. Do the readings, participate in class, and he's a rlly rlly easy grader. Ending with a 95.... take him!!

Professor Burton-Rose is a chiller. He does cold call so just watch out for that. If you go to his office hours he lets you know exactly what he is looking for in the papers, and he is overall a pretty easy grader. Would for sure recommend, one of the best profs I've had here.

Professor Burton-Rose is a really great guy and makes himself really available outside of class if you have any questions. His classes can be a little boring, but overall he tells you exactly what he wants on each assignment and is not a super harsh grader. He does cold call, so be sure to at least have a general idea of the readings before class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I love Professor Burton-Rose! He is a very chill grader and outlines exactly what you need to know for each assignment. His lectures can get a bit dense and boring, but you can tell he is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter. He also really cares about his students and is understanding if something comes up.

BEST PROFESSOR EVER! Dr. Burton-Rose is an incredible professor who truly cares about his students. He ties his lectures in with movies to give context, and the reading is always applicable to what we learn in class the next day. He's accessible outside of class, and he offers insight into the papers before they are due. I 100% would recommend.

An interesting class that is an easy A if you do the readings, which can be heavy at times. That being said, I skimmed half the time and still ended with an A. Burton-Rose really knows his stuff... a very smart dude. A pretty easy grader for this class and made sure we were well-prepped for papers and the few quizzes we had.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Extremely nice and passionate. Can be a be a lot of work sometimes, but lets you skip a few homeworks and will always understand if you have something going on/have a busy week. Midterm and final are take home and I don't know anybody that has lower than an A. The debates are super fun also after each unit and would definitely take her again!

Prof. Neal is great! She is very understanding and lets you skip 4 homework assignments. While the workload can be heavy at time, the mid-term and final are take home projects. She is such a caring teacher as well. She brought in candy for us and had us go asynchronous one week to give us a break. I would 100% take her again! Such a great professor

Lowkey a solid amount of work that can be tedious, but don't necessarily need to read everything. As long as you do your work and put in effort, you should get good grades on the papers. Essays are pretty easy because she gives really specific instructions and questions to answer. Also, take home quizzes that are really easy. Participation matters!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Love love love Professor Neal for REL 101! Really caring professor who gives helpful feedback on assignments. I learned a lot!

"Doctor" Lynn Neal is by far the worst professor I have had at Wake. This is a divisional requirement, and she makes it way more difficult than it has to be. Also, very disrespectful to students who are trying their best to get a good grade. She is inconsiderate and will make your life very unpleasant. Do anything you can not to take this class!!
Dr. Neal is a very kind and caring professor! Extremely knowledgeable in her field of study. The class is great for fulfilling a divisional or elective credit. Would recommend to anyone.

Dr. Cho is a great professor, and a funny guy. He can come up with dad jokes for anything and while it can be a bit cringey, I usually find it super funny. He gives practice exams and practice exercises to help with exams and projects, which help tremendously. Only downside is that sections on his rubrics are all/nothing, so missing 1 part hurts.

He does no in person lectures at all. No attendance whatsoever and super easy tests, not much homework. If you already are good at the material of the class it is literally a dream class with minimal work. If you don't know it he will NOT teach you anything so definitely don't take him. Super weird class. Chill guy I guess. A bit shy
Great semester. It really helped that he had practice tests that prepared you for the real thing. Don't slack and take advantage of this golden opportunity.
START LABS EARLY.  He throws you off because he seems like an easy-going guy.  Ask for help early.  He is fair and willing to help.
Lectures are way more easier to follow that the book.  The projects are tough so you have to ask for help and start early.
Tough class, but the lectures were clear and easy to follow.  He's funny in a dorkish/cool kind of way and very helpful on projects.  I'm so glad he corrected all the typos in the textbook.

Charles Lewis is a great man and a great professor; however, if you are not thinking about majoringminoring in philosophy, I would not recommend taking this class.  This was the hardest introductory course I have ever taken and would not have survived if I hadn't created a study group amongst other students.
Best teacher I have ever had, the type of guy I will never forget
Best teacher I have ever had. Hard classes, but will change your life.

Best professor I have ever had.  I am not a philosophy major, nor have I read philosophy before, but he is great.  He is a tough professor, and a tough grader, but you leave his class with a better understanding of the world.  He is open to questions and differing opinions, and has frequent office hours and "voluntary discussions" of the material.
I also took him years ago. He is one of the best professors I have ever had. His class is the reason I majored in philosophy.
I took all of Prof. Lewis' courses over a decade ago.  He is a gifted and inspirational teacher, one whose courses I still remember fondly.
Amazing prof!
Very helpful outside of class.
Plan on a math class. Always available, caring, as much individual help as I needed. Knows his stuff. Several large projects, "hat" problems. Good lectures, but very technical.
Good knowledgeable teacher. Just be aware that his classes are extremely theoretical, and really turn Computer Science into a sort of math. (Not that this is bad, just... difficult.)
Clear and knowledgable. Very approachable, good guy; intelligent and caring.
Enthusiastic.  Keeps you motivated.  Intelligent and willing to always help.

Professor Tara Baldrick-Morrone is a great teacher who will always make everything very clear. She does a great job presenting topics in her class in an organized way. Assignments were always clear, instructive, and pretty easy. I feel like I learned a lot without be pushed too hard.

Zero tests. All quizzes are open note and completed outside of class. One midterm paper and one final project. She cares about her students, and puts their mental health first. She understands that college is hard. 24hr grace period on most assignments which allows you to turn them in a day late with no penalty. I would recommend her to anyone!

SHE IS SO NICE!!! truly cares about her students wellbeing and cares more about your mental health than assignments. I really learned a lot and actually enjoyed going to this class. Definitely recommend.

One of my favorite professors so far at Wake. There were a lot of assignments like weekly annotations and bi-weekly quizzes, but she was super accessible and willing to help if needed. Class was one of the easiest I've taken because she didn't want us to struggle through her class knowing Wake itself was already hard. She was also so fun and kind!

Clearly cares about the mental health of her students. Class was often lecture and then group discussions. Graded based on weekly annotation assignments graded by participation, open-note quizzes for each unit, attending group-led discussions, a mid-term essay-like project, and a final project which can be an essay or some other creative project.

I love Professor Tara!She's the nicest teacher. I'm not really a religious person but her class actually draws me in. She makes everything interesting and she's hilarious. She cusses in class so you know she's cool. Class is mostly fun stories readings, participation, discussions, easy quizzes, midterm project, and a final project. No exams!

Dr. Mayers deserves the world. If you're half decent at Spanish, definitely try to take her for 212. Her teaching style is a bit more old fashioned than other professors, but her lectures are extremely organized and helpful. 
No surprises on the tests because she makes sure everyone understands. 
Anyone saying she's hard didn't put in the effort.

loved Mayers 212 - class isnt as hard as other professors, based on what I've heard. Theres homework every class but its due 30 minutes before class on canvas, easy, graded for completion. vocab quizzes every couple of weeks. The tests are long and feels like theres not enough time but not too difficult. She definitely cares about her students

Overall average professor. Takes too much time lecturing, and there are assignments almost every day. She's a tough grader and there are too many exams, and compositions. Participation in class is key, especially if you want to do well on oral exams. There are probably better teachers for Spanish 213, take someone else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Mayers doesn't care about the class or the students; she is never available. The course is mostly her talking; the tests contain material not discussed in class. She picks favorites. Her lessons are difficult. Her grading criteria non-existent. She seems to be an old, bitter woman. Stay away from her 212. I should have taken Boston W.
Great professor, good bit of work though. Attendance is mandatory but it does really help learn.

Dr. Mayers is the absolute best!!! The class is difficult at times, but Dr. Mayers is an excellent teacher, extremely caring, and very helpful. You can tell she loves her job and genuinely wants her students to learn! If you get the chance, take a class with her. You will not regret it!

His testing was not the clearest, but he is an amazing lecturer who deeply cares for his students and for the topics he teaches. My friends and I legitimately loved his open to every lecture: "Previously, on Criminal Law."
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I only took this with him because it is a required class and no other professors taught it.Students can easily cheat on his quizzes, leaving everyone else at a disadvantage.He is unclear, and tears through tons of info, though its only a 2 credit class.His powerpoints pose questions left unanswered.Ilearned nothing.
Obtuse. Disjointed from real-world, professional standard of subject understanding.
obscure and weird
No Comments

I took Dr. Palmiter's Sustainable Corporations course as an elective for my MA Sustainability degree, and I rly enjoyed it! Lots of reading, but he is very approachable and helpful. If you feel behind/lost, I highly recommend chatting w him in office hrs to get up to speed. Hard grader at times but gives great feedback. I 100% vouch for this class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Had the pleasure of having Palmiter for M&A my final semester of law school. In addition to being a widely-renowned expert & scholar in m&a, securities, and corporate law, Palmiter is a genuinely nice guy. He  communicates key concepts clearly and has a good sense of humor.

He does not explain things clearly AT ALL, he is wishy-washy & confusing. The way he formulates his midterm questions is equally confusing. He wastes quite some time on ineffective group work. He is inconsistent with what he says in class and then how he comments when he grades. ALL IN ALL: Do yourself a favor and take the other prof. for BusOrg.
Best prof at Wake
Prof. Palmiter keeps class interesting and basically uses everyone's weekly writings to guide the discussion--and yes, it IS a discussion.  Highly recommended.
Extremely confusing professor.

The class is easy and the homework is just readings. The final essay was easy as it was about a biography about 3 Black figures. Honestly, I didn't read the homework and got a high grade. His class is so lecture-heavy that he takes up most of the time talking and does not call on others. I would just play on my computer during the whole class.

Overall he was a good history teacher. The class was very easy and he really cares about the topic. You have homework but if you have basic understandings of Africa history like the slave trade and kings then you barely have to read. He also goes over eveything in class. He is very kind and he will give extra credit.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Very likable guy! Clearly passionate about what he teaches, which can make it a little hard to keep up with him. However, easy grader as long as you put in effort. Few papers and presentations, some of which are graded solely off completion. Lots of reading, expects you to speak up often during discussions (though they feel more like lectures)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I don't know how the other reviews are so positive. He's probably the worst teacher I've ever had. Lectures are insanely boring, assigns hundreds of pages of dense reading each class, doesn't give clear expectations for papers or tests. 10 page theme paper is brutal. Study guide is literally just 15 pages of random terms. Pretty easy grader though.

The lectures are really boring, but it gave me time to catch up on sleep. He is a  great guy easy to get along with. Tough grader when it comes to test but the material isn't too hard.  Makes you read a lot of primary documents.
Simple introductory course.  He reviews the material assigned clearly and his tests aren't too tough.
Best teacher of the department. Made comp sci straightforward and easy to learn. Class was labs, tests, and four problem sets which if you studied and did carefully could easily do well in.
Absolutely amazing professor. Super kind, sweet, and caring. One of my favorites in the department.

One of the best professors I had at Wake. Was a bit nervous to take Compsci because it seemed daunting at first but Dr. Turkett is super accommodating and a great teacher. Turned out to be such an easy class. Also, attendance is not mandatory and there was no cumulative final which was definitely a plus as well.

He is a blessing and deserves everything good in the world. He is so kind to students and a great teacher because he actively reflects and practices educational pedagogy, unlike most Professors who only teach because they're required to but are more interested in their own research. I wish more Professors like him existed at this school.

Did Programming Languages with him online, not sure how he is in person but I thought the lectures could get a little slow. But he is very caring about his students and their understanding. Great guy.

Simply a gem of a professor. He's patient, even if you're slow to catch on, and he has a good sense of humor. He has a starbucks addiction, which I frequently joked with him about. Every Comp Sci Student here pretty much prays to have a class with Turkett, and for a good reason.
horrible, rigid grading. teaches useless generalizations. subject of IT is intimidating, so he doesn't get challenged enough by  students.
Good leader of case discussions, but that did not make the course useful.
Great class discussions.  Excellent cases.  Best prof at Babcock.
Great instructor, clear on expectations, great cases, excellent discussions.
Great!!!
He's a very nice guy. Very good teacher for grammar. You can tell he loves his thing.
Excellent teacher. He knows the ins and outs of grammar, and makes it very easy to understand.
TERRIBLE TEACHER!!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Got A's on the standard department-wide tests, didn't do well on his quizzes though, so I got a 89.5 overall. didn't bump it. DONT TAKE HIM.
Very unrealiable with grading. I got A's on the tests and a B+ average on the papers, yet somehow he gave me a B- in the class...
very comical
Business Negotiations with him was one of the most interesting classes I've taken at Wake. He is very knowledgeable and assigns interesting assignments.

Great teacher, good semester. At first I thought I was not going to make it. I went to see him in office hours and he put together a list of things I had to do and checked on me regularly as if he was my coach. I feel he trusted me when I did not trust myself and he helped me see I could do it. I'm now considering a minor. I definitely recommend.

Take him!! He will explain something until you get it. I was very insecure at first with Spanish, but I went to his office hours and he coached me and made me realize I could do it. Now I am considering a minor in Spanish after his class. It's hard work, but totally worth it!.

He's pretty helpful if you go see him during office hours (gives points back etc). Grading seems a little arbitrary, and it's true that he often assigns homework without letting the class know. However, this makes him more lenient with late work.
Absolutely horrible professor, should not be allowed the ability to teach.  He picks on students, assigns work without even telling the class about it, and does not know how to teach at all.

Professor Huang is a tough grader, but a wonderful teacher! I enjoyed her class despite having some trouble on the exams. I think she prepares you well for them, but she's really specific about the answers. However, the difficulty of the homework and exams match up which was great!

Class starts off super slow, so seems easy and I had a hard time paying attention in class. But it gets tough about halfway through the semester. Labs and homeworks are graded very easily, but tests are hard to do well on. Professor Huang is super nice.

Not a particularly exciting class, but she will teach you what you need to know to do well. She is a tough grader and homeworks are graded for correctness, but she's really nice and clearly wants her students to do well. Just keep a top of the work and pay attention to the little details when answering free response questions on the tests.

Solid STA choice. She talks very slowly and makes sure everyone is on the same page before moving on. There are group "labs" where you practice coding in R. If you get a bad lab partner its not very fun, but her tests were open book/note and fairly easy if you paid attention.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: All lectures that she posts online so class Is not mandatory but will help her decide if she rounds up grade. All of it is very straightforward. Homework is not hard and helps your grade alot. She's very nice and very understanding. Tests follow what she teaches in class with a little extra studying. Can defiantly get an A with work.

Only lectures so beware it gets boring. Easy homework that counts for 20% of grade due once a week. Midterms and final are hard though and contain questions that aren't like anything covered in class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He is one of the nicest professors I've ever had! He was incredibly patient and helped me work through practice problems and homework during office hours. I was scared of math and he single-handedly made my fear disappear. He's the reason I ended up loving quant. He is a gem of a person, take his class if you can!

Professor Moore tries his best to explain all the topics clearly and in detail. He also gives out homework that leads you to understand the topics learned that day and at the same time, gives you the chance to review the topics too. Personally one of my best professors so far and definitely recommended.

Professor Moore is intelligent and kind and I learned so much from his class. However, it is crucial that you go to his office hours in order to understand the topics. The nightly homework is easy and on Web Assign, but the written homework can be difficult and confusing. His lectures can be quite confusing as well. This class will be a struggle.

I took multivariable calculus with him. Good teacher, he gives a lot of homework but it was really helpful for me to keep up with the concepts that were being taught. He is very accessible outside class time and explains any doubts on the homework. Practice exams were helpful, overall really good professor! Would recommend.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Moore is very friendly and can explain things in a very clear and concise way, which makes him very helpful when you are confused. The classwork is not too bad, though the concepts can be difficult so don't get behind. He is a fair grader on tests, and doesn't make them too hard. He gives us practice tests beforehand too, which is helpful.
Incredibly entitled. I worked so hard, and she was not understanding or caring whatsoever. Also, an awful TEACHER overall. I did not learn anything, and I feel like I really could have.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: She's the best! Very enthusiastic. She doesn't take any crap from anyone but lets each of her students know that she cares about them. Some of the readings weren't my favorite but she made them much more fun! Take her!!
Amazing teacher! super nice and interesting content in this course, highly recommend for a divisional
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Dr. Hogan is a decent prof, and not that hard overall. She assigns a lot of reading and homework overall, and expects you to discuss the homework in class. I didn't do all of the homework and was still fine. Make sure you talk to her about your paper ideas cause those are the majority of your grade. Overall not really hard as long as you keep up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Solid teacher that is super engaged in her work. Lots of readings to do outside of class although the discussion that takes place during lecture hits the key points. One big group project and two essays dictate a lot of the grade but she doesn't grade too harshly from my experience.

Dr. Hogan is a fantastic professor! She is super nice, accessible outside of class, and you can tell she really loves, and is passionate about, her job. If you have the opportunity to take a class with her, go for it! You won't regret it.

Great guy and a really good teacher. I was already pretty good at spanish but he definitely helped solidify any areas that were an issue for me. I also knew people who were struggling in my class and he moved heaven and earth to get their grade up so the guy is the real deal. If you are terrified of language build your schedule around this class.

Profe Jung is the best. Absolutely take him for 153. Out of class writing assignments bi weekly, but they are easy 90+'s if you put the time and effort in. Start studying a week before and the class is manageable. Spend a little time each day studying vocab too. Participate as much as you can. Homework is not super difficult and are typically mild.

THE BEST!i took him for 113, 153 and now i am going to take him for 212. He makes it enjoyable and he seems like he loves his job. He gives worksheets out to help study which make it seem elementary but helps so much. I actually took 153 with another teacher and it didnt compare to him at all so I retook the class. Very accesible outside of class.

I had him for 153 and although the class can be a bit demanding at times, he is an extremely good and clear professor. There is a lot of outside work as a result of the Spanish department that you will have to complete no matter which professor you have, but Jung is chill. Would recommend to anyone no matter the situation.

I truly enjoyed Dr. Jung this semester! His class does have a decent amount of homework, but it definitely helps reinforce the concepts learned in class. The tests aren't very difficult as long as you study vocabulary, grammar, and the format of the study guide he provides. He has a great sense of humor and is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Daniel was a great SPA113 professor, he is nice and understanding. There is a lot of work but that's a given for an accelerated course. He gives a mix of assignments from written assignments to oral exams but is not a harsh grader and will give you a study guide which is super helpful. Just stay on top of the reading and study vocab.

He's a great professor & the class is chill! Just memorize the vocab & do the hw; Participation is a breeze & he doesn't grade harshly. The tests are chill, just study the grammar & vocab &  study guide that tells you test content & format. He has a good sense of humor & has engaging, diverse activities to practice the content.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Jung is fantastic! His class does have a decent amount of homework and reading, but it's not bad at all and actually helps you understand the course content. Jung is great at keeping the class fun and interesting.
My absolute favorite class because the teacher has so much energy. It was so fun and I really learned a lot about dance. It does not matter if you have no prior dance experience.
She is an amazing ballet teacher. And although she can be tough on us sometimes she has everyone's best interest at heart. She is also always there to support her students in all endeavors.
Gives great and personal corrections. Very caring teacher.
She's amazing!

Brantly Shapiro is one of the nicest teachers and women I know.  She always has something nice to say and she gives the best corrections because she is usually right about what you are doing wrong.  I plan on taking this class every semester.

You don't get any sort of inclination to what your grade is until the very end of the year, and it is simply not fair to the students. He picks random pop quizzes from the year that you don't even get to know your grade on, he just averages 3 of them. Some quizzes are in class with impossible questions for people who took diligent notes Overall BAD
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: He grades everything at the end. During the year he doesn't grade the quizzes or tell you what you get on them, but at the end he goes “surprise” and picks 3 quizzes that are 20% of your grade. He didn't give an A to anyone's group project that's worth 35% of your grade. All grades are released on the last day and canvas doesn't line up w workday.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: He is a really really nice friendly and smart teacher but the class is super lecture heavy and boring. Pop quizzes but most are taken home and pretty manageable. Very difficult reading that isn't very interesting. Final exams and final group papers are worth alot and you don't really know your grade until the end of the semester.

Gunkel is very jolly but loves pop quizzes and only has one large cumulative final exam. I think he designs his classes so that he has to do the least grading possible which really makes it difficult to know how you are doing in the class until the actual final.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gunkel is always excited about class and intrigued by all thoughts and ideas.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: He is a super nice guy and I learn so much in his class. One of my top 3 fav professors at wake. He changed the way I view the world
Really pearsonable and helpful

French is pretty difficult for me, but Professor Pellet is an amazing teacher. Unlike some language teachers, she doesn't make you feel stupid for messing up. She really cares about you learning the material. Her class are very fast paced; she packs a lot in. A few quizzes and tests, hw every night. Not too bad though.

She is a very sweet lady, but be prepared to only speak in French. You get used to it after awhile, but it is a bit of a shock at first. Most people in 112 have only taken French for 1 semester, but she does a good job at making the language more familiar. The lessons are a bit jumbled but overall she is a good teacher.

Pellet is a decently good professor. She's a nice and pleasant person, and offers good thorough explanations, even though she does jam a lot into each class. Her grading was fair on most assignments, although she was a bit slow with it sometimes.
She was kind of all over the place and tried to cram as many things as possible into one class period. So so so sweet though and such a fair grader. Absolutely love her and would highly recommend

Good teacher, knows her stuff. Very sweet and helpful. She's a fair grader and she teaches well. She is a good french teacher especially if you are not the best at french because she is very thorough. I would recommend her!

She is nice but overanalyzes EVERYTHING. She will take what you say in class and think deeply about it. Participation is mandatory because this is a discussion-based class. Kind of a tough grader, but will make you a better writer. It gives a lot of HW but eased back on it as the semester progressed.

She's cool but overanalyzes what a student says a lot sometimes. Like A means A, not A1 or A2 all the time. Not the most understanding person there is and required a lot of work from students. Solid class after all but there are better professors here at Wake

Not the worst, but not the best. She graded my papers very harshly for no reason, even though everyone in the class said that my papers were great. I liked the in-class discussions, but there was a lot of homework. I would recommend it only because it is on the easier side of WRI 111 classes.

This class is intensive, however, you will undoubtedly emerge a better writer. If you are taking a packed schedule with difficult classes, I would not take this class because the workload is high, however, if you have the time to dedicate to this class, I would highly recommend it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: amazing professor!  love her would suggest her to anyone.  All class we discuss and she has great insight and makes you look at things in a totally new perspective.

Insensitive. No structure/foundation to the class. Hardly taught even a single thing all semester - just showed stuff as if everyone knew it and then had them figure it out. Worse, when you ask questions, almost never understands them. Just three big grades with unclear criteria; harsh (v few A's), subjective grading. Material is interesting bc soc

Class can be boring and he isn't always great at explaining things in class, but it is fairly easy to get an A. Grade is made up a lot of midterm and final and data paper which he gives ample time to do. For SOC divisional its not bad
