Class was way too difficult for an entry-level sociology class. Other professors teach basic sociology while this professor expects students to have the basic knowledge required to write data papers and data analysis with little preparation or expectations. The only grades taken were over a midterm, attendence/participation, a data paper, and final
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This professor was rude and demeaning towards other students. He should not be in an educational institution if he can not address students with respect and professionality.
incredibly condescending towards students. his attitude towards questions he deems insignificant is so pretentious and arrogant it is shameful to witness.
He's super smart but extremely pretentious about it.

Not the best teacher, lots of respectable background work as a researcher but he is objectively bad at educating. Doesn't seem to know how to translate his knowledge to others beyond a "Wrong" or "Right." Should maybe not be involved in introductory level courses at the very least.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr Klotz is extremely helpful in helping to develop your college-level writing skills. After taking ENG 111 with him first semester, I was much better prepared to take on other academic endeavors. He is also very helpful and dedicated to his students.
keeps you thinking...have to do the reading, but overall good class

If you want an easy grade, do not take this professor. You will improve your writing but your grade may suffer. He is a competent professor but if he doesn't like you personally, your grade suffers. He looks upon his students condescendingly, sometimes he voices these opinions.

Michael Klotz is wonderful. he has great class discussion and can honestly be himself. he is intriguing. he grades fairly and notices effort. in regards to papers and essays he is willing to help and steer you in the right direction.

Professor Klotz's class was fairly easy. He was very helpful in working with me to improve my papers and responded promptly to emails. He always has you turn in a draft and then a paper, so he always looks over your draft so your paper can be adequate for his liking. Overall, he is a great professot who cares about his students. Take his class!

He is a great teacher that expects a lot from his students. While the class is super easy and his lectures aren't tough, the test are full of detail. You have to know every little thing about whatever is going to be on the test. He is a tough grader! As long as you talk in class and ask questions, your grade will be great. It is impossible to fail!
Great class
A great professor, has an easy class, is easy going, and barely assigns any work

Dr Crowe is the best religion teacher I have had. Love his lectures and he is very funny! TAKE HIM! Is flexible with his schedule and cares about his students. Makes everything clear and he makes funny faces when he talks! You will have a good time in his class!
Fabulous discussion leader. Get him talking about social activism and athletics.

Very passionate about helping students do their very best work. She expects diligence but will go over and beyond to help guide students towards achieving their goals. She challenges and inspires throughout projects. One of the most interesting and caring people/professors I've ever had.

Dr. Kirouac is very knowledgeable and passionate about what she does. This keeps class interesting and everyone involved. She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. She's candid, thorough and clear. Somehow she is able to bring out the talent in everyone she teaches.
Kirouac is a great teacher. Very intelligent and fair. She knows her stuff, it always ready to talk to students and keeps class entertaining. Her projects are challenging yet completely do-able.
Very enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and smart Professor!
Great class with an easy going and very entertaining professor. Professor Kirouac knows what she's talking about and provides a fun working environment.

I took 309. Take this course if you want to understand grammar. Prof. Lancaster knows his stuff in linguistics. There's quiet a lot of homework, but that's to be expected for a grammar course. Prepare for the work but the grading isn't unreasonable. He's open to answering questions and never makes you feel like an idiot for not understanding
Although his writ-111 is pretty challenging, Dr. Lancaster provides useful feedback to help you improve.
Dr. Lancaster gives tons of feedback on your writing

He doesn't engage very well with students and can be weird - however, he's not the worst teacher and his class can be interesting. Graded by 4 big papers and participation, but it's not that hard to do well on the papers because he gives plenty of opportunity for revision.
Dr. Lancaster's class is demanding, but it is not hard to do well in his class if you put a lot of effort into your papers and revisions.

Dr. Lancaster is super sweet, but he shouldn't be teaching freshmen. clearly a very smart guy but can't get down to an 18y/o level. his instructions were almost always confusing and during class he just talks about stuff that doesn't really matter since the only grade you'll get for the class is based off your papers. not the easiest wri to take
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Lancaster is a super friendly and accessible professor.  He truly wants you to become a better writer.  However, his class is heavy on reading and lectures.  There are around 4-5 big papers.  No draft can be perfect.  There are easier WRI-111 courses but there is no doubt that Lancaster is unmatched in preparing you for academic writing at WF.
Definitely take any course with him.
Definitely super boring at times but overall not a bad teacher.
She's lovely and she is an incredible lecturer. She can be a little disorganized at times but if you do your work you'll get an A
Very nice teacher. Kind of just went on my computer the whole class. Not a lot of work throughout the year, but finals week is heavy. If you work hard, you'll get an A.

Dr. Moore is so kind and engaging. Almost every class is lectures, little work outside of class. Exams require many details to remember for essay questions so it's really important to study. Assignments sometimes lacked structure/needed clarification. She cares a lot about her students so use office hours for help. Take if you rly like art history!

Average art divisional, but DO NOT underestimate the quizzes/tests. Just study a decent amount and you'll get an A. For long response questions (8-10 sentences) you need every sentence packed with a detail or fact. She is so nice and very interactive in her lectures. You are graded on participation, but very easy. Recommend taking, just be careful.

If you need to fulfill your art requirement, definitely take History of World Architecture with Dr. Moore! She is an incredibly engaging speaker and very lenient in terms of grading. There is a lot of reading and projects, but the exams are relatively easy if you have a general idea of the material.
Dr. Moore is so kind-- I highly recommend ART 105 to fufill a divisional. Class can sometimes be a bit boring, but super easy.

Dr. Moore is so awesome. She is an inspiration for what it means to be a smart, strong woman. She graduated from MIT and has done amazing work since then as a teacher-scholar. She is a lenient grader and the oral presentations are not stressful. She's so sweet- I'm even in the campus knitting club with her.
SUPER SWEET GUY. He's a very easy grader and appreciates when students participate. Highly recommend him not only is he not the hardest professor but he's interesting and very nice.

Most assignments are really easy besides the compositions. If you show up and partipate a tiny bit and then study before the exam you should be okay. He is really bad at communicating, answering emails and grading quickly though

Hayes is such a good professor to knock out your language requirement with. He grades pretty generously, especially on assignments like the presentation and conversations. No homework outside of class, but he offers practice problems. One of the better 212 professors to get an A if you just put in basic levels of effort

Show up and participate a little. The literature readings are easy enough, and homework is never checked without him telling you first. Tests, compositions, and interviews arent bad at all if you put in moderate effort. Really good prof to finish your language requirement with! He wants you to succeed and is really understanding.

Dr. Hayes is a wonderful and caring professor. His class is clear and straightforward. Participation is key. He keeps class engaging and wants students to enjoy learning. Additionally, he is really down to earth and understanding. He is super easy to talk to. TAKE THIS MAN'S CLASS. Thank me later.

Pretty easy class. There was only 4 homework assignments which had clear criteria and weren't demanding. All test questions are provided the class before the exam, so you have no excuse to do bad. The final is just the 4th and final exam and is not cumulative. Very lecture heavy, but she is very engaging. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I really like her as a professor. If you have psych background then the class should be a breeze, otherwise learning for the first time might be a little difficult. Textbook reading is "required" for HW but I never read them and have been doing fine. She gives you test questions which is really nice. Great teacher!

Very lecture based class. Not a ton of homework to do outside of class. 4 small quizzes, a midterm and final. A few essay assignments. Very easy grader so far. She gives you all the info about the quiz the class period before so you know what to study. There is a 20 hour community service requirement for the semester.
Great professor and will take her class again!
She's a fine professor. Good intro to psych, definitely an easy class. Canvas quizzes
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Mendonça is super sweet and really passionate and enthusiastic about what she teaches; however, her entire class period is just an hour lecture about the material in the textbook. The class often gets boring and there arent many assignments but as long as you put effort into the few assignments that there are and take notes, youll do fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: In all honesty, this class is not hard it's just people don't want to put in the work and study... It's not impossible to get an A if you actually study (not just in one day). Many are complaining but Ruppert is so nice and straightforward about his expectations. Test questions come from his powerpoints... Get ready for med school ;)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: He is a great professor who sets very clear expectations up front. If you study regularly and show up to class you will receive a good grade! He holds us accountable for studying the material and has never been negative when answering questions. I have learned a lot from this class!

The class is hard, but Professor Ruppert is definitely worthy of my respect. It is actually not impossible to get A from learning hard. He designed the class in a hard way because he cares if we really learned from the class and he hopes we can have a bright future. 

I don't believe a straight-A science student would earn a C and almost failed ^^_
Grades are only based on tests and 1 project. Definitely take another section, where they have open-notes quizzes and low stakes assignments and all get As.

He is difficult for no reason. He gets angry when we ask questions about our exams after we take them. His tests are very difficult and he can't answer a lot of our questions during lectures. He only teaches one section of this class. Compared to the other professors for this class definitely take someone else.

He is very caring and passionate about what he teaches. I had him for classical/biblical Hebrew and he is incredibly understanding and kind. He likes to engage with the students and create a good and happy atmosphere in the classroom. He is definitely one of the best professors I have had in my educational experience and anyone who has him is lucky

Loved Dr.Hoglund but he's not easy. His class taught me so much and I would recommend it if you are willing to accept an A is very difficult to receive. Most of your grade is dependent upon 4 tests, 2-3 group projects, and 1 paper. Such a sweet man- he has a lot to give as a person and professor!
Horrible teacher. Hard grader. Ruined my college experience.
Take him. Go to class an pay attention and its an easy A.
He's a good teacher and I'd definitely reccomend him. He doesn't take attendance but he notices when you're not there, and you have to go to class to do well on the tests.

This FYS was easy / I recommend. There is are midterm final papers and a few other assignments towards the end of the semester but other than that it is reading books/watching movies and answering a questions on them. She is not a harsh grader. Class consists of discussing the works we did outside of class. She usually ends 15 minutes early.

Her FYS about psychopaths is very interesting. We just watch horror movies, tv shows, and read total of 3 books all about psychopaths or killers. It's honestly pretty fun. There's a couple long essays at the end of the semester but nothing too bad. Highly recommend to anyone who is looking for an interesting and not super intense FYS.

I took Dr. Knights FYS and the class consisted of us discussing the homework for the entire period. She requires a lot of reading/movie watching but isnt a harsh grader at all so as long as you read the required material and give minimal answers and show up to class, youll do fine.

She's a really good professor! Had her for 153, and I learned quite a bit. She's usually good about office hours and is really good at helping answer your questions. She also emails back quickly. You do have to study for your quizzes and tests. Decent amount of homework, which is helpful to do but not usually collected. Definitely a good choice.
new to teaching, classes require a lot of studying and outside work, she is however available and eager to help, classes sometimes go off topic, overall an average professor
Terrible professor. Likes to hear himself talk. Gives you whatever grade he wants and doesn't back it up.
Clearly knew the subject matter, but sometimes had a difficult time expressing it in a clear manner.

I took Dr. Durotoye for multiple classes, both lower and upper-level. In a nutshell: Highly knowledgeable, funny, and candid (a breath of fresh air), as a caveat his classes aren't organized well and tangents can occur, but getting a good grade in class is eminently do-able.

dr. durotoye has been one of my favorite professors at wake.  he is brilliant, as is obvious, but what makes his classes are his unabashed lectures--he's not afraid to look at both sides of an issue.  this is necessary, especially at a homogenous, narrow-minded institution like wake forest.
Not a very good class...teaching was unclear and discussion was not very stimulating.  Not a lot of work, but hard to get an A.  Nice guy though, talks a lot.

I learned a lot from being in her Com Sci class last semester. Learning to code in Java was a challenging yet very rewarding process. Her teaching encouraged me to create my own solutions before I looked to technology, which encouraged me to critically think and develop stronger problem solving skills.
She made me want to be a computer science major
Professor Crellin was an excellent professor! She clearly understands the material well
Class can be hard but I feel like Im learning how to program well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Terrible. Stay away from this professor. She is the worst and cannot teach. Please steer clear.

I loved having Prof. Schroth. He is super nice and helpful in explaining the more difficult French concepts. He was always accessible. I found the class itself difficult, but I thought he made otherwise difficult material as easy as it could be and was a super lenient grader. When the class as a whole messed up a topic, he would just not count it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: It is not necessarily an easy A. Be prepared to study vocabulary and grammar a lot for FRH154. Very fast-paced class, tests, or writing assessments every other week. But it is doable and manageable if you put in the work. He uses the same structure for all the tests and will give you clear expectations of what you should know.

I took FRH 154, not 153... but he's a very nice and understanding guy. He realizes which aspects of the class are difficult for the students and modifies the course accordingly. this is a very fast-paced class-we have a test every other week & in week we don't have a test we have a writing/speaking asessment. no idea what my grade is, late grader

I absolutely loved Dr. Schroth. I took him for both FRH 111 and 112 and he is such a kind soul! I'm not very good at french but he made the class so enjoyable and took the time to really get to know each student individually. He's super understanding and really cares about his students both personally and academically. If you can, take him!

I took Dr. Schroth's FYS about Sexuality. It was his first time teaching this course. Overall, he was a good professor. He is very understanding of mental health and is accepting of all students. My biggest issue in the class was that all of the work (essays) were assigned at the same time in the last few weeks of class. It was stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I took Dr. Schroth for an FYS100 about sexuality (I did NOT take him for FRH153). At first, I hated the class, but once we started to read better books, I started to enjoy it. Most of the books were really good. The papers are pretty stupid because they are out of 1. Lots of reading, lots of work. But overall, I liked the class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: With a blended course instruction, I was hoping to receive some sort of online instruction. That was not the case. Originally, class would be 50min every day, but we only received 50min of instruction on Friday. No async lectures and zero communication, but the same work load. Takes 1-2 months to grade assignments. Be prepared to teach yourself
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This is a very difficult class, but he is caring and good working with students to help meet needs. Reasonable test questions, doesn't want students to excessively memorize, and instead focus on key points. Lenient HW deadlines, and HW is relevant to material + exams. Overall great professor, very approachable which is good for a hard class.

I took Dr. Stich for Chem 111 L and found it to be fine. He does prelab lectures at the beginning of class to make sure everyone understands the lab. He is always happy to answer questions and is helpful during lab. There is a lab midterm and final but not too difficult if you study. Lab reports are graded by TA's as Satisfactory or Unsatisfactory.
Really nice person outside of class, and very helpful in class.

He is a very nice guy who's passionate about chem, but lectures were boring. In his defense, our semester was the first class he taught, so a lot of it was him figuring out how to work everything; with little help from higher ups. I did do a lot of self teaching, but it's also just a repeat of HS chem. Forgiving with grades, hard to reach on email.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Prof Stich is a very nice man, but a very boring teacher. His lectures will put you to sleep, and I basically had to teach myself everything in his CHM111 class. Luckily his class is an entry-level course so the material is not crazy difficult, but don't take him if you do not want to waste your life away on ALEKS.

He is a great professor who is very passionate. He is flexible & allows his students to take risks and just have fun exploring the topics of AI. There is reading to do, but it's what you would expect from an English class. He brings really unique & interesting perspectives and connects topics that I wouldn't have considered relating to AI.
Dr. Garite is a great professor! He is very engaging and you can tell that he is truly passionate about the subject he is teaching. Reasonable grader and very nice person overall! Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I love dr. Garite. He is extremely passionate and knowledgeable about the topics. As long as you do the work it is very easy to do well. Id recommends participating at least once each class. He requires a lot of reading and checks annotations but it is easy to get past that. As long as you do the work and put in a little effort, you will get an A.

Get ready to read and annotate. He actually checks annotations and takes attendance every class. He is an extremely boring lecturer (don't take him in the morning or you will pass out). He just reads from a packet of notes and isn't super engaging. Takes class participation very seriously and it has a huge impact on your grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Garite allows students to take intellectual risks. While his course explores alternative ways of expanding the bounds of our perception, he encourages students to do this in their own lives. His course allows for a healthy dose of introspection.
A large amount of homework every night. The teacher believes in cold calling rather than voluntary participation. He grades really hard on the tests also.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He is a super nice teacher, and he is always open to talk in office hours. He is also transparent with grading, and allows for corrections on compositions and then takes the average of the two versions. However, the tests are nearly impossible. No matter how much you study, they are so so hard. The average on tests was never above a 70.

I'd recommend someone else for 309 if you want to minor in Spanish. He doesn't really teach, he just expects you to come in with questions about the chapter you read. Exams are really difficult and so hard to finish in 50 minutes. You can correct your compositions though. The final project is doable but he doesn't give a lot of time to do it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: He gives reading quizzes every other class, and they can be difficult, even if you've done the reading.  He is good about answering questions and is always willing to meet with you outside of class to explain things.
Most unclear, unhelpful professor I have ever come across. Does not give helpful guidelines and is unresponsive to students asking for clarification. Do not take!
Very few assignments make up the grade, class is boring and information is not well conveyed. In general, other spanish professors want you to succeed much more and make it easier.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor is okay however get ready to learn everything outside of class while just having meaningless practice in class. All assignments are rated incredibly heavily and everyone is graded very toughly. Getting 80s is not difficult but this professor did not assign a single 100 to anyone in the class throughout the entire semester.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She gives everyone a chance to participate, so even quiet kids who do not want to raise their hands are not out of the conversation. She gives homework, but does not check it so as long as you come in knowing the concept of the reading, it is completely fine if you get a few answers wrong. She accepts all opinions as long as you back it up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Awesome professor would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: minimal homework, takes attendance, participation is important
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Utley is quite possibly the most intelligent and enlightened human being that I have ever met, and I felt smarter after leaving class each week. He got me to think critically and deeper than I ever have before, and I am more prepared for law school because of Dr. Utley. I recommend that everyone take a class with him, but you have to work!

Easily one of the most intelligent men I've ever come into contact with at Wake Forest. You should only take him if you are very intellectually curious and are highly motivated to do work on your own, because the only graded material is the final. If you take him seriously, he will mold you into a better student and human being.
The themes and ideas from this class will stick with you and will time and again influence the way you see the world. You're in college, think a bit. It won't kill you!
He's brilliant, but not easy. If you have the slightest intellectual curiosity, you'll love him. If not, why are you here again?

what a way to enter the college world.  this guy is pretentious, and literally gave the entire class a flat B.  apparently he couldn't be bothered to grade the work, but was certainly willing to put us in our place, so to speak.  furthermore, his idea of a competent student is one who will regurgitate the professor's opinion on site.

I took FYS with Dr. Jenkins. She truly cares about her students and is always willing to provide great feedback on how you can improve. There are a lot of readings and writings, and participation is a big part of her teaching style, but I honestly found it pretty chill and easy. There is one final project, but its personalized, so its not too bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Jenkins is so caring and nice. She's always available to help and gives very clear feedback on how you can improve on your writings. Some weeks there will be no work others there will be a lot of reading, but if you like animals, its all interesting to read. The 7 writings are not that long and she bases the questions off of class discussion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Super cool professor and actually super interesting class, however can be very bipolar with work. One week its nothing, the next is 50+ pages of reading. Graded on 7 in class essays, 2 of which u can drop and grading is very fair. One final project at the end which is personal so its chill. Take if u wanna play with animals.

I opted to take a course with Dr. Jenkins for a major elective; it was a mistake I won't repeat.  She is very exacting in how she grades her students, but doesn't hold herself to the same standard.  Ungraded in-class assignments were returned with two pages of negative commentary.  She is an overly critical micro-manager.  I'd avoid her.

Absolutely great professor. English profs are frequently confusing and a little out there - I've never encountered one as organized as Prof. Jenkins.  So sweet, down to earth, relate-able, interested enough in material w/o being weird, and just a great teacher. Can not emphasize enough how helpful and available she is.

Instructor took a potentially intriguing topic - Anilingus in Contemporary Fiction - and made it into a dreary Calvinist affair. Too much kvetching about his old man (and Don DeLillo, for that matter). Not recommended.
Absolutely love this professor. hilarious tangents. sometimes can be mildly offensive and or offtopic but is brilliant. love his take on the literature

Great class. Hans is hilarious and really down-to-earth. He also talks you through your paper ideas and lets you know what may work and what won't. Also, his tangents during lectures are world-class and often very funny.
No Comments
No Comments

Personally, I wouldn't recommend others take this course. The details of assignments weren't made clear, she responds way too late, and doesn't discuss anything in class which makes it virtually impossible to reach her. The assignments weren't that interesting and half of the time it seemed that she wasn't too sure about what she was teaching.

Stay away. Stay far away. Atkinson has no business teaching at a university of Wake's caliber and is a clear example of young, incompetent PhD grads slipping into teaching positions that they aren't up for. She talks so much yet says so little of substance. She is the most finicky grader imaginable and can't answer the most basic content questions.
She has NO IDEA what she is doing or why she is here. Just inconsiderate and inconsistent with grading all around, that is all I have to say.

She was alright, just does not accept late work and made the discussion posts due on Saturday at noon. The class itself is not difficult, she is just all over the place and I don't think anyone feels like they have learned anything of importance (or anything at all) in this class

She is an easy A, her essay prompts are a nice mix between complex and simple. She gives plenty of opportunities for more grades. Her feedback helps become a better writer and is a light grader with revisions. But at times classes can be very boring.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Lachgar was such a thoughtful teacher. He was always so caring and so kind twords students, understanding if they had to miss class or didn't complete assignments (he would always move back the due date). He has office hours everyday and is quick to email back. He made such an effort to know students personally. My favorite professor at Wake!

Professor Lachgar was amazing. He is a very nice professor and cares about his students. As a chem student you certainly want to get to know this man. He is extremely laid back and funny, and a fairly easy test grader. I strongly recommend this professor.

This man is the nicest and so caring. He went out of his way to get to know me. The online homework was very time consuming and frustrating to complete. He taught the class backwards, so did not line up with the lab. This made it super hard to understand/succeed in the lab, which is why I would not take again.
He rocks. CHM120 with him was fantastic. He goes out of his way to learn about each student.
Dr. Lachgar was my favorite professor this semester. Made a not-so-interesting class interesting. Homework is manageable. Tests were very clear and pretty easy.

Really nice guy, but lectures are long and fast paced. There are labs every week and the tests come pretty much from the homework and lectures. This class requires minimal coding. He is very reasonable with curves and rounding and using notes for tests.

Dr. Gade is very knowledgeable and a great teacher! There's a lab/homework about every week, but they are fairly straightforward and the due dates are communicated very well. He is very accessible outside of class, so office hours are helpful if you have any questions.
Lectures are a little confusing. A lot of the work is graded on completion. Exams are fairly easy.
His lectures are usually long and can be fast paced and get confusing . He isn't a hard grader and the workload is manageable. He is also a very genuine guy.
So easy going and genuinely a nice guy! highly recommend
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Good teacher, great person. Dr. Eure was my major adviser and Evolution professor. He taught the course excellently. The material  was challenging but comprehensive. Pre-meds might find little material in this course that's applicable to them, but (true?) biology majors will enjoy Evolution. Highly recommended as a teacher and an adviser.

Dr. Eure is hard--there's no doubt about it.  But it was refreshing to have someone who challenged you rather than told you that by getting into Wake you were "smart enough."  I hated the class as I suffered through it, but I would do it again because I think it was a great foundation for the rest of university!  Everyone should take Dr. Eure!
I actually complained to the department head (at the time) about him. I found his teaching style too arrogant and he seemed disinterested in students.
I thought he was very hard, but fair...and willing to help/open to questions.  I definitely learned a lot.
This man is horrible!! I am on the dean's list as a Chem major, and he actually told me that I don't belong in college! Don't go near the class...save your sanity and self-esteem.

Prof Simmons is SUPER nice... but make sure to pay attention in class... BUY THE DRESSLER SUPPLEMENT.... and read the chapter you are discussing in class before the class.. and you will be wayyyy ahead of your peers because she talks in circles. but if you know ahead of time what its about... it all makes sense

I heard a lot of negative opinions about Kami while I was taking her class from past students. However, I think she has improved a lot over the past year. Lectures are interesting, she is a really nice person, she maintained a good atmosphere in class, and while her exam was long, it was fair. I particularly liked her compared to other 1L profs.
She is a terrible professor and gets agitated and frustrated when asked any question because she is unsure of the material.

Seriously the worst teacher I have ever had. She doesn't help you at all if you have questions because she has to look to the hornbook to figure out the answer. Also, she even gave wrong elements for certain crimes. I have no clue how she got a job at Wake
Nice person, dreadful professor

The course is interesting but Prof Williams makes it super boring. This class was HORRIBLE. He goes on super long tangents that have nothing to do with the subject and you pretend that you are paying attention or he will be super weird and go up to your desk and call you out. he expects you to know a ton of information that was never talked about
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests? Not many

comment: Big History is a crazy weird course. It's something stoner kids would love to watch a documentary about narrated by Neil Degrasse Tyson or the like. In fact, some episodes of Comsos covers stuff on the tests! He also lets you take your tests outside of the class, so it's basically open book. Go see him in office hours once and he'll love you, too.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: This is by far the worst class I have ever taken at Wake Forest. He spends the entire lecture rambling on about nothing with no structure or overall point. He then holds you responsible for all the material in the book that he never mentioned in class. I had to work extremely hard to do well in this class and I hated every minute of it.
Great man. Favorite class. I loved this guy. He is brilliant and just a truly extraordinary man.

Pretty much one of the worst professors I've had at Wake. He is a brilliant man who is incredibly knowledgeable. Sadly he is very bad at teaching and has very few moments of clarity. His expectations are absurd and I found the class to be a total waste of time. On top of that, instead of encouraging open discussion, he pressed his agenda constantly
I feel bad for him because he desperately wants to be the cool teacher and engage his students but I just feel so much second hand embarrassment.

Robert Hellyer is the worst professor I have taken at Wake. He gives an absurd amount of reading, is incredibly short tempered and distrustful of students. He leaves no room for error you will be penalized harshly for the slightest mistake. Not to mention his classes are incredibly boring
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: DO NOT TAKE HELLYER!! There's a lot of reading with the possibility of an essay-style pop quiz. For the final project, he decided to change the instructions after we had written our drafts by requiring more sources and asking us to explain why each source was reliable, which makes little sense as he allows you to research only using his database.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This is the worst professor I have had at Wake, and I guarantee it is the worst FYS class possible. It has an insane amount of reading and other assignments with difficult grading, including difficult grading for even participation. The content is not interesting at all (unless you care about things such as water infrastructure in the 1800s).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very paranoid about students not doing the reading so we constantly have pop quizzes. Very distrustful of students in general. Gives assignments with confusing directions because he doesn't know how to be concise. Lectures are painfully boring. Also so much reading about the most pointless topics.
Took her for FYS... she was going crazy style for no reason - the readings we were doing we insane for an FYS class. Nice lady but there are WAY easier options out there.

When lecturing she moves a little slow but that is also because she ask for a lot of student engagement and kids will just sit in silence, other than that she is a good explainer and very good with answering questions if you have any.

Currently done with the class and awaiting the final. 
Very prepared for class, notes were very clear and well-organized. Always open to questions and made sure everybody understood the material before moving on. Very caring about students and learned everyone's names quickly. Classwork questions similar to what's on the exams, with notes posted.

I am currently in Dr. Falcon's class and I love it. She is a great teacher and also so nice and personable. Her tests are challenging but not insanely hard. I would definitely take one of her classes again.
The lecture is clear and well organized, and she always uploads the class notes which help me understand much better. A lot of extra credits that will boost your grade.

Even though this class wasn't my first option I'm glad I stayed because she's a great professor. Her lectures are always informing and her work is pretty clear and direct. She's a straight foward person and she likes her papers a certain way but it's helpful for organization. Taking her class was good for my gpa and I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Tough class- but meaningful!

Assigned too many things compare to other FYS courses. She is so demanding and rude over emails. The syllabus alone can be its individual book. There is not one single enjoyable thing from the class. For your own good, avoid her at all cost.

Worst professor of my life. I've never had a professor that honestly made me consider dropping out of college before her. She didn't use Canvas, posted all grades publicly for the entire class to see, and was very picky and confusing about what she wanted on her essays. AVOID HER LIKE THE PLAGUE
AMAZING!!!!! Take her class. It was like therapy. So amazing.

Took his class twice. At first, I thought he was boring but the second time around, after taking a couple of courses by far worse professors, Dr. Thomas is actually really good in hindsight. Clear lectures, has a chill atmosphere, and is a great guy all around.

Took this course during summer school, and he did the reverse classroom setting. I enjoyed this approach for summer school and I think Dr. Thomas has a great mind set for summer school. He teaches you a lot without making you overwhelmed, and understands you want to do well so he helps his student be successful.
Best teacher I have ever had.
Avoid at all costs.  Anything else would be libelous.
Very thorough and easily understood.  You'll learn much!
Decent amount of work, but her POL 280 class is very helpful in preparing you for the 300-level seminar class. A lovely woman who is very easy to talk to.
Very helpful outside of class, but will make you work for it!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her classes are thought-provoking and her enthusiasm for politics is awesome.  Some assignments don't always connect to the lesson right away, but you're able to make the connections eventually.  She is super helpful! I would take her again and recommend her.

She's pretty easy - show up, do the hw, you will get a good grade. Her lectures are pointless though, the readings don't really connect to the tests, and she assigns seemingly random but very inconvenient out-of-class assignments (ie, tutor for free for 20 hours, lead a tour for 4 hours outside of class on a Friday). Would not recommend
She's great! Extremely helpful too! Take her.

Take her FYS class!! She is the sweetest, kindest professor, and she makes her lessons engaging! There is a lot of reading, but as long as you participate and have an overall idea of the reading, you should be good to go!

This is one of my favorite professors. She is accessible outside the classroom and wants her students to do well. I took the FYS on fairy tales with her and genuinely enjoyed learning about it. She was extremely fair with the workload and gave a lot of leniency if she didn't explain an assignment correctly. Love her!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Somewhat disorganized and unclear on graded material. Plus, lots of reading every night. Other than that great professor! I just felt that the class was harder than it needed to be. She cares about the topics and if very amusing.

Dr. Howards was a great FYS professor for the topic of Fairytales and Grimm Brothers. There was definitely a lot of reading each night, but Dr. Howards was always well-read on the readings and passionate about them. She is always energetic and incorporates fun elements to her classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I took her GER 111 class this fall, and she's really amazing. If you make a concerted effort in this class, you will be sure to learn.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Howards is an amazing professor. She teaches students tough material but yet it feels so easy. She is so excited about German that students want to do well. Just go to class and don't miss a class.  And don't come late or she'll make you say a tongue twister in German!

The class is interesting and she does a good job of selecting interesting readings, but there are frequent quizzes that are pretty specific and difficult if you haven't read. She's fairly accessible for questions but there is a lot of work outside of the class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Lots of extra credit opportunities, straight forward exams with practice exams from previous years posted. Reviews well in class. Don't need to read textbook as everything on test will be covered in class but necessary for HW. Would take

Honestly a pretty good teacher that gives good lectures. However as someone who was doing really well in her class, her extra credit did not reward skill in Econ. Rather than simply doing a curve, it leveled the playing field too much. On one test, people could earn up to 50% extra with almost no Econ knowledge. Otherwise, would be a 4/5.

I really enjoyed Prof. Manassah's FYS. The topic is very interesting and I learned a lot about poverty economics. Many lectures and unannounced quizzes on readings but they aren't hard. A few papers and debates, lots of reading, no exams. Lectures are sometimes interesting but some complicated econ concepts. Easy grader and very understanding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a cool person that makes it very clear what the curriculum and grading system will look like. A lot of opportunity to gain back points. People who complain that it's too hard are just not that smart. She gives a lot of extra credit when the class needs it. Uses student examples to convey ideas

moves rly fast and only lectures, no time for practice/review. the whole class is just a few lecture days, an exam, and she goes to the next unit. the textbook doesn't cover anything on the exam: if you don't take note of everything she says in class/if you miss class even once there's no way to prepare for the exam. there r way better ecn150 profs
4 midterms and the lowest grade drops. Mandatory final. Very kind and funny professor that makes lectures interesting. A lot of extra credit.

He makes the class seem easy but the guy can't teach for his life.  He expects the class to know exactly what he's talking about in class and assigns us GRADED homework that he never taught in the previous class.  Half the time he gets trumped on his own problems, do not take his class.
DO not be fooled he only reads power point slides for his lectures the class is worthless.

I had Professor JP for the first session of summer school. He teaches strictly from the book and gives aplia homework assignments everyday. We only had two tests, a midterm and a final. He curves grades by a lot so that's one positive aspect of taking one of his classes. A lot of people in my macro class were retaking it though.
JP, what a fellow. He's an extremely nice individual, and he's Chilean. In his ECN150 class, there are two tests: a midterm and final exam. The curriculum and teaching is by-the-book.
Chuck is awesome.  Easily one of the best professors at WFU Business.  He makes the classes enjoyable and subject matter comprehensible.
No Comments

Chuck is legit-real world experiences related to students are great and he's got the stories. He's got one about a trip to Japan-it'll keep you on the edge of your seat!!! He's pretty laid back but a very interesting speaker. Probably the best at Babcock.

Chuck rocks!  He is so interesting and takes a daunting subject and makes it enjoyable.  His stories are fantastic.  Yes, we all think he is a covert CIA agent and that makes it even better.  Absolutely the best professor I've had in 4 semesters at Babcock.  And has that Texan swagger.  Older-yes?  Married-yes? but my, my, my he sure is charming!

I love how this class pushed me to do my best work. At first I was not that excited about law, but now after taking and going through this class I have decided to become a lawyer. That is all because I had such a great time learning the material, and I knew that I could always go up  to the teacher after class and ask him any questions that I had.
Great class, teaches you practical aspects of litigation.  Prof. Anderson is very knowledgeable and will help you get *real world experience*.
Has a real interest in teaching you and in making you a good lawyer.
No Comments
Best prof at Wake Law.

One of the best professors at Wake. A little bit like the old TV detective Columbo - pretends to have no idea what's going on, but actually knows it all. Including whether or not you're not paying attention...
Peeples is entertaining and easy on students; hated the topic of torts however; class was a free for all-
His class was fun, interesting and moved at a comfortable pace.  He covers the material from all sides and encourages class discussion.  I looked forward to class.
Bomb dot com. He's tough, but it's worth it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Alright folks, Ill keep it short. Dr. Won teaches a great class where youll work a lot and learn even more.
Hard exams, lots of homework
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: Dr. Won is a great guy! He's approachable, smart, and he inspires his students to achieve greater, not only in Mathematics but life. His tests are hard and he doesn't give out 100%s on homework but he is very transparent and fair in his grading. While his class is difficult, he is a great professor and I would totally take his class again.

Never taken comp sci before and I had to take 111 for a science requirement. this class is NOT beginner friendly. most ppl had some experience with cs already, so i already felt behind and the whole semester was playing catch up. he moves too fast in class and there was no set structure to anything. exams are hard; problem sets are even harder.

Dr. Pauca is an amazing professor! He is so kind and cares so much about his students, he listens to our requests and concerns with great attention and will do whatever necessary to help you succeed. He helps struggling students and pushes successful students to take extra steps, and ultimately makes his class rewarding for everyone.

Dr. Pauca was awesome. He is always there for questions and can help you with anything you need. If you pay attention in class and work hard on the problem sets and study for the midterms you will get an A.

One of my favorite professors so far. The midterms weren't bad, but make sure you study a lot. The online reading/homework takes a while, but it's totally doable. 

If you get stuck on homework or Problem-sets, he's usually super patient and ends up showing the class how to do most of it anyway. If you're new to comp sci like me, take his class

Dr. Austin is quite the character. She goes off on random tangents which are hilarious and worrying. This class was pretty great, I really enjoyed the content, but the whole class is simply two papers and two tests, so it's high pressure on each one. The readings are dense, and at times hard to understand but interesting. I'd recommend this class

I was actually in her FYS class, "The Good Life." Super interesting class, easy A and a light workload. Dr. Austin is an incredibly interesting teacher who creatively engages her class every time. We legit had a class where we went out to lunch together. Super awesome class, would definitely take any of Dr. Austin's classes again.

Professor Emily Austin was my favorite professor this semester. I could not recommend Contemporary Moral Problems more than I already have for those with a passion for the philosophical side of current social issues. Professor Austin focuses on pressing issues in various lenses through thought-provoking class discussions.

Love her as a person! Her class can get confusing at times because of the hw, but she's really good at explaining things and clarifying. She actually cares about her students and is funny. She never forces her opinion on you either. I recommend this class if you're ok with reading hard philosophical papers.

He is a very nice and down-to-earth professor. Attendance is mandatory, but he won't force you to participate. He does give a bit more work than other FYS classes, but it's usually like watching movies for class discussions. Nice guy and not a bad option for an FYS class. He isn't strict on grading and is easy to engage with friendly class dynamic
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Knapczyk was an okay teacher. Not a class I wanted to take but needed to take, so if you are interested could be a different experience. Harsh graders on papers basically always got an 83 to 85 and papers are a main part of your grade. Class is boring and he takes attendance

Dr. Knapczyk is very nice. He worked hard to give background information on topics covered in class. However, the work load was very intense, more than every other FYS I have heard about at Wake. He would also give you grades on weekly papers with no feedback on how to receive a better grade on the next paper.
Very easy grader but lots of homework and studying, very rewarding class

Please don't take his class. He is an extremely tough grader and it's overall a very hard class to do well in. The Canvas page is very disorganized and his slides can be tough to follow. There's lots of reading & writing to do in this class. I would take any other professor. He's a funny guy, but his teaching style just isn't it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Was docked from an A to a C on a paper based on double-spacing after periods on a paper. Appealed to professor and subsequently showed that double-spacing not actually correct. No change. Would not take professor again - not reasonable.
He is a decent teacher. Gives you lackluster feedback regarding your essays. I would not take this class. Hes a nice and smart guy just grades hard for no reason when its a freshman seminar class.

Dr. Llewellyn is extremely knowledgeable and intelligent. It's clear he knows what he's talking about, and always offers great advice. Caring and funny guy. Lots of reading/writing, a tough grader, and slightly disorganized, but overall a good professor. Llewellyn definitely has his students' best interest at heart. You will learn a ton from him.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Please take him if you can. His class is medium difficulty compared to other teachers, which is good because the final is a department final. He is very understanding and also funny. Office hours is great for outside help, which can't be said for many of the other profs.
He is the best and doesn't make you memorize formulas (he gives a cheat sheet on the tests). The homework is a lot though and it is harder than the tests but he is great

Professor Odessa is a great professor. The tests he gives are quite easy however beware of the homework as it far exceeds the lessons and tests in terms of difficulty. Professor Odessa is very kind and mostly teaches clearly however he does make a lot of simple mistakes throughout lecture.

Take this professor if you are bad at math! I love Professor Odessa. He is so kind and wants to succeed. He understands that not everybody is good at math (like me) and that math is more about knowing how to do the problem than having to memorize equations that you will never use again. He is the best math professor at Wake!
the kindest, most caring professor ever. I LOVED him. He is who you want for CHM111. Easy, clear, straightforward and cares about his students.

Dr Linebarrier is very nice, but he tends to be all over the place and overly energetic. Lectures are boring and not helpful, read the textbook to actually learn the material. All orgo classes are hard, but I would not pick Linebarrier as my first choice. Overall okay professor but not recommended.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is so wholesome and genuinely cares about his students. He is very accessible outside of class and loves when students come to office hours or have questions. The material is really not hard, and ALEKS helps you keep up with it. There are weekly short quizzes, but they honestly help to make sure you're caught up on the material.

LOVE DOUG! He is genuine, high-energy and loves teaching chemistry. Weekly quizzes based on optional hw problems and the lecture but help prepare for common exams. I would say he kind of assumes you have prior chem knowledge during the lectures but he is super available after class and in office hours. If you've taken honors/AP chem you'll do fine

One of the best professors I have ever had. He really understands his subject. He genuinely cares about his student's work and will sit down with you and go through each sentence of your essay and help you.
best teacher I have had at wake forest. He genuinely cares about his students.

Dr. Giles is such a caring professor who clearly explains how the course is graded and outlines the best path for success. He understands how upsetting it can be to do poorly on one test and have your entire grade drop because of it, so he takes that into account in his grading system. Such a fun and interesting class; I really recommend it!

Professor Giles may be one of the best professors Ive ever had. You can tell that he really enjoys teaching his subject, which is reflected through his assignments, lectures and involvement with students. He is also extremely understanding, and is not overly critical with missing or late assignments, as long as you have a genuine interest and care
Don't take a class with Eshe Sherley. Her grading scale makes no sense, she is insensitive and it is truly a headache to be one of her students.

Well well, where do I begin, the amount of work for this class is other worldly, there is more reading for this 100 level course than as if I was studying for the bar exam, I think I could've devoted my time to becoming the head engineer at space X and it probably would have taken me less time then completing the first three readings for this class

Way too much reading. You complete homework and quizzes that seem easy and expect completion grades. She lets you do a few homework assignments and two quizzes before she grades a single assignment. She then grades it like she is Jesus Christ and you are a goat. You go from a 100 in the class to a 70 in seconds and must get your way out of a hole.

I am absolutely flabbergasted, I enrolled in this course because it was a 100 level divisional course. Little did I know, my work would be graded as if it was as important as the declaration of independence, Im not entirely sure why on gods green earth I didn't drop this class. I think I lost years off my life due to the ridiculous grading system.

There is no world in which you should ever take this class, quite possibly was the most ridiculous class I have ever taken in my life. She grades as if everyone has a Harvard degree in African American studies. She teaches a 100 level class and grades your work like a military sergeant. Ive never seen anything quite like this class. Run, run far
Very easy and open notes test. Very kind professor.

She's the sweetest professor and we've had one test, which she made open note, and one essay, that she gave us a month to do. She gives good feedback on your assignments and is a very generous grader. Her class is focused on lectures, and she posts links to short readings that she recommends you to complete before the class.

I strongly recommend taking Dr. Roy if you are taking SOC 150. She is so nice and understanding and the class is fairly interesting. Both our midterm and final were open note. Definitely an easy way to satisfy a divisional and an interesting class if you want to pursue sociology.

I took Dr. Roy for SOC 150 and she is the sweetest person ever! Her class is not hard at all even though it is very lecture heavy. We had one test and it was open note, and our final exam is also open note. so strongly recommend! She also has a lot of knowledge about the topic of sociology and is very passionate.
Good professor, extremely organized, clear, always willing to help. Learning a new language takes a lot of work. But she sets you up to succeed

I had never taken Spanish before taking this class, and it was fairly difficult for me because I had previously taken five years of French and it was a rough transition. She was always willing to meet with me outside of class, and she really wanted me to succeed. I'm specifically choosing my Spanish class for next semester so I can have her again.
do not take her class

Professor Francom is quite the mean-spirited woman. I was out with mono for a week and a half and she did not allow me to make up quizzes (I received 0's) and she did not respond to my emails asking about missed assignments. She does not speak English very well and when you ask a grammar question, she often responds w/ "I don't know". Inconsistant.

Honestly the worst teacher I've ever had. Lectures are rambling & confusing & so pretentious the message gets muddled. If we did good on the test she would make the next one much harder to ensure we did poorly. Tons of negative & unnecessary comments on papers. I could go on & on but the bottom line is do NOT take this teacher if you can help it.

She's frustrating. Her papers are easy to write, but she nails you on the weirdest things and has a few unrealistic expectations (can't use outside sources, but expects you to cite when you make "generalizations." I didn't really like her style and she just came off as flippant and rude a lot.

I took Prof. McClancy for ENG150 and I was happy I did. Every week we had to have read a book and then in class she just talked about that book all week. She didn't ask for participation and she pretty much told us what the book was about (so you didn't have to read it). There are only three essays, but I'll admit she's a tough grader on those.

She's great! Very open to any idea you shoot her and has a great classroom setting. Get to know her! She's fun to talk to and if you put an effort into her class you'll thouroughly enjoy it. Loves to be challenged and contridicted.
Best professor ever.  Excellent and extremely patient teacher...had him for choir all four years and for independent study...passionate about his music and his work...AWESOME!

Wow, it's hard to beleive 18 years have passed since I was Dr. Gorelick's student.  I was telling a friend about him just the other day and decided to take some time to google him. He was a fantastic teacher!
awesome professor, loves the subject and respects his students. he's also Kenny G's brother. no joke.
very good prof, very clear and helpful, cares very much about his subject and his students.
I loved this class a lot! You can tell Dr. Cho is very intelligent but he explains things in a down to earth way.

I was trying to decide between being a physics major and going to med school. Now I know for sure that I want to be a physics major. Dr. Cho is really inspiring and I liked that he really cared about how I did in class.

I remember hating physics in high school, and now I'm a physics major.  This class spoke to me and everything became clear.  I hope the rest of my classes are like this one.  Office hours helped a lot!
I really liked him a lot.  He's tough (and fair), but he's super-nice and helpful.  You can tell he really wants you to succeed.

Prof. Calhoun is such a sweet person. His Strategic Job Search Class is rlly easy with only one final group project. Actually rlly helpful for the future with the job/interview process. easy way to gain credits and add to GPA

Love Prof. Calhoun. This class is super helpful in navigating the career search and learning how to network. Prof. Calhoun was very accessible and easy to get in touch with regarding questions or concerns. This class was great, and I recommend it all Wake students take this course with him at some point!

Dr. Calhoun is AMAZING. I took his summer edu120 course. He's extremely accommodating of anything you need and is the easiest grader I've ever had. He only gives a couple assignments a week that are super easy. 1000000% recommend.

Professor Calhoun is perhaps the nicest professor I have ever had, and for that reason alone I would recommend taking his class. His EDU 120 and 220 class (I took both) are worthwhile if you are genuinely trying to get something out of them and pretty easy to do well in if you do the work.
You will have to read many books, but they are worth your time. Great in class discussions and he really cares about each of his students. Would definitely take another class with him.
Really cares about the material learned and not the grade. He's great and I got so much out of the class.

His online persona is inappropriate, however, he is a great professor with great insight on the topics he teaches. As long as you do the readings and participate in class discussions, you will be more than fine. And he lets you choose your grade at the end of the semester.

The class is pretty laid back, and he tries to make it based around discussion rather than lecture. There are a couple small essays/group projects, but nothing too crazy. Be expected to talk about the reading during discussion though. He's also really understanding and nice, and not a harsh grader. Learned a lot from his class, would take it again.

He gets a pretty bad rap from all the students but he is not the worst. Compared to other professors in the program he is a pretty good teacher. He just walks through models and exactly what you need to do. He provides tons of material so that you can learn and study on your own if you needed. The exercises are challenging and frustrating at times.
he cares a lot about his students and is open to feedback. the course isn't particularly challenging so long as you pay attention in class. overall would take again and he's a really nice guy

He taught so badly in the Process & Supply Chain Analytics course. Listening to his class and learning out-to-dated skills like Arena is totally a waste of time. Nobody loves to listen to him in class. Additionally, he has many assignments which are too time-consuming for students seeking jobs.

OH Professor Shafer, balalala 
OH Professor Shafer, balalala 
Read off his slides
Give so much homework
Take students' feedback as sh*t
Literally ruined the whole program, Professor Shafer
VERY difficult exams that go far beyond the content in 112. be prepared to teach yourself a lot of the material.

Smart guy but cannot teach nor is willing to teach. This guy is so caught up with his research that he acts as if hes too busy or students are bothering him. Also his course content goes above typical 112 material TAs in the CS center often comment we were working with 300 level material. Finally the lectures are disengaging he reads from slides.

He wants his students to understand more than they are capable of in CSC 112. Tests are long and the time given does not allow for a completed exam. He is willing to discuss mistakes on tests. Students are allowed a cheat sheet for the final which helps if you maximize the space. His accent and phrasing does not help with learning.

A professor who meets all the bad stereotypes of a research CS professional with a confusing accent. 
Have a strong heart and be prepared to teach yourself all the materials.
Awesome professor!
MAR is the GOAT. Best professor in the department.

Really great at teaching material in a way that students can understand. Definitely attend class because lots of the material that is helpful to know for tests is not on the PowerPoints she uses in class. She is very accessible and great at answering questions. Tests are definitely fair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: powerpoint is her main medium to teach... she puts the narration of them online so you never have to go to class. online quizzes every friday.. very easy and helpful grade boosters. tests get harder as semester progresses. they are still very fair though.

Dr. Valbuena's class was one class I would highly recommend for the English divisional credit. The class is book-heavy with several novels you read over the semester. With only two papers, there are a handful of discussion posts. However, she is extremely caring and a lovely professor to have! Don't be afraid to participate either! It's worth it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Extremely good prof. Gives good feedback and has an easy pathway towards an A if you're willing to put in reasonable amounts of work. Simulates learning very well while managing to not put anyone to sleep with zoom calls.
Enthusiastic, understanding of non-English majors, makes expectations clear, definitely one of the more reasonable professors to reside in Tribble Hall.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: very nice and not too boring

Dr. Bryson Kisner has been a very fun professor to have. He is very knowledgeable in his field and has genuinely intriguing lectures. He allows students to take online notes, and all PowerPoints are posted on Canvas after class. There are no exams and only a few essays, so there's almost no memorization. Overall, great professor for HST divisional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Kisner is a very knowledgeable instructor and class lectures are engaging. Readings can be long but only 2 per week and typically not too difficult. The grade is largely based on take-home writing assignments and plenty of resources are provided for said assignments. He is also a genuinely nice guy and cares about his students.

While I haven't taken a full semester with Professor Kisner yet, I can definitely say he is one of my favorite professors and does not grade too hard. He is always open for extra help and gives great feedback. There are no tests, so the class is not too memorization based.

Prof Kisner is my favorite educator. He's a fantastic resource for History majors/minors. His lectures are fast-paced, but slides are on Canvas, and there are no tests, so memorization isn't key. The readings are genuinely interesting, and his lectures are consistently engaging.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Chet Miller is AMAZING.  He is at the top of his game, and I can not say enough good things about the man.  He has a passion for teaching and a passion for his subject matter that is second to none!
GREAT professor, I wish they all loved to teach as much as he does.  Very accessible and interesting.  Really knows his subject.
Great teacher.  Very energetic and makes the material fun.
No Comments
Literally just so awesome, he's super fair and an awesome guy

Dr. B is super cute and just an all around great teacher. His office hours are totally flexible and you can contact him whenever you need to. He's really good about answering his email. Class is fun and he gives interesting paper topics
Epic.
Dr. B is super cute and a really interesting thinker.  His class was way fun.  Take him if you get the chance!  :)
Dr. Black is a GREAT professor! She's a great lecturer, has a clear course outline and expectations, and is very accessible outside of class.
Dr. Black is an excellent professor. Her class is very applicable to the real-world marketing field. She is very kind and always eager to help her students succeed!
Professor Black is an expert in her field. Not a super hard course, and she is a great lecturer and a fun professor. Recommend this course

Lectures most of class, but not that boring. Lots of content but tests are all open-note / open-textbook. There aren't that many questions on the test though so it's pretty easy to get a lower grade than expected. She is always happy to meet with you and very nice overall.
Polly want a cracker, polly does not want to be a Zizek character!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Dr Lamb is a great professor! In his FYS, he assigned a lot of readings and some were kind of unnecessary. Participation is important if you want a good grade. He loves to talk to students in office hours and is a really caring person! The class was on virtue ethics and he taught it in a way that made me motivated to make changes in my character.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback

comment: For an FYS class, Dr. Lamb gives out a ton of work. But, he is one of the smartest if not the smartest professor at Wake. Take this class if you are interested in learning about ethics and morals but don't try and take this class to get an easy A in FYS.

Dr. Lamb is an extraordinary professor. He cares about his students and their understanding of what he teaches. He expects a lot from students, particularly that they read the material and actively participate in discussion, but he makes you want to do these things. He is an extremely fair grader and is always available for questions or concerns.

PChem is definitely one of the hardest undergrad CHM courses out there. Dr. Ding is super smart, teaches it well and is never arrogant. The subject is SO hard (math/physics based) but if you try and just can't get things to make sense, definitely see him during office hrs. He'll help and never make you feel stupid. He's a terrific prof and person.

Dr. Ding is nice and wants to help students. However, he is very intelligent so it can be hard to learn from him. He also has a very heavy workload attached to his class. Long lectures and weekly homework (written and aleks).
Dr. Ding is very nice, but his class is very hard. The amount of weekly work is extremely heavy. He also has very difficult tests that are super math focused.
He is a great lecturer and cares about the students. He is also willing to listen and adjust accordingly. His tests are definitely on the harder side though.
My favorite class of the semester and the easiest. Virtually no work, discussions are interesting, tests are easy if you review, and she is an excellent teacher.

Lots of lecture, but easy for a divisional and very caring. As long as you listen in class and then review notes from class for the three in class essays throughout the semester you should be fine. She makes the topics interesting and cares about class. No final either and goes over readings in class most of time. Would recommend
She is a very kind and understanding person. Go to her for help before test and she will happily explain things.
Very easy class and she is so nice and considerate

Loved this semester with Dr. Cella! His tests are pretty easy; they are very similar to the homeworks and in class activities. It is best to attend classes as his annotations on the notes are not on the slideshows, but if you show up you'll learn. He doesn't accept late work at all, but will drop some homeworks. Funny guy too, recommend this class.

Dr. Cella is super funny, relatable, and genuinely caring. He really understood the material, and the in-class and homework problems were very similar to test questions. He does test review as well. Attendance is mandatory, though, as he does not post annotations and work on problems/proofs. He also does not accept late work at all.

Dr.Cella is just wonderful! He is super caring, humorous and patient, often brought donuts for us. The content is very clear and easy to understand. As long as u finish ur homework, tests will be easy to u.

I adored him!! He was wonderful and caring, and I would recommend him to anyone! There are a lot of slides, so be prepared to take notes. He is very clear on what the test should look like and the content, so he ensures that you are familiar with what you are learning. A quiz every week but it is very brief and easy!

Amazing professor. For STA 111, tests are easy and short. In terms of homework, there is a canvas quiz due every Tuesday, and a problem set due every Friday. The quizzes take less than 10 minutes and the lowest two of the semester are dropped. Overall, super fair grading system and super nice professor. I highly recommend.
Theres only 4 assignments and they are graded on participation. He is caring and does not want to stress out his students. He is very kind and gives great feedback. Would recommend!
Extremely kind and knowledgable. Willing to work with you to help your writing.
He is amazing. He cares that students actually improve their writing rather than just grading their papers. He is caring and always open to helping you even outside of class.

Amazing professor! His class was very interactive and he cares a lot about his students. He is very accessible outside of class and is even willing to help you with papers for other classes. I highly recommend him as a professor to take sometime!

While it seems Dr. Phillips is a nice man, I would never ever recommend a class taught by him. Classes are entirely discussion-based and usually revolve around whatever political philosophy he wants to indoctrinate you with that day. Grading and assignments are unclear. He will keep you late (even if you have a class afterwards).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Jesus Christ. Lord have mercy. Kill me now. I found myself thinking these exact thoughts while sitting in Dave's class almost every day. One of his key flaws is assigning 80 pages of reading and then spending 2 weeks in class analyzing 3 sentences. His class was extremely boring, and attendance is highly mandatory. For your sake, don't take him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: David Phillips where do I start. Possibly the worst professor I have had at Wake Forest. I am not sure how somebody like this is allowed to teach at such a great school. Almost every class revolves around his political ideologies about climate change, racism, or some other boring topic. Did more for this class than ORGO. LOL do not take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Very boring class. I felt like I was never reading anything new, he would move due dates around constantly, grading criteria wasn't clear at all, not much of a seminar because he did most of the talking (probably because nobody did the tedious readings he assigned). He wasn't that understanding either. Only perk is he is a pretty easy grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Best class I've had so far. Really fun and enjoyable class. Very easy grader. Papers have like three rounds of revisions which makes it very hard to get below a B+. Would 100% recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Love her! Has mandatory reading conferences after your second rough drafts of every paper so you know exactly what she wants you to fix before you submit your final draft.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Littlejohn is both an amazing professor and person. You can tell she really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. The workload, however, is a little crazy for a WRI 111 class and should never be taken that seriously, but nothing too insane. She holds conferences after assigned papers and is very passionate about what she does.

Love her. She is so nice and easy to approach. Is willing to teach you if your going to put in the effort. Can redo assignments and turn things in late if you didn't do it or did it wrong. I miss taking this class. Likes when you participate in class, it makes class go quicker and will let you leave early. Honestly, not a boring class either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Littlejohn came to WFU from UNCG last semester. She is probably one of the best WRI 111 professor you could have. She held conferences for each of her students following the submission of the second rough draft of each paper she assigned. This basically ensured you got a grade of a B+ or higher on each paper. The feedback was amazing.
Need a good calc background but good class. You can tell he really enjoys math and had a lot of knowledge abt the subject.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class
