comment: The most difficult A I have ever had to work for. If you have no calculus background, DO NOT take this class. His lectures are not engaging at all and I sat confused most of the time. I would have to go back to my room and teach myself the material, which just took time away from my other classes. This course was extremely time-consuming.

Dr. Veconi is a sweet man who truly wants his students to succeed. However, that does not mean that he is a good professor. As someone with a good calc background, I struggled in this course. His problem sets are impossible without going to office hours. You could do great on his homework problems and quizzes, but the exams are what matters...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Great guy that is. very passionate in math. His understanding of the material is immense to the point where if you do not have a solid math foundation the class can be difficult. He is always open for office hours and usually the homework questions are harder than the test actually is.

If you are taking Calc 111 for the first time, do not take Dr. Veconi's class. Homework heavy. 3 exams and a final exam. The weekly problem set is nearly impossible without going into office hours for help. The lectures do not help with understanding the material. Weekly quiz. He is very understanding with extensions and wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She started out very hard to follow during lectures, but given it was her first semester teaching, she either got better or I got more used to her style. She really is great and accessible during office hours. In terms of difficulty, the class content is hard, but she does about everything in her power to help you succeed (makeup tests, etc).

Dr. Siahmazgi is super nice and very helpful. She has lots of office hours and will let you retake tests for partial credit back. Her teaching style can be a little confusing, but she definitely improved as the semester went on. Homework grades can help your grade so make sure to do them!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Good teacher overall, and especially easy for grading tests. Definitely takes some adjustment to her teaching style, but once you get that hang of it everything will be fine. Doing homework accurately is important since she's more of a harsh grader on that. Overall good teacher, most struggle was the material being hard, not her fault.

Sometimes hard to get the material on the first day, but it eventually makes sense. Homeworks are hard and worth a lot of your grade, so make sure to perfect those. She is a harsh grader for homework. She is a super chill grader when it comes to tests, and she lets you retake them. She definitely wants you to succeed.

Her lectures are often confusing but if you ask questions, she is more than happy to help. Exams are very straightforward and often the same questions as the homework. Very accessible during office hours and will let you retake an exam if you do poorly. Also an amazing person will always make you laugh! She's my queen.

Dr. Horton was a great professor.  You actually had to study in his class, which a lot of people didn't want to do considering this is a required course for most of us.  He was extremely kind and helpful.
He doesn't make any sense and doesn't explain the assignments, then grades them really hard.
nicest professor ever
No Comments

"Pray to God, sailor, but row for the shore."       This quote actually has nothing to do with Professor Foy, it's just awesome. Miles Foy is a fiddle playing, football tossin, great teacher. His voice is soothing, and he only calls on volunteers. Expect a down-to-earth relaxing class. Believe the hype, rumor has it he signed away the Panama Canal.
Test last year was ridiculous.  Nothing like the example he gave us to study from.

Professor Foy is fantastic! He is thorough and clear, and is a wonderful man. His class may seem a little slow at first, but after a while you will be surprised at how much material he has actually gone through! Count your lucky stars if you get him for Contracts as a 1L.
Foy's class goes a little slow but he is the man and knows everything about contracts.  He is also funny.

Professor Knox is an awesome professor.  He is very very clear, funny, and interesting in his lectures.  I really enjoyed his class - and the material.  Property was one of the more tangible classes for me, and it spurred an interest in real estate and estate planning.  Also, he's pretty foxy so that counts for something!
BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD. Explains everything super clearly, calmly and always stays on point. I wish all professors were like Knox.
He is funny and friendly. He's also clear in class, and very approachable. One of the best professors I've had so far.
Probably easiest going friendliest teacher you will have- One of the best at Wake-

The best thing about Dr. Cooper is that he really simplifies organic chemistry and goes slow to explain everything in a manner that's easy to understand. His lectures along with outside work (a few hours of doing problems a week) guarantee you a B+ or higher. He's not a tough grader and doesn't have a final exam supplement.
I would advise to avoid this professor if you can! He gets mad at students when they don't understand the subject matter and is a boring lecturer.
He's super smart and if you pay attention and try you should do fine.
Interested in the students academics
I love her lecture. This class is easy to understand. Even we have HW every week but so easy.
one homework assignment a week, ask for help if you need it. she's really flexible
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I like her a lot! The class is very clear! It suits people who have no background for econ. she will give out on class practice and exercise on SAKAI which I found so helpful for the tests! I am planning to major in ECON!!

Horrendous teacher DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. She is terrible at explaining all of the material and could not answer a large majority of the questions anybody asked her in class. There is no homework but the tests are very difficult.

This professor was the worst professor I have ever had. No matter what you do DO NOT TAKE HER. She assigns 2 hours of homework a night if you're lucky. She's also just a mean person too. Don't try to go to her to get something extended or take something another time because she'll she she can't believe she would ask you that.

This is genuinely my least favorite teacher I have ever taken. She cares very little for the success/mental health of her students, is personally offensive and expects way more out of her students that they are willing to give for a divisional requirement. She is extremely unfair and makes hard tests. Almost impossible to get an A/A- in her class

Coco Mann does not care about her students well-being or mental health. She assigns hours of homework each night and expects you to spend 2 hours everyday on French. She claims to care about her students, but her actions say otherwise. She is an unhappy person and she takes it out on them. Avoid her like the plague.

This woman sucks. I actually suffered through two semesters with her and dreaded going to her class EVERY SINGLE DAY. I have never sat through a longer 50 minutes. Be prepared for 2+ hours of homework per night. She is one of the hardest graders EVER - tests, papers, homework, even participation. Whatever you do, DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I loved Professor Welsh as a person, she was always available for help and was extremely knowledgeable in her field. Her lectures were sometimes boring unless you participated, which I found to be helpful in doing well in the class. Class is based on few writing assignments and quizzes that she grades very harshly, so be ready to work.

Dr. Welsh is an excellent professor. Her class is very lecture heavy, and moves quickly, but she keeps them interesting and engaging. She is very accessible outside of class, and cares a lot about her students. Dr. Welsh is seriously an incredible professor.

Very straightforward with the textbook readings. Only two exams (including the final) and two quizzes and a research paper. Participate in class and you will be fine. You have to study and read to do well, but its all straightforward. Tries to make class fun and interesting. Very caring, and if you reach out she's always willing to help

Very kind and caring lady. Exams/papers aren't too hard, but harder grader than I expected. Hoping to get an A (due to it being a 100 level) so I was a little disappointed Good lecturer though. Just make sure your papers/exams are good.
Class was not very hard. Lectures were boring and disengaging.

A true gem. He made me actually enjoy calculus and is one of the nicest professors ever. The videos are a little long but totally worth it because they help so much. He is very considerate and really listens to his students. 12/10 recommend :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Dr. Rezapour is an incredible professor. He is incredibly helpful and understanding and does not give up until he is positive that every student understands a concept. If you need help, he is always 100% willing to give you what you need. He's definitely one of the best professors I've ever had! I'd recommend his class to anyone.

Dr. Mostafa is the best teacher that I have ever had. He is the most well organized teacher that I have ever seen. His lectures are the most informational lectures that I have ever seen. He explains the materials very clearly so that everyone would understand. He answered emails in minutes!!! He is my favorite professor.

Dr. Guthrie was phenomenal for the ART 265 summer session. She is passionate about Renaissance art and makes the topics so engaging. I loved the coursework and found all of the assignments genuinely fun to work on. She is great about adjusting the course to accommodate students' needs and goals. Highly recommend!
Great professor! Very accommodating and gave super interesting lectures. No tests, the final is just a project that cannot be an essay. Definitely very knowledgeable in the subject.
She is so nice I absolutely loved her.

Dr. Guthrie is the sweetest professor I have had at this school. She does not like the idea of grades so it is very easy to do well. Even though there are not many assignments, I have learned so much just by listening to her during lectures. I love how stress free of a class it is and can learn by listening rather than by a bunch of assignments.

Very kind and very fun. 113 is inherently a difficult course but he always did a good job of explaining things and the in class activities were extremely helpful. Provides a study guide for every test which was also very useful. best language teacher I've had.

He is super sweet and understanding with the work given. The course is difficult, and he is aware but he tries everything to ensure you understand what is going on. He was always very personal and comforting in class. Participating does matter though! And be ready for daily quizzes.

Dr Goodman is an awesome person and very enthusiastic about the subject but intense workload. Daily quizzes on homework but not always super clear what it would be on. One time the hw was a conjugating activity, and the quiz was on the vocab in the word bank of the activity. Other than that, super helpful. He wants you to understand the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Easily my favorite Spanish professor here at Wake. Not only does he know what he's doing and does a phenomenal job of communicating material to his students, he is very personable and seems to really enjoy teaching Spanish.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Class has no hw basically which is awesome til you get to the test and then he grades like a robot and gives u 70. On top of all that, he will mess up your spring break by not letting you take the test early at any time even if you notify more than two weeks before you leave. Don't take this class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: great professor who cares a lot about teaching students.
Final is pretty difficult and his office hours are not very helpful, but in general he is a decent professor personality wise
Great dude
No Comments

GPA DAMAGER. When I chose Wake, I hoped to apply to the bschool. I am no longer eligible to even apply. This class was beyond challenging and non interactive. Tests were super hard, and after spending entire weeks locked away in the library studying, I consistently recieved Cs on her tests.

DONT TAKE. As someone who did well in AB, I found this class very challenging. Her grading makes it extremely hard to do well (2 tests worth 25% of grade, no retakes, no curve). Class is just her writing notes on the board and she's not good at explaining concepts if you're confused. She's accessible during office hours and gives of partial credit.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Took Calc in HS and excelled, and have continued to do well in Professor Bourdon's class. However, for first time calculus students, I would highly recommend taking another professor to make the class easier and more understandable. She is not a great lecturer as she reads directly off notes, and constantly makes mistakes.

Dr. Bourdon is great! I had a tough time getting used to her style of teaching but she is very clear and super willing to answer questions. 1000% recommend her office hours, very helpful!  Also, she is super great about giving LOTS of partial credit in order for her to give you the maximum score possible even if you're answer is wrong
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Solid professor. I didn't want someone who would make passing the class easy anyway - I wanted someone helpful who could challenge me to learn and that's who I got. Very friendly and understanding, not condescending at all, recommended highly.
He is a very good teacher. He really wants his students to learn abstract algebra. Unpretentious yet challenging lectures. The young professor is also very friendly and open-minded.
Not clear at all, but tries hard to help you understand. All studying and understanding is done on your own.

Young professor who tries hard but isn't always very clear. Uses lots of powerpoint presentations and it's easy to space out during his lectures. He's good about answering questions and seems to want his students to succeed.

Dr. Ucer is truly the best physics professor I have ever had. His content is very organized and he provides so many great resources on canvas to help you study. It is also impressive with how quickly he responds and how resourceful he is. I don't find physics to be intuitive, but his explanations simplified everything.  I 100% recommend him.

I hate physics but Dr. Ucer made it bearable. He is kind and always helpful in office hours. Definitely not an easy class even over the summer, but very manageable as long as you study and work hard. Lectures were a bit boring but he has a unique, subtle sense of humor that I thought to be absolutely hilarious. Would recommend him for pre-health

I took Optics from Burak, his facet of research, and even though he's in it every day to the point where it becomes fodder to him, he still explained it very lucidly in terms us students unfamiliar with the ins and outs of the practice could grasp. One of the better professors in WFU Physics for sure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Physics is always going to be hard, but he graded pretty easy and was always available for office hours. I think over half the class got an A in summer school.

This FYS course is rather uninteresting. Most classes consist primarily of lectures, and it can be challenging to understand what the professor expects in terms of assigned work. If possible, I would recommend choosing a different course. Overall, it falls somewhere in the middle—neither particularly good nor bad, but just plain boring.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Fine for a FYS 100 class it is just super boring. You write 3 5-6 page essays but he does not really explain what they are about. He assigns a lot of readings but you don't need to do them after the first paper. It is an okay class if it is the only option for FYS.

He's a super nice guy and def doesn't make FYS too hard but it's a pretty boring class. If you try a little you'll get a decent grade. He assigns a ton of reading but I've never done it and its been completely fine.

I have enjoyed having Professor Lee as a professor and he is an amazing and nice prof, and I would recommend everyone to take this FYS. 3 Papers and a presentation. As long as you take notes, you are in great shape for the papers. Lectures/discussions are enjoyable, and class is fun. This class is an easy A for an FYS as long as you put effort in.

You can tell he really wants his students to learn by challenging them. The work isn't very hard, but still really makes you think.113 was very interesting and more in-depth than I expected. As long as you read and do your best work, you'll get a good grade. He doesn't reward the bare minimum. It's a decent amount of work, but nothing stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Hardwick is a good man and professor.  He truly cares about his students and is very understanding.  The class is lecture and reading heavy.  But, he makes everything easy to understand.  Be prepared for discussions!  The class is very easy as long as you pay attention, do the reading, and keep up with the assignments.  Take this class!

Dr. Hardwick is very passionate about music, and that often shows in class. The class is very lecture heavy, but is easy to follow and understand. The hardest part of the class is the discussions, which are random so you have to be prepared. Other than that, the midterm and final are open notes, and every assignment is relatively easy to follow.

Dr. Hardwick is very passionate about music. He grades very easily on the assignments and is very clear on what he wants. There is reading for each class and he cold calls during class (the discussion grades are the hardest graded part of the class). The midterm and final are both open note, open book. Everyone I know has at least a 96 in the class

Really funny and knowledgeable teacher that makes class fun with light hearted conversations and activities. There are a lot of small assessments and he grades pretty fairly but the material itself is pretty challenging. There's daily quizzes based on readings and grammar but they aren't so bad. I recommend spa 212.

Took this guy for SPA 111, terrible teacher. He takes off points for missing the smallest details but won't give points for anything. If you hate your life then take this class if not please pick a better teacher
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The material is not so bad; it is actually interesting, but this prof. makes it harder because he is dogmatic. Not only that but the interaction with students leaves a lot to be desired. Does not understand the flexibility of the U.S. system. If U cannot find another prof. here, transfer to another place.

Dr. G puts very little information on the slides he gives us to study, but expects us to remember small minute details of things he mentioned once on our exams. When our class got a 70% average on our first exam, we were told to study harder. He is available outside of class time and is willing to work with you, but very rigid in the way he grades.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Parsley is AMAZING. Though, the class itself is pretty tough but he wants you to do well. If you put in the work and he sees that, you will do fine in the class even if the exams aren't your best. Make sure to participate and put in lots of effort. Lots of homework but it is all very helpful and none of it is busy work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Really nice professor and he cares about his students. It was hard, but mainly because the material is difficult. I found that he explained the concepts well and would always backtrack and reexplain however many times needed. Office hours were super helpful and hes just an awesome professor overall.

So much homework. Otherwise I love the dude, he's definitely cares about his students and does his best to make sure his tests are fair. Note that since he gives a lot of homework, his office hours are usually packed so you may need to get outside help

Dr. Parsley is the cutest ever. Fair grader, although he gives a loooot of homework. I definitely learned a lot in this class and if you put in the work it is very rewarding. He is definitely difficult and doesn't curve but is the nicest, sweetest professor ever and cares so much about his students. He is very passionate about what he teaches.

Dr. Parsley certainly gave a lot of work but he was really good at making himself available to help out with any questions you have. He really wants to see all of his students succeed. If you put the work in, this class is very rewarding. I got a lot out of Math 113.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr Maffeo is a great teacher to have your first semester of freshman year as she cares a lot about her students and is very understanding. My only warning is if you don't like teachers who get off topic frequently, this might not be the class for you. Also fair warning to keep up with your work, but overall great class!
Very nice prof! Cares about her students.  She can get off topic during lecture.  A bit of work but due in batches so stay on top of it.

I loved Prof. Maffeo for my FYS. She made the class very interesting and was very caring about her students. She broke the semester into 3 themes and there were a lot of assignments we had to do by the end of each theme that took a lot of time to complete. She also takes a long time to grade. She does get off topic sometimes but overall I liked her

Dr. Maffeo is very educated in psychology and clearly displays that she knows what she is talking about, but she is pretty lazy when it comes to grading. It took her a very long time to grade everything and she often talked about what she did on the weekends instead of grading. Her class was very interesting though, and I definitely learned a lot.
Dr. Ross is by far best professor that I have had at Wake. I would highly recommend taking his class.
Absolute beast, GOAT teacher at Wake. Everyone should take him if you have the chance. Easy but informative and nice.
Professor Ross is singled handly the most passionate professor I've had. He comes to class with great enthusiasm which makes it so enjoyable.

Excellent professor. Class is mostly discussion based with a few fairly simple writing assignments with groups and annotations. Clearly cares about his students and gets to know everyone's names. Chill vibe.

Dr. L is super kind and helpful when it comes to answering questions on the hw and labs. However, I felt like her exams where always way more difficult than her review sheets/hw. She was a tough grader on tests, but not on the final project (worth something like 25% of the class grade)

Dr. Lotspeich is kind and genuinely cares about her students, but her grading on tests is very strict—she'll take off half points for minor mistakes. The class is heavily lecture-based, with most time spent going through her slides. Be prepared to stay focused and learn a lot from her detailed explanations.

Dr. L was a great teacher, but this class was a struggle to stay awake through. If you paid attention in AP Stat you'll be fine in STA 112, but this class is by no means engaging. Also, be prepared to learn R coding, that's basically the whole class since it features on every lab and test. Definitely learned a lot, but on my own

Dr. L is fantastic! She gives a good amount of weekly homework, but it is helpful when reviewing concepts and when studying for exams. Exams are extremely fair, and she doesn't require you to memorize distribution formulas. Do the bonus questions on the homework!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Homework and tests are much harder than what she taught during the class and some questions need clarifications too. The lecture i kind of like writing down everything in the handout she gave which I think is kind of boring.

Feel bad not giving her a good review because she is kind and hands out A's, but the class was comical. She will lecture for 75 minutes while getting horribly sidetracked about the most random topics. Managed to somehow get slower as the semester went on to the point where 3rd midterm was take home and we still didn't get through half of macro.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU WANT AN A!!!!! She is very easy to get into contact with for office hours and super nice. All of our quizzes are take-home and the tests are almost the exact practice exams she gives us. She is 100% the easiest econ professor at Wake.
Honestly a pretty easy A, especially if you've taken any Econ before. The tests are multiple choice, so just study a normal amount and ur fine
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you want an easy A, take this class. If you actually want to learn about economics and don't want to deal with unnecessary stress from her constantly changing schedule and due dates, skip it. She managed her time so poorly that we spent 2 weeks covering macroeconomics, which was supposed to be half of the course.

Professor Knott's lectures are very informative, and she is very knowledgable and breaks down complicated topics to better explain difficult concepts. The homework is done in a way where wrong answers are not penalized. Quizzes were open notes, and overall would recommend, would take again.

She is so sweet! I am genuinely confused by some of these responses because I always came to her office hours and she was respectful, clear, and willing to answer anything. The tests are directly off the slides. She explained what was on the final and if you went to her office hours she would help you brainstorm for it.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I have no idea why these ratings are what they are. Dr Lack is extremely caring and wants everyone to understand the content. I've found that some exam questions aren't totally clear, but if you ask her, she will clear it up for you. Exam averages are high. Again, I don't understand the other ratings.

Don't get on her bad side or your grade will reflect it. Creates an environment for students that does not facilitate learning.. very untrustworthy, egotistical and condescending towards students she dislikes. Probably one of the worst professors I've had. Unfortunate she plays a large role in the neuroscience department.
Exams are long and complicated. Not very trustworthy of her student. Does make lectures understandable though and interesting class.

Very friendly, supportive, encouraging, and wicked smart. Best teacher I've ever had. Grading is very clear, reasonable expectations, very helpful outside class, engaging lectures, homework is actually helpful and never overwhelming/busywork. The class content is difficult (comparative animal physiology) but she makes it doable 10/10

This FYS was not my first choice but I ended up loving it. KP is the sweetest professor. The class has a lot of reading but it was really interesting so I didn't mind. There were two papers, 6-10pgs but she gives you plenty of time and flexible deadlines. As long as you do the work, you'll end with an A.

I love and have so much respect for Professor Pribble. She is my professor for FYS: Prison Narratives Across Cultures, as well as my lower-level advisor. She is approachable and makes sure you have the support you need for her class and just Wake in general. She has done a great job of making the content understandable for the texts we are reading.

Dr.Pribble is a kind, smart, and exceptional professor who cares so much about her students and their Russian education. It is incredible how accessible and enjoyable she has made learning Russian. I highly recommend taking Dr.Pribble if you are interested in learning Russian at all!

Dr Pribble is an incredibly smart and kind professor who loves the subject. She's one of two main professors in the Russian department and teaches Russian language too. She's extremely available and offers very detailed feedback on all of your assignments. Grading is clear and pretty lenient, as long as you show evidence you did the reading.
Doesnt teach well
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Interesting lectures...  extremely hard tests

Very organized and clear. Very helpful during office hours--take advantage. Tests are very comprehensive, and the average grades are low. He curves generously, but don't be fooled--you still need to study.

Fred thinks in numbers.  He's a genius.  I wouldn't be surprised if he won a prize for economics in the future, but don't take him if you're looking to joke around.  Serious class, hard tests, but fred cheezy is the truth!
Explained pre-labs well, was very understanding and wanted students to have fun in his lab.
Had him for my 223L. In person prelabs helped a lot. Very nice and helpful.

He is a very good teacher and very ready to work with you. His lectures can be a little unorganized, but in combination with the text book can make sense. His tests are challenging, but certainly not the most difficult.

He is a very very good teacher and is extremely willing to work with you if you ask him. His tests are not easy, but I truly enjoyed him as a teacher. You definitely have to put in work to do well in the class, but that's probably simply because of the fact that it's organic chemistry.

Dr. Wahl is by far one of my favorite professors! She is kind, understanding, and knowledgeable about sociology. The class has interesting topics and she provides thought-provoking readings daily. She sends emails and communicates very clearly what to know from each article to prep for tests. Seriously, take her...you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: most amazing and caring person

Professor Wahl is such an amazing and caring teacher. I loved taking her class because it was super interesting and pretty easy. Her exams are super simple and she doesn't really give work besides some reading. She is a little disorganized on Canvas but it's not a huge issue. 100% would take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Most deserving faculty in the department and at the university.

Dr. C was a really nice person, but I learned nothing from this class, it was really a terrible experience.  I am an a student, and thus far I have been able to make a's in college, but she doesn't answer questions well and her class was miserable. NOT RECOMMENDED!

Dr. Cotwright presents the material in a well-organized fashion, but can sometimes be hard to follow.  If you do the homework and ask questions you will do fine.  Beware of the tests- they were challenging.
Dr. Cotwright is a very nice person, but cannot teach material and makes it very difficult to understand, especially if you have never taken calculus before.

Dr. Fetrow is a tough grader. You need to be an expert in writing to get a good grade. To make things worse, she cannot clearly explain requirement for writing assignment. You may get a C-D if you misunderstand rubric. She is a nice person, though. If you ask for help, she's willing to help you. But she is always too busy to make appointment.
RUN!!!! Too busy to help. Disorganized.
No Comments
Class is easy, she is nice but her accent is thick and the class is VERY boring, almost zero engagement from students because of this.

I took Dr. P for MATH 2050, which made me hate the subject. She is very nice if you show up to class and ask questions. You will be very bored in class so get enough sleep before class or you WILL fall asleep. She teaches from PowerPoint and then does example problems. She moves fast and her explanations aren't the most helpful.

She is fine, the class is just extremely boring. Her accent is so thick that even if you do try to listen you won't be able to understand what she is saying. She is willing to help but very hard to understand. I wouldn't recommend her but shes fine if you have to take stats. Tests are pretty hard but just study

I took Dr. P for stats 111 and I would definitely recommend. She was very nice, and often let me submit the homework a little past the deadlines. I found her lectures helpful and her style of teaching to be very organized. She does have a strong accent, and every assignment is due at 5pm, but overall I loved the class and it was easy.

Review for PHI 241: Very kind professor and an entertaining lecturer. Interesting guy and he was always willing to help clarify concepts. Sometimes the papers were graded harder than expected but the comments were fair. Great dude.

Interesting character. Very "active" lecturer making sure he gets his steps in. Super good at explaining concepts and very nice. Graded our papers in PHI241 sneaky hard, getting an A- was easy but getting to an A was basically unheard of from people I've spoken to. Unless he helps us out on the final paper so that is TBD.
Class is optional, but bumps ur grade up if u participate. Grading is 45% midterm 55% final.  Thought it would be easy but exam questions are actually pretty hard.

Interesting class, and overall good prof. Hes kind of an odd guy, but very kind and intelligent. His lectures may be hard to follow if youve never taken philosophy though. Additionally, theres no incentive to do the reading because he gives you a pdf summarizing each one, and your grade is based off 2 midterms.
Easy grader
So sweet

Dr. Bowie is one of the most biased professors I have ever had. If you do not agree with her she will be incredibly petty towards you. She doesn't grade anything on time. Her grades and feedback are based on whether your thesis agrees with her worldview, she gives zero feedback in regards to actual writing. Avoid this professor.

i have taken her class twice now. love and adore her. she is a fair grader, but your grade will increase tremendously if you go in for office hours. super knowledgable about niche things (convinced she was in the CIA)
Very nice and a great professor. You get out of the class what you put in learning wise. An easy A- but not an easy A. She is super clear about grading/what she expects. Deffinitely recccomend!

Professor Coberly is extremely intelligent and loves to convey her knowledge. She frequently uses her experiences in the State department to inform her classes. She is a tough professor, assigns a lot of reading, but if you put in effort she will reward it. She loves meeting with students and helping.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: She is super nice and caring! She cares a lot about attendance though so make sure to always be there on time. The writings were never graded too harshly
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Class called Digital Humanities. Graded based on group projects involving research and creating online visualizations. All of it was very easy and she graded easy. Typically, if you did a good job on your projects you would receive a 100. Very easy FYS as long as you have basic understanding of technology. Professor is caring and considerate.

Professor Johnston's class was super interesting. If you are decent at English and motivated to read and write this is an easy A. I would definitely take her again--she knows what she's talking about and makes class easy. Class is basically all discussion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Great teacher and an overall kind person. He relies heavily on readings which can be a lot times, but he almost always reviews the reading and if you don't read you can sorta coast under the radar during the discussions. Definitely be ready to read. Takes a while to grade but the grading is not super tough. Weekly journal is easy and helps grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I really enjoyed Professor Ilesanmi Rel 107 class, I took it for a divisional. It was very easy, the reading wasn't alot you can get an easy A by participating once a week and submitting your work on time. Ilesanmi is very understanding. Even if you don't do well on the ONE TEST in the class its designed for you to still get an A.

a nice and chill professor. takes a while to put the grades in. as long as you do the homework and show up, there's no reason you don't pass. a lot of readings, but they're discussed in class. highly encourages participation as it's part of your grade. the material is pretty straightforward otherwise. he's also very funny.

Dr. Miller is an incredibly intelligent and kind professor. Class is completely discussion-based and although she would LOVE for you to participate you can get away without it. There is a lot of reading (also can get away without doing) but this is what is discussed in class. The only grades are essays, the only difficult part of the course.

Dr. Miller is one of the most caring teachers I have had. She is constantly asking how her students are doing and making sure her workload is not overwhelming to students. She is so intelligent while portraying herself as equal to her students. The topics we discussed in class are crucial to humanity and I found all papers and books interesting.

She is the nicest woman in the world, and her classes are essentially all seminars. She gives a fair amount of reading, but nothing terrible. Her rubrics are a little loose for essays, but she is a nice grader.

Actually took 280. Truly a caring and engaging professor. The material is interesting and you learn. She has a lot of concern for improving her class and makes sure everyone stays involved. Only downside is that her exams have a fair number of bad questions, but they're still absolutely doable. Highly recommend her and her class!

sweetest lady ever, so cute and fun. however, she doesn't use canvas at all and is super unclear about grades and upcoming assignments/homework. she also WILL NOT let you go to the bathroom. class is easy and not much work outside of the classroom, just prepare to do a lot of impromptu writing and speaking. if ur prepared it won't be hard at all.

She is an amazing woman! I love her so much, and she is so engaged with her students. Her class was very difficult, but it definitely challenged me in a way that allowed me to grow and develop my language skills.

Tough grader, but you know what she expects. Best Spanish teacher at Wake though, hands down. Very involved with her students, and you actually learn things, unlike other Spanish teachers. She really cares, even though she might not be the easiest A (I worked for it) it's doable.
Great Teacher, Very engaging!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Such a sweet teacher! The class is interesting. Minimal homework that he gives you a 100 on. One open note quiz and project! Take this for your divisional!!

Based off the syllabus, I thought this class wasn't gonna be too fun but I adore this man so much. Discussion and lecture-based class, and even if you say the most dumbest thing in a discussion he'll find a way to make it work and makes everyone in the class feel important and whatnot. Caring and entertaining guy with a great personality.

THE SWEETEST PROFESSOR EVER!! She was so understanding and the class was light work. Although there were a lot of readings and pop quizzes, they were scheduled every Thursday and self-graded. The class was graded based on 1 presentation, 2 papers, and 2 short event reflections. Super easy to get by and she drops your lowest quizzes. Easy A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: She is a very kind and knowledgeable professor! I learned a lot from her class and it was everything I wanted out of the class; there is a lot of reading though and you get "pop" quizzes every thursday on that day's reading, however if you are actually interested in the class, the readings are very interesting and very easy to read through.

Dr. Gupta is a super kind person and is very knowledgeable in her field. I would warn you, however, that you'll get anywhere from 30-90 pages of reading per class, and you will sometimes be pop quizzed on the readings. Classes are probably 60% lecture 40% discussion. I would recommend Dr. Gupta, they're great if you're dedicated!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: great teaching style with powerpoints that are super engaging

Dr. Clayton's lectures were very engaging and fun to follow. In addition to learning the theory, we discussed the real-life applications and even had some demonstrations. We were also encouraged to have fun with the subject. This hard class was pretty straightforward and, although challenging, easy to follow with Dr. Clayton's guidance.

Tricia is amazing. They are so approachable and really care about each of their students. Their FYS was so much fun, and it was a relatively easy class. There's some required readings and group projects but the subject matter is fascinating and Tricia brings such an amazing energy to the classroom. They also bring snacks

Very sweet and a generous grader. A little hard to understand, but she cares about the content and success of her students. If you've taken stats and understand it, it should be easy, but the exams might be difficult if you're not great at math. All assignments except the three exams are easy. Pay attention and you should be fine.

She is so sweet and means well. She does have an accent so she is sometimes hard to understand.  While none of the info in this class is that hard she explains things in complicated ways that make the info seem hard. She doesn't know how to use a graphing calculator and it sometimes feels like she doesn't know statistics that well.

She always makes knowledge complicated and confusing and she's often wrong with her calculations. She said she doesn't know how to use ti84!!!! But she is nice and answers any questions (except you can't understand what she is saying sometimes), and you can always go to her to check your problemset to help you get 100%.

One of my least favorite classes in B school. I did not like the subject, teacher's personality or his working style. He gave way too much homework assignment. I was happy when class was finished. I don't think I learned much from this class.
Aneil is very helpful and provides insight.  He helps you to think and uses the class to teach, instead of simoly lecturing.  A great professor who is always willing to help
He teaches you nothing except TO THINK--something not enough instructors do.  I'd much rather deal with that than to regurgitate the professor's opinion!
So hard, lots of reading and discussions.

Dr. Brady is one of the best psychology professors at Wake Forest. She is kind, cares for her students, and is easily accessible outside of class. While her social psychology class involved a good amount of reading and work per week, it is easy to keep up and get an A in her course.

It's easy to get an A in Dr. Brady's class, but this class gives an unreasonable amount of homework. Be prepared to read multiple 10 page papers a week, along with 10-14 short answer questions, in addition to the other projects she assigns. She also will make you line up in order of who has the most money. Take any other FYS that's available.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Gemmer is one of the best professors I have taken at Wake. Highly recommend for anyone taking a math class, especially a higher level math class. He does give a lot of homework, and it is difficult, but he provides solutions afterwards and thoroughly explains the topics. Super accessible in office hours and cares about his students.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I love this man. Definitely time consuming but you will actually learn the material and feel prepared for quizzes and tests. Also, he actually cares about his students and wants to help. Would recommend 100%

Really great professor and human being. Very tough class but you learn a lot so it makes it worth it. He also really cares about you as a person and will sit with you in office hours until you understand something. Youll do well if you put in the effort outside class. Literally love him so much, Ill definitely try to take him again if I can.

Yu Laoshi is great! Her class has lots of HW and quizzes but she's very flexible with turning things in late. Attendance is mandatory and you only get 2 free absences. Her tests are pretty hard but you'll be fine if you study. Also, she LOVESSS to cold call so get ready for that. She's super sweet and cares a lot about her students and the class!

Professor Yu is a great teacher. It is very apparent that she cares about her students learning the language. Although there is a lot of homework, it is fairly easy as long as you manage your time well. The one thing to be most prepared for is participating in class, she always cold calls on students to make sure everyone is paying attention.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Yu is a great teacher and although the class has a lot of homework and the pace is pretty fast, as long as you keep up you will do good.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Aloraini explained things pretty well. The class was overall pretty easy a lot of your grade is homework and group work. Dr. Aloraini lets you bring a notecard to each test which is very helpful. Overall I would recommend taking Aloraini if you have to take STA 111.

I actually like this profesor but I know its a controversial pick lol. He explains things well in my opinion and is very lenient if you forget a homework or group work. I also think he's good at explaining things.

Prof. Aloraini is extremely vague (or even wrong) whenever I have a question for him. The workload is pretty light: group-work and homework every Friday. With that being said, I wouldnt take his class without a basic understanding of stats or if youre not willing to learn the material outside of class time because you wont learn it in class :/

If you can get Dr. Martino for lab, DO IT. This lab was so easy: he walks you through how to do everything and lab reports are graded on completion. All you need to do is show up and listen to his pre-lab talk and you are good to go. Great at answering questions and hilarious. He's amazing.
The best professor at Wake Forest. He is the goat.

Dr. Matrino was a great lab teacher! Labs are required to go to. You have a mid-term & a final and then weekly 3-hour labs. In class you do the lab and often have time to finish your lab write-up. Gives you clear instructions for the lab write-ups (Graded by TA). Offers extra credit! Really Nice!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Yang was a great professor for my summer MTH 111 class. I highly recommend taking his course as he is engaging, understanding, and very accessible outside of class. Since it was online, zoom lectures were not mandatory but they were recorded for students. Yang understands we all have stuff going on in the summer and is very accommodating.

This is for his MTH 111 SUMMER course. Dr. Yang was very understanding and explained well for students who had never taken calc before. Since this is a summer course, it is VERY fast paced, however he sends the classes through Canvas so if you can't make it to class you can still watch it later. It is a hard class, but he made it a little easier.

Professor Yang is a king amongst men. The greatest University Math professor I have ever had. Extremely clear AND efficient lectures that are very engaging. Does not mince words, great whiteboard skills, great conceptual teaching. This class WILL teach you Calc 3. Grading policy was very lenient, homework was hard but not overwhelming. Chill guy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Took this as a divisional she is actually the nicest person. So so easy to get an A. Wish i tried harder but i kind of slacked and still did really well. I had an 89.51 and she rounded me up. She's the best
Super nice and helpful. Would definitely take her class again

Very good teacher who's very sweet. She gives her students all the material they need to succeed and if you put the work in you can easily get an A. One thing I hated was how nitpicky the TA's are with grading homework.

The lectures/slides were clear and well-organized and corresponded with the textbook, so it was easy to study material. There were several labs/homework assignments/in-class activities, but exams make up the bulk of your grade. The exams were pretty straightforward and similar to practice problems/hw. She was extremely helpful in office hours.

Dr. Jayanetti explain the materials well and you can find everything in the Canvas page. Exams are hard but the question types
are similar to the practice problems. Attending office hours is really help full.

Professor Jayanetti's lectures are pretty boring, but you only need to go to 85% of classes to get full credit for attendance. The exams are long but not especially difficult. She is not the best at answering questions you ask in class, but her lectures are easy to understand. I would recommend her as a stats 111 professor.

I wouldn't take her again. The lectures were very boring and she was VERY strict about attendance and making tests and assignments up. The tests were extremely long and her slides were pretty confusing in my opinion, had to learn on my own sometimes. There weren't too many assignments though, so that was good. The final exam is cumulative.

For me this was the best class at Babcock - I always understood everything and it seemed to me like the right amount of homework and teamwork. Teacher is extremely helpful and patient. Very nice personality and a kind person.
No Comments
One of the best Professor at Babcock. Extremely down to earth and helpful. It was a pleasure to attend his class.

Great teacher. He lets students lead the discussions and makes them very interesting. There is no reason not to get an A in this class because he lets you email him as many drafts of your papers as you want and he thoroughly edits them. If you follow his corrections you will get an A.
Good teacher. Decently tough grader on papers but allows you to send in drafts of papers for him to edit which was very helpful. I would strongly recommend him.

Amazing professor! You can tell that he really loves the subject, and even when the class may be lost over a point, he is not hesitant to stop and explain in a different way so that we understand. The class is discussion based, with papers here and there. Dr. Burkett also switches things up sometimes with movie clips or slides to help. Take him!

No homework. Like 2 papers and 2 in class writing assignments. And a final project that's pretty chill. Super nice and knowledgeable and interesting class. Also super flexible with deadlines, just ask for an extension

I definitely recommend Professor Cole for FYS! She is super understanding and a really caring teacher. Classes are mostly lecture based, but the topics are interesting. The few assignments throughout the semester are pretty simple, and she is very available for feedback or help along the way.

She's the best. The class has barely any homework - only projects and there were very few. The class is discussion-based, not lecture, which is incredibly interesting. She's kind, understanding, and personable.
A+ Prof.
One of the best professors in the Wake MBA program.  Explains abstract concepts clearly and concisely.  His course laid much of the groundwork for other core classes.

Teacher is extremelly nice and very, very helpful. He helped me with some questions I had even a year after graduation!!! Has a strong grasp of his subject and has good humour at times. Attending his class is an enjoyable experience.

She is awful. The tests were so hard and consisted of reading plays and memorizing obscure quotes, who said them, and the context. We read SO many plays and the tests were free response quotes. Awful. It was an FYS and should have been much much easier. I do not know anyone who got an A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Interesting at times, but the plays that you're required to read are pretty long (at-home quizzes on those), but the textbook reading isn't too bad. You have to watch three school plays and write papers, but the grading criteria gave an outline that made them easy. Pretty tough grader; not sure why she took points off sometimes. There are 3 exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class was sometimes boring but if you want to get a good grade all you have to do is participate a little bit and go to office hours to ask how you can improve your grade. She will improve your essay scores whether or not you are actually doing better (I think she just appreciates the effort).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: ECN 239 - Fascinating lectures every class. Homework is a chapter every week or so, time consuming if you don't like to read. 4-5 grades in the class, so if you mess up on a test, it can tank your grade. Interesting class and ideas, you need to participate at least once a week based on the homework. I had a B but was curved to an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Only take Marein for 205 if you are a great test taker. Completely optional attendance, and only grades are very tough exams. Upside is gives big curve, but class averages were always below 80.

Would recommend taking someone else for micro. Not a bad professor, but 100% of grade is tests, unlike some others, and everybody bombs every exam and he only curves to an 80 average. I know multiple people really struggling, felt lucky to get out with a B-.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Greiman could not be more confusing if she tried. She has a terrible set-up for ENG 290. DO NOT TAKE IT. She assigned so many different readings that just didn't work together, and I (and a lot of my classmates) were very confused by everything going on in this course. If you're taking it as a requirement, DON'T. Take Lit Crit from someone else!!!

Dr. Greiman is very nice, but this course was terrible. It was extremely ambiguous and complicated, and it really shouldn't have been. She held an exam midterm that was very confusing, (not just to me, but to most of the class) and she did not help with preparation at all. It is not well organized and was extremely unhelpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: One of my favorite professors at Wake. I ended up in this class because everything else was full, but it wasn't that bad. There was a lot of reading but if you listen in class you can manage without doing it. The grade is based on 5 short papers and 2 longer ones, all graded for completion. Recommend if you're just looking to fill your requirement

I took Dr. Greiman for FYS 100 and it was an okay class to take for the requirement. She is very kind and understanding. The best part is the grades are based on the completion of assignments, participation, and extra credit. However, I don't recommend it if you are not willing to read the books because one of the novels required is Moby Dick.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Phenomenal Lecturer. Super Organized and great at explaining things. Easy access outside the class, and always willing to go the extra mile. Provides ample practice material and genuinely wants you to do well in his class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Definitely take Dr. Kim-Shapiro if you get the chance! His lectures are very deliberate and well-prepared, with well-organized slides - easy to take notes on, and he prepares you very well for tests (and gives plenty of partial credit). He is also a genuinely kind and caring person, and always happy to answer questions and chat outside of class.

Really great professor who knows what hes doing. Also very understanding and willing to help. The class is difficult but doable, but its physics so I didnt expect it to be easy anyway. Three exams count for 45%, but he makes the lowest score count for 5% and the other 2 for 20%. Take Kim-Shapiro if you can!

I you go back to him with homework questions he is very helpful. Getting a good homework grade requires work and will go a long way in making the class easier and helping your grade. He trails off on his own tangents sometimes but he is a wonderful teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Very good at explaining concepts and accessible outside the classroom. There was a lot of homework but it was not hard to get A's on the homework, especially if you go to him for help. Only difficult thing in the course were the exams.

I really liked Dr. Allen, he's funny and will explain material as many times as you need to understand. He's big on homework, but you can get extra credit if you do it over 24 hours in advance. Can be unclear at times, but you just need to tell him what you don't understand and he will help. Good experience!

Took his class as an art requirement. I used to like filming short videos with my friends, but this class made me question if I could ever enjoy video making again. The information found online could be more useful than his lectures. The feedback was also not helpful, in my case, AT ALL. That being said, you get access to some fancy cameras, sooo

This professor knows nothing about making films. We have seen one of his works during the semester and it was awful and boring. He claims that he will never give A unless you demonstrate superior skills in making films. He is not helpful at all and doesn't support his students.
He is not a good teacher. Takes the intro class way too seriously. He is too hard on students who have never even touched a camera before.

Prof. Curtis best!! He's incredibly passionate about this subject and super accessible outside of class. There's a reason his classes are always full—he makes learning enjoyable and genuinely cares about his students! If you study for his tests they are not hard.

Really nice professor and accessible for extra help. Lectures are really boring and hard to engage with. All the power points are posted so it's not a big deal if you miss a class. Only 2 tests and the final exam each worth 25% of your grade.

Easy if you pay attention. Super cool and normal dude. Teaches well but the lectures are super slow and can be painful to pay attention. Can miss some classes if you catch up on the material on your own. The only grades are 2 tests and 1 exam (other than 10% homework), so each test matters a lot and you'll cram a decent amount.

I think the course material is great, but sometimes the readings were a bit a lot. He also just wasn't there for almost the whole second half of the semester because of his own studies, so a lot of people did worse towards the end of the class. There also aren't that many grades so the exams and quizzes really matter.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Rule number 1,
Don't expect Professor Devotta to remember your name

Rule number 2, 
Don't expect Professor Devotta to teach a lot as he devotes most of his effort to his own studies

His assigned readings are your teachers of the class. The exam papers are not relavant to what he teach as his syllabus always changes due to his many conferences.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This class is interesting, as DeVotta knows a great deal about S. Asia in general. There is a lot of reading, but it is interesting and also easy to skim. The quizzes are simple, and as long as you did the reading you will get a decent grade. His tests are not too bad either, consisting of multiple choice and short answers. He is a fun teacher and

Elka Staley was a great professor for Writing 111. The workload was fairly light, and her grading was easy. She was very clear with her expectations and she was a very kind professor. She clearly cares about the students.

LOVE ELKA! Class is super easy, learned a lot, and gained lots of writing experience. Clear grading, gives great feedback, is very involved in her students' success, and is so nice. She is very lenient if you need an extension or help. Show up to class and do your assignments and you'll do well. She makes the course topic interesting too!
So so easy - a couple of essays the whole year, flexible deadlines, very understanding, cancelled class a couple of times
Super easy class. Such a kind and funny professor. Grades really easily and is always avalible for questions. Would definitely reccomend.

I quite liked Dr. Willis' class.  Lectures I found informative and enjoyable, especially if you participate. There were group projects, but you can choose your partner, and if you do the work, it's quite easy to do well. He was very available outside of class and gave good feedback and help if you asked. I would definitely recommend his divisional.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great guy who wants his students to learn. Group projects sucked if you had a bad partner. Every class was a long lecture with a lot of unnecessary talking; it can easily be very interesting or very boring. I know he if forced to teach the material from the textbook, not completly his fault.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Super easy if you just copy down what's on his slides. The lectures can be a little boring from time to time, but overall, they are really interesting and he is clearly very knowledgeable. He grades generously and really wants his students to enjoy the topic

Professor Willis is a great professor. He knows a lot about international politics and wants his students to learn. There is very little homework for the class and minimal reading. The tests are easy if you pay attention in class.

He is a very bright guy. Have learned a ton in one semester and has sparked an interest in International Affairs for me. Class is very lecture-heavy, but he does mix it up with in-class activities that are engaging once in a while.

Professor Willis is an amazing professor, loved his class. The only thing is that there are very few assignments, so your grade is determined by those assignments. However, he's not a tough grader and as long as you put in the work, you'll be fine. The class is lecture heavy, and there is assigned reading but he summarizes it in class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Taught a Celtic Christianity class - great topic, great instructor; she knows pretty much everything there is to know about it!

completely inept and too long-winded, she makes for a soporific lecturer at best.  furthermore, she has a talent for digression that will leave you wondering how is it that people like this are allowed to teach...
she sucks!  just take my word for it

M.Jimenez was the TA for my CSC 101 class, but whenever he was in class he was super helpful, not only with the course content but with school in general. He really wants everyone to do well and tries to present material in ways that will help you better understand what we're talking about. I would recommend taking a class taught by him!
Very good! Eric was interested in the topic and was very helpful
He is very passionate about this subject, which is obvious to see when he is teaching our class

I had Dr. Wiggers for 113 and 153. He really took the time to make sure everyone enjoyed learning German. He is available outside of class for anyone needing extra help. If you have the opportunity, take Dr. Wiggers.

Professor Wiggers has been one of my fav professors at Wake. I took his elementary german class as well as his intermediate german class. He is one of those professors who is just kind, caring, and works to create a relaxed environment within his classroom. He gives daily homework, typically just a light worksheet, a few quizzes, and 3/4 exams.

Dr. Wiggers is by far the best professor I have had. He is very caring toward his students, and completely fluent in German and educated in German culture. He includes current events in Germany to his class and highlights his own experiences in Germany, making class intriguing. He is definitely the reason I am going to continue taking German.

Eccentric as all get out. Have to love him, he's a very well spoken and inspired professor. Even took us on field trip to museums in the area. RIP Pual. Yet I give him a four because while we briefly went over many topics on curation, we were never pushed to practice curation in a way to deepen my curatorial abilities.

had him last year for my FYS, and he is AMAZING. he made the class enjoyable despite it being online. nice, caring, and engaging. he even had mental health policies in place. you still had to show up though. a lot of reading and discussion posts, but they were manageable.

Class is a little boring, but Dr. Gurstelle is a funny guy. The field trips and trips to the anthropology museum are fun. The papers are very clearly explained in the syllabus and there are not many of them. Super chill overall, easy divisional.

He is the best! In fact, I have taken three of his course, and he is really the reason I chose antho as my major! ANT190 FYS100 ANT305, he is an expert of museum. He wants his student to do great and have a A; meanwhile, he is really passionate about his material. You will love him, trust me. Three papers all around 750-1250+final+midterm, easy

I liked him- was kinda annoying at times and I found the class to be so niche it was hard to pay attention. But overall not too bad for WRI111- not sure about his other courses though. Only had 3 papers and they weren't too long so that was good.

Don't take his class. His contract grading system is a complete joke he gives no feedback at all. He grades quantity over quality all you get are Bs to get an A you have to do these crazy unnecessary useless extra assignments I got an A so I know. He changes assignments after assigning them don't bother doing them early. I hated this class so much.

Dr. Keating is a nice professor and definitely knows what he is talking about. However, the course material can get very repetitive and there is a lot of work outside of class. On top of this, he takes peer review very seriously, a little too much, and in the end, you spend as much time on your paper as you do on your peer review/ editing process.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Erhardt is super funny and kind - overall great professor. For stats 112, the course was not extremely fast paced but I still learned a ton! He takes time to review before tests and is very accessible for extra help. His office hours are super helpful.

Dr. Rob is such a pleasure to learn from, he is kind and funny but also an excellent professor. The pace of the class was relatively slow, lots of review, but there was a decent amount of homework and the exams could be quite tricky. Overall, Dr. Rob made STA 112 an interesting and rewarding class that I would wholeheartedly reccomend!

Dr. Rob is a great professor! He works extremely hard to ensure that every student understands the material. And while there is a decent amount of outside work, it is all geared towards understanding the content (not busy work). Overall I highly recommend this professor. He is the reason I am continuing with statistics.
Great and caring teacher. Tried a new grading structure that was very low stress and pressure. Think she will continue it. Very nice and understanding. If you put in effort you will get the A.

She doesn't really care very much about whether her students do well or understand, just that she is staying on track with her schedule. you will end up learning most of the material from your textbook outside of class and the homework does not well reflect what she is talking about. the entire class is lectures. she is available for office hours
Very caring professor and passionate about math, which shines through in lectures. She makes things easy and wants you to succeed but also learn a lot.

She's very caring for her students and wants everyone to succeed. Its calculus so of course its not easy, but she tries to make it fun and to keep everyone interested. There is opportunity for extra credit and she's a very fair grader. Ive learned alot without an immense amount of stress.
TAKE HIM. Super nice guy, genuinely cares about his students. It is a decent amount of work, but it's pretty easy. Easy A.
Super chill prof, highly recommend for a 200 level as his class is pretty stress-free and interesting. My favorite prof throughout my minor

Gives two reading assignments per week, literally just a paragraph response that is graded on completion. No tests, one final project (paper and presentation), Allowed to have computers out in class. Used to teaching at Auburn where students don't care or show up so he's happy to hand out A's to students who do. Definitely recommend as divisional.
Really boring class. Unfortunate because the content is actually interesting, but he lectures the whole time and makes it so disengaging.
Good professor. Manageable work load. No textbooks needed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Halliez is a pretty solid professor. His lectures are PowerPoint presentations. There are 2 tests (midterm & final) and 2 essays throughout the semester.  He is very accessible outside of class and is very clear on what he expects in the class. There are also a lot of opportunities for extra credit which is helpful.
Very funny and very chill. Gets along with students and will engage conversation with them. Towards the end of the semester class just turned into comedy. Fun stuff, not hard to get an A.
Easy and nice. Not sure how much I learned in all honesty.

I would definitely recommend taking him. His tests are so fair to what is taught and easier than the tests I took in lower level Spanish courses. He also grades really graciously on things like compositions, presentations, and interviews. If you aren't great at Spanish I would 1000% say to take his class. Also super nice

Took HST108 - Lot of busy work and daily quizzes. If you miss a class you must make the quiz up. Long papers that increase in % worth as the semester goes on. If you put in the work, you will do well but it is a lot of reading/work. Class is all lectures + never get out early. However, she is great outside of class and gives fantastic feedback.
Nice lady and as long as you try and do some of the readings you will be fine for History 108

I really love coming to this class. I feel really welcomed in the classroom, and I know that if I have a question that my question will be answered so that understand the material better. In the class, nobody laughs at anybody even if the student gets a question  wrong or does not understand something all the students help the student better learn.
Great professor in my opinion. Not too hard to do well if you go to class, pay attention and review the powerpoints online.
All the notes are on powerpoints for the students to have. He is fun and really smart. He wants his students to succeed.

Dr. Lane really cares about his students.  He gets in touch with you if you are not doing well and gives you techniques on how to get better. His tests are very fair, pretty much straight from the lectures and powerpoints.
A must take course from one of the best professors on campus. Always looked forward to this class.
best course in the business school
Truly one of the best at Wake Forest. Went out of his way to help and relate to students. Great examples from working experiences.  Best class that I've taken in four years.
Rude and condescending. Has some anger management issues. Berated for asking a question on two occasions.
tough, but a GREAT professor. he really wants you to learn, and you will!

Dr. Marsh can be really intimidating at first, but he ended up being one of my favorite professors. I took him for both Anatomy and Biomechanics, then was an Anatomy TA senior year.  Anatomy is an incredible amount of material- it's not hard but you have to make sure you keep up!
Lectures are poorly made. If you take her, prepare to teach yourself the entire course. Do not take.
Not a good choice for General Physics I Lectures are not very clear and therefore you have to teach yourself EVERYTHING I would recommend avoiding this professor
Not a very good general physics professor. I do not recommend taking this course. Lectures are very unclear; you will be better off taking another professor for PHY 113. Exams are very hard as well.

Dixon is a good professor but this class was just a snoozefest IMO. If you are interested in the material it is a good option, and either way the grading is super generous (you choose when to take reading quizzes and are told the questions on the midterm and final) so it is a good pick for a divisional, just not the most interesting.
Super nice professor but class was sooooo boring. I almost fell asleep in some lectures, that being said, the professor is a super nice guy and the class is pretty easy if you need a divisional
I took PHI 164 with this guy and now I'm majoring in PHI
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Dixon is great!! The material was really interesting and made for a lot of critical thinking. He gives you multiple options to select from when answering the reading questions and you choose whether to take the midterm and final home or as an exam.

Professor Dostal is intelligent and passionate about the power grid. There are two tests and two small essays + a big group project near the end of the semester. All of these are easy to prepare for and easy to get an A on if you put in the work. I learned a lot about the power grid and found the class to be worthwhile.

Dr. Dostal was my favorite professor in the fall by far. He's incredibly intelligent, and I could tell he loved teaching us new material because he got to think about it as well. We had two tests and two papers, but both were easy to prepare for. I definitely recommend taking his course.

Really good demonstrations but lectures don't translate to the test and homework - average grade on midterms is 60-70% - seems to care about helping students but just wish 20% of my grade was not 25 MC questions
Horrible class, lectures are very long and dull.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible. Stay away

He's very funny, class is interesting and very informative on the subject at hand; but he is a very very hard grader. There isn't all too much work to do for the class, but except for 5 or 6 papers throughout the semester, but he grades them very hardly with almost no other grades to buffer it.

I took Dr. Yarfitz my first semester of my freshman year in college during the pandemic, so it was entirely on zoom. I was struggling with mental health issues and woke up with no energy every day. I was communicated this with Dr. Yarfitz and he was genuinely empathetic, flexible and caring. I am grateful for him and I’m glad I took his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Yarfitz is such a nice teacher. There are no quizzes, exams, or tests. You only get graded on essays and group discussions which is pretty nice. However, there is SO MUCH READING. Be prepared to read for hours a week in his class. He is a great person and his classes are super interesting but it's basically all discussion.

Dr. Yarfitz was a really great professor, I loved taking his class! There is a lot of reading each night and a few assignments but they are all manageable. Dr. Yarfitz also believes in self-reflection and "un-grading" so you basically get to choose your own grade as long as you can justify that you worked for it. Really interesting and fun class.

Dr. Caron is a great professor, but likely the hardest grader in the history dept. For the mid-term and final (both take-home) because of her high expectations, you either have to cheat or put in a lot of time preparing. If you're aiming for an A, be prepared to put in a ton of work. But if you're content with a B, the class can be manageable.

Wouldn't really recommend this class. It's difficult and if you need a divisional there are easier classes to take. However, it isn't terrible and I don't dread going to the class so at least there's that.

Dr. Caron is a very lovely professor, however, their grading is difficult. Definitely, the most challenging grader I have experienced in the history department here (I have had 6 different HST profs). Do not take their class for a divisional there are much easier options. Lots of lectures and essays and readings
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Caron is a very lovely professor, however, their grade is difficult. Definitely, the most challenging grader I have experienced in the history department here (I have had 6 different HST profs). Do not take their class for a divisional there are much easier options. Lots of lectures and essays mainly, but overall tough grading. Lots of reading
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I would absolutely not recommend this course to anyone. I took it for an easy divisional credit and interesting course but it was anything but. Cook gives a lot of homework which I personally did not mind, and did well on all of them. Ended the course with a 99% on all homeworks and 98% overall on labs, yet a B in the course due to tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy
