comment: we were online when i took this class, but there were a bunch of pop quizzes. he does drop 10 of your lowest ones. also curves your grade at the end of the semester. can't say lectures were interesting but that might've been cause we were online. he definitely was available for office hours when you needed it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Cook is a good guy; he really wants to help out. However, I don't believe he was well prepared after the course became part-online. His video and synchronous lectures were not the most helpful, whereas his exams were not intuitive to the practice problems or homework given. Make sure you read the textbook as your primary source of knowledge.

I loved the class. It is very lecture-heavy, but there is little to no work during the semester. Just make sure you take notes on the specific artists and what they believe in. Also, the whole grade is based on two tests and a final project, so be prepared. He also claims that he does not give out As almost ever.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Lubin is an incredibly considerate and kind professor. I would 100% take his class again if I could. He is also attentive and accommodating with mental health, which is very helpful to students with disorders or other concerns. Hands down one of my favorite professors at the university and one of the best in the department.

I love Dr. Lubin! He is such a sweet old man, really funny, and great at stimulating interest in art history. The class is discussion based and hell cold call ppl, but it honestly isnt that bad. Hes really caring and likes to ask students questions about their lives. Your grade is based off a midterm, a final, a final paper, and participation.

Dr. Carmichael was definitely the best professor for MTH 111, at least compared to the other professors I know of. He genuinely wants you to do well, but there are so few grades that each test/quiz matters. Calc is hard so its not the easiest class but he was a good teacher
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Carmichael is a really sweet guy, kind of reminds me of my grandpa. However, the class was EXTREMELY HARD, or maybe I'm just bad at calculus. We have a short 2-4 question quiz every Wednesday. He is lenient with extra credit/ half credit on tests/quizzes, and ultimately just wants his students to do well. He doesn't round grades and no curves.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr Carmichael is so nice and a pretty fair grader. He gives extra credit if you get below a certain grade on a test and gives you as much time as you need to take tests and quizzes. He assigns a lot of homework but doesnt check if you do it but its pretty helpful and he goes over the problems.

Dr. Evans clearly knows a lot about stats, so he does well at explaining the different topics. Lectures/activities balanced examples and notes well, and prepared you for tests and projects. Only complaint is that office hours were 1 on 1, sign up based rather than drop in, because I personally prefer a group office hour setting, but helpful still.

Compared to Dr.Dalzell, I will not say he is a tough grader, but if you make some fatal mistakes on like building models or something, the deduction will be huge. Other time I think the grading is good. He teaches smooth and peaceful and can literally answer every question I throw.

He is really passionate and knows a ton, which makes it hard for him to simplify it for students unfamiliar with the content. Super accessible and helpful if you can find the time to seek that out. Wants you to succeed and is understanding but wont hesitate to give out a bad grade. Take if you like stats and want to be challenged/learn a lot!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Do not take this course if you want to be overloaded with so much work. You read about 3-5 research studies each week and have to write about nine 1-page-single space reflections in total. There are 3 argumentative essays that are 3 pages long(double-spaced). Dr. Buchanan is a good professor, and the course is interesting, but overall hard class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Dr. Buchanan is a nice professor. Her parent-child course was interesting. However, the entire course is set up to read multiple research papers per class, so be ready to read. Plus, most assignments are papers. I probably wrote 7-8 substantial papers. If you think you will like the material, go for it, but if not, maybe choose another psych class.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I loved Dr. Buchanan and this class so much! We had to read a study every single night, which was a lot, but it's so worth it. The class was so interesting, and she wants to help her students do well. It's definitely not an easy A, but if you put in the work it's easy to do well. There are pop quizzes, but they're easy as long as you do the reading
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The low ratings aren't entirely fair. Yes he is monotone, but his lectures are pretty easy to follow regardless, and he does a good job at clearly explaining what's going on. I went to his office hours regularly and they made the class significantly easier. If you put an ounce of effort towards his class he will notice and reciprocate.

Most of the time he offers no explanation in his monotone lecturing. His lecture feels like a dialogue of himself in his head. Doesn't care how students are understanding his lecture. There's a coding portion where you cannot find anything to teach yourself online and if you have no experience, you will get really lost. Worst professor I've had.

Does not engage with the class at all. Also had unfair expectations of his students. Most students came in with very little knowledge of coding, but he clearly expected everyone to know how to do it and made no effort to help students who didn't. Lectures were very unclear

A great professor and wants students to get an A. She is homework-heavy, but it's on Cengage, and it's only to help, not hurt you. Although her tests are hard, she gives test corrections and extra credit opportunities. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She's the goat of Physics class. Best teacher of the year so far by a long shot.

Dr. P is amazing and wants you to succeed! She makes herself very accessible for office hours. She lets you do test corrections and gives lots of partial credit. She gave weekly hw through WebAssign. She is my favorite teacher in the physics department and really cares about her students and wants to help you get an A.
Such an amazing teacher, a fun and interesting class for a divisional!

Professor Nesson is approachable and open to questions outside of class. The course has few assignments, so exam performance significantly affects your final grade. There are three exams, followed by a homework assignment due before each exam. Professor Nesson said that typically the average final grade in the course is a B.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He was a great professor that really cared about his students. Would definitely recommend and would take again!
Amazing professor. Always willing to help and super accessible outside of class. I would definitely recommend.

Alqahtani is a decent option for 112. The exams and final project are weighted very heavily (75% of final grade) but she is a very generous grader on them. The instructions on the weekly(ish) projects are not very clear but once you figure it out they are not too difficult. The lectures and in-class exercises are very helpful.

Having taken CSC 111 with a challenging professor, CSC 112 with Alqahtani was easy. The class consisted of lectures and weekly projects, which, while they took a while, were more than enough to understand the material. We had 2 exams in the course, which she graded VERY generously (I thought I got a 70% but received a 90%), and a final project.

Really nice and understanding teacher. Doesnt grade too harshly on tests compared to other CS teachers. Projects weren't too time-consuming and not impossible. Wouldn't lecture for that long sometimes but didn't expect more than what she taught. Gave good practice questions before each test. Overall, great experience in her class.

Without a doubt the worst professor I have ever had. She is extremely strict with grading, her lectures are confusing and don't really teach you anything, and to perform well on assignments you are expected to know material from much more difficult classes. Also, at the end of the semester, she drops everyone's grade by like 5 points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Quite possibly the worst professor at the school.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The other rating on here is spot. Take Kairoff or literally anyone else and you will be fine. Dan is a meth head compared to Kairoff. Same exact class, but 15 times harder. Not only do you need to memorize a bunch of songs, but you need to know random ass details about each song too! Half of which he either did not go over, or said one time
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This is the hardest divisional you can take. I spent more time studying for these tests than any other class. The listening portions of exams are difficult. Don't take this class if you aren't a music major, not worth the stress and gpa impact

One of my favorite professors at wake so far! Very patient and willing to help. Gives a lot of homework but you are allowed another attempt to redo it, and adds 3% to your grade just for handing in your phone every day. Only thing I didn't like was weekly quizzes. He made quantum mechanics as stress free as possible and I definitely learned a lot!

Dr. Anderson is among the best physics professors at Wake and one of the kindest and most dedicated professors I've ever had. He made quantum mechanics interesting, clear, and understandable for me. Be prepared to be challenged in his class, but he is readily available to answer questions and gives you every chance to learn and succeed if you try.

ridiculously hard for a divisional gave us a cumulative 80 question which is so ridiculous for a divisional. Intentionally tries to mess you up on questions by using keywords and even admits to doing. Worst professor I have had a Wake by far.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Sweet professor, focused on your success. There is so much homework, but if you do it helps your grade and practice. Tests are hard, but gives points if you show work. Put time and effort into her resources and you can do good. Do not procrastinate in class, or you will fall behind. Everything builds on. She always has office hours!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Chem is a hard class, but if you go to the lectures and pay attention you will do fine. She is a good professor and explains concepts well during her lectures.

She's an excellent Professor, and does care for her students. The class was difficult and there was is a lot of homework, but it does prepare you for the difficulty of the tests at Wake. She constantly has office hours where she will guide you through a problem, or explain a concept you may not have understood in class. Make sure you study!

I graduated 7 years ago, and while all of my Spanish professors at WFU were excellent, he stands out. His approach to teaching grammar was truly scientific, completely thorough, and very effective. He assigned a lot of work and was consistent in thorough and timely grading. You do not find this caliber of teacher very often.
No Comments
Easiest intro Econ teacher hands down

I had Boko for International Politics and did very well in class and with the written assignments.  Whenever you had a question and emailed/called or even stopped by, Boko would not respond to ANY questions.  He is solely there for research.  When questioning the break-down of how my final grade was determined (reasonable to ask) he never responded

I loved Brubaker - he's the man. Classes are long (he gives a break each day) and lectures are also quite lengthy. Be sure to take good notes & be prepared to study quite a bit. Tests are manageable but nit-picky with details (ex: he'll give TF questions and you must correct the false statements) Very easy to work with and wants to see you succeed

Dr. Brubaker was my favorite professor at Wake. He is really chill and truly cares about his students.  Although the course material can be complicated, he was great at explaining it clearly (and re-explaining if necessary). His tests are nit-picky but if you study you'll be fine.

Bilal is a relatively new professor, and he is great for an introductory class. No required attendance, straightforward grading system, and no pop quizzes. He use an online homework program, and that counts as 100% of the homework. It's required every week and takes about 30 minutes to do. Overall, I recommend him for a 150 class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Celik is a fairly new professor. He teaches directly from the textbook, which can be read on your own. In my class we never had a quiz. We had 3 tests and a final. Homework was online and you had a bunch of chances to answer each question. Interesting class. Good professor. Pretty easy

Overall just a really great teacher who cares about making class not only fun, but more interesting to learn about, especially considering the fact that it's Spanish. The class is easy, but it's definitely no easy A, you still have to put in work to receive it.

If you put the effort in, you can easily get an A in this class. She is so helpful and willing to work with you to make sure your doing okay both mentally and emotionally. The work is bearable but there is HW and tests. She's straightforward and wants everyone to do well. Highly recommend for any level she teaches.

Loved her. Only one paper at the end and just journal entries about the reading during the weeks. The readings were short- thats why its called "slow" because you only read a little and discuss about it. Im a stem person and found this class super easy even tho English is very much not my thing. Loved her- she even sang to us once. An angel
Literally so nice. I would recommend her if you're not a huge english person but need to fulfill a divisional.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor Dinan is an amazing lecturer. If you want to do well in this class, you will need to take extensive notes. His assignments are difficult but very doable, and achieving an A in his class can be done, but you can not slack.
A lot of work (three exams and two 12 page papers) but I guess you can't complain since it's a 200 level course. Great lecturer though. He always made the topic interesting.

Dr. Oksanish is a great guy, and definitely cares about his students. However, his class didn't feel very organized, and he basically didn't use Canvas at all. The material wasn't challenging, as long as you do the reading, but he does not post notes from discussion, so don't miss class. He was also a slow grader, and grades essays kind of tough.

He is a very entertaining guy and knows how to be extremely productive in a class but he is extremely hard. He teaches so much material each class and you must do the homework as you go over your answers the next day and he even cold calls. prepare to work hard if you are bad at latin.
She is an awesome professor! Does not give tests, mainly project and group work. A lot of reading and she knows when nobody read.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Hernandez is awesome, a kind woman who loves her discipline! She is also a supportive teacher, who goes above and beyond for her student when they need it.

I absolutely loved professor chandras. Shes the sweetest person ever and is really passionate about anthropology. She cares about her students and makes an effort to get to know you. The course includes reading a few books with short quizzes on each and a final paper/project at the end. 10/10 recommend
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Interesting class and everyone I know finished with an A and had nothing but good things to say about Chandras. Decent bit of reading but you can get away with not doing it once and a while. Great class and professor for a divisional.

Dr. Boyd is an awesome professor. The course has a lot of group work and the material is easy to understand. He gives you many opportunities to improve your grade, but can be a difficult grader. As long as you show up to class and are prepared, it's an easy A. He is also very nice and understanding.
Lots of group work but if you participate and do all of your assignments you should get a decent grade.
I loved taking Curtis. He wasn't the greatest professor in the world but he had quality lectures and was a fair grader. He also was just a cool guy that liked sports. 100% would take again.
Very very nice man. He tries to make the content interesting and relevant to real-life situations. Very clear and organized. A great teacher. Highly recommend for economics.
This class and grading was straightforward and the material was actually interesting to read and discuss.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Darvay was always enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the course work. Lecturers could be very dense and non-interactive. Two major papers, a handful of discussion posts, and a presentation are required for course content. Grading is very lenient. I would definitely recommend this class as a curriculum requirement!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I was nervous for my first college language class, but Prof Poveda made it very easy to settle in and feel confident in my Spanish. Questions can be asked in English when needed, and she genuinely wants us to learn spanish. Overall I think my skills have improved a lot and I don't feel anxious in the class. I'd love to get her again next semester.

Super nice and really wanted her students to learn spanish. She would slow down and speak in English if it was really needed/to clarify. We had a lot of homework each night, but it wasn't graded harshly. Also lots of group work and speaking in class, so be prepared to speak up. She always gave study guides that were practically the same as the test
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I would avoid taking Dr. Waugh. Originally, I thought he seemed alright. When it comes to grading, though, he can be awful and so unhelpful and not caring. He will try to find things wrong with anything you submit. Instructions aren't clear often, which leads to terrible scores. He is overall rude. Take a different psych course with someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Tough grader and rude to students. Used a flipped classroom model that was disorganized and difficult to study from.
He grades very strictly but he lectures amazingly and is very funny.

I actually took CLA 180 but there was no option for that since it is a new class. Prof Laughlin is great though. She makes class enjoyable, the rare lectures aren't great since she's just reading straight from the slides but the class is really just 2 essays, a group project, and then a single assignment that takes 15 minutes every week.

Prof. Laughlin was very nice and had super cool experiences to share. Honestly did not learn a thing but the class was fun and we did some cool projects and activities that connected the material to pop culture and contemporary issues. Super chill class to fill the classics requirement, I would recommend.
Very nice and has lots of resources, but a rigid grader and the daily quizzes are annoying. Overall a good teacher but not my favorite class.

Brooks is a good professor. She has online videos instead of a textbook, making learning the material much easier outside of class. However, she gives daily quizzes that aren't too hard and are worth very little of your grade. She also deflates final grades if the average is too high.
No bueno
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Chris was a great professor for business analytics. It was a class that I was dreading having to take and quickly became one of my favorite classes.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a great professor and I enjoyed lectures. However, so many papers, usually two a week and often he would just leave comments like "try to go more in depth". A great teacher but definitely way too much work for a class to complete a divisional requirement.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This class gave me PTSD. Gives a paper each week that's supposed to be 4-7 pages along with ~80 pages of both textbook and supplemental reading. Tests aren't hard if you do all the readings and pay attention during class. He's a pretty nice guy, but the workload is insane for an intro class. 0/10

Dr. Ramirez is a very nice person and a pretty good sociology professor. He has very long, interesting lectures every class, with daily reading homework from the textbook. The exams can be difficult, but as long as you pay attention to the lectures and at least skim the readings, they aren't too bad.
Participate and do the hours and this will be the most interesting course in law school.  Prof was hired to do this clinic and it shows. Very casual but learned so much.

Avoid at all costs for criminal procedure. He was unclear and we never got a late picture or takeaway. The final exam was atrocious. He offered no practice questions or even recommendations on how to study. His hypos in class were not at all aligned with the rigor of the test. Not worth it.
One of the most fantastic, and fantastically complicated classes. He knows this, and its all he has done, but my god its detailed.
blah blah blah.  I'm going to talk and you are going to listen.  I am going to talk so much that if you try to ask questions I will lose my spot and get irritated.  blah blah blah.
Seriously the hardest class and hardest tests I've ever taken.  70% of the class failed. I squeaked by with a D- .  Would NOT recommend.

Nice, but difficult to understand and gets aggravated when people don't understand him. I spent 2 weeks studying for a test and still got a 66. Which was still higher than the average. Hasn't curved, but offers extra credit assignments instead. Not the best, but not the worst either

Civ Pro II.  Really confusing professor who teaches material that is not at all relevant to the exam.  If you get stuck with Green, ignore everything from class and teach yourself using supplements from day 1.
Prof green is the best. You have to take this course.

The best class for the English divisional! Lots of reading but the class is only discussion so it evens out the work load. 3 papers and 2 exams, pretty straightforward. I learned so much and she's the sweetest professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had her for Eng 150 and her 18th cent brit lit class.  i love her. she is organized and straight forward.  a TON of reading but you learn to manage it.  the class is interesting so i think its worth it! she's just a great teacher
Take Weselcouch. Cannot go wrong. One of the few teachers I have had at Wake that actually cares about teaching not just being a worthless professor. Accessible office hours and easy to get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Calculus will be hard for me regardless, but I can recognize that Dr. Weselcouch is a great professor! Would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Graczyk is one of the nicest professors you will ever have. Always demonstrates patience with students and is more than willing to answer any questions. You can tell he knows a lot about Economics. The only downside to his class is that he explains terms/topics in an overly wordy/confusing manner that will easily throw you off.

Dr. Graczyk was a good professor, he just taught introductory econ content in a very confusing way. The tests were generally pretty hard (a lot of people didn't do well) but homework and other assignments count for a lot of the grade, which balances it out. He also gave us the opportunity for extra credit and you can tell he loves econ as a subject

Very friendly professor! So many times see so many stupid questions been asked in his office hour, but he still answers them with great patience. Exams are very easy and straight forward. But sometimes forget to include stuff in his lectures.
He is amazing! He is very patient and have lots of fun in class! He is very helpful during office hour and offer review sessions.
very chill and super laid back profesor which helps in an easy course. Made class super interesting every day. 10/10
I love Dr. French! Her classes are always fun and not too hard. She really cares and wants you to do well. You have 1 paper, a couple of assignments, and a final project.
Dr. Rives was an ok lab professor. He tended to lecture for a long time before each lab which was a little annoying. He was very good at explaining the lab concepts and was a fair grader.

Professor Rives is great at letting students know what material is really important during his lectures and what will be on exams. Definitely dedicated to student learning and helping you out if you're struggling. Bases grades off of how much you learned and improved over the semester. High recommend him for General Chemistry classes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: (I took him for PSY248 but it wasn't an option) Dr. Dagenbach seems like a nice guy and he can definitely be fun when he wants to, but sometimes he is just petty. He is happy when the average for the exams is like an 82 (in a psych class I just feel like averages should be higher). His lectures are disorganized and so boring. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This man is so sweet! People sometimes say he's boring, but I loved him! He makes boring lectures interesting and sometimes comes with fun activities and tricks for the class. He's a fair grader and his tests aren't hard at all if you read the textbook. This definitely isn't an easy A class but it's not hard. He gives little quizzes after lectures.

Prof Smith fosters such a fun learning environment in his classroom and is genuinely hilarious. Clicker questions are common in class, and each week there are about two chapters to read with an online reading test. Overall the material is very interesting, and has made me want to be an Envi Science major. I wish I could have him for all classes!

My class would have been 100% perfect if it wasn't at 9:30, but otherwise, it's perfect. He's fun, engaging, friendly, a fair grader, and assignments are fun. Instructions and assignments are very clear, and it's virtually impossible not to get an A and not to enjoy the class. I just wish I could take him for every class going forward.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Great Profesor! She really cares about her students and facilitates phenomenal class discussions. I would highly recommend taking any class she teaches. There is certainly a hefty amount of reading but nothing that is not manageable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: A wonderfully kind and knowledgable woman who really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Her class is interesting, and she provides you with many opportunities to be creative with assignments and interpretations of material. She is also very down to earth despite her impressive credentials.

Yea I was definitely a fan. His Tutorials were very helpful – definitely read those before the lecture. He explains stuff super well, makes the class as fun a possible and shows a real interest in the content. The content is aggravating, but Pease does a great job in BIO II I really honestly think so. Wish he taught full semesters
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Dr. Pease is a good lecturer. However, he is oddly sensitive regarding his exams and cannot admit when he makes mistakes. He makes exams too complicated and when I pointed that out to him, he made me leave his office which was a highly unnecessary response for our tone of conversation. Success was difficult so I had to withdraw from his course.

BIO 160 is a pretty hard class. However, Dr. Pease does a good job of breaking down complex concepts. He is really knowledgeable about the material and is always accessible outside of class. I highly recommend going to his office hours, especially before a test. I think he is a fair grader and truly cares about his students.

An entertaining and tough instructor. Preparation for all classes is extremely important due to his fondness of cold calling. He is a tough grader and harsh with deadlines. All 3 of the courses I took with him were reading intensive. Missing class is an automatic grade reduction. He is extremely knowledgeable and I genuinely enjoyed his classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: You won't know what your grade is until midterm and then again at finals. The workload is large and the grading is brutal.

Dr. Welsh is an excellent Italian professor. It's a language class so obviously attendance and participation are crucial to your grade, but the textbook is not required (just the online part is), and he has a bunch of great accessible resources to help you. He wants you to succeed and is on your side. He's a great guy.
As long as you do the work you can get a good grade in the class. Quizzes are pretty hard but there are other easier assignments that can boost your grade. He is very nice and helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Would not wish her upon my worst enemy
Would not recommend taking this if you care about your gpa. Simple as that.

FYS Chocolate Tea Coffee and Wine with Gary Miller is my favorite class. Half the semester we are outside at the B-school picnic tables. We made coffee at campus grounds. We also made our own chocolate. No homework. Very minimal work in class. Gary is the best. Good luck getting into this class, it filled up in less than 1 hour.
Gary

Dr. Rottenstein is one of the most caring and accommodating professors at Wake. I have had them twice, and they are the best. Their class isn't super difficult as long as you put in some effort. Would totally recommend, they also always have really interesting facts in their lectures and make sure to include current research.
I literally love this human more than myself. TAKE TAKE TAKE

This class is any easy divisional. There is no text books and no exams but really short quizzes, like 5 questions, and easy readings. She is very lenient and she don't expect us to do much because she know the stress of being in college. Also she do expect us to at least participate in class discussion to make class interesting. Overall easy class.

Great professor! Taken for Philosophy of Language. At times, the reading seemed repetitive and very lengthy, but it was so repetitive you didn't have to read it all. Three papers make up your final grade, but she seems like a fair grader. Definitely recommend.
Take any class you can with her! she is truly brilliant and will make you a better student, person and thinker.
If you do the work, you'll do well. That being said, she's not a professor who lets you just cruise by. Tons of reading but she's a very friendly professor. Don't bring up personal politics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: I am mid-course and shocked at the lack of clarity and direction. She does not describe her grading criteria, does not provide requirements of any sort when she assigns a presentation, and seems surprised when several of my classmates ask for these things. I am too shy to ask in class, but wish she had answered their questions.

Dr. Rizzo is a highlight of Wake's biology department, he is extremely understanding and willing to work with his students. This class is definitely one you should study for because the exams are weighted super heavy, but he also makes group case studies that boost grades. Very engaging lecturer, willing to repeat, and overall very kind.

I think Dr Rizzo has become my favorite professor. The content is definitely hard, but he really wants you to understand it. Makes himself available at any time to help. There are some case studies to do with a group, but not hard at all. He grades super easy, and exams are straight forward. I've loved this class!
Very knowledgeable and clear in explaining concepts. She is also very nice and wants everyone to do well. Homework is very manageable.

I have never taken Italian before, but she made it very easy/straight-forward. There is easy homework due each class (graded on completion) and vocab, other bigger grades, like speaking videos compositions, and tests. She is very forgiving and caring. Classes are engaging but easy. The grading is fair - easy assignment grades but harder tests.
best professor you'll ever have
Excellent professor. Excellent class.

Dr. Epps is one of the best professors I've had at Wake Forest. She provides great feedback and genuinely wants to see you succeed. She is understanding of absences, and accepts late work under her policies. I would absolutely recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She's the nicest professor ever, and the class is pretty interesting because of the wide-ranging writing topics you look at. Just get ready to write, a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: very nice professor, concepts are not too difficult to understand, passionate about his subject, always available and eager to help, keeps up to date on modern issues, would recommend his course

This class is not a bad choice, especially as a divisional credit to avoid taking a bio or chem course. Professor Kell tries to make class as interesting as possible with quirky powerpoints, and lectures each day based off the slides. The powerpoints are posted online, but it still helps to attend class each day as he will add sidenotes and such to
Unnecessarily difficult. You basically have to teach yourself the material. Lecture doesn't match up with lab, so it's like a completely new class.

She is so adorable and a great professor! She's funny at times and is good at explaining difficult concepts. Her tests are pretty challenging and she grades them harshly, but also curves them. I would definitely recommend this class with Dr. Browne!
PROFESSOR NEWMAN IS AWESOME!  This is the most practical class in law school.
No Comments
The best professor !!
Awesome professor! Better than Rose!

This class was awesome, and I would take it again if I could. Professor Moser makes learning fun. We always did team-building activities or we listened to guest speakers. Everything that you learn in this class, you can apply to your life. The only thing that he asks of you is to be on time, do your assignments, and participate.

Although he is not a professor, he is one of the best teachers I have ever had. Mr. Moser had the most amazing lectures that typically included completing leadership challenges and talking about examples of leadership. He also doesn't assign a lot of meaningless busywork, all assignments were actually really valuable to my learning.

Doctor Casey is a phenomenal teacher, I took her LatinX Literature class and was floored at her ability to spark class discussion and tackle hard conversations head on. She clearly deeply cares for her students and is passionate about English and teaching. A pretty heavy reading load that is critical for group discussions, but interesting reads.

Professor Casey is amazing! I took her LatinX lit class, and I loved it. There's a LOT of reading, but she does a great job of keeping her students engaged with the material. It doesn't feel like as much work as it actually is. As long as you're committed to keeping up with the work, the class shouldn't be too overwhelming!

Class was pretty much about all AI stuff. Very repetitive and boring at times. If you need a GPA boost or just tech savvy take this class. I finished with a 100 and was never stress about the class. The final is a group project.

Amanda is amazing! She genuinely cares about her students and their lives both inside and outside the classroom. Her first-year seminar was a bit repetitive at times, but a very easy A if you make even the slightest bit of effort and at least pretend that you care.

Dr. D is very caring and enthusiastic and gives amazing lectures. Explains through examples in slides and puts down key ideas on board; easy to follow. Provides useful tools and files for review. Project is sometimes tricky, but she is very helpful and kind in office hours. You'll get an A if pay attention to details and check progress with Dr. D.

Great professor. Recommend 100%. 
Lots of HomeWorks, labs to practice but helpful for exams. 
Available outside of class to answer questions and convey the material as clear as water.

Projects are challenging and doing them sooner is the only way to do well in class.

Dr. Lee is a very genuine professor who truly cares for his students. If you are struggling or need more time on an assignment, he will definitely accommodate you. He is also sympathetic if you feel uncomfortable in any group projects as a minority student and quickly accommodates your needs there without question. Highly recommended professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took his class as my english requirement, and it was great - he's clearly passionate about teaching and is a fair grader. His lectures and class discussions are a lot of fun without a lot of pressure. Not too much hw either and just an 4-5 pg essay as the final. Highly recommend this for the eng divisional, or major!

Iltis is an amazing professor as well as person. She is very passionate and accessible, and very understanding. The main stuff to the course is mini readings discussed in class, and papers. Also a semester long reading group which was kinda fun actually. Highly recommend, easy as long as u try for papers and show up!

Professor Iltis is very caring. I just had her for PHI 161 and it was a really interesting class and she allows for a lot of large group discussions, but does not always require participation, so if you for get to read the articles a few times it is no big deal. She was a little tough of a grader on the final paper but I think she is very fair.
Dr. Maine is my favorite professor I've had at Wake. He goes out of his way to help you and is genuinely invested in students' success and the content he teaches.

This class can be tough with all the reading, but you only have to go to class once a week. The class is a giant lecture about short stories, but Dr. Maine is pretty brilliant. He's also been at Wake for an impressively long time. If you actually want to learn and willing to put in the work, take this class.
Does not care about students or show up to lectures prepared. Then gives grades based on how much he likes each student.
Terrible Professor. Nobody knows how he grades anything and never explains to students. Would not recommend for anyone actually looking to learn.

Dr. Shirey is FANTASTIC! Not only was my writing class very interesting, but he's so engaging and makes content fascinating. Lots of work, but worthwhile work. I see the world differently after that class.

10/10 would recommend if you have any interest at all in learning a little bit more about writing. Professor Shirey is passionate about his teaching and even more passionate about seeing growth in his students. Class is effort based so if you actually try you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Super nice, easy A- or better class if you are good at math. The homework is great prep for the exams. Attendance is quite optional if you can keep up.

Dr. Hill is very sweet and caring. I loved her class. She wants you to succeed and is very easy to talk to. However, her homework is very difficult, but the tests are straight forward. It was the hardest class I have ever taken, but she was the best professor possible to have for calculus 2.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Lowkey the goat. Super funny and teaches you a decent amount about South Asian religions. The essays/tests are super light but just don't show up late or he'll call you out.
super nice and funny. Kind of a lot of busywork but easy A (south asian religions)

Avoid this class! It was so fast-paced and made math even more confusing. You need to be great at math to do his class, especially without a calculator! His class was probably the most difficult 111 class in the school.

He is a very hard grader and his tests are extremely difficult. The homework problems were much harder than the problems that he taught us in class, and he had little to no sympathy for students that had trouble understanding the material. His class moved very fast, so if you do not have a strong precalculus background good luck keeping up.

Prof Coco is very strict, she assigns a lot of homework, and she cold calls on students during the entire class period. She will keep you accountable and test you every day. That being said, you learn a lot. I would recommend this class to anyone who is majoring/minoring, but if you're simply fulfilling a requirement, I would avoid this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Prof Mann is knowledgeable and passionate about the material she teaches. She is tough and expects students to stay on top of the work and come to class ready to participate. Under extenuating circumstances, she can be understanding but will definitely hold you accountable. Overall I truly loved her class, but be ready to work hard.

rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Does not clearly outline grade boundaries. A 93 numerical grade resulted in a B+ in his class. Is also condescending and rude.
If you want to do 50+ pages of reading each night and do writing assignments daily, this class is for you. It should not have this much work as a required class to graduate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: You will learn a lot, and she gives really helpful feedback.

His grading criteria was often ambiguous and it felt like a coin flip. Lots of readings and lots of notes to take. He was knowledgeable but it felt like he did not know much more than what was on his slides. Cheat sheet on every test was helpful and two sentence summaries were sufficient understanding for the readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: great professor but a lot of reading. You get a cheat sheet for every test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Good professor, a lot of readings.  There's just a final project.  Not a lot of assignments and only graded on a few things.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Love Madame Anthony. Very kind woman who clearly cares about her students, and what she does. The class sessions themselves center on discussion and group work regarding readings done outside class. You'll usually have a short homework assignment every day. The workload is very manageable. The texts can be hard but I found them pretty interesting.

She is really sweet and class is generally interesting or fun. There are in class essays which can be tough but she generally allows rewrites and averages the grades. Tests are very manageable if you do the readings.
Pretty okay class and nice professor. Always explained the homework and assignments in class in French, so it was harder to know what I was doing or what to complete. Other than that very helpful.

I adore Professor Anthony. She is an amazing teacher, and I would 100% recommend her class. She is super caring and always willing to help. Professor Anthony cares deeply about her class and shows up every day with enthusiasm.

Lots of lecturing but he did a good job making it entertaining and engaging in discussion as well. Midterm and final were somewhat difficult but you'll do fine if you do some readings and review the slides. He also curves it generously if the class performs bad.

Absolutely fantastic professor with super engaging lectures. Requires attendance and participation, but it's worth 25% of your grade and keeps you attentive for the class. It was his first semester as a professor as well. Quizzes were easy, mid-term was pretty hard but curved. Final was average. 100% take this guy, he is a top-notch professor.

Overall great guy, very chill and lax, pretty funny but also kind of awkward. Grading is based entirely on quizzes, midterm, and final except for a small percent for attendance and participation. Any assessments are super easy as long as you go over the slides, while technically he has a textbook you don't need it, I literally did not open it once.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very funny and chill guy. Lectures are long but are overviews of the readings and helpful to do well on the quizzes. Participation and attendance matter. No homework besides reading to prepare for the lecture content. Three quizzes are super easy. Midterm was average, but he curved it. Learned a lot, great guy, not super demanding. Def recommend!

Prof. Hernandez is amazing! His class is highly connected to current political news instead of dull theories. There are pop quizzes, but the one with the lowest grade will not be counted. Those who are interested in Latin America can definitely try his classes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: While he isn't necessarily the most brilliant professor in the department, I would encourage anyone to take his class if they care about Latin America. He is definitely passionate about Mexico, and isn't afraid to share his political opinions. The course is a little one-dimensional, but it's not that hard. Also, he cold-calls on people in class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Esch really makes you work for your grade. However, he is always available outside of class and loves talking to students. He will provide as much help as he can. He wants his students to succeed.

This class is pretty interesting and Dr. Esch is always available outside of class. However, he has no lecture slides and does not go off of the book, so you have nothing to reference outside of class. This can be very challenging and require you to have to meet with him regularly to keep up.
Susan was the best I ever had in college!  Smart, sweet, but tough!  I loved her class!  I highly recommend.  - Junior, Kevin Neathery

Com 100 was pretty easy and somewhat interesting, except for the final paper and presentation. This class was the only 1 that had to write an 11 page paper and do a power point presentation. I would recommend taking another professor to avoid these assignments.

I took Jarrod for Debate and Advocacy and Historical Research in Rhetoric and he was hands down one of the most interesting professors I have ever had at Wake. He does not require a text book and most of the readings for class were not extensive and were very interesting. I would take any class with Atchinson! I learned so much!

Took him for Debate & Advocacy. Extremely brilliant, lectures were based off what was happening in the world today rather than a textbook analysis. Homework was minimal and the Debate topics were interesting

Fitzgibbon expects her students to understand the material before taking her course and has high expectations for all of her students. She is very helpful in office hours. She always takes attendance, do not be fooled.

*Extremely* tedious lectures, sleep's a constant enemy. Prof. Fitzgibbon is highly informative and knows her field very, very well. Big caveats, however; readings are long & highly dense, participation is difficult, often questions are phrased to class in a confusing manner & it's difficult to come up with any right answers. Only for the very brave

She is fun and exciting though Prof Zavala-Garrett does not know much English. She does make learning fun though she is pretty harsh on essays and tests. She does let you redo essays for half credit. I like her but I didn't like my grade. She is among the better Spanish professors though.
She's amazing and fun. We were listening to music in class and she just got up and started dancing to regeaton!!!

While the class was labor intensive, in this major that is expected. The material was interesting and clearly well taught. While I ended with a good grade, there was times during the course that I was afraid of an alternative ending. Reading for this class was a must! Homework was pretty rough but like I said, worth it for professional growth.
Dr. Seth Hayden gave exceptional feedback that was constructive and positive.  He was very knowledgeable on professional counseling and quite helpful during residency.
He cares about his students and wants you to learn and succeed
Great professor, and such a nice guy.
This class is fast paced and it operates on a deeply intellectual level. But she is a good teacher and I thrived in it.
Excellent professor and excellent class. Really helpful ti students.

The lecture material is separate from the textbook material, so YOU HAVE TO READ FOR THE EXAMS! The course is great but I think what makes it difficult is the lack of assignment as there are only three exams and one paper that make up all of your grade so if you don't do well on one there isn't really a way to get a better grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: very kind, not online at ALL which has its pros and cons. not a particularly tough grader but you still need to pay attention in lectures and do the readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: It is obvious that this professor really cares about her students and puts all her effort into making the class a nurturing environment that helps improve students.

Dr. Bolduc is a very kind, caring professor. That being said, her teaching leaves much to be desired. Her powerpoints are disorganized, and she herself doesn't seem to have too great of a handle on the material. She is new, so hoping her teaching style improves, it is just unfortunate for students trying to learn the material with her this semester

Disclaimer: I took this class during COVID. I took the class for div 4 credit. It was an easy A provided you actually did the work. Lots of reading, but the tests were very straight forward. Some of the books were better than others, all in all a solid divisional choice. I'd take her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: An absolute joke. Waste of a class and your tuition money. I am putting this nicely
Awesome professor. If you have the chance to take him, I definitely recommend it.
Good guy
LOVVVEEEED THIS MAN! take him! he is so kind and understanding. if you need more time for papers, he is willing to give it. The sweetest person.

Professor Holdridge is an excellent person and an even better professor. He does a great job at engaging the class and creating an enjoyable experience. This man is one of the nicest, most laid-back people you will ever meet. Papers are the only graded things in his class, and he isn't tough on grades at all which is great.

Dr. Rapaport made no effort to compromise regarding my disability accommodations. In class he likened my condition to Freud's idea of “hysteria”. He refused to Zoom me into the class (when my disability makes absence necessary), citing lack of correct set up, despite offering Zoom for office hours. I learned nothing from his teaching or materials.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I really liked this professor. The class is lecture heavy but he has a lot of interesting things to say and is open to questions or comments. I was rarely bored. Not your typical English professor and very open to different viewpoints. The class was a decent amount of work but I felt like I learned a lot. I would recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: She literally does nothing and talked about her cats all the time in the videos. It took her forever to grade an assignment and she is really not fair about the grading. She does not know how to teach you need to self-learn the whole semester and read the textbook all the time because her exams are disgusting and it is torture to watch her videos.

The quizzes and papers are basically your whole grade. The quizzes are written responses, and they are hard because you do not have a lot of time to finish the quiz in time. Her videos on the lessons are really helpful and funny. She is a great professor, just not an easy A class.
She's a queen.Easy to maintain a good grade.

This class was awful. She removes all of the important information from the lecture slides online. If you want to look back at the slides for the day and have come to class, you can't. Her tests made no sense, the questions always had multiple right answers. Also, her tests were graded off of 30 points, leaving little room for error and no curve.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is for his FYS 100 Sex Panics. The class wasn't over my favorite topics but it ended up being interesting and just overall a very chill class. Encouraged to attend each class not req. Fair and organized grading scales. All the work is manageable and Professor Gitzen is available to help whenever and clearly wants his students to succeed.

Dr. Gitzen is a super nice and amazing teacher. He is very understanding and takes time to really connect with his students. He does have a large workload with assigned readings. However, if you just do the reading and take notes in class you will be fine. He is also flexible with you turning things in late

He's a swell fella but I was drowned by homework in this class. He does a good job laying out notes and lectures seemed to go decently. Tests are always a time crunch and he has some questions that are harder than they should be on there sometimes. He grades hard but you should make it if you stay on top of your work.

Dr. Parsley is personable and energetic. Content is presented clearly. Textbook (Adams/Franzosa) is a great choice.  Available outside of class, but frequently busy with undergraduates. The amount of homework is fair and sufficient to learn material. Does not give outlines for exams, and questions may catch you off guard. Not enough time to finish!
The best
She gives more work than her peers, but it works. Makes her students better.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is awesome! ACC 111 sucks, and I hated the content, but she cares so much about her students, and I would take any class that she taught! Definitely the best accounting professor at wake.

Professor Jefferson is the best for ACC 111. The class is considered challenging because of its importance to the b school but she does the best at making the material very easy to understand. She is also very flexible and always willing to answer questions before the exam. Take her for any accounting class.

Jefferson is an amazing choice for 111. The class is very much standardized so it will be decently hard no matter who you take it with, but Jefferson really wants you to succeed and does her best to make sure you understand the material if you ask for help. She explains things in a way that makes hard concepts easy to understand.

ACC111 in itself is pretty much the same with any professor. I really like Professor Jefferson because she really cares about each individual student. She briefly goes over lectures but you should go over them beforehand on your own. She's really helpful with in class problems and generally a great professor.

Dr. Jefferson really cares about her students. All ACC 111 classes have the same exams and homework so I can't say how she would be for those. She explains each concept well and always asks for questions. She just wants her students to succeed. There isn't anyway getting around a hard acc111 class but Dr. J makes it enjoyable.
I really enjoyed her class. It was very easy but not boring either. You really just have to show up and do the work assigned, and she is very sweet.

rambles and talks slowly, class 2.5 hours long and feels like wasting time, her voice is pretty exhausting, sweet woman/ understanding, hard to know what she wants out w projects, teaches photoshop but you're expected to already have artistic skills - wouldn't take as an easy divisional for art take another intro class
COM 110 - three really easy speeches, really nice prof, very hard to get a B

Very easy class however she is so disorganized and class is so confusing. She stresses me out with how all the place she is, BUT she let us do an hour and half of community service instead of a final project and presentation so I really can't complain. Class is easy if you need a few more credits.

Dr. Yu asks insanely vague questions on the exams, and accepts only one specific answer. She talks about how she is the hard teacher, and encourages students who are not doing well, not to seek help, but to take the other professor's section if they fail hers. Doesn't seem right, with all the other caring and helpful professors Wake has to offer.

Final project was kinda nuts - not much instruction and graded pretty harshly (max score available is like a 9/10 or something). Exams are straightforward if you study. Basically its a stats/math class since there is absolutely zero economics going on in there.

Dr. Yu is a tough grader with no partial credit on exams, making it difficult to recover from small mistakes. The final project instructions were unclear, and high grades are unattainable (10/10 has never been given). Office hours were discouraging, and class time often went off-topic. Be prepared to teach yourself a lot of the material.

Professor Cadematori taught STA 111 very well. He is literally one of the most eloquent and clear speaker I have ever had the pleasure of coming across, which makes his lectures quite understandable. The class is fairly easy for a 4 credit STEM course. He is a very lenient grader and his homework really helps with understanding the material.

I took this class for the divisional requirement and would definitely recommend him to others. Solid lectures, one homework and one lab a week, very fair grader and made clear from the beginning he wants us all to succeed.

I think Dr. C did a decent job with conveying the necessary skills we needed to ace the class. He is a pretty lenient grader and is very accessible outside of class if you have any questions about course content. I would never in my life take another stats class by choice; but if I had to, I would take him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a STA 111 professor by choice which can't be said by every 111 prof. He's very understanding and the way he grades represents that. You're given easy-to-follow, step-by-step instructions for every lab and midterms aren't too hard. The exam was written to be even easier than the midterms.

Professor Shams was a great teacher. I would definitely recommend taking his class as a divisional. He lectures but all his slides are posted online so attendance is not completely mandatory. As long, as you study the lecture slides and do the homework you will do well. He also drops your lowest two labs and homework.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He is a great professor and explained everything thoroughly. Answered any questions if you asked directly. Drops lowest hw and lab and replaces lowest test will final exam if the final is higher. Would definitely take him again.

As someone who has never taken a stats class prior to Stats 111 with Dr. Shams, I would highly recommend him. His lectures are posted online and easy to understand. If you do and understand the homeworks, you are basically set for the 3 exams and final since the exams are the same as the homeworks, just with slight changes. Lowest labs and hw drop.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Here is very objective and provides both sides of the argument.  Is not afraid to introduce controversial topics and creates an interactive discussion that engages students.  We often lose track of time, but you will more than likely walk out really knowing and understanding the issue. (informal, he sat on a desk throughout every class)
Engaging

His class is pretty tough, but as long as you do the reading, show up to class and take notes (which you should for any other class) it's fun, his lectures make the readings clear, and he is super helpful one on one

Take Blumenthal for Psychopharmacology if you are at all interested in the subject! The material is pretty complex, but Dr. Blumenthal does a fabulous job of clearly explaining each topic. His passion for the class is contagious and I would definitely recommend him!

Prof. Burkett is excellent for 206. You can tell he's a really sharp dude, and sometimes this comes off harsh, but he's actually a really cool guy. The material requires precise answers, which is what he's trying to help get you to see when he's being critical. Tests are not bad at all. Enjoy how he makes an abstract topic apply to real life.

Burkett is a rude, arrogant, & inept teacher. He makes everything 10x harder than it needs to be since he teaches only specific examples & then yells at the class for their poor performance. He structures his tests so that most people get between 30 and 50%. Thankfully he curves but it doesn't make up for the sheer horrendousness of class.

Extremely helpful and easy to contact outside of class. Her curriculum is flexible so as to always meet the needs and interests of her students. She uses the textbook A LOT, which is nice but occasionally makes class time feel irrelevant.
Light workload. Easy but thorough. Extremely engaging.

Professor Taylor is not a bad professor by any means, she's just a bit weird. She is anal about people showing up late for class and would give these poor souls the evil eye. She's a bit awkward as she laughs really loudly at her own jokes. Comes off as arrogant because of her personality. I'd say she's about an average professor.
Personality leaves something to be desired.  Everything in her lecture is scripted down to personal cues for laughter at her own "witty" comments.

I was given Professor Curtis for Con Law 1. He is very nice but this class was a mess. He is very unclear and confused the class on a daily basis. He is very knowledgable but has a hard time explaining things to students.
One of the best teachers at Wake law... Great class
Hardest course I've taken.  Very interested in students and their welfare.  Hilarious in a dorky way. Looked forward to going to class.

sherri bridges knows her stuff, but she is ridiculously hard.  she was really discouraging and i think that is necessary for an intro to marketing course.  she also keeps the class average at a C so don't even think about an A in her class... it's impossible.
Good guy who had a sequence of unfortunate events happen in his life so that he couldn't make our 111 class a few times. Was a easy teacher for a pretty easy class. Talked about his cats a lot.

He's a cool guy + a good teacher, and 112 isn't that hard. It can get a little boring, but math is pretty much impossible to make interesting anyway, so take his class to get the math requirement out of the way

The professor is an attorney in a big international law firm and brings a lot of practical advice from practice into the classroom.  Some of the assignments are what a 1st or 2nd year associate would be asked to do and he leads us through the work as if we are associates.  It is unique.
The professor lives in Milan, Italy and teaches the course via Zoom with a local professor that is in the classroom.

Terrible class, not engaging. Despite studying for hours on end, I could never get an A. This is the first B I will ever have as a student. Hardest grader and will not reason with you. Asks way too much for an art divisional.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: The hardest class for the dumbest divisional. Do not take! Only lectures that are extremely dry and boring, in a lecture hall with the lights turned down low. Hardest grader I've encountered at Wake and I had to take the class pass/fail. Tests are so hard with memorization of 40+ works of art.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Southerland is awesome overall! Very engaging during lectures and helps with truly understanding the behind the scenes of film making. The movies he had us watch were very good as well, which made it easier for testing. Highly recommend taking his class. Just know his quizzes come directly from the movie or what is in the powerpoint.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I had Dr. Southerland as my Intro to Film professor and he inspired me to go on and do a Film Studies minor. He is very knowledgable, engaging, and always keeps the class light and fun. I would recommend him and this class to anyone even if you are not a film junky.

Professor Sigal certainly knows a lot about the subject matter she teaches. I like how the class encourages free thinking and bouncing ideas off of each other.  However, this course can be very disorganized. She will also give little feedback about your writing while giving B's on your papers. Somehow I ended with an A. Participation is KEY.

All around great prof. Organized, accessible, understanding, caring. Perhaps the most outside of class accessible prof I have had at wake even during Zoom semester. Participation matters but she lets class discussion run its course and results in a really enjoyable mesh/bond among classmates as everyone is bouncing arguments off of each other.

(212)He's great! Adjusting to wf spanish was hard but he was so approachable/willing to help or answer any question.He never made anyone feel bad for not understanding something and he's funny and encouraging. He's understanding/tried to help students schedulewise etc as best he could.The tests were kind of hard but that is normal for spanish tests

I have taken him twice now and am about to take another of his courses next semester. He is so nice and so approachable. His grading may seem tougher, but it is fair, and he gives plenty of opportunities to bounce back from a bad grade. As long as you are willing to put the work in and participate his classes are rewarding and not too hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is very nice, he has a super lenient attendance policy, and is very approachable. He teaches in interesting ways and is super energetic. His grading can be slightly tougher, but he does allow for essay corrections. Overall, despite the slightly tougher grading, I would take again.
I do not like her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Wiethaus is an amazing teacher for REL 111 but the the gravity of topics lead to the class sometimes feeling overwhelming in addition to constant group work and the final grade being based on a group project. She is passionate about what she teaches but the amount of reading and work given by her is a lot.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I cannot say enough bad things about this professor. The class material itself is pretty easy, but Professor Rogan makes everything so much more complicated than it needs to be. The lectures are boring, the homework is unhelpful busy work. The Canvas page is entirely unhelpful, he doesn't reply to emails, and is unwilling to work with you.

I took Dr. Rogan for Empirical Research in Communications, and I really hope to get to take him again. He is genuinely a genius, and he always has the most interesting stories and bits of information. HW was graded by an assistant, so can't say much on his grading style. Class is lecture style, but he keeps it relatively engaging.
Very strange professor. He grades fairly straightforward, and tests never have any surprises. However, it is important that you remain engaged and actually review. Be prepared for field experience!

I like zeyl as a person- as a professor he is ok. It seems like he just wings class. There is no book, and its just him lecturing. He's kinda quiet and hard to understand sometimes. He isn't the best at getting the point across, and also will never grade the HW. But, hes super nice and tests r very fair (easy) if u take notes/pay attention.
Everyday class is just a lecture, every two weeks there are online open book take-home quizzes and then there are two online Tests and an online Final. Super easy classes can be boring

I loved having Dr. Wells for Human Physiology. It is clear that he cares more about his student's wellbeing and their interest in the material than intense testing. He relates material to real world situations which makes learning so much more enjoyable. Grade is based on biweekly comprehension checks, 3 take home exams, and a research paper.

J'nese is an awesome teacher. She is very engaging in class and is very open for outside help. However, I myself just couldn't do what she wanted, as she always gave me subpar grades for the papers which is like the only grades. Medium risk medium reward type of class.

Dr. Williams is such an amazing professor to take. There are a lot of readings for her class but you can get away with glancing over it during group discussions. There are no tests but there are around 4 papers you need to write. She's also very open for office hours if you need help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Did not like the class at all, but Dr. Foskett is an amazing professor and person! She cares deeply about her students. Only had one assignment, a SPARK webpage. O

Mary Foskett is such a sweet woman and the divisional Bible In America class she teaches is really interesting. Reading is mandatory and the readings impact how well you do on the writing assignments. The lectures are where the test materials come from.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very inspiring. I was looking forward to every class. She really wants to broaden your horizon. The reading material is always interesting and the class is very engaging. Would love to take another class with her. Take the class, you won't regret it.
I loved this class. Very modern and engaging professor. Her class topics are always interesting as well.
She is super nice and she uses class to do meditations which are fun. The quizzes are easy if you study beforehand.
She's such an angel and just wants everyone to learn and appreciate the content.
Faber is very knowledgeable and it's easy enough to get a good grade as long as you show you are putting in effort!

He is clearly very passionate about printmaking and if you are too, you'll probably love this class. However, if you're taking it as your art divisional, it might be pretty boring. Most of class time is him taking 30+ minutes to explain something that should take 5. However, you'll get a good grade if he can tell you're putting in some effort.

If you are struggling in French, take this woman's class. I had gotten solid B's in all of my previous French classes and hadn't had one for a year and a half. I am currently getting an A in her course. Class time is spent going over the homework, so as long as you complete it and show up, you get an A. Best teacher ever.
he is pretty funny sometimes

Good choice for prof. Definitely read for each class, but it's usually pretty easy and not too much (like 10 pgs). Bring textbook to class too. Passes around attendance sheet every few days and lecture material from only class is presented, so go to class. Use the "study guides", take notes, and read, and you'll do fine.

Omari is probably the worst teacher I have ever had. He talks in circles and makes no sense. He is not concerned with whether the students understand the material. If students are still unsure after doing the readings, he can't be bothered to explain any further.
she is so awesome! really invested in making sure students succeed and ready to help them learn. definitely take her for real estate finance its the best way to go
He is a fantastic prof. Hard, demanding, but you will learn a lot. And, he is easy on the eyes, which helps.

I would highly reccomend taking Dr. Hughes for a divisional class. He is very knowledgable, interesting and super sweet. Most importantly, he has a great handle on the fact that he is teaching a divisional level class. Involved enough to be engaging but not a crazy ammount of work. Lectures are interesting. TAKE HIM!

Professor Scoggins teaches a very insightful class on the value of information security in the business world. I was apprehensive of the course as I am not a very "techie" person, but was surprised at how accessible he made the material with the readings he assigns and how interesting he makes lectures.

Had Amy for Personal and Team Development in the first semester of the MBA. Probably learned more from this class than I did in any other course Ive ever taken. Amy is incredibly personable and passionate about teaching. Its a lot of reading, and youll spend a lot of time working together on the group project, but its not hard to make an A/A-

Dr. Khuri is excellent, and very clearly knows her stuff. She grades assignments and tests within a day or 2, and gives very good feedback on your projects. She definitely expects a lot out of her students, and assigns a good bit of work, but she is great in office hours. She cares a lot about her students, and wants everyone to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: 10/10, enjoyed his tangents from back in his day. Nice guy. Man should become an author. He likes to say "okay" or "very good" or "excellent" to anything you say. Definitely living on his millions he has invested in the S&P on a ranch somewhere with his beloved solar panels.

Prof. Cochran is a very smart man and has a unique perspective of the intersection of computer science and moral ethics. The material is very interesting and he makes you think in new and complex ways. Be ready to read and have in class discussions. No tests but there are a few papers and projects. He is a tough grader, but overall great professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Love this guy, here is what I'll say. He speaks quickly and is a native speaker, but its not an issue. Overall, the tests are very important. Other than that you just practice grammar all of each class by going over homework (UNGRADED) as well as extra practice in class. He is super chill. I was scared by others about 309...class with him was great
She's lenient but she's actually pretty rude. She also forgets that we have other material to study for in other classes outside of her own.

Professor Mihalko is such a sweet lady, she really wants to see you do well in your classes and in life, but the effort has to be there. She loves participation and active engagement in classes, and there is one project with every class that she teaches. She is super understanding and knows what a life outside of school is.

She is very intense to start but ends up being a great teacher. It was my favorite class of my freshmen fall. You get graded on class participation, 2 papers, and a small final presentation. Lots of reading, but it is very interesting and not super dense. If you put in the time to being energetic, you will like this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Boggs is laidback and understanding. The workload was not overwhelming. She cares so much about her students and is willing to help you with whatever you need.
Good professor, have to do 3 debates in the semester, other then that pretty laid back, take the class and just do the work with some effort and you will be fine

Dr. Norman was an excellent professor. You can tell she is genuinely interested in archaeology and in our learning. She is very flexible on due dates and assignments. I found it to be an easy A, but it was also very interesting. A lot of group discussions as well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Liu is very educated and is very caring toward his students. He does, however, have a very thick accent that is sometimes hard to understand, but I got used to it. Dr. Liu answers emails very quickly and is very helpful one-on-one.

The best professor I have ever had. Professor Holton is extremely knowledgeable and could talk about film with you for hours. I took the class for the CCM major, however, it is still a great divisional. The only HW you have is to watch film, and occasionally write a small written response. If you enjoy film even a little bit, 100% take this class.

I took this class as a divisional and was expecting to hate it because I know nothing about film. He does grade attendance but is always ready to give extra credit opportunities. He gave the class 10 points for doing two bonus movie reviews on the midterm and final which brought my grade somehow from a 91 to a 99. Super chill and funny guy!

Professor Walker is great, in this class he told us that everyone gets an A as long as we do the work.
