There are a lot of readings, sometimes even up to 40-50 pages, but as long as you know the gist of it and take notes on your reading notebook it'll be fine. He does check the reading notebook a couple times but he doesn't really dive into it a lot
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Toha is awesome! She really cares about her field and the students she has. Her lectures are interesting, and she really wants to hear everybody's opinions! The class always felt like it flew by, it was never boring or felt like it dragged. Definitely take her to satisfy the cultural diversity req, or if you like politics!

Dr. Katula's lectures are very clear and engaging. Participation matters though and he will cold call. The material is not that hard but MC questions on exams and quizzes can be tricky so make sure you really know everything well. He doesn't take attendance but you need to come to class because the majority of the material is not posted online.

Dr. Arroyo is smart and seems passionate about the subject. However, he makes this class way too hard. He speeds through lectures with so much material and detail that we need to know for exams. In addition we have difficult and time consuming assignments and papers that he grades harshly. His expectations are way beyond the scope of this class.

Dr. Scott is GREAT! It really isn't that much work for a psychology class, you just have one assignment a week and they were actually really useful as a study guide for the final. She's also really nice and understanding about missing assignments or absences. The only hard part was a group project so prepare for that if you find that challenging.
So much homework. I love him so much but the class was just way too much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Steward cares very deeply about her students, but I find her to be an unreasonable grader. She poorly entertains opinions or conclusions that differ from hers in mine and my peer's experiences. This is difficult when you are being graded on some topics with some level of subjectivity.

His class is mostly partner work and discussions about what we read. There is a lot of reading and he gives quizzes last minute after each book is finished. The only problem I have is that he can go very fast with lecture notes and dates, but he gives the slides before the midterm and final. His essays are also short and easy with 2 pages of work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Dr. Linebarrier is very eager to help any student who requests it. I had him for CHM 111 Lab, and his pre-lab lectures were helpful. The pre-lab quizzes were simple- always read and annotate the lab handouts, it's very helpful. Lab reports are graded leniently, and there's a lot of resources available for assistance and guidance.

She is a passionate professor, she is nice and her lectures are somewhat interesting however the tests, reading and a 2000-word final project are ridiculous for a 105 class, there are far less difficult MSC classes out there, and i would not recommend taking this one solely based on workload.

Nice professor but a very tough grader. No attendance is nice. Only accessible during office hours she has the class vote on, does not love answering questions outside of that. Lab turns into a semester long project with ZERO guidelines and she's not there A LOT. Expects "perfection" in the report at the end but does not give a rubric.

Wonderful professor and person! He is the very reason that I am planning a trip to Rome, Italy! Exams are all essay, so maybe not the best class to take if you're not a good, analytical writer. However, Dr. Titus rewards students who come to class and make a consistent effort. Definitely a class worth taking!
He is really nice and willing to help. He has an optional test at the end of the semester to help your grade and will exempt you from the final if you have a 97+ average
Avoid this guy like the plague. He's petty, arrogant, and unapproachable. Also fails to disclose the actual amount of work expected for class until well after add/drop is over.
Great teacher, helpful in reading papers and giving comments back. If you put in the work, you will do well!

Although attendance is not mandatory, good luck knowing what you're doing if you don't go to class.  Labs and Tests are extremely difficult.  He definitely knows what he's doing, and he makes concepts that are impossible to understand fairly   comprehensible.

I had Professor Knott for property. The class is lecture heavy and there is a good deal of reading. However, this class was a lot of fun. You get practical experience and he takes the time to explain everything in detail. Great professor!

Professor Silman is honestly one of the best professors that I have ever had. Her lectures are very informative, engaging, and entertaining. There is no homework but a suggestion to read the book. Even though it is a 9am class, I can honestly say that I look forward to it every time. Because of this class I now plan to at least minor in Psycology.
Great Guy.

There's a way to teach in law school. This isn't it. Students have no choice about taking his class in the first year, but if you're assigned to him, just know that MANY will feel your pain. I've never been so unmotivated in my life. He's decided to make an already dry subject lifeless and tedious. I regret coming to my school due to him alone.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I had Dr. King for Organic Chem I and II.  He is an absolute genius, but is also very down to earth.  Will make you laugh with his quirks, and is very good at teaching an impossible subject.  His tests are challenging, but you will learn in his class. Very willing to meet and work with students.

The class content is interesting and he really wants his students to learn and grow. The assignments are straightforward and hes very good about balancing out the workload. I'm never bored in class and he keeps us all engaged. Very funny. Easy to do well in the course, just have to do the work he assigns and be prompt about it

This was a pass/fail class and it was super easy. No tests, very few readings, and didn't have to pay attention in class. She was really nice and her class was interesting. We had a few easy papers and discussions but besides that there is no real time commitment. Would definitely take her again!

Great professor! Her class is very interesting, you need to read the chapters assigned before class, but it's not heavy reading. The feedbacks on reports are helpful. Test is based on books and in class readings, mostly multiple choice and some short answer, overall not really hard.

Dr. Smelcer is a lovely and caring professor. I definitely learned a lot in her Research Methods class. The only issue is that she can often be somewhat disorganized or unclear, leading to some students falling behind (especially with RStudio). She tried to make a tough class fun, though, which I really respected.
The greatest teacher of all time. Class is fantastic.
Prof. Chen is one of the best introductory  CS professor out there at Wake. Really recommend her!

I took ENG 175 with Klarr and there are 7 books that you have to skim. She is a pretty easy grader, but you do have to read at the beginning. There is a 500 wd essay every week but it only takes like an hour and you do not actually have to read. Very nice professor and you get 3 free absences :)
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Caring--So many papers

comment: I love Dr. Fanning. Very engaging and very capable of explaining material in simple, understandable ways. Slides are NOT posted so make sure you go to class and take detailed notes. I could not recommend Fanning more, he is a great professor and a super friendly human as well.

I took Money, Market, and Medicine with Prof. Brewer at WFU and it was my favorite class by far. We have really interesting discussions and the articles are not very long and you can skim. She is a thorough grader but not very harsh. There are 4 papers and they are not very long. 10/10 recommend you will learn a lot and she is so funny and sweet.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: I really liked Murphy - the class itself is easy enough, but he is a pretty tough grader, so keep that in mind. Also only speaks in French during class with very few exceptions. Do not leave class during the 50 minutes if you can avoid it. Feel like I learned a lot from him though!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: He's honestly really overqualified, really a brilliant and charismatic professor who's passionate about the subject. The only issue that crops up in this course is that literally nobody in it cares about the material, so it gets awkward when there's absolutely no class participation. He also has a podcast about heavy metal, which is kinda cool.
Professor Shuman is an easy-going and laid-back kind of guy. The class is an easy A so long as you show up and participate!

Dr. Irby is the most compassionate professor ever. She teaches hard material but works equally hard to make sure every student knows what they need in order to do well. She is always available and recognizes that students often are stressed. She cares about her students above all else. She does not give busy work. She truly cares and it shows.

I took her class for both Spanish 212 and 153, and she was excellent. She understands students' struggles and issues learning the language and is very willing and able to help. She made it much easier to learn Spanish, and she gives great feedback on assignments. She was commonly a few minutes late to class, and attendance is mandatory.

He is a nice teacher for orgo. He does not stick to the textbook, but his lectures are sufficient and prepare you well for his tests. He provides notes and practice problems on the canvas page as good resources. He is very caring and has a sense of humor with students. Downside of easier class is it may not prepare you as well for second semester.

Professor Clark is a very nice woman and is very understanding. She had pancake parties at her house twice. She often wears 2 masks and all classes have to be outdoors, but it can be kind of nice to get some fresh air. Class is mostly graded on completion and although there is some busy work, its not bad at all. Highly recommend for FYS.

Bren is a great professor who taught me a lot. But many students disliked how they were doing so well to be given a final grade that was one letter grade lower than what they were sitting at in the class before the final exam. This would be reasonable if students were able to actually see the final exam feedback.

Professor Jeri is a very kind person. He wants everyone to have a fun time playing music. He doesn't really keep people accountable for practicing. Everyone gets an A. I took his jazz ensemble class last semester and I am taking it again now and I don't regret it at all. Everyone is taking this class for fun.

Chris is a great dance teacher. He is always lifting students up instead of putting them down, and his corrections are practical and really improve your technique. He cracks dad jokes almost every class and he's just brings a fun energy to class. It's a dance class so obviously attendance matters but if you show up, you'll get an A.
Dr. Von Burg is very caring and supportive. He worked hard to make sure the students in his class were supported, and his first year seminar was very interesting.
He is nice and the class will be difficult no matter who you take it from. He has group presentations that can save your grade if you do badly on a test.
Maria is the goat, would definitely recommend taking her. She is so sweet and caring for her students and she will help you get where you need to me.

She's the sweetest professor! Wrote each of her students individual cards at the end of the year. Lots of busywork for hw but you don't rly have to do it. Spent a lot of class translating poems line by line which can be boring. We have 2 vocab quizzes each week but they're easy. Waiting for sophomore year to take a 200 LAT so I can have her!

She is an amazing professor! She's intelligent, kind, & very flexible. She is by far the best bio professor I have had at Wake and I would 100% take her for BIO 160 again. We also did it on the points system, so that made class a lot less stressful; study her lecture slides & attend class b/c her test questions are from the lectures/slides.
His lectures were really interesting. There are various plays read that you get onlined quizzed on. Tests are somewhat long but if you payed attention are easy enough. Hes overall such a good person

An excellent professor! Dr. Seta always comes into class in a good mood, very energetic, and truly loves teaching students! I wish I had found her earlier so that I could have taken more classes with her! Her exams are difficult, but fair, and she's always willing to help students. I would definitely recommend taking a class or two with her!

I took Dr. Siahmazgi during her first semester teaching at Wake and she had a few things that needed fixing, being a new professor. Over time, she improved her lecture style and engaged with the class more. Dr. Siahmazgi cares about you as a student and will do anything to help you achieve a good grade in her class.
Great class

Took this class for my english divisional --> i thought the information was interesting. A whole lot of class discussions and participation which isn't my favorite but if you try she appreciates it. No tests only writing assignments that she gives you feedback on and allows you to resubmit for full credit. Very chill, loved her

Really fun and interesting course. Professor shields is nice and engaging mixing lecture and discussion. There are “pop quizzes” but you basically know they are coming and can always easily do well on them if you do the readings (even if you don't read super thoroughly). The tests are open note, and not too hard.

I had professor Shields for PHI-111 and I would recommend him for anyone interested in this course. His lectures are interesting and the readings never take more than 30 minutes. Tests are not hard as long as you show up prepared and he allows students to argue their multiple choice answers for credit. Overall an amazing person and great professor!
Super nice and smart guy and lectures are a lot of fun but this class is anything but an easy A. Exams are really, really hard
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She is nice and the class is very interesting. We sometimes go to the campus garden and talk about plants. She can be tough when it comes to grammar but if you study beforehand then you will be fine. There is a presentation that you have to do and a lot of readings.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She is the sweetest, understanding professor. She asks "What do you guys need today?", catering to her students even before she begins her lectures. Everything she teaches has a reason and once you see it, it is very eye-opening. Her assignments are easy, but you do read a lot of article/chapters. She give a lot of good advice.
Rock climbing is such a fun class and Meghan is the best instructor!

She has a thick accent that's sometimes hard to understand but wasn't a hard grader and was pretty nice. She explained  the concepts really well for me but I know a lot of other students in the class didn't always get her explanations.

Definitely a tough grader with high expectations, but if you stick it out and make an effort you will be amazed by your improvement. At first I was super intimidated by her, but Swier is actually a really funny and nice person and one of my favorite professors at Wake. Highly reccomend!
She can make Italian an easy and enjoyable language to learn!

What a nice and caring lady.  Professor Tessien knows how to get the most out of her students.  The class is extremely tough, the hardest class I've taken at Wake, but such is the nature of the Business School.  Highly recommended.
Easily my favorite Professor.  She genuinely wants to ensure that students understand the material.  Her class is also entertaining because she brings a wonderful positive energy with her.

Easily one of my favorite professors.  Catanoso is very fair and surprisingly involved with his students for a part-time professor.  He'll help you with whatever you need as long as you act like an adult and ask him not-at-the-last-minute.  He's interesting and funny, and if you attend class and pay attention you should do fine.
Wonderful tone

Dr. McCoy--aka Dr. Mac--is the sweetest professor I have met at Wake. She is such a wonderful teacher and general presence. Her EDU101 class was very easy but also very interesting. Dr. Mac cares about what she teaches on, and she cares that her students learn. She gives plenty of quizzes but always goes over the material right before. Take her!

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! He doesn't believe in grading and gives everyone an A at the end of the class. He is also extremely caring and will improve your latin skills and ability. 10/10 in all aspects: teaching style, personality, accessibility outside of class, and resources to help you learn. There are also asynchronous days during the semester.

Lectures are fast-paced and filled with anecdotes, important information, and current events which kept them engaging. Memorization is important, but applying and understanding concepts is what'll bring you to the A-range of grades. Also every once in a while she would give us a 5 min break mid-lecture which was SO nice.

Remi is the man, he's truly a great professor. I loved his style of teaching because while he focuses on the language itself, he uses Italian culture to teach it. We always watched movies and read articles that were really interesting. 100% take him if you can

Dr.Griffith makes everything clear in the lecture and she cares about her students' success. She is very responsible, but at the same time she is a fairly tough grader. Be careful and you have to visit office hour to prevent your HW from becoming a disaster. smart and fast-speed class, sometime she may not understand students' confuse.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: The worst TA I have ever had. Never responds to emails, withholds necessary data until less than 24 hours before major lab reports are due, and then refuses to change the due date. Gives advice for statistical analysis without considering whether it is even possible for a certain experiment. Gives out incorrect grades then refuses to change them.
I love Dr. Mitchell. She genuinely cares about her students and is extremely accommodating and understanding.

If you're good at French you'll be fine. Your participation in the class doesn't get graded but it sure matters. She grades your work based on how much you participate in class not on how well you actually do. She's a nice teacher and when I was doing well in the class was enjoyable. Don't really recommend but taking her isn't the end of the world.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She comes off as a very nice lady, but don't be fooled she is the spawn of satan. She accused me of cheating and when explaining that the work was my own she wouldn't listen. I did an assignment for her to prove myself and she proceeded to say autocorrect is cheating. From here she hated me and failed me on every other assignment out of spite.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Pellet teaches a good linguistics class. She adds a lot of nuance to the conversations since her first language is french, and she cracks some funny jokes among the lectures. There is a lot of reading but that's just the class. She explains things well and is very accessible (and a couple minutes late to class every day).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Literally the best prof I've had a Wake. Down to earth guy and hip with the kids. Loves putting memes and stuff on his slides to spice up some pretty hard topics imo

I took Dr. Pyke's Sherlock Holmes class for a divisional. I really enjoyed this class, I do not normally enjoy English classes, but this one was enjoyable. We only had two papers, and most of the class was spent having group discussions. I thought all of the readings were interesting and fun. I would definitely recommend this class as a divisional.
He really is a good TA. Respect
It was the most boring and meaningless class I've ever had. He did not provide good feedback and deliberately made a theoretical class even more abstract than it could have been.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Comstock taught us Biochem I and Biochem II at the same time. So every exam there was way too much content for a normal class. She was the prof you take if you want to learn it, but you better be ready to work for any kind of decent grade in this class. Get a tutor for the problem sets. They are relentless and so is she

Much prep needed beforehand but she is always willing to meet with you when you need help. HER TESTS ARE SUPER FAIR and she posts all old exams online so you know exactly what is expected of you. Her exams are mirror images of her old ones but she changes the questions slightly.  Definitely take her if you want a good grade in orgo!

If you need an easy divisional, take PSY151 with him. There are 7 tests worth 100 points and you drop the lowest, including the final. No attendance policy, and graded extremely nice. By far one of the easiest classes I've taken, and a great professor. Take this for an easy GPA boost.
Maybe my favorite professors I've had at Wake. I've taken both of his Russian electives. The class isn't a walk in the park, but an A is definitely doable if you care about the course material.

I could not recommend this class enough. The readings can be a little bit on the longer side, but they are super manageable. As long as you participate in class and take notes, the mid-term is super easy. As well as the final is open-note. While the ethnographic papers can seem daunting, they aren't too bad and she is a really nice grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Loved this class! It was super entertaining and you get 3 free passes of absence. We had to have a book I didn't get mine and was perfectly fine. Lectures are on power point and your participation is 20% however i spoke a little every other class and was good. We had 4 papers, all very interesting midterm and a final which was take home open note.
Professor Straker is great. I don't have anything bad about to say about him. He cares about his work and tries to connect with his students. Would definitely recommend super easy class.

Amazing professor. The class really wasn't difficult, and I had very little homework to do for it which was really nice. He drops one test score if you have an A in the test category, which means you don't need to take a final if you already have the A across the first three exams. He clearly loves anthropology. Dr. Kaiser is the GOAT.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr Kaiser is one of the best professors I have had at Wake Forest. Dr Kaiser shows real compassion for his students and is passionate about the material that he teaches. The tests are difficult but comprehensive study guides are given that are easy to study. Papers are also graded leniently. Love this guy!

I took Ant-112 with Dr. Kaiser as divisional. Honestly, I didn't do much for the class and ended up with an A. The 3 exams are not hard at all if you just memorize the info on the study guide, and there are 3 papers, each graded generously. Dr. Kaiser is a funny guy who genuinely loves his job and anthropology, and that shows in his lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Lischer is a great professor, and is really caring about the political realm. The class is very lecture heavy, and at some parts becomes somewhat hard to learn and conceptualize. The class is heavily based on tests and homework. Overall, she is a great teacher and makes it easy to learn about politics in the real world.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment:
Oh Marc, where do I begin…

Your outstanding aura inspired me daily to try my hardest. Thank you. Love that class very awesome.

Professor Vail is an amazing professor -- but boy is he tough.  He cares so much about the material that he doesn't let any kind of inaccuracy slide... and you're tested on a LOT of material.  But if you're a strong polysci student you SHOULD take him (even if it''s pass/fail) because he has so much to teach and genuinely cares about you.
Maybe the hardest/most demanding class I've taken at Wake, but Dr. Vail is absolutely brilliant. Definitely don't take this class if you're looking for something low-stress.

She is pretty confusing to understand in lecture and has a strong Jamaican accent. However, she is always available in office hours. To do well in this class you need to spend at least an hour in the text book after every lecture and meet with her to ask any questions. The tests are pretty hard too.
No Comments
nice man but very difficult tests

José Villalba, Ph.D was not only knowledgeable about Cultures and Counseling but he was entertaining as well.  This made a controversial class more enjoyable.  Dr. José Villalba gave wonderful resources as far as readings and documentaries too.  He cares about his students and was willing to stay later with office hours too.

Dr. Gladding is one of the nicest people I've ever met. The class is so much work if you do all the reading, but nobody in my class reads, and we still all have Bs and As. As long as you go to class and pay decent attention, you'll be okay. Spend a little more time on the papers, and he'll be really impressed. Loves his students and Wake so much.

I took Biology 101 with Dr. Gibson. I took AP Biology my freshman year of High school got a 96 in the course and didn't take the AP test. I would say I am good at biology but Dr. Gibson's class proved that wrong. She is a really nice person one of the warmest i know. However, her tests and grading mechanics are very hard. As in this class are hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: No Comments

I love Booze with all my heart. He is hands down one of the best science teachers I have ever had (this is even going all the way back to middle school). Jon genuinely cares about his students and takes the time to make sure everyone understands without being too slow for the students who get it. He is a great lecturer and a fair grader. Fantastic.

Professor George is a true angel. I had her for Civil Procedure and I couldn't be more glad. She brings cookies and candy to class for us for crying out loud. I learned so much throughout the course as well. So grateful to have had her for my first semester in law school!

Dr. Otteson is the best professor/teacher I have ever had. He is extremely intelligent, but he does not let that be a barrier to his students. He is available to meet outside of class at anytime and gives great insight. Anyone interested in economics, business, or philosophy must take his class!

Dr. Craig is a good professor. Her expectations are simple and straightforward. Do all homework sheets, study guides and recommended textbook problems. Furthermore, make sure you study the powerpoints, as she takes the time to make them detailed and puts practice problems which are similar to test questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: Great professor. Definitely teaches from a biochem perspective and makes sure you know 100% why things work how they do within cells. Always willing to answer questions. Tests are very very fair. Also offers out-of-class review sessions before every single test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Rahman really cares about his students. He makes the lectures very interesting and interactive, and gives plenty of opportunities to get your grade up. Very understanding of students' needs if you need an extension/help. He gives very good feedback on assignments: my writing skills improved significantly in this class.

Absolutely loved him! He is very nice when it comes to participation and he understands that not everyone feels comfortable speaking in class. Not much work at all, just weekly journal entries that he will always give you full mark for and a midterm and final (he will give you the questions in advance). His class are also very interesting!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Nice and accessible. Recorded lectures are super clear and easy to understand. The readings are short, 5-7 pages each. There are some work to do though: reading responses, participation, mid-terms, papers, final. But the grading is easy as long as you follow the recordings. Don't have to read everything or be extremely strict with all the details

I had Dr. Watson for Calc 2. Despite not liking the material in the class, I love Dr. Watson as a professor and a person. She truly cares for her students and she will spend all of her office hours talking you through a problem if need be. I wish I could have taken her again. (She does do small pop quizzes)
Nice lady and easy class. Take her

Dr. Doug is a great professor who clearly cares greatly about his students and wants to see them succeed. He is not afraid to get vulnerable for students to illustrate the significance of specific concepts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: She's very nice but her grading was unclear and she couldn't explain notes and points she took off from my tests. I like her as a person and a lecturer but I don't think the bio bin grading style fits her teaching.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Okay professor, lectures in BIO160 are very boring but she is a nice person and tries to help you. She grades very hard on tests and it is difficult to score well on them, but the bio departments grading scale is terrible anyways. Overall a nice person but I wouldn't take again, take the other professor instead.
Prof. Catanzaro was great-- her poetry workshop class was pretty chill and she was a gratuitous grader. She is super nice and seems to really care about her students!

Professor Englebretson is the easiest professor I've had at Wake. He pretty much gives everyone an A if they try at all. His assignments are fairly easy, and a lot of them are done in groups. The class revolves around LLMs, which makes it even easier since you just need to plug things into them and see what comes out.

Professor Huie is fantastic, he is very funny and really tries to engage students in theater, even though most people are taking it for the divisional. He assigns weekly quizzes which are annoying, but most of the class is one month long project that isn't too bad. I would recommend taking this course, but you do have to do some work out of class.

The course material itself was not difficult at all, but you had to spend SO many hours outside of class going to campus events. If you are a student athlete DO NOT take this class. You do not have enough time in your schedule to go to these events, and the professor does not really care. In addition you also have to take a 12+ hr certification

He's a nice man, but the lectures were difficult to follow and often confusing. However, if you go to OH, he is really helpful. Deadlines for the weekly homeworks were very flexible. There were 2 midterms: one for linear topics, one for diff eq & the class averages were always very low :( If you study the textbook and practice, you should be okay.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved this old man. MTH113 was not too difficult of a course and he was fairly lenient to our class given that it was mostly freshmen, but he was genuinely very sweet and cared for his students. The only problem I had was that he was difficult to understand at times and may run on tangents that lwky put me to sleep but they were kinda interesting
very difficult and VERY harsh grader. accessible out of class but not very helpful during office hours. avoid taking his class.

Dr Gregory was awesome! She really cared about course material and was very engaging during class lectures. I really liked this class and it was pretty easy if you stayed on top of it. There's two short papers and 6 1-page image annotations. It's a very reasonable course load. She's also super accommodating. Great class.

Very flexible and relaxed professor, which reflect in his class difficulty. Homework was just checkpoints in writing assignments where you get feedback. Only have 4 papers with many extra credit opportunities. He's very eager to provide feedback & support. A very easy class with practical lessons about environmental justice.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Terneus is a kind, laid-back professor, and his seminar is a breeze. Assignments are brief and very basic, with clear criteria. Extra credit opportunities abound. You won't miss much if you're not in class. Easy to set up appointments for feedback & support. Not a good fit if you want to be challenged and hone your writing for future courses.

Overall there was little work but all the work was concentrated around large due dates. 3 weeks of every unit would be dedicated to assignments that were supposed to teach us how to write a certain way or learn how to do something but they did little to teach us how to write. The only helpful piece was the feedback meeting after the rough draft.

Dr. Tsufim cares about her students and has dedicated time to meet with them about each of their assignments. The rubric is always clear, but the assignments were sometimes confusing but she answered questions. I would recommend her FYS, it took me quite a bit of work outside of class but if you complete the work you should get an A.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Reynolds is a sweet heart! she is a very nice professor, and will help you if you need it!

Attendance isn't mandatory, but occasional pop quizzes, etc. so go to class. Good professor but makes it interesting and talks about his own research too. Go to class, pay attention, and STUDY and you'll do fine on the tests. Kids who don't do well on the tests, don't study. Only grades are tests and research (participate in upperclassman research)
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Raley is a great guy. You'll definitely learn a ton in his class and be very entertained.  He expects a lot from students - a lot of reading and analysis - but he is a very fair grader and always willing to talk to students outside the classroom. He was by far my favorite professor at Wake despite all the work. Bring a friend.
Serious about his research yet he adds humor and makes learning the material interesting.

SOCIAL PSYCH: Solano is wonderful for this class! She has taught this class so many times that she knows everything to a tee. She expects a lot from you on the tests, but they're really not hard and it's pretty easy to get a good grade. Super helpful, engaging during class. One of my favorite professors at Wake (coming from a senior psych major)
Fly is a great professor.  He is interesting and funny, yet still very knowledgeable.  The class is very little work (compared to normal Calloway standards).  And the time flies during class.

A difficult, but very fair grader. I took Spanish through high school and college up to this point, and Dr. H really inspired me to push myself to become better at the Spanish language and to analyze and critique Spanish/Mexican civilization. She also goes above and beyond to help her students succeed. I recommend her 100%!

Dr. Espino-Perez is really great! She makes an effort to interact with the class and gives interesting lectures. Be sure to participate in class, the amount of fun you have in class is dependent on how much you interact. The tests are pretty hard but there are plenty of opportunities to earn a better grade in the course.

Dr. Wright is by far the best professor I have ever had. He cares so much about his students and is always available to help. I took this class over the summer and it was very difficult, but he is a great instructor and I felt like I was more prepared for orgo 2 than the people who took it over a semester were. If you can, take his class!!

Great teacher. Took her for Spanish 113, and I was massively anxious. She did her best to make the class interesting and stress-free however and showed genuine care for all her students. I did lose 1/3 a letter grade for missing one too many classes, so be careful with attendance.
I love Prof Faullin. His class was super interesting and not difficult at all. He has such great experience and is very interested in student experience! Highly recommend
Mr. Faullin is generally a great guy. This class is straightforward and easy. Can miss a class or two.
Nice guy, yet merciless grader

I love Dr. Berry. He's super chill and funny and makes a lot of Dad jokes. Im in his HES stats class right now and you are only graded by canvas quizzes that are given once a week open note so there is not a lot of work required. Most people are doing pretty well in this class but the quizzes can be hard which is your entire grade.

Took two of her class, absolutely recommend. Professor Leigh is passionate, caring, and very knowledgeable. She would expect you to come to class and finish the portfolio on time, but she won't push you out of your comfort zone. She also offers great suggestions and commentary on your work.
She is AMAZING! So engaging and intelligent. This class wasn't super hard but the tests have way too many questions for the time allotted. Anyway, take this class with Dr. McGowan!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty good prof who always asks about your day. Not too difficult a learned a bit about journalism.

Professor Folmar is very funny and kind, but he is an extremely tough grader. He claims that, on answer with points out of 10, having a correct and clear answer will earn you an 8/10, but you have to go above and beyond to reach a 10/10. So it is hard to an A, especially on your first papers and exams. You have reading homework almost every class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He is a bit scary at first but nice. Tough grader with few assignments. Not very clear on feedback. Material is semi-difficult to understand but once he explains it and you take good notes then you will be fine. I would recommend the other courses if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Very chill, slightly long class but graded through 3 main projects. Easy A if you go to class and do work

Dr. Wahl is the sweetest person ever and so understanding of any situation. Her class is almost all lecture and can be very boring. There's a lot of reading every night but only two exams and a few random assigments. She is so nice but the material can be confusing at times and the exams are content heavy. Still would take her again though.

Easy class, with lots of homework/assignments but is a breeze. Super kind, cares about the material a lot and is very understanding and accessible outside of class. Show up to class and do the work and she'll love you! Lots of in-class assignments and talking to peers. She outlines all assignments/projects clearly. Great professor, great class!

Class is mainly comprised of 4 papers. Readings dealt with writing and grading theory. Not something I was previously familiar with but I enjoyed learning about it. Young, funny guy with a lot of energy. His feedback is very helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Great teacher! He gives great feedback. 4 main papers and lots of reading (but the reading actually matters and his lectures are based on it). Go in to his office hours if you need help! He will help!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very test heavy, one group project, two concert reports and mandatory attendance of 5 concerts. The class wasn't difficult , but for this to be an introductory course and a divisional credit ,WAY to much busy work with Midterm and a final and homework after every class. If you enjoy music definitely take her, but there are easier divisionals !

Our discussions weren't just about music and often went off-topic, but still remained relevant. I will say I won't recommend this class (The Golden Record) to people who don't have musical knowledge. You need to understand musical terms in order to understand what's going on. If you don't, it's hard to participate, which is 20% of your final grade

I took my FYS with Dr. Weng, about the Golden Record, and I cannot recommend it enough. He's a super smart guy, not only when it comes to music but in many topics, and is super nice. Class is easy enough, as the grading is only based on three short papers and a presentation, all of which are graded pretty easily. The content is also interesting.

Dr. Currie is my favorite professor at Wake. He is incredibly knowledgeable and engaging. This class's material was interesting and clearly presented. His lectures had lots of information, which sometimes made it difficult to study for exams, but each exam was graded fairly. He gives partial credit for responses, too! Highly recommend.
Solid introduction to the Bible with a caring professor. I learned a ton. Highly recommend the course, not just for getting a divisional out of the way but learning how to read religious texts.

Dr. Alford's class was excellent. It mostly consisted of class discussions of the readings for homework, which are enjoyable if you do the work. She's very knowledgable about her subject, but she's also down-to-earth and friendly. She's a fair grader, gives good feedback, and is very readily available outside of class. Would absolutely take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Carmen is an awesome Spanish professor and can make Spanish seem less daunting. She makes classes fun and really values participation. Her test can be a little challenging, but if you put in some effort they are doable. I would recommend taking her class for SPA 153.

One of my favorite teachers I've had here -- she genuinely cares a lot about her students doing well. Lots of little homework but not that hard because she doesn't get hung up on little grammar mistakes. Super easy to get in touch with her or meet for help, and she also makes an effort to make her classes engaging and fun. Take her for Spanish!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: loved them as a prof.
I learned so much from Dr. Moore's class!!! I would absolutely recommend it to anyone. It was beyond impactful in my own academic journey!
Prof. Moore is so intelligent and caring. I was in their video games course, and it was unique and impactful. They are kind and insightful.

She is the sweetest professor. She actually made the lectures pretty interesting. The homework is not too bad throughout the semester. She is a very gracious grader. The only test is the final which was not too difficult. As long as you participate and pay attention you will be absolutely fine.
A very history savvy and jolly professor. While attendance is mandatory i'll be worth it. Also engaging projects that she will try to stop you from procrastinating, despite her efforts, I still did.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Tough class but required for the major. Take this class with her if you can... explains things very easily and gives you plenty of opportunity to apply the things you learn. If you do the work, you will do just fine.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I LOVE him

Prof. Amoureux is a nice professor, but the class is extremely lecture and reading-heavy for an introductory course. The material can be interesting, but I wouldn't recommend if you're not a politics major. He is a reasonable grader, but you must put in effort for an "A". He also shows up to class late each time, which rubbed me as disrespectful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Very caring, generous grader. She gave out short readings before every class (but it's actually okay if you don't read all of them), set standards of grading, and respected every single of us during the class. No exams, no pop quizzes, only 1 paper and final project throughout the semester. Definitely recommend her.

I LOVED this professor! You have to read quite a bit and complete reading journals, however, this is super beneficial for tests and papers. She really doesn't ask much of students and is super sweet! She makes the material fairly interesting and fosters healthy discussion!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Caring and approachable
